roman historie containing ſuch act occurrent paſſed conſtantius iulianus iovianus valentinianus valens emperours digeſted 18 bookes remains 31 written firſt latine ammianus marcellinus tranſlated newly engliſh wherunto annexed chronologie ſerving inſtead briefe ſupplement thoſe former 13 bookes iniurie time lost together compendious annotation coniectures upon ſuch hard place occurre ſaid historie done philemon holland citie coventrie doctor phyſicke london printed adam jſlip 1609 right worſhipfull major brother alderman c citie coventrie entred heretofore engliſh tranſlation romane hystorie compiled livius foundation romecitie unto caeſars dayes proceeded forward life death domitian according penned suetonius tranquillus j late earnestly moved noble baron kingdome travaile ſtill follow traine argument ſo farre forth found extant ammianus marcellinus written large end ſaid emperour unto beginning gratianus albeit enterpriſe ſeemed unto mee difficult conſidering harſh ſtile author souldior grecian borne delivered theſe hystoricall report latine ſtrange tearmes occaſioned late alteration state conſtantine greater part originall loſt might given light unto rest print ſo defective faultie even remained want others tread way language yet could deny honest requeſt ſo honourable perſonage knew verie ſtudious paſsing well learned judicious right commendable part adorning true nobilitie ſet hand peece worke alſo finiſh ſame ſome ſort though altogether therein pleaſed ſelfe better give contentment unto reader time perceived ſhould come preſſe tooke new labour like loſſe later part livius ſupplied breviary l florus ſo want beginning writer made chronologie end might preſent unto deere countreymen continued narration romane affaire firſt infancie venerable old age declining day may uſe marcellinus owne word eternall citie explane likewiſe thoſe unuſuall phraſes tearmes aforeſaid obvious former hiſtoriographers alſo open ſome obſcure place offer themſelves thought much paine annex therunto certaine briefe annotation conjecture mine owne yeeld full ſatisfaction unto reader may yet miniſter occaſion ſome better learned ſelfe travaile kind unto whoſe cenſure judgement ſubmit thoſe suppoſals theſe endeavour mine whatſoever dedicate unto worſhips chiefe magiſtrate grave senate citie diver reſpects firſt wiſe moderat government place wherein j ſo many yeares converſed hath affoorded unto quiet repoſe meanes alſo follow ſtudies secondly affectionate love yee alwaies borne good literature testified courteous entertainment learned men competent ſalaries allowed time time ſuch profeſſors peaceably diſcreet carriage beſtowed talent among exhibition given poore ſchollers vniverſitie erecting alſo late maintaining faire librarie exampled without offenſe others ſpoken many city realme laſtly experience already kind acceptance former labour though exhibited unto firſt hand emboldened enforced rather immediatly entitle name tranſmit ſame unto others doubting wil take ſmall gift good worth token unfaigned love affection hath alwayes prayd welfare wiſheth live longer may ſee proſperous flouriſhing eſtate citie worſhips dutifull reſpect unexpected honor princely dignity running beyond bound authority conferred upon made foule worke every extreame rigour marred preſuming upon neereneſſe kinne unto couſin germane conſtantius euen ſonne joyned marriage brother ſonne king annibalianus devill incarnate inciting incenſing continually given hee cruell tyranny leſſe bloudthirſtie ſelfe milder diſpoſition husband proceſſe time little cruelty certaine perſons upon obſcure miſts onely ſuſpitions preſumptions judged guilty condemned ſome ſuffered death others puniſhed forfeiture good turned houſe home baniſhed folke hauing nought left unto plaint mones bitter teares lived onely contribution almes thus while lieu civile juſt government bloudie mind bare ſway wealthy noble houſes quite ſhut neyther required theſe heapes enormity trouble voice accuſer counterfeit ſuborned criminall matter might ſeeme though outward ſhew committed formall triall law courſe tyrant diver time taken whatſoever ſetled caeſars irreconcileable heart ſame went currant right lawfull yea followed hard even preſent execution moreover deviſed certaine unknowne perſons ſuch baſeneſſe ſmall regard ſhould ſent purpoſe part call day aleppo • telius antiochia hearken tale rumor direction relate whatſoever heard theſe fellowes manner travailers raunging place place covertly joyning themſelves cloſe men quality honour meeting entring alſo habit needie poore folke rich men houſes ever could learne heare let court ſecretly backe dores made report thereof obſerving one point joyntly one accord ſome thing invent forge owne head knew deed make ſame worſe one halfe wiſe ſuppreſſe conceale praiſes came eares caeſar many men forced even againſt wils give feare calamity hung head otherwhiles fell ſo husband whiſpered ought wife eare within ſecret roome ſervitor inward privie life preſent ſame ſhould emperour bee ſure know morrow leſſe b amphiaraus martius renowned divinors wiſards old time gave intelligence thereof therefore bare wals alone made acquainted ſecrets feared obſtinate ſetled purpoſe ſearch theſe many ſuch like matter became greater force reaſon queene ever elbow pricke proke forward bearing ſelfe ſhrewd froward upon husband high eſtate lay ſtill creaking crowing one moſt ſharpe ſet hotely bent worke miſchiefe whereas mildneſſe beſeemeth woman ſhe ought rather good holeſome perſuaſions reduced way truth courteous humanitie reported act gordians wife maximinus c cruell emperour woont conclude gallus new pernitious example feared put practiſe ſame foule dangerous pranke gallienus reported attempted ſometime rome greateſt diſhonor ſhame might taking ſome companie privily weaponed would evening walke ſhops hoſtelries carrefour croſſe ſtreets buſily inquiring greek tongue wherein perfect man thought caeſar theſe part plaid boldly within citie even light ſhining cleere night long woont reſemble bright dayes length oftentimes knowne perceiving came thus abroad hee ſhould bee diſcovered hee ſeene go forth openly daylight ſerious affaire thought theſe verily courſes hee tooke whereat many man grieued groaned heart furthermore thalaſsius praefactus pratorio lord chiefe iuſtice beeing place alſo himſelfe arrogant nature conſidering haſtineſſe hazard many ſtill increaſed gravitie ſage counſell mitigate mood diver time men placed high authority mollified aſſuaged wrath ire prince way oppoſition rebuke unmeet ſeaſons ſet farther made ſtarke mad giving information thicke unto emperour aggravating proceeding making yea endevouring mind know ſame ſhould hidden whereat caeſar within much fell enraged erecting high banner ſelfewill frowardneſſe without regard either men ſafety owne ran end ſtill manner ſwift ſtreame irreclamable violence beare downe carry quite away chap 11 warre raiſed brigand robber iſauria whereof euents iſſues diuers neither verily bane plagued eaſt ſundry trouble calamity iſauri uſuall matter oft time reſt quiet often ſuddaine outrodes diſturbe confound ſecret robbery thoſe ſeldome committed brake impunitie foſtered boldneſſe growing worſe worſe grievous warres ſtirring verily hoſtile rebellious ſtomacks long time commotion without reſt howbeit mightily moued occaſion indignitie gave ſome conſorts taken priſoners cogni bellonio gognia poſtello conia leuncla • iconium towne region within cilicia ptolem piſidia contrary unto manner cuſtome caſt devoured ravenous wild beaſts publique ſhew amphitheatre according ſaying tully like even ſavage beaſts upon warning given returne moſt part unto place ſometimes beene fed even ſo manner whirlewind come downe cumberſome high mountaines repaired ſea coaſts along hiding themſelves within vallies full lurking hole toward darke night eſpecially moone new firſt quarter therefore yet ſhining full light obſerved na • tices ſhippemaſters ſaylers perceiued layed along ſleepe creeping foure among anchorgables going ſoftly heard conveyed themſelves ſlyly ſhippeboats ſo ſtood hard ere aware thus greedie covetouſneſſe gave fire unto cruelty ſlaine ſpared ſo much one cadentium yeelded caried away rich marchandiſe • f op • ma vel utiles gainefull commodity none make reſiſtance theſe prankes long practiſed knowledge taken ſaylers marchant venturer thus murthered left dead place man afterward arrived theſe rodes avoiding leſſe deadly cliffes e scyron ſayled cloſe along coaſts cypri cyprus whereas lye oppoſite unto rockes iſauria therefore within could find nothing thither brought leaving ſea coaſts went lycaonia adjoyning hard unto iſauria within thicke growne faſtneſſes forefences manner thoſe lye ambuſh ſuch paſſe maintained enriched themſelves good well provinciall inhabitant wayfaring folke broile raiſed ſouldiers lay garriſon within many townes caſtles confining upon endevoring might maine repell incroaching ſtill ſpreading thus abroad one whilekeeping together cloſely ſquadrons while diſperſed aſunder overmatched reaſon huge multitude bred brought among high crooked mountain carrying great compaſſe uſe nimbly paſſe plaine place even charging farre many come toward ſhot affrighting hideous cryes yelling diver time footman forced purſuit clime ſteepe riſing hill albeit foot ſlipped taking hold ſhrubs buſhes got verie top yet among thoſe narrow unpaſſable ſtreits roome imbattell ſet themſelves array yet march ſure ſtrong footing while enemy trauerſing ground fro tumble downe peeces rockes crag aloft made ſhift get away downe hill danger ynough elſe driuen upon extreame neceſſitie valiantly fight overwhelmd laid along fall huge weighty peeces thenceforth therefore due obſervation warie circumſpection made ever theſe robber began make towards high mountaines ſouldiers knowing diſadvantage place gave way retyred might found upon plaine happeneth verie often libertie either ſtretch forth armes brandiſh ſhake dartes carry two three apeece fortune ſlaine like dumb ſilly beaſts wherefore ſame robber afraid lycaonia moſt part champian countrey knowing many proof made ſhould able make part good men ſtable ſet fight blind bywayes went 〈◊〉 giravo alph adnan together cilicia 〈…〉 c • ramania bellemu • pamphylia continued long time verily without trouble yet feare waſting ſpoyling murder while ſouldiers ranged quarter neere adjoyning fortified ſtrong garriſons everie ſide whereupon ſpeeding themſelves great haſt prevent rumor remove exceeding celeritie truſting alſo upon vigour agilitie body winding lane got ſomewhat late though hill top overcome theſe dangerous difficulty come farre bank deepe whirling river crionero marius niger melas ſtead wall fenceth inhabitant either ſide thereof conſidering time night grew apace upon reſted wayting daylight ſuppoſed gotten ſame without one hinder paſſage ſhould ſodaine unlooked incurſion able lay waſt whatſoever ſtood way laborious painfull toyle tooke came effect ſunne riſing reaſon big ſtreame narrow deepe withall diſappointed paſſage while ſeeke ſmall fiſh boat prepare flit ſwim upon float ſet together pinned haſt legion wintering chiriſonda candalor citie pamphylia sideniſte came abroad ſpeedie march affronted imbattelled themſelves neere unto rivage joyne fight hand hand moſt skilfully made fence targuets couched thicke cloſe together alſo truſted upon ſwimming adventured hollow troughes trunk tree ſecretly croſſe river moſt eaſily killed whereupon aſſayed many meanes deviſes even uttermoſt perill nothing auayled feare violent reſiſtance quite put beſide purpoſe doubting way take whither go drew neere unto towne laranda refreſhed themſelves food repoſe feare paſt ſet upon rich townes helpe certaine company horſemen fortuned approach neere hand ſo much aſſaying make head againe broad open plaine ground departed aſide retyred backe raiſed ſtrength manhood youth left home forasmuch ſore diſtreſſed want food went place named paleas bending toward ſea fortified ſtrong wall layd ſtore even day victual uſually diſtributed among ſouldiers lying garriſon defend coſts iſauria ſtrong hold therefore beſieged round three dayes three night together ſeeing neither place ſo ſteepe could poſſibly gained without danger death good might done undermyning deviſe belonging ſiege tooke effect departed heavie ill appaid purpoſe end upon angry mood enterpriſe exployts reach conceived therefore feller fit furious rage diſpaire hunger together ſet fire reenforced power heat unreſtrainable advanced forth full reſolution deſtroy mother citie seleucia caſtritius como • lieutenant f together three legion old beaten ſouldiers hardned alreadie warre ſervices defended captaines theſe ſayd ſouldiers advertiſed hand truſtie eſpials comming ordinarie token watchword given led forth armes well appointed make quicke ſpeedie ſally great agilitie paſſed bridge ſtanding upon river saleſo mar nig salepho matth paris call day del ferro calycadnus mightie ſtreame wave whereof run hard verie tower wall arranged order readie fight beit one ſet foot haſtily forward permitted encounter joyne battell ſtood feare adverſe power ſo furiouſly ſet upon rage number ſuperiour readie alſo run without regard life upon verie pyke ſwords point theſe brigand eſpied armie afarre heard trumpettiers cornettiers ſound ſtayed march ſtood ſtill prety drawing forth ſwords threatening wiſe afterwards went faire ſoftly againſt ſouldiers continuing ſtill reſolute ready make head encounter diſplayed rankes yea knocking ſhields ſpeares together manner faſhion ſtirreth vp warriours anger dolour geſture hard hand greatly terrified thus ſharpe ſet give battaile leader reclaimed drew backe ſuppoſing unſeaſonable inconuenient hazard themſelves upon doubtfull peece ſervice yet farre wals citie within defence whereof might fully ſecured danger ſouldiers moved effectually perſuaſion brought backe againe within ſaid wals locked made faſt gate every ſide ſtood upon platformes bulwaikes battilments every readineſſe ſtones daits end one ventured farre forward might multitude ſhot ſtones beaten downe overthrowne howbeit one thing mightily troubled thoſe ſhut within becauſe veſſels uſed bring corne along river taken whereby iſaurians part plenty victuall themſelves ſpent already ordinary proviſion food ſuſtenance wonderouſly feared wofull deadly miſeries imminent famine newes theſe occurrent flowne farre abroad intelligence thereof continually given one another made gallus caeſar ſtarckle generall maſter g horſemen greatly employed buſied farre nebridius come orientis lieutenant generall eaſt commandement commiſſion directed unto part aſſembled force ſped himſelfe exceeding haſt diligence deliver citie ſo great ſuch importance danger knowne foreſaid theeves departed without atchieving memorable exploit beſides ſcattered aſunder manner made toward wields deſart mountaines chap iii violent rhode meſopotamia nohodares perſian together saracen whoſe manner lively depainted caſe thus ſtanding iſauria while king perſians encumbred warres borderer buſie driving owne confines frontier thoſe moſt fierce cruell nation certaine wavering mutable mind many time hoſtile manner aſſaile otherwhiles aid warreth upon u certaine great lord bankes river giulap tabulis geographicis hornuz onuphrius abora diſcovered betrayed owne men bodily feare ſome foule hainous fact committed ran unto romane garriſons went way without thing done afterwards ſat ſtill ſtirred howbeit saracen never wiſh either friend enemy raunging downe countrey whatſoever came way ſmall time ſpoyled deſtroyed like unto ravenous gledes kite ſpied prey high 1 magnentius faction ſore tortured awarded wofull exile like craſie ſickly bodie wont bee ſore diſtempered upon every light grievance even ſo baſe faint tender mind ſuppoſing whatſoever hee heard prejudice imperiall majeſtie ſuſpected anger ſet fire flattering ſpeeches tending bloudineſſe ſuch favorite next ready ynough aggravate multiply occurrence making ſemblance alſo exceeding griefe ſorrow caſe prince forſooth ſhould looſe life upon whoſe good eſtate welfare upon twined thread whole world depended open mouth counterfeit word gave therefore reported commaunded man time adjudged bee puniſhed theſe ſuch like offence called backe upon tendering manner commendatorie teſtimoniall thing hard hearted inexorable prince wont doe miſchievous deadly vice others ſometime abateth waxeth cooler age came upon grew hoter while company clawbacke flatterer egged forward purpoſed courſe among principall greateſt note one paulus n notarie borne spaine verily ſmooth countenance chancellor caried cloſe ſecret nature man paſſing witty ſubtile finding hidden way endanger folke ſent brittany bring away certaine martiall men entred conſpiracy action magnentius ſeeing could make reſiſtance outrageouſly come manner floud ſuddainly ſeized upon fortune eſtates many thus went ſtill making much ſpoile havocke utter undoing number impriſoning ſuch free borne afflicting body bond yea cruſhing ſome mannacles while forſooth patched pieced many crime imputation together layed charge falſe might whereupon committed ſuch impious wicked fact branded day conſtantius note perpetuall ſhame one martin ruled thoſe province deputy iuſtice lieutenant pro prafecto grievouſly lamenting miſeries innocent oftentimes beſeeching ſpare guiltleſſe could prevaile threatened depart end malicious inquiſitor perſecutor leaſtwiſe feare might give length draw induce open danger people naturally given quietneſſe peace paulus ſuppoſing meanes profeſſion trade would decay ſhrewd artiſan craftsmaſter wrapping linking theſe ſuch like matter together whereupon hee came alſo bee ſurnamed catena id eſt chaine drew ſaid deputie lieutenant himſelfe ſtill protected yet ſpared beare part theſe common peril earneſtly bent bring alſo bound tribune many others ad comitatum imperatoris court emperours priuie counſell extremitie miſchiefe ſo neere hand martin throughly provoked caught rapier dagger aſſaulteth perſon ſame paulus right hand haply gout ſome infirmitie therein fayled ſo able give deadly wound ſayd weapon drawne hee ſtabbed himſelfe ſide ſo unſeemely kind death departed life moſt righteous man attempted ſome ſtay eaſe piteous caſes many wicked part thus committed paulus embrued bloud returned prince campe bringing number priſoners covered manner chaynes men dejected plunged miſerable calamity wofull ſorrowes whoſe comming eculei rackes p made readie hangman prepared hooke wreſtingvices many proſcribed outlawed ſome baniſhed puniſhment bloudie ſtroke civile ſword man well remember constantius one went away quiet whenſoever theſe matter way whiſpering ſet foot theſe troublous affaire orphitus governed vrbem aeternam citie rome q civile juriſdiction iudge c l iuſtice praefect bearing himſelfe inſolently beyond bound dignitie conferred upon wiſe man verily paſſing well practiſed plees judiciall proceeding nothing ſo well furniſhed adorned liberall art nobleman ought beene time whoſe place dangerous commotion ſtirred ſcarcitie wine common people greedily ſet upon uſe expence whereof ſoone provoked raiſe many tumult inſurrections chap v lively portraiture citie rome flower youthfull day growth full yeares ſtrength old age alſo craſie time full diſeaſes likewiſe deſcription moſt miſerable estate thereof conſtantius gallus much ſuppoſe ſome ſtrangers happily ſhall chaunce reade theſe writing may wonder ſhould reaſon ſtyle diverted ſhew thoſe thing done rome relate nothing ſeditions tavernes ſuch like baſe matter ſummarily touch cauſes hereof ſwerve good one whit truth time rome began ariſe luckie preſaging token even firſt worldly glorie like live flouriſh ſo long men ſhall remaine upon face earth end ſhe might encreaſe grow ſtill high eſtate firme league eternall peace vertue fortune moſt part uſe diſagree concurred togither twaine one ſhould failed ſhe never mounted pitch perfection people thereof cradle one would ſay firſt cenſorius hath ſhewed demanded among many noble perſonages owne image ſtanding leiffer quoth good men ſhould move queſtion wherefore deſerved twaine worſe mutter ſoftly among themſelves obtained honeſt man come ſtranger unto one theſe great monied men ſo puffed pride full bagges thy duty way ſalutation firſt thou findeſt entertainement right welcome wiſhedfor gueſt many ſundry queſtions asked whereby thou art forced make ſome lye thou wondereſt never ſeene great man thus affectionately favoureth thee ſo meane perſon inſomuch repenteth thee thou hadſt ſeene tenne yeares ſooner theſe happy day principall felicitie thus preſuming confidently upon ſuch romane courteous affabilitie thou doe ſame next morrow thou art ſtand thy ſelfe one altogether unknowne come ſuddaine while wonderous encourager heartened thee ſo much yeſterday doubt long time thou ſhouldeſt whence thou art come length agnized taken ranke friend thou ſhew thy ſelfe ordinarily chamber preſence doe honour reverence iſauria freſh goodly countrey like ſort well plentifull vine aboundance corne graine middeſt whereof runneth navigable river calicadnus verily region two city beſides many good townes doe beautifie river euphrates unto border nilus bounding left hand upon nation saracenes right lying open roaring ſea tract coaſt nicator seleucus poſſeſſed much enlarged deceaſe alexander macedonian hee held kingdomes perſis right ſucceſſion seleucus ſay mightie victorious king according nicator ſirname doth import making uſe owne advantage multitude people ruled long time peace rude ruſticall habitation built city ſurely ſeated much wealth ſtrength preſent albeit beare greeke name impoſed upon according founder pleaſure yet looſe primitive name quite antient erecters gave aſſyrian tongue oſdroena hath beene ſaid put apart deſcription firſt azor mar nig comagena called euphratenſis greatly riſeth degree countrey well knowne reaſon three great city namely hierapolis old ninus samoſata lyeth soria syria ſpread abroad along ſpacious large plaine hath much renown antiochia citie wherof world hath taken knowledge may compare paragon affluence commodity well homebred thither brought laudichia ortel laodicia alſo hamous bellon apamia seleucia likewiſe moſt flouriſhing city even firſt beginning next hereunto phoenice bending toward mount libanus region right lovely beautifull adorned great faire city among pleaſantneſſe name excell tyrus said nigro sidon baruti berytus matchable ſame camula nigro emiſſa seham siam damaſcus built auncient time theſe province river oronz orontes environeth running along foot bottome high hill caſius lariſſa theveto caſſius diſchargeth ſelfe arme part mediterranean ſea thought gulfe • azzo parthenian ſea cneus pompeius vanquiſhed tigranes medicinable holeſome many purpoſes even theſe country alſo pompey like ſort tamed iewes woon ieruſalem brought forme province committing juriſdiction governour cloſe unto adjoyneth arabia reaching paſſages meet place advantageous region alſo hath among ſome townes city likewiſe wit b • tra 〈◊〉 boſtra geraza philadelphia ſtrong wals moſt ſurely fenced countrey traian emperour given name province ſet governour enforced yeeld obedience unto lawes many time quelled abated ſwelling pride inhabitant time made glorious brave warre upon medium parthian semblably iſle cyprus diſſoigned afarre firme land full haven two city among townes ſtanding thicke doe make renowmed namely salami paphus one much requeſt reputation holy alta • ſhrines iupiter temple venus ſame cyprus aboundeth ſo great ſo manifold plenty thing ſtanding need forraine helpe meanes hath owne able build great carricke ſhippe burthen bottome keele beneath higheſt topſailes rigged furniſhed ſame tackling thereto belonging ſhooteth ſea neither baſh ſay people rome invaded iſle rather upon greedy mind encroch juſt title thereto king ptolome confederat allie occaſion treaſure went low vertue decree without fault part committed proclaymed proſcribi outlaw thereupon hee voluntarily made himſelfe away drinking poyſon became tributarie ſpoyles alſo thereof enemie ſtate beſtowed fleet brought rome citie cato come backe againe order hiſtorie chap viii certaine perſons principally epigonus euſebius commaundement gallus executed amid theſe ſundry miſchiefes miſeries falling one necke another vrſicinus upon mine allegeance emperour commaunded give attendance ſent niſibis keeping whereof charge driven looke narrowly beginning occaſions theſe dangerous debate man gaineſaying repugning flatterer whole troupe barked one alwayes beene doutie warriour ſouldior captaine meere ſtranger law caſes trouble barre much perplexed feare owne danger toward ſaw thoſe ſuborned accuſers judge aſſociate joyned newly appearing ſhewing head ſame pit matter plotting deviſing either hand openly ſecret letter informed conſtantius craving mean aid aſſiſtance feare whereof prowd ſwelling humor caeſar ſo notoriouſly knowne might breath ſpent overmuch warineſſe circumſpection happened ſticke faſt among worſe ſnares laied ſhall ſhew hereafter while envious concurrents packed patched grievous matter entrap unto conſtantius prince otherwiſe indifferent moderate ynough perſon whatſoever baſe though unknowne put head ſome ſuch matter cruell implacable cauſarum titulo matter cauſes triall unlike himſelfe vpon day therefore appointed aforehand theſe deteſtable inquiſitions examination ſate downe iudge forme faſhion magiſter equitum wit vrſicinus generall horſemen aſſeſſors taught leſſons directed ſhould doe aſſiſtant either hand notary ready carry poſt haſt queſtions demanded anſweres made unto caeſar whoſe commandement ſet wholly upon crueltie inſtigation queene laying eare otherwhiles tapiſtrie hanging many permitted cleare themſelves crime objected allowed defence caſt away undone firſt therefore others came barre epigonus euſebius layd hard unto ſore wronged affinitie name ſaid montius little death blamed certain fabricarum tribanos maſters forge bare theſe name promiſed ſome meanes helpes worke revenge time ſhould ſerve verily epigonus philoſopher habit onely apparrell much entreatie craved favour vaine ſides tewed gaſhed yea feare death preſented unto ſhamefull confeſſion avouched himſelfe bee partie acceſſarie ſuch plot project never whereas hee neither ſeene heard anything ſilly man one altogether unacquainted law matter judiciall proceeding euſebius ſtanding confidently deniall imputation layd upon notwithſtanding suſpenſus hoyſed k aloft upon rack perſiſted long one craving peace conſent romane armie graunteth while eaſt part endured cruell tyrannie long time ſo ſoone warme open weather come conſtantius ſeventh yeare owne conſulſhip ſecond caeſars departed riſing brooke arculanus arrived one guardband ordinarie ſonne hermogenes late maſter horſemen torne piece long ſince petty riot broile people conſtantinople reported upon whoſe relation moſt truly towne gallia narbonenſis cabillo impatient delay grew mutinous raging incenſed maintenance life reaſon uſuall proviſion food c yet come whereupon rufinus ſame time lord chiefe iuſtice driven hard carriage made great journeyes haſtened millaine remained caeſar likewiſe ſhould ſent ſpeed put away ſuſpition conſtantius many faire flattering word ſollicited wife conſtantia conſtantina ſo long time ſo much deſired miſſed ſhe come unto albeit ſhe ſtood doubt fearing ſo often bloudily minded yet hope ſhee might appeaſe pacifie naturall brother ſhee taketh journey ſhe entred bithynia certaine baiting place lodging ſtation named coenos gallicanos ſhe died ſuddainly violent fever whoſe death husband ſeeing conſidering truſt affiance wherewith thought himſelfe ſurely upheld fallen ſtood perplexed penſive cogitation himſelfe way worke preſent eſtate ſo troublous ſo intangled brought brier carefull mind ran ever upon one thing constantius meaſuring weighing according pleaſure would neither admit ſatisfaction pardon offence hee prince much bent overthrow kinred cloſely lay ſnares hee tooke unawares trip would bee ſure put death brought hard exigent looking extremitie unleſſe faining daughter iuſtice doe teach vertue certaine hidden eternitie overſeeth earthly thing shee queene cauſes iudge matter ſhe alſo umpire arbitrate tempereth ſhaketh pot lot making alternative raiſing good men advanceth happie life hath fabulous antiquitie therefore fitted wing flightſwiftneſſe ſhe might thought preſent place given helme rudder ſhip carrie yea put wheele might unknowne ſhe running element ruleth univerſall world well caeſar wearie even himſelfe kind untimely death departed life nine twentieth yeare age reigned foure yeares borne among thuſcanes keepeth ſtill ſame name ortel maſſa veternenſis whoſe father constantius brother conſtantine emperour mother galla ſiſter unto rufinus cerealis noble conſuls time honourable governours province man goodly preſence well favoured comely ſhape feature bodie lims ſtreight proportionably compact haire head yellow beard ſoft reaſon downe newly come upon tender cheekes yet ſo carried betimes manly countenance manner behavior much difference betweene brother iulian betweene veſpaſians ſonnes domitian titus lifted higheſt degree honour fortune could give experience thoſe mutable motion play make good game men ſevered ſhoulders one led captive chaines another promoted rule ſome high place never hoped another againe caſt downe higheſt pitch dignitie example man would know many ſundry ordinarily fall may well like witleſſe foole able number tell ſands weigh peiſe mountaines xv booke chap 1 conſtantius upon execution gallus become fierce outrageous wilie ſubtile deviſes ſycophants court undone overthrowne goeth kill vrſicinus iulianus gorgonius men eſpeciall nobilitie thus farre forth according wee could ſearch truth might yeares ſee ſelves learne ſome ſort though obſcurely enquiring ſuch converſant place reported declaring order proceſſe diver occurrent reſt text enſuing ſhall lay abroad wee abilitie performe perfit exactly fearing backbiter depravers ſo long worke hold brevitie commendable cutting impertinent unſeaſonable delay defalketh nothing knowledge neceſſarie materiall point gallus yet noricum deveſted royall robe apodemius firebrand kindler broyles ſo long lived caught ſhooes carying away riding poſt quicke change horſes exceſſive enforcement might ſpoyle kill ſome came millaine fore runner tell newes beeing entred palace threw downe conſtantius foot king parthian ſpoyles ſuddain tidings brought giving intelligence unexpected buſineſſe ſo great weight difficultie ſuch facilitie fully performed mind thoſe bare greateſt ſway court employing ſtudie deſire pleaſing manner flatterie extolled vertue felicitie emperour skie whoſe becke two prince namely veteranio gallus although diver time manner common ſouldiors better thus caſſed exquiſite fine affectation faire word lifted ſuppoſing cō fidently thenceforth ſhould freed diſpleaſures harmes incident unto mortall men forth declined juſtice ſo intemperately would ſticke avouch maintaine ſame eternitie ſo much ſpoken enditing writing owne hand tearmed himſelfe lord whole world men ſaid part ought taken foule skorne indignitie laboured withall earneſt endevour gave frame life compoſe behaviour example patterne civile prince ſay rule thoſe infinite world democritus making inciting anaxarchus alexander great dreamed ſhould conſidered withall reading hearing mathematician one accord agree compaſſe whole earth unto u ſeemeth unmeaſurable compared greatneſſe univerſall world little pricke time horrible fall caeſar thus put death while trumpet judiciall danger ſounded alarme vrſicinus accuſed high treaſon envie hurtfull good men grew prejudice life eſtate ſurcharged one difficultie emperours eares faſt ſtopped admitting equall plea reaſonable defence lay open ſecret ſuggeſtions cloſe enemy deviſed foreſaid generall name conſtantius became quite forgotten tract eaſt much miſſed wiſhed home abroad onely dreadfull enemie unto perſian nation magnanimous knight ſtood unmooveable againſt accident whatſoever heedfull warie hee might ſeeme overbaſely caſt himſelfe downe deſpaire yet grieving groning heart innocencie ſure place ſafe repoſe one regard heavily appaied friend heretofore flocked revolted mightier ſide much like unto officer ſergeants according cuſtome wont goe old maſters new magiſtrats ſucceſſors moreover colleague arbetio faire ſhew counterfeit courteſie calling many time valiant warriour hee paſſing skilfull laying traines entrap man plaine ſimple converſation withall thoſe day great authoritie proved heavie friend ſet himſelfe ſore againſt like ſerpent ground lying cloſe hidden within hole obſerving every one paſſeth fiercely ſuddaine aſſaileth even ſo joyning office alſo warfare unto power hurt neither harmed time ſo much provoked polluted conſcience unſatiable purpoſe doe miſchiefe well forced making ſome captaines privie ſecrets cloſely breake emperour reveale mind agreed beene night following vrſicinus caried violently away farre ſight ſouldiors ſhould killed without condemnation even time paſt report domitius corbulo truſtie wiſe defendor province murthered troublous confuſion happened neroes day plot thus layd match ſet thoſe appointed doe feat waited time aforeſaid ſuddainely counſell turned mild commaundement given put ſo wicked act unto ſecond conſultation ſo whole engine forging calumniation turned upon iulian newly brought thither renowmed prince afterwards intangled within twofold crime iniquitie unjuſtice men deemed firſt marcellifundus place lying cappadocia flitted aſia upon deſire learne liberall ſciences againe becauſe hee ſeene ga •• u brother hee paſſed conſtantinople cleared himſelfe theſe imputation ſhewed done neither theſe two thing without warrant yet urgent ſuit curſed crew flatterer died gracious favour heavenly power euſebia empreſſe queene ſtood friend whoſe meanes brought towne como comum neere millain abode little permitted travaile greece according ardent deſire ſtudie apply wit learning neither wanted henceforth matter ariſing theſe caſes puniſhed order law would diſpleaſed good fortunat iſſue elſe fell away without effect void vaine happened ſometimes rich ſeeking ſuccour greater mightier men hand cleaving cloſe unto yvie doth tall tree bought diſcharge deliverie exceeding high rate whereas poorer ſort ſmall meanes none defend life condemned downeright without order therefore truth diſguiſed masked lie diver time alſo falſe forged matter went currant true ſame time gorgonius alſo brought queſtion charge caeſars bedchamber committed unto appeared upon confeſſion hee beene partie thoſe enterpriſes deſignes yea otherwhiles ſetter cauſer yet complotting practiſing guelded eunuch while juſtice ſhadowed lie finely framed wound himſelfe danger went wayes cleare chap 11 thoſe taken part gallus together many innocent perſons cruelly puniſhed taking cup liberally blurted ſome fooliſh word conſtantius therefore put dolorous torment kept cloſe priſon while matter thus paſſe millaine brought aquileia eaſt martiall men whole troupe company together number belonging gallus aforotime courtier limmes readie fall ſunder among chaines drawing much adoe little breath remained ſo manifold calamity diſtreſſes deteſting longer life charged beene gallus miniſters right hand outrage thought verily domitian mangled torne piece montius alſo others haſtily brought utter deſtruction hearing cauſe arbora ſent euſebius chiefe chamberlaine men given inconſiderate craking boaſting unjuſt alike bloudily minded deepe inſight matter without putting difference betweene innocent guiltie condemned ſome ſcourging torture endured live baniſhment others thruſt downe meaneſt place warreſervice reſt adjudged ſuffer death thus peſtered funerall place dead body returned triumph relating worthie act atchieved unto prince theſe ſuch like matter openly ſeene perſiſt ſtiffe reſolute rigorous hereupon thenceforth conſtantius minding violently one would ſay breake foredoe preſcript order courſe deſtinies diſcovering within breaſt lay expoſed perillous conſpiracies many whereby ſuddainely ſhewed themſelves number hunted liſtened rumor gaping greedie bit higheſt ſuch moſt honourable place rhinwalder scudo lepontij runneth downefals water manner nilus ſwift current ſwelling immediately firſt head beginneth ſo ſtore owne water violently paſſeth forward one ſingle channell time augmented ſnow melted reſolved water raſing go high bankes curving reach entreth round vaſt lake rhaetians dwelling thereby call brigantia carrying length foure hundred threeſcore great furlong whereof 8 make mile ſtadia breadth well neere much whereto acceſſe land thicke growne ſhadie unpleaſant wood unleſſe auncient ſober valour roman made broad way while nature ground rigour alſo ayre impeached barbarian mere therfore river frothing whirlepooles breaking running ſtill ſtanding water thereof cutteth quite middeſt juſt betweene two equall ſides throughout end like unto element ſevered apart everlaſting diſcord without encreaſing diminiſhing one whit ſtreame carried ſaving name ſtrength whole maketh end race neither afterwards ſuffereth meeting fellowſhip river entreth himſelfe gulfe maine ocean great wonder neither lake ſtirred violent ſtreame running yet river ſtayed haſtie courſe muddie filth lake howſoever confounded together yet mixed one bodie ſight prove ſo man would beleeve meanes could parted one thus alpheus orphea rophea riſing arcadia love beareth fountaine arethuſa cutting quite ionian ſea runneth forward fable doe report confines beloved arbetio expecting untill meſſengers came bring word barbarian comming although knew beginning warres uſually ſharpe fell within danger privie ambuſh ſuddaine unlooked miſchiefe ſtrucken ſtone dead meane enemy diſcovered leaping forth ſtarting hole without intermiſſion ſhot ſticked many kind dart whomſoever could find neither ſide able reſiſt hope meanes ſave life ſpeedie flight wherefore ſouldiors wholly bent avoiding wound diſorderly march ſcattering one another fro offered backes take blowes harmes howbeit moſt diſperſing themſelves narrow lane rid preſent danger helpe darke night upon returne day light refreſhed ſtrength betooke themſelves every man owne rankes file ſo heavie unlooked miſchance great number ſouldiors tenne tribune beſides miſſing upon defeature alemans taking heart ſtoutly every day approching neere unto romanes fortification while morning miſts dimmed light ran downe braving drawne ſwords grating teeth letting flye big prowd menace ſuddaine scutarij targuetiers ſallied forth reaſon troupe enemy affronting driven backe ſtand provoked fellowes one mind reſolution fight greater part affrighted example foyle ſo freſh lately received arbetio ſuppoſing behind would ſafe river ſo comming upon enemy way ſet battaile running skirmiſhes maner brigand put ſhamefull flight diſperſed diſarray upon opening rankes while make haſt eſcape heavie load encumbred forced diſarme lay body bare ſo many blow thruſt ſwords ſpeares went ſlaine many ſlaine horſe man together even lay ſeemed ſtill ſit faſt upon backes ſight thoſe iſſued heapes campe made doubt goe forth battaile fellowes unmindfull taking heed ſave themſelves beat downe trode foot barbarous ſort unleſſe ſuch made ſhift running away eſcape death trampling upon heapes dead body embrued bloud ſlaine enemy thus maintaine truth wicked plot diſpatched letter made purpoſe agreeable point thoſe preſented unto emperour per praf ••••• pręfect unto ad 〈◊◊〉 cremenenſis maſter worke houſe forge h cremona name silvanus malarichus ſaid maſter put mind one privie unto ſecret deſignes provide thing expedition read ſame ſticking doubting good ſhould meane remembred theſe perſons whoſe letter received ever communed ſuch ſecret buſineſſe returneth ſame miſſives carrier brought ſouldior unto malarichus praying explaine meaning openly write ſo darke tearmes aſſured himſelfe ſomewhat rude ſimple man underſtood ſo obſcurely ſignified unto malarichus hee quickly found thus much even ſorrowfull ſad grievouſly bewailing hard hap himſelfe silvanus countryman taking frankes flouriſhed number time palace ſpake boldly made uprore traine laid faiterous plot come light muſt need graunted bloud ſought theſe matter beeing knowne emperour gave order while thoſe conſiſtorie men warre generall conſidered buſineſſe ſhould enquirie ſearch made iudges ynough thereof began loath thing florentius ſonne nigrianus agens tunc pro magiſtro officiirum place k maſter office viewing diligently writing finding certaine remaines old prickes accent letter perceived former content new furbiſhed another made farre different tenor silvanus endited ſame ſet lieu thereof according pleaſure packe falſe forger therefore miſt fraud deceit ſcattered diſpatched emperour truely enformed faithfull relation made unto commaundeth prafectum praefect deprived authoritie brought judicially queſtion triall accordingly painefull travaile conſent many acquit euſebius late treaſurer prince exchequer ſtretched high upon racke ſaid theſe matter broached ſet foot privitie aedeſius ſtiffely denying hee knew done went way guiltleſſe buſineſſe ended diſcharged information made crime cauſed bee preſented brought queſtion dynamius one excellent skill cunning made renowmed carried away dignitie 1 correctoris corrector thuſcus alſo commaunded reforme reſt credulous prince militarie traine chap v silvanus unreaſonable abuſe offered unto adverſaries driven plot take violent courſes gaule mounteth imperiall dignitie ſo length ſlaine while theſe matter thus handling silvanus making abode colein agrippina taking full knowledge continuall meſſengers friend apodemius practiſing endanger whole eſtate knowing alſo well ynough pliant mind prince eaſie induced perſuaded ſaid cauſe fearing withall leaſt abſent without ſentence paſſed againſt might held attaint guilty plunged thus great extremitie thought commit himſelfe fidelitie protection barbarian laniogaiſus tribune onely while ſerved warres yet promoted place commaund candidat written conſtans lying point death prohibited ſhewed frankes deſcended would ſurely either kill el reward received betray ſuppoſing preſent caſe ſtood ſafetie put himſelfe upon utmoſt ſhifts ſo little little ſecret wiſe conferred head captain chiefe officer armie principia againe earneſtly endeuoured ſame conſideration great reward promiſed tooke forcibly away enſignes dragon banner time mounted imperiall dignitie while theſe thing paſſe gaule toward latter end day unexpected newes came millaine declaring plaine word silvanus while colonell footman endevoureth climbe higher ſolliciting armie ſide advaunced emperour constantius weightie unlooked accident ſtrucken leſſe thunderbolt fatall deſtinie called counſaile midnight chiefe officer ruler haſtened palace every man ſeeke adviſe ſpeake point namely make choice ought bee done mention ſoftly made vrſicinus moſt worthie man policie warre affaire one beene provoked upon fruſtra deſert grievous injurie ſent chiefe gentleman uſher thing uſually done way great honour ſooner hee entred counſell chamber purple robe preſented unto ſo ſet ſuppliant emperours foot manner forraine king whereas read alwaies emperor ſaluted like iudges thus little malicious ſpightfull railing tearmed orientis vorago swallowingpit waſter eaſt yea complained aſpiring uſurpe ſoveraigne place meanes ſonnes forſooth became moſt politicke wiſe leader beene fellowſouldior constantine great hee alone called quench fire good honeſt meanes muſt need ſay yet covertly way traine great care diligence uſed silvanus might deſtroyed moſt ſtrong arrant traytor state ſhould miſſe yet vrſicinus alreadie exulcerate carrying rancour heart utterly aboliſhed end ſcruple ſhould remaine behind greatly feared therefore while order giving make haſt ſet forward journey ſaid generall went repeale confute crime beene objected unto emperour way prevention mild ſpeech ſtayed ſaying time goe hand traverſe cauſe put plea defence conſidering neceſſitie urgent occurrent bee mitigated grew inforced rather ſides ſhould grow tearmes former concord old love much debating therefore long deliberation point principally handled device uſe silvanus might think emperour yet knowledge deſignes doings length probable matter found aſſure thereof adviſed letter penned honourable tearmes hee received vrſicinus ſucceſſour hee ſhould returne whole power authoritie untouched theſe thing thus digeſted ſtraightwaies colonell captaine commaunded take journey foorth hee led companie aſſiſt neceſſarie publique affaire state tenne protectores domeſt • o emperours guard ordinarie according demaunded number marcellinus author hiſtorie alſo ſelfe one together colleague verianus reſt kinſmen ally familiar friend ſo ſoone hee gone forth countrey every man feare himſelfe accompanied great way albeit thoſe fight wild beaſts caſt untractable ſavages yet weighing throughly one good thing yet evill heavie precedent ſubſtitute bring place fortunate event admired notable ſentence tully delivered publiſhed even eternall oracle truth ſelfe wiſe albeit quoth wiſhed fortune alwaies continued upright flouriſhing proſperous yet hath condition life ſo much ſence feeling owne good wofull deſperate caſe returne fortune againe better happier estate make ſpeed therefore take great journies end ambitious • iſter ar • orū meaneth solvarus called rectorem pedeſtris • litia colonell infanteri • commaunder force rumor uſurping tyrannie paſſed italian coaſts march ſuſpected might appeare running haſt made certaine wandering flying fame gotten ſtart u bewrayed thing ſo entred agrippina wee found reach reaſon multitude people part thither aſſembled grounding ſure enterpriſes ſo haſtily begun beſides great force gathered together preſent ſtate required tooke better way pitifull lamentable leader vrſicinus ſhould framed accommodate mind new emperour aſſured himſelfe vaine mockery pręſaging ſignes ſtrength encreaſed end while ſundrie counterfeit ſhewes flatterie ſecuritie proked forward milder courſe fearing hoſtilitie might deceived iſſue project ſeemed difficult dangerous indeed would ſtood better good policie ſafetie take heed deſires might correſpondencie oportunitie neither running lagging behind ſhould breake due time ſure vertue one writ word ſuffer death howbeit ſaid captaine mildly received forced preſent buſineſſe ſelfe requiring leſſe bow downe ſtoupe yea adore ſolemne wiſe manner aſpired ſo high purple robe eſpecially regarded made much moſt inward eaſie readie acceſſe unto honour ſit royall table ſuch preheminence others time hee uſed ſecret conſultation maine point importance empire ſelfe silvanus tooke heart unworthie perſons advanced dignitie conſuls honourable place high government himſelfe vrſicinus alone ſo great manifold paine endured weale publique ſo deſpiſed part cruelly abuſed ſifting examining familiar friend baſe manner proceeding triall ſhould bee accuſed treaſon againe malice hatred enemy haled eaſt brought home theſe continuall complaint made hee ſecretly open place yet theſe ſuch like ſpeeches terrified mutinous grumbling every ſide ſouldiors alledging want hotely ſet haſt breake ſtreights monte genebre mont cenis cottian alpes perplexitie doubtfull trouble heart wee cloſely caſt ſought ſome device like take effect end many alteration mind reaſon feare reſolved thus wee great induſtrie gotten warie miniſters bound communication religious oath proteſtation ſhould ſollicited braccati cornuti n company wavering allegeance large hire mutable readie turne every way therefore buſineſſe made ſure meanes certaine baſe mediator broker betweene obſcure condition meet worke feat ſet fire beſide expectation reward sunne ariſing ſuddainely crew armed men breaketh forth falleth ſuch doubtfull caſes bold hardie ſlaine warder entred palace plucked silvanus forth little chappell whither hee fled amated breathleſſe going congregation chriſtian religion many ſtrokes ſwords ſlew outright thus brave leader man meane deſert died kind death even feare ſlanderous accuſations wherewith faction enemy abſence enſnared entangled ſo ſafetie life driven proceed unto utmoſt extremitie ſhifts albeit regard iſſuing foorth ſo ſeaſonably young gallant ſouldiors battaile murſa hee held constantius obliged unto good turne yet feared hee prince variable uncertaine although might pretend valiant act bonitius alſo father franke verily civile warre behaved himſelfe many time right manfully taking part conſtantine againſt faction licinius uſurper licinians happened ſo ſuch matter working gaule people greateſt cirque shewplace rome whether upon ground reaſon moved ſome pręſage unknowne cried lowd voice silvanus vanquiſhed chap vi conſtantius great glorious word flatterer exalted skie exerciſeth crueltie upon noble perſonages leontius repreſſeth ſeditious uprore raiſed citie romane biſhop named liberius favouring athanaſius biſhop alexandria put see expelled citie silvanus therefore thus ſlaine hath beene related agrippina emperour taken knowledge thereof exceeding great joy prince made altogether inſolent pride vanitie aſcribed alſo proſperous traine courſe owne felicity holding ſtill old manner evermore hate men action valiant domitianus time paſt yet deſirous contrarie ſlight whatſoever overthrow nay ſo farre praiſing induſtrious act wrote intercepted ſomewhat treaſure gaule truth man ever looſe hanged himſelfe life halter matter embaſſage tripoli theſe thing thus finiſhed conſtantius one touched heaven head commaund humane chaunces puffed loftie ſpeeches big ſwelling word flatterer number himſelfe encreaſed namely deſpiſing rejecting thoſe ſo cunning others kind read croeſus therefore thruſt solon head ſhoulders kingdome becauſe could skill ſoothing humor alſo dionyſius denis threatened put philoxenus poet death others praiſed recited owne abſurd verſes ſuch carried grace alone never moved hearing thing moſt pernitious foſtreſſe vice commendation onely deed ought acceptable unto great potentate perſon high place otherwhiles alſo rowme allowed entertaine diſpraiſe thing done amiſſe care paſt ſecuritie obtained inquiſitions according manner judiciall trial holden whereby number impriſonment chaines yrons puniſhed guiltie malefactor paulus divelliſh promoter could hold longer breake joy roſe practiſe licentiouſly venomous peſtiferous art while conſiſtorianis counſellors state martiall men alſo enquired buſineſſe commaundement given proculus one silvanus houſehold put upon racke thin bodied man diſeaſed men feared leaſt poore carcaſſe beene wearied extremitie exceſſive torment would cauſe many man one another indifferently called queſtion charged haynous crime fell farre otherwiſe expected remembring dreame whereby forbidden lying aſleepe himſelfe affirmed hurt innocent perſon notwithſtanding hee tortured almoſt death yet named hee appeached one conſtantly avowed fact silvanus ſhewing evident proofe attempted enterpriſe upon ambitious deſire meerely conſtrained upon neceſſitie alledged probable reaſon inducing thereunto ſame well knowne teſtimonies many upon fifth day tooke upon thoſe princely infules ornament given ſoldiors pay name constantius hee ſpake unto continue valiant faithfull whereby appeared gone take preſumptuouſly enſignes higher eſtate hee would expended ſuch weightie maſſe gold owne poemenius part condemned perſons haled execution died meane related time men treviri trier ſhut gate citie againſt caeſar decentius elected protect defend common aſclepiodotus lutto maudio comites killed many beſides obſtinate ſelfe time ſearching narrowly upon ambiguous tearmes preſumptions theſe ſuch like matter while ſome deadly peſtiferous whirlepuffe raiſeth ſtill theſe miſeries common miſchiefes state leontius governing aeternam urbem rome gave many good teſtimonies proofes excellent iudge hearing cauſes quicke deciding determining moſt juſt owne nature friendly favourable howſoever hee ſeemed ſome maintaining authoritie ſharpe ſevere withall much enclined love firſt device therefore ſtirre ſeditious tumult againſt moſt baſe vile philoromus runner chariotdriver commaundement drawne harried away common generall following readie reſcue defend owne deare child terrible violence ſet upon ſaid p praefectum governor taking timorous man perſiſting firme reſolute ſent ſerjeants officer among ſome attached put painefull torment confined iſlands neither gainſaied man made reſiſtance day communaltie likewiſe chafing broile wont complaining want wine met together settiſonio septizonium place much reſort marcus emperour built baine ſumptuous ſtately piece worke ſaid governour going thither purpoſe earneſtly entreated gowned follower ſerjeants put himſelfe throng ſo malapart menacing multitude ſet upon raging ſtill ever ſince former commotion hardly moved afraid right went forward inſomuch ſort ſaid attendant follower forſooke albeit haſtened apace enter ſhrewd ſuddaine danger sitting therefore chariot lovely ſhew boldneſſe confidence beheld piercing eye face thoſe unruly crewes beene ſo many ſerpents ruffling foule noiſe crie every ſide taking knowledge one fellow reſt big huge ſtature reddiſh yellow head asked whether peter ſurnamed heard called valvomeres anſwered kind chiding accent man commaunded one knowne old chiefetaine ringleader ſeditious rebel contradiction gaineſaying many hand bound behind backe ſo hoiſted hanged vpon kind racke aire ſeene aloft calling hard vaine helpe thoſe owne ſept tribe whole multitude little ſtood ſo thicke thruſt together diſperſed ſundrie part citie vaniſhed ſight ſo hote buſie ſtirrer commotion ſides racked torne ſecret judiciall place torture expelled ſent away marca ancona picenum afterwards daring offer abuſe diſhonour virgine meane patronage hee therefore upon ſentence given patruinus conſulari preſident judged condemned looſe head government leontius liberius biſhop chriſtian religion precept directed constantius ſent ad conutatum privie counſell one oppoſing himſelfe againſt emperours commaundements decree many owne conſorts matter briefely run athanaſius biſhop time alexandria bearing himſelfe high profeſſion one went enquire matter belonged dayly bruit rumor went congregation synode tearme ſame place excommunicated remooved ſacramentall dignitie held celebrated reported paſſing skilfull necromancie expounding truth oracle prophecy alſo well ſeene thoſe thing augurall bird portended praeſaged diver time foretold future event beſides theſe matter charged alſo point diſagreeing purpoſe meaning law religion whereof prelate athanaſius liberius biſhop ſame mind opinion reſt commandement emperor warned ſubſcription depoſe ſacerdotall see hee ſtiffely withſtood denied ſo doe often cry unlawfull even higheſt degree condemne man unſeene unheard openly one would ſay ſpurning againſt emperours pleaſure hee enemie alwaies bitterly bent againſt athanaſius although hee knew thing performed accordingly yet earneſtly deſired ſame might bee confirmed ratified authoritie biſhops rome enjoy could obtaine liberius without much adoe great difficultie even midnight feare people loved exceedingly could caried away thus verily ſtood affaire rome former text hath ſhewed chap vii reaſon gaule inclined revolt conſtantius able undergoe charge minding take iulian companion empire length upon right way meanes effect ſame came mind joyne companion empire couſin • atruelem fratrē germane iulianus long ſince ſent brought achaia even yet ſtudents cloake gaberdine upon urgent occaſion ſo many imminent calamity bewrayed thus much favourite friend next ſhewing plaine tearmes himſelfe one ſhrunke hee never done burthen ſo many neceſſities trouble comming ſo thicke upon beeing throughly taught exceſſive flatterie beare foolified gulled man telling ever anone nothing world ſo adverſe difficult powerfull vertue heavenly fortune together able ever heretofore overcome many pricked conſcience offence committed ſaid thus much moreover henceforth beware name caeſar rehearſing therewith lewd part committed gallus againſt labouring hard upon point queene alone oppoſed ſelfe feare flit ſo farre country naturall wit wiſedome ſhe thought good policie state wote ſhe ſaid kinſman ought bee preferred much debating matter way deliberation fro reſolution ſtood firme ſo ſetting aſide frivolous bootleſſe diſputations hee fully determined take unto iulianus compartener imperiall governement ſent come day prefixed emperour company fellow ſouldiors preſent called together tribunall erected upon high banke ſtood maine ſtanderds eagle enſignes mounted unto holding iulianus right hand thus way mild gentle ſpeech began ſay ſtand right valorous defendors weale publique maintaine manner one breath ſpirit common cauſe plead equall iudges briefely declare unto death rebellious tyrant rage furie moved egged attempt theſe deſignes proiected barbarian meant romane bloud ſacrifice unto wicked mane invade gaule overrun broken peace march encouraged upon confidence aſſured perſuaſion extreame neceſsities bind u fast ynough occaſion land ſo farre diſioyned aſunder miſchiefe therefore incrocheth alreadie beyond frontier hard adioyning time permitteth helpe together conſultation ſhall ioyntly one accord meet neckes theſe prowd nation ſwell ſo big bound alſo empire ſhall remaine entire reſteth hope affaire doe conceive yee alſo ſtrengthen fortunate effect iulianus mine unckles ſonne father ſide well approoved yee know well ynough modeſtie regard whereof well neereneſſe bloud deare unto u young gentleman industrious action alreadie appeareth wiſh ioyne place power caeſar motion mine thinke ſame profitable expedient confirmed alſo graunt allowance ſay effect aſſembly interrupting ſpeech gentle manner ſtayed ſaying foreknowledge future conſequence choice mightie iupiter man wit underſtanding emperour ſtanding ſtill without ſtirring untill ſilent went confidently reſt ſpeech much quoth ioyfull acclamation ſheweth correſpondencie favourable aſſent let young gentleman endued peaceable vigour whoſe temperate behaviour imitated rather commended riſe honour ſeconded fortunate favour whoſe ſingular towardneſſe inſtructed good art even herein thinkes fully ſhewed choſen therefore grace preſent direction heavenly god clad princely robe ſaid ſoone put upon iulian grandfather purple declared caeſar joy armie ſpeaketh unto ſomewhat ſad carrying demiſle lowly looke manner thou hast thy prime brother mine loving brother ever recovered glorious flower thy parentage originall augmented confeſſe mine owne glorie take ſelfe truly advaunced conferring ſuperiour power upon noble prince mine owne bloud ſoveraigne power ſelfe enioy come therefore partaker paine peril undertake defence ſervice gaule one readie bountifulneſſe eaſe part afflicted need require ioyne battaile enemy ſtand ſure footing among enſignebearers themſelves conſiderate exhorter encourager adventure due time leading way adviſed warineſſe heartening emboldening fight ſuccours ſupplies ſtrengthening thoſe troubled diſarray modeſt tearms rebaking ſlouthfull preſent moſt true witneſſe well induſtrious ſouldior idle coward therefore urgent ſervice requireth forth like valiant knight lead likewiſe hardie ſouldiors aſsiſtant one another turnes courſe firme ſtedfaſt love ſerve together another day god graunt requeſt ioyntly governe world equall moderation pietie part ſhall place even preſent againe whatſoever ſhall goe bee wanting haſten ſake unto higheſt enterpriſes men wiſhes prayer ioyne purpoſing defend vigilant care ſtation ward aſsigned unto commonwealth ſelfe theſe word ended man afterward held peace ſouldiors terrible clattering knocked entertained caeſar glittering reſplendent imperiall robe whoſe eye carrying terrour amiable lovelineſſe withall whoſe pleaſing countenance alſo extraordinarie quickneſſe lively vigour wiſtly long time beheld gathered one like prove throughly peruſed old bookes reading whereof declareth bodily ſignes phyſiognomie inward indewments mind end might regarded better reſpect reverence neither commended meaſure yet leſſe meet becomming therefore eſteemed voice cenſours ſouldiors end taken ſit chariot received regall palace verſe homer poëme hee ſoftly whiſpered himſelfe 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſhould redreſſe common calamity cry one voice thinking leſſe ſhone upon certaine bleſſed comfortable genius certaine old woman loſt eye learned enquirie came citie iulianus caeſar cried ſhould repaire temple god conſidering therefore loftie poet virgil mantua ſaid time maius opus moveo maior mihi naſcitur ordo rerum— greater worke enterpriſe greater traine matter doth ariſe thinke convenient time ſhew tract ſituation gaule leaſt ſhould army readie encounter among variable chaunces battailes curſarily tell ſuch thing unknowne unto ſome might ſeeme follow example ſlouthfull ſaylers mariner worne auncient writer doubtfull touching originall gaulois left knowledge buſineſſe unperfect afterwards timagenes diligence language greeke collected many ſundrie bookes thoſe thinges lay long unknowne whoſe credite authoritie following obſcuritie remooved declare ſame diſtinctly plainely affirmed people firſt ſeene theſe region borne homelings homebred aborigine called celtae name amiable king galatae according mother named ſo gaulois greeke tongue tearmed others reported dorienſes follower auncient hercules inhabited coaſts confining along ocean pith • u readeth diuides draſidę record part deed nation homelings inborne bred others alſo utmoſt iſlands tract beyond rhene driven owne native ſeats continuall warres inundation ſwelling ſea conflowed thither ſay deſtruction troy fled face greekes every diſperſed poſſeſſed themſelves theſe place lying void inhabitant theſe country vouch alſo read engraven monument record hercules ſonne amphitryo made haſt deſtroy geryon tauriſcus two cruell tyrant one infeſted spaine gaule vanquiſhed lay gentlewoman countrey begat many child called owne name thoſe part rule people aſia phocęa avoid cruell rigor harpalus lieutenant generall captaine king cyrus ſailed italie one part built veleis velia baſilic ••• lucania 〈◊〉 maſſilia province vienna afterwards age enſuing puiſſance encreaſed founded many townes muſt forbeare ſuch varietie oftentimes hath ſatietie joyned meane men place growne little little civilitie ſtudies laudable ſciences begun bard eubages druides mightily flouriſhed verily bard ſung unto ſweet muſicke harpe valorous deedes worthie men compoſed heroicke verſe eubages ſearching higheſt altitude nature worke endevoured lay open declare ſame among theſe druidae higher wit conceit according authoritie pythagoras decreed tied unto ſocieties fellowſhips addicted wholly unto queſtions deepe hidden point deſpiſing humane thing pronounced men ſoules immortall climate gaule reaſon high difficult riſings mountaines thoſe alwaies covered hideous heapes ſnow time unknowne almoſt inhabitant world beſide unleſſe coaſteth upon ſea encloſed every ſide fence environ naturally art man verily south ſide mar toſco mar de marſeille tyrrhene gaule ſeas runne cloſe toward north divided ſavage nation river rhene weſtward ocean high mountaine hath many name according diver part thereof pyrenaeus way beginneth mount eaſtward giveth place high bank cottian alpes king cottius gaule conquered ſubdued lying hidden alone cloſe within ſtreits truſting upon unacceſſible roughneſſe craggie place feare well length allayed himſelfe received friendſhip emperour octavian lieu memorable gift great labourious workes made ſerve compendious way commodious travailers ſtanding juſt midſt betwixt old alpes touching report anone learned knowne theſe cottian alpes begin town reguſio suſa leandro seguſio peaketh mightie high mount man almoſt penetrabile paſſe without danger men come gaule bendeth ſteepe forward great downefall terrible behold reaſon cliffes hanging either ſide eſpecially spring time froſt yce thaweth ſnow melteth hot breath wind ſtreits broken ſides hole ditch hidden heapes frozen yce men verily ſtaggering ſtaying foot make ſome ſhift come downe horſes cart fall headlong forward put miſchiefe one remedie alone hath beene deviſed namely moſt wagon mightie great rope tied faſt unto maine ſtrength men ox ſtraining behind ſtay ſame ſcarcely creeping pace ſomewhat ſafely come rolling downe ſaid happeneth spring time yeare winter ground charged coat yce ſmoothed therewith thereby ſlipperie foot ſetteth men forward gate run upon noſes open vallies along broad wide plaines truſted reaſon yce beare ſwallow otherwhiles folke paſſing thereupon regard danger thoſe cunning way know countrey well pitch downe faſt certaine pile maine ſtakes timber bearing head ground way along ſafer place end way faring man directed ſtand row may paſſe without harme happen lye hidden hilled ſnow namely overthrowne land flouds river falling downe mountaines hardly paſſable guidance ruſticall people leading way pitch italian cliffe reacheth plaine ſpace ſeven myles unto ſtation named marti hence another high hill upright much adoe paſſed ſtretcheth forward farre head top matrona occaſion name came chaunce befell unto noble woman whence way verily lyeth ſteepe downe yet eaſie travaileable farre fort brigantium ſtandeth towne brianſon virgantia sepulchre ſaid pettie king reported made thoſe way abovenamed seguſio neere unto wals mane twofold reaſon devoutly honoured hee ruled owne ſubjects way juſt moderate government alſo becauſe received alliance romane ſtate procured perpetuall peace reſt unto nation albeit way ſpoken middle one therefore compendious ſhorter yea haunted yet others alſo beene made long diver time firſt hercules thebe marching milder manner deſtroy geryon hath beene ſaid tauriſcus cauſed bee wrought neere unto maritime alpes hercules gave name semblably caſtle monoecus conſecrated everlaſting memoriall himſelfe revolution many age upon occaſion alpes poeninae deviſed publius cornelius scipio father elder africanus saguntines memorable miſeries fidelitie upon conſtant reſolution more beſieged goe spaine aid tranſported fleet manned puiſſant power ſouldiors citie morvedre saguntum mightier force deſtroyed able reach overtake anniball three day paſſed rhoine rhodanus marched apace part italie croſſed betweene ſwift ſayle arme ſea long cut watched genoa genu towne riviera de genoa oriel liguria ſhould come downe mountaines end might fortune given leave opportunitie encounter plaine wearied roughneſſe thoſe comberous way howbeit regard maine chaunce common good adviſed brother cn scipio goe spaine keepe backe haſdruball likewiſe get come thence whereof anniball intelligence given fugitive man nimble craftie wit taking thoſe piemont taurine dwelt hard guide came way • ntrecaſteux provence 〈◊〉 tricaſtines utmoſt coaſt county • ifort vocontians chace forreſts de craux tricorij beginning worke made another way beene unpaſſable hewed rocke ſtood huge height making mightie fire pouring vinegre upon broken diſſolved marched along river 〈◊〉 druentia runneth winding wandering ſtreame ſeized upon region tuſcane thus much touching alpes come behind chap x gaule called celtica aquitanica belgica principall part thereof together ſhapes manner people deſcribed auncient time theſe part lay hidden barbarous thought beene three ſorts people divided celtae ſame galli acquitani belgi different language order lawes verily gaules alſo celt river garonne garumna ſevereth thoſe guienne according marlianus acquitances river ſpringing pyrenaean hils hath paſſed many towne hideth himſelfe within ocean ſame nation alſo ſeperated belgae marne matrona seyne sequana river equall gemina magnitudinis duple bigneſſe running province lyon lugdunenſis encloſed compaſſed round manner iſland caſtle pariſij named pan lutetia meet one channell keeping joynt courſe together forward neere unto conſtance normandie caſtra conſtantia fall ſea theſe nation belgae name auncient writer moſt valiant farre remooved civile kind life behaviour made effeminate daintie delight brought unto warred long time germanes beyond rhene acquitanes unto whoſe coaſts next hand peaceable marchandiſe uſed brought part fell demeanor carriage delicate ſoone brought romanes dominion whole countrey gaule ever ſince driven ſo many urgent warres yeeld unto iulius dictator hath beene ruled tetrarchie government divided foure part whereof narbonenſis firſt contained within viennenſis lugdunenſis ſecond rule wholly acquitanes upper lower germanie together belgae two juriſdictions governed ſame time reckoned within whole circuit gaule theſe province wit ſecond germanie beginning firſt weſt coaſt fortified colein agrippina tongeren tungri great city wealthie firſt germanie beſides free townes boroughes magontiacum mentz magontiacus wormz vangiones alſo speyr nemetes strasburg ſome read argentoratſi argentoratus renowmed overthrowes defeatures barbarian firſt belgica hath frontier thereof metz mediomatrici trier treviri famous emperours reſiance adjoineth ſecond belgica wherein ſtand amiens ambiano eminent citie among others chalons champaigne cathelauni alſo rhemes burgognor • rhemi among beſanſon sequani ſeene augſt neere unto baſile biſontij lugdunum lyon rauraci greater note eſtate many townes lugdunenſis firſt adorned cavailon lugdunus sen cabillones bordeaux bourges rather senones autun biturigae rovan roan auguſtudunum note mightie auncient wals touraine rothomagi make ſhew ſecond lugdunenſis sainctes mechelen ſome thinke turini avenche mediolanum alſo tricaſtini alpes graię poeninę beſides obſcure town bourdeaux aventicum alſo citie verily deſolate forſaken baſe account time paſt appeareth even day building decayed halfe downe theſe ſay goodly province city gaule aquitania lieth toward mountaines pyrenaei part ocean reacheth unto spaine firſt province acquitanica well inhabited beautified faire great city letting many others goe bourdeaux burdegala avergne averni doe paſſe likewiſe xainctes santones poicters pictavi auchx auſci bazadois vaſarae commend unto u ninenations province narbonenfis compriſed narbone narbona tolou • e toloſa carry chiefe name city viennenſis joyeth beautie many city thoſe better ſort vienna ſelfe arles arelate valence valentia whereto marſeiles maſſiilia annexed ſocietie power whereof wee read rome otherwhiles great danger diſtreſſes hath beene relieved ſupported neere unto theſe aix neere unto solies salluvij nizza nicea antibe pineto antipolis iſles iſles de hyerres • ortel stoechades much traine text hiſtoricall worke come theſe part unfitting abſurd ſay nothing rhodanus river greateſt name rhoſne rhodanus flowing poenine alpes ſtore spring guſhing forth great plentie running downe apace directly toward plaine countrey owne ſtreame hideth bankes ſo engorgeth himſelfe lake named lac de lozanne de geneve lemanus albeit runneth within ſame yet entermingled water beſides owne gliding one ſide ſlower ſtill ſurface water ſeeking iſſue ſwift current maketh way forth whence without hurt thing runneth thicke fennes eurgognons sequani hath gone great way forward paſſeth lightly hard province viennenſis left ſide lugdunenſis right thus rid great ground wavie ſtreame taketh unto saone araris call sauconna running within firſt germanie giveth owne name place beginneth gaule thenceforth uſe meaſure journeyes myles league rhodanus growne bigger charged river falling carrieth exceeding tall big ſhippes uſe oftentimes toſſed gale wind ending among vale nature hath ordained preſcript limit frothing foming incorporate gauliſh ſea open frith gulfe called otherwiſe called gallious sinus ad gradus lying arles almoſt tenne mile thus much touching ſite place deſcribe ſhapes manner people gaules manner ſtature tall complexion cleere white ruddie haire carrying caſt eye kind terrible ſterne grimneſſe given much brawles exceeding inſolent one ſet chiding brawling ſhrew wife commonly twaine ſtronger farre ſallow hew take part whole band others ſtrangers able match eſpecially ſhe ſetting necke big ſwollen veines fals grating teeth levelling ſnow white armes thoſe mightie big ſize begin lay fiſts heeles together bolt dart diſcharged violently writhed wreſted ſtrings brake ſuch like engine ordinarie word moſt well pacified angrie dreadfull full menacing like diligence curioſitie neat cleane neither thoſe tract eſpecially acquitania ſhall ſee woman ſhe never ſo poore foule ragged clothes place every age among moſt meet warfare like courage hardineſſe heart old man brought field luſtie youth carrying limmes hardened froſt continuall travaile reſolved contemne many thoſe fearefull occurrent neither ever knowne one italie feare going warres cut owne thumbe ſuch ſo doe tearme merrily way jeaſt murcos nation greedily given wine affecting make ſundry ſorts drinke reſembling wine ſome among baſer ſort wit ſences dulled continuall drunkenneſſe cato ſentence hath defined voluntarie kind furie raviſhed beſtraught wild wandering cogitation ſo may ſeeme true tully pleading fonteius ſaith gaulois henceforth would drinke wine delayed becauſe thought poyſon theſe region eſpecially thoſe confine upon italy abhorred much come little little romanes empire firſt attempted tried fulvius afterwards ſmall battailes ſore ſhaken sextius laſt tamed ſubdued fabius maximus unto compleat effecting buſineſſe namely vanquiſhed fell ſtout nation allobroges gained ſirname gaules unleſſe quarter unpaſſable reaſon meeres mariſhes saluſt mine author telleth u mutuall overthrowes given taken ſpace tenne yeares warre together caeſar perpetuall covenant league joined unto u perfect ſocietie flowne farre returne length matter begun chap xi ſtate gaule time conſtantius iulianus emperours domitianus aboveſaid cruell death diſpatched way muſonianus ſucceſſor governed eaſt place authoritie pratoriani praefecti praefectus praetorio lord iuſtice man renowmed eloquence language whereby hee aroſe higher degree expected constantine time ſearched narrowly ſuperſtitious ſects q manichee ſuch like meet interpreter could found made choice commended ſufficient man behalfe performing office function skilfully hee would named muſonianus whereas wont commonly called strategius beginning run many degree honour mounted dignitie praefecturam praefecture iuſticeſhip prudent man otherwiſe well ynough endured province mild alſo faire ſpoken upon occaſion whatſoever eſpecially upon ſuits action law abhominable thing wholly ſet upon filthie gaine lucre whereby hee grew baſe odious appeared evidently among thing commiſſions inquiſitions holden death theophilus called beene confull bare conſuls enſignes conſulare governor lieutenant syria betraying caeſar gallus confuſed tumult uprore people torne piece affaire poore men condemned even thoſe knowne certaine beene forth countrey outrage committed rich one author deed foule act turning living eſtates let goe equall unto proſper commaund ſouldiors lieu generall horſemen abiding gaule baſe coward abject perſon ſuch one comicall poet ſayth deſpiſing art cloſe theeverie uſed open extortion violent oppreſſion while theſe two agreed together enriched themſelves mutuall commerce reciprocall bringing cheat one anothers hand perſian captaines bordering upon river king buſied fartheſt march owne land company crewes brigand made foule worke pale boldly invading one armenia another meſopotamia taking vantage while theſe romane commaunders employed gathering together ſpoyles died xvi booke chap 1 report commendation iulianus ſetting behind delightſome conſul called fellowſhip degree entred kalender thereof inbred naturall vigour put forward action dreamed nothing craſhing noiſe battaile ſlaughter barbarous enemy preparing alreadie gather broken fragment province hee might length beene ſeconded forward gale favourable fortune much therefore thoſe notable matter throughout gaule vertue felicitie redreſſed ſurpaſſe many valiant deedes men old time ſhew every one particularly progreſſe traine ſtorie minding purpoſe ſtraine ſtrings meane wit affoord happily ſerve turne whatſoever narration ſhall delivered ſubtile falſitie forgeth ſound truth matter fully relateth ſame reſting upon evident proofes ſhall pertaine manner alaudative argument ſeemeth certaine ſet law canonicall rule better life accompanied young gentleman rocking cradle unto
