mercifull antoninus ſearching true perfect reaſon thing ſutable marcus reſemblance imitation framed action whole deportment ſo much according taught tully grave author take delight height noble art doe tree rootes ſtockes even ſo rudiment beginning ſingular towardneſſe covered many thing ſhaddowed darkened ought right bee preferred many thoſe wonderfull deed afterwards reſpect prime youth foſtered like erichtheus retyred place minerva fetched quiet bower academie militarie pavilion feat armes fighting battailes quieted germanie allayed ſtiffe ſtirres trouble rhene one place drew bloud bloudie minded king another hung chaynes hand well while hee paſſed toileſome winter vienna towne aforeſaid among flying rumor ran abroad continually hee underſtood wall autun butgundie auguſtudunum auncient citie carrying large ſpatious compaſſe rottenneſſe long continuance ſtrength ſuddaine forcibly beſieged ſtrong power barbarian while company ſouldiers garriſon ſat ſtill nothing old beaten ſervitors right watchfull care aſſembled themſelves defended place oftentimes utter diſpaire wont put backe moſt imminent danger life ſafety wherefore remitting whit provident care caſting behind ſervile flatterie attended upon whereby thoſe would haue drawne delight riotous life thing provided ſufficiently upon 24 iun • eighth day calends iuly hee came auguſtudunum aforeſaid like beene leader long continuance great name others courage policy ready ſet upon barbarian ſtragling heere whenſoever could ſee opportunitie advantage deliberation therefore together aſſiſtance thoſe skilfull country way might make choice march ſafetie much ſaid point fro ſome opined muſt goe arbois butgundie arboroſa others againe countrie leuci thoſe toul certaine ſecretly ſuggeſted silvanus late colonell footmē paſſed venturouſly though hardly eight thouſand aidſouldiers compendious ſhorter way howbeit ſuſpected becauſe darke much ſhaded caeſar ſtrived ſtrained much imitate might venturous boldneſſe hardie leader becauſe delay might impeach project taking none men corſelets footman heavily armed piece armes baliſtiers unmeet ſouldiers protect defend ruler paſſed ſame way came auxerre ortel autoſidorum ſhort reſt manner refreſhed himſelfe ſouldiers marched tricaſtines barbarian came violently upon troups part feared farre number obſerved ſtrong wing flancks ſtanding cloſe together ſome againe taking advantage higher ground hee eaſily ran downe upon trod underfoot others feare yeelding themſelves tooke priſoners reſt whoſe care altogether imploied make ſhift quickneſſe eſcape becauſe encombred heavie armour could follow chaſe ſuffered goe away without harme therefore upon aſſured hope confirmed reſolution reſiſt violent occurrent many danger came troics ortel tricaſſae ſo unlooked while manner rapping gate ſuch multitude barbarian ſpred dread entrance citie without much adoe many curious circumſtance conſultation ſtayed little time provided wearied ſouldiers thinking good ſlacke buſineſſe goeth ſtreight citie rhemes hee aſſembled whole armie together charged give attendance wait comming beſanſon veſontium governour whereof marcellus ſucceeded vrſicinus vrſicinus himſelfe commaunded abide thoſe part unto end expedition wherefore many ſundry opinion delivered agreed ſet upon people alemaine ten territory ſouldiers thicke ſquadrons marched thither willing cheerefull wont day ſo foggie darke could ſee ſmall way enemy advantage knew coaſt countrey traverſed croſſe crooked way behind caeſars backe charging upon two legion gathering armour together put well neere ſword ſuddaine outcrie made cauſed aidforces aſſociates aſſemble themſelves hence forward ſuppoſing could paſſe either way water without ambuſhments hee became provident tooke leiſure caſt doubt ſpeciall point good policie great commaunders wont helpe ſave whole army hearing therefore barbarian poſſeſſed city strasburg argentoratum brucomat brotomagus tabern simlero tabernae towne betweene strasburg trier saliſo spcir nemetae worm • vangiones mentz maguntiacum inhabited territory lying townes themſelves avoid leſſe dennes place beſet round net toyle ſeized firſt hand brotomagus advaunced toward power germanes encountred way offered fight arraunged men two corneredbattaile began cope tother enemy driven upon twofold miſchiefe while ſome taken priſoners ſlaine furie medley ſeene caſtle unleſſe cobolen • x confluentes place ſo called river moeſell moſella rhene meet together ſtandeth rigoll rigodulum towne alſo neere unto colcin colonia ſelfe one tower therefore entred agrippina ſtirred thence ſuch time king frankes terrified furie well delayed eſtabliſhed peace good meane commonweale alſo recovered ſaid citie moſt ſtrongly fenced joyous theſe good hanſels overture conqueſt victorie departed trier treviri minding winter apud sen •• sen towne good importance carrying ſay upon ſhoulders world warres comming like floud upon diſtracted hee manifold care namely ſouldiors forſaken wonted garriſon townes might eſtſoones brought ſuſpected place danger hee might diſcomfite ſcatter nation layed head together banded themſelves worke romanes miſchiefe foreſee armie like raunge diver way wanted victual pondered carefully caſt theſe matter mind multitude enemy giveth attempt upon mightily enſtamed hope win towne confident enterpriſe becauſe learned information certaine fugitive neither band b scutarij e gentile beſtowedin ſundry townſhips better feeding diet therefore ſhut citie gate fortified part wall weake undefenſable himſelfe perſon together armed ſouldiers uſually ſeene day night among bulwarkes battlement boyling heat anger fretting himſelfe gnaſhing teeth many time gone ſally breake upon enemy ever checked impeached reaſon ſmall force preſently end thirtie day barbarian went away ill appaied ſad mumbling ſoftly themſelves vainely fooliſhly ever thought beſieging citie beſides thing muſt imputed great indignity while caeſar jeopardie marcellus generall horſe abode next ſtations drave aid whereas albeit citie beene diſtreſſed without prince beeing ought beene reſcued delivered calamity follow ſiege making head againe another power chap ii vertues iulianus beſeeming magnanimous prince ammianus marcellinus exactly deſcribeth caeſar prince right puiſſant wonderfull action ſooner freed feare conſtant carefulnes alwaies carried provided ſouldiors long travaile might ſome reſt though ſhort yet ſufficient refreſh ſtrength albeit thoſe land ſoulely order reaſon extreame want beene ſo often waſted affoorded ſmall meanes meet maintenance life watchfull diligence order taken alſo behalfe mind lifted ſprinckling plentifull hope proſperous ſucceſſe bent ſame practiſe performance many worthie part firſt thing bed ſilver ball ſleepe came upon let looſe ſtiffe ſinewes joint ringing ſound ſaid ball made fell downe might breake ſleepe iulian without ſuch deviſe meanes wakened oft would riſing alwaies midnight emperor skill catch latch mony given underſtand certaine parent daughter young virgines forcibly raviſhed paſſed decree hee abuſed upon conviction ſhould confined ſent away ſaid parent maiden complained indignitie ſuffered partie put death anſwere made thus farre forth quoth let lawes blame clemencie emperour hee ought excell others lore moſt mild gracious mind hee time goe foorth certaine warlike journey expedition many called upon way juſtice ſuſtained ſome wrong put commended ruler province complaint heard returne enquired every one done according gracious mercie naturally mitigated puniſhments offence laſt ſetting aſide victory whereby put flight defeated barbarian ſlew battaile without touch many time contumacie hereby moſt appeareth good unto gaulois labouring life extreame penurie entred firſt thoſe part hee found demaunded way tribute five twentie piece gold every poll departure thence ſeven onely full ſatisfaction duty regard whereof rejoyced cheerefull mirth dauncing cleere sunne ugly darkeneſſe ſhone upon conclude wee know unto end empire dying day obſerved one thing right profitably matter paying tribute remitted overplus remaining arrerages way indulgence call well wiſt ſo ſhould ſomewhat mend better eſtate rich whereas well knowne poore every beginning dictorū exordium tax impoſts compelled make full payment without eaſement relaxation howbeit amid theſe courſes way hee tooke rule governe moderation good prince ſtrive imitate rage furie barbarous nation brake flaming fire like wild beaſts wont live ravine prey keeper ſlacke negligent uſe depart leave wont theſe removed ſtronger ſet place growing outrageouſly wood hunger without regard life run upon whole heards flockes cattell even ſo alſo ſpent gotten ſpoyle pillage hunger urged diver time raiſed drave booty away otherwhiles againe could meet ought came ſhort died chap iii trouble court conſtantius whoſe eares lay open accuſations arbetio brought queſtion ſome eſcaped without harme iulianus himſelfe accuſed patron eutherius eunuch ſingular gift whoſe mind declared thus yeare went theſe affaire gaule doubtfull hope yet luckie ynough event emperours 〈◊〉 court traine envie ceaſed barke carpe every ſide arbetio one made way alreadie imperiall purple robe would ſhortly attaine higheſt dignitie ſelfe certaine c • me counſellors courtier name veriſsimus came hotely upon letting flie open mouth exceeding hainous matter namely charging openly common ſouldior raiſed high place ſervice armie nothing contented therewith ſmall advauncement aſpired chiefe ſoveraigne honour eſpecially one dorus beene phyſician chirurgian scutarij man challenged followed moſt magnentius preferred rome centurion e niceterio •• niceterij related accuſed adelphius governour ʋrbi praefectum rome citie one began ſhoot higher deſignes matter came ſifting judiciall examination inward friend buſineſſe detained priſon ſo expected ſome proofe crime objected ſuddainely beene maske enterlude helpe ſome gentleman bedchamber conſtant rumor made report perſons attached impriſoned acceſſarie privie thing delivered band dorus alſo vaniſhed ſight veriſsimus likewiſe quickly held peace huſht like upon ſtage play done hanging taken downe ſame time constantius enformed mouth ſuch chanced come court marcellus ſuccoured caeſar beſieged se •• senones aforeſaid diſcharged militarie oath commaunded depart home owne houſe received ſome grievous injurie plotted practiſed ſomewhat againſt iulianus preſuming upon emperour whoſe eares open every accuſation therefore marcellus departure eutherius prapoſit •• cu • iculi chiefe chamberlaine ſtreightwaies ſent readie confute evict caſe ſhould forge untruth ware therof came ſhortly millaine buſtling keeping foule ſtirre vaine talkative foole like mad man otherwiſe admitted conſiſtorie chargeth iulian bee malapart perſon one fitted himſelfe alreadie ſtronger wing might ſore higher theſe word ſpake great geſture motion bodie while fell forging theſe imputation licentious manner eutherius according owne requeſt brought place commaunded ſpeake would modeſt tearmes word ſheweth truth coloured covered lye caeſar quoth hee beene long beſieged senones marcelius captaine f force ſlacked ſervice ſat ſtill verily thought purpoſe provident watchfull induſtrie magiſtro armorū drave backe barbarian withall undertooke even pawning owne head ſaid iulian ſhould continue life loyall miniſter dutifull ſervitour firſt founder preſent matter hath put mind inſert ſomewhat briefely touching ſame eutherius numa pompilius socrates ſhould give ſome good report guelded perſon bind ſame religious oath would bee charged ſwerved much truth among bramble grow roſes wild beast ſome waxe tame tractable wherefore ſummarily declare principall thing beene knowne concerning borne armenia free parentage taken priſoner enemy borderer even while little one carried away ſold unto couple romane marchants brought palace constantine little little skilfull training good government gave ſufficient proofe honeſt courſe carriage life alſo wit knowledge inſtructed literature much might ſuffice one ſtate calling paſſing quick conceit deviſing inventing doubtfull ſcrupulous queſtions exceeded alſo excellent memorie deſirous doe good full righteous counſell constantius emperour would haue regarded time paſt growth youthfull yeares might heard one maturitie ſtayed ripeneſſe giving many precept leſſons tending honeſtie juſtice ſinned leaſtwiſe committed veniall treſpaſſes eutherius prapoſituscubicul • principall chamberlaine would ſeeme reforme even iulian alſo nuzzled engraffed manner aſia therefore vaine unconſtant moreover retyred himſelfe aſide quiet life afterwards taken eftſoones palace ſober behaviour alwaies paſſing well ſtayed two notable ſingular vertues faithfulneſſe continence embraced ſo challenged time reſt beene either diſcloſed ſecret unleſſe ſave another man life burnt greedie deſire getting whence came paſſe withdrawing himſelfe anone rome ſetled reſiant untill well ſtept yeares carrying good conſcience keepe companie eſteemed hee loved degree whereas ſuch kind perſons wont commonly gotten rich unjuſt indirect meanes ſeeke ſecret corner flyer light ſhunning ſight multitude whome wronged guelded eunuch old time ſhould compare eutherius peruſing many time monument antiquitie could never find long ſince aunceſtors day ſome though truſtie profitable lord yet ſtained ſpotted certaine vice thoſe ſpeciall good quality one gotten ſtudious endevour naturall wit either given greedie extortion overfiercely felly bent hotely ſet upon miſchiefe kind pleaſing thoſe loved elſe exceſſive prowd overweening greatneſſe one eunuch every way ſo skilfull well qualified confeſſe never read heard notwithſtanding preſumed upon ſufficient teſtimonie age happily curious reader antiquity ſet oppoſition againſt u menophilus eunuch mithridates king pontus let upon advertiſement call remembrance nothing hath beene recorded onely gloriouſly ſhewed utmoſt extremitie foreſaid king mightie great battaile beene vanquiſhed roman pompeius flying ancient inheritance kingdome colchis called mengrelia lavia nig colchi left within caſtle sinhorium daughter named direptis grievouſly afflicted ſickneſſe committed charge menophilus keeping virgin moſt ſafe father ſhe meanes phyſicke could affoord perfitly cured time ſaid fort wherein ſhe encloſed began beſieged manlius priſcus lord general lieuten • nt perceived defender place minded render fearing leaſt ſhamefull reproch father young maiden marriageable ſhould remaine captive bodie abuſed killed firſt ſoone ſword ſtabbed himſelfe bowel chap iiii example tragoedies acted conſtantius theatre confident fortunate libertie vrſulus honourable perſon uſed defence truth ſtupiditie conſtantius maketh way civile trouble calamity whereof example laid open worth obſervation let returne whence digreſſed marcellus ſaid taken foile serdica place nativitie deſtroyed within emperours court militarie tearmes allegorically taken campe many horrible act pretence maintaining imperiall majeſtie committed one ſought counſell unto theſe cunning men wiſards ſqueaking rat meeting weazill way ſuch praeſaging ſigne hee uſed old woman charme enchantment mitigate paine thing warrant phyſicke may avowed partie hereof enformed againſt meanes could gueſſe therupon haſt endited arraigned ſuffered death ſame time report went certain man named danu wife onely upon feare terror accuſed ſlight matter guiltie indeed unguiltie whether hee liſt avouch want defence hee rufinus inſulted beguiled gave information ſome particular knew gaudentius purſivant intelligencer africanus conſularem conſulare governour pannonia given notice principall office belonging praefectus praetorio while alſo greatly ſuſpect place corrupt defective untill therfore perfect copie may foūd muſt paſſe manner hee chiefe actor way vow earneſt promiſe twice ſpeech went induced brought wavering fickle minded woman hee filthily lyen danger ſelfe hurt perſuaded packing number lye together accuſe guiltleſſe husband treaſon namely forge thus much ſtollen purple garment covering diocleſians ſepulchre privitie ſome hidden thus framed theſe matter utter deſtruction many rufinus himſelfe hope greater booty hies apace emperours campe raiſe falſe ſlaunders wonted manner vrſulus 〈…〉 high treaſurer emperour man likewiſe commendable ſeveritie matter therefore aggravated according condition good liking thoſe time nothing upon torture great many could found iudges fault ſeeke length truth beene overmuch oppreſſed ſmoothered breathed againe upon point neceſſitie woman confeſſeth rufinus author machination neither ſuppreſſed ſhee filthie adulterie committed howſoever preſently contempt lawes much debate canvaſing fro yet length order juſtice ſentence condemnation given dye conſtantius intelligence hereof fared fumed lamenting alſo protector defendor life periſhed ſent horſemen poſt commaunded th reatening manner vrſulus returne unto counſell verily rejecting thoſe would ſtayed brake feareleſſe entred conſiſtorie free ſpeech bold heart declared beene done thus ſtoutly ſtopped mouthes flatterer word ſay delivered pręfect iuſtice aboveſaid himſelfe great danger happened aquitaine fame bruited farther abroad certaine craftie couſener invited ſumptuous feaſt whereof many theſe country ſeeing paire fine toralium table cloth linnen counterpoint two button ſo exceeding neither paſſage ſound ſhould large skill ſervitors might meet cloſe together table ſpred like naperie carrying hand forepart cloke whole furniture within clothes adorned ſet together principall thing rich patrimonie aſſure evertit everrit ſwoopt away like malicious naughtineſſe certaine purſivant intelligencer employed spaine bidden ſemblably ſupper heard boyes bringing light evening crie manner vincamus let u winne making wicked hainous interpretation thereof brought ruine deſtroyed noble houſe theſe ſuch like prankes played every day constantius beeing exceeding timorous feared alwaies marke ſhot even denis tyrant sicilie upon ſelfeſame infirmitie taught even owne daughter play barber becauſe would commit face ſtranger ſhaven made ſmooth little houſe rowme wont lie environed deep ditch made drawbridge might unjointed taken aſunder every peece disjoined plank pinnes whereof carried went bed ſame ſet together againe joynts goe forth morning betimes theſe trumpet ſounded alarme civile trouble great men likewiſe emperours houſe gave blaſt end might beg good condemned perſons unite owne appeared manifeſt proofes conſtantine firſt opened iawes theſe favourite conſtantius fed fat marrow province emperour head principal every ſtate degree infinitely enflamed greedie deſire rich without reſpective difference juſtice right among ordinarie exerciſe clvile juriſdiction iudges firſt rufinus prafectus pratorio lord chiefe iuſtice among militarie martiall men arbetio equitum magiſter maſter generall horſemen prafectus cubicul • provoſt bedchamber vrſicinus alſo praefector equeſtris 〈◊〉 prafectus captaine knight order rome citie anitius quaeſtor quaeſtor treaſurer aiming poſteritie princelike royall port could never ſatisfied extraordinarie poſſeſſions perſians eaſt theeving robberie rather uſuall manner encountring field battaile raiſed booty people cattell ſometimes gained comming upon ſuddaine otherwhiles overmatched multitude ſouldiors loſt alſo permitted ſight might carried away howbeit muſonianus prafectus prat • rio lord chiefe iuſtice thoſe part furniſhed ſaid many good art yet corrupt man given briberie money eaſie turned truth mean certaine ſpies ſuborned ſent purpoſe cunning artiſans deceiving jugling enquired project plot perſians joyning ſuch conſultations caſsianus duce lord g warden march meſopotamia warrior hardened ſundry ſervices daungerous exploit notwithſtanding plaine intelligence giuen unto faithfull relation ſaid ſpies agreeing one talke king sapor utmoſt march kingdome much ſlaughter bloud ſhed people could hardly repell nation infeſted dominion yet meanes baſe obſcure ſouldiers ſecret conference hand ducem marqueſſe lord warden sapor lay neere unto province oportunity might ſerve would letter adviſe king make firme peace length romane emperor whereby ſecured every ſide might tame ſubdue enemy continually moleſted sapor ſaide dux marque warden condeſcended hereunto gotten thus much truſting thereupon enformeth king conſtantius much encumbred moſt grieuous warres way entreaty required haue peace while theſe letter ſent unto chionites halani whoſe confines king sapor wintered long time paſſed betweene chap v conſtantius cowardly prince thinketh upon triumph mightie long traine largely deſcribed great pompe entreth rome while theſe matter diſpoſing thus according time required well thoſe part gaule conſtantius hauing made peace whole world ſhut temple ianus vanquiſhed enemy deſirous ſee rome triumph without glorious matter name magnentius overthrowe death even romane bloud neither vanquiſhed himſelfe nation made warre underſtood conquered valour owne captaines laid aught unto empire ne yet ſeene extremitie daungers either formoſt among formoſt forſooth might ſhew goodly pompe reaching mighty length banner ſtiffe againe goldſmiths worke beautifull traine gard unto people liuing much tranquillitie neither hoping wiſhing ever ſee like ſight againe knew peradventure ſome auncient prince time peace verily contented themſelues attendance ſerjeants officer heat battailes certaine mingled light manifold degree alternative courſe high power authoritie while others againe compaſſed dragon wrought woufe purple thred thoſe faſtened top ſpeares gold ſet coſtly gem gaping blowing wide mouth therefore hiſſing angry therewith leaving winding tailes wift wind ſides marched double ranke armed men targuets creſted helmet ſending ray beames brandiſhing light wearing upon fine ſhirts maile habergeon men armes entermingled bard horſes perſians uſe call clibanarij harneſſed good corſelets bard guard ſteele ſo one would taken image finely poliſhed handworke praxiteles men indeed alſo went thin plated hoopes made fit handſome bending body running limmes ſo way ſoever need ſtirre moove joynts apparrell habiliment would agree thereto joyning thereof ſo meet ſerved ſo well every way therefore ſaluted luckie acclamation name augustus while noyſe voice trumpet together thundered broken ſound trembled againe ſhewing himſelfe juſt ſort ſo unmooveable hee wont bee ſeene owne province bowed downe bodie low entred high gate alſo ſtiffe necke head beene one piece armed caſting eye directly turned face neither right hand left beene image man neither ſeene ſo much give nod head wheele ſhogged ſpit wipe lip blow rub noſe wag hand albeit affectation yet theſe geſtures ſome beſides uſed reſt life ſmall token patience ſpeciall gift alone well might thought moreover time empire neither tooke man ſit carroch admitted privat perſon companion honourable eſtate conſull prince wont alſo many thing alwaies thoſe bloud royall raiſed though high conceit pride himſelf obſerved therefore endevour attempt ſuch thing onely horſe traian ſtanding middeſt court yard emperour himſelfe portraied ſitting ſaid would alſo could imitate whereat hormiſda prince perſia perſian courtier bloud royall ſtanding hard whoſe departure perſis declared ſhaped anſwere manner countrey geſture commaund emperour quoth like ſtable built thou able horſe thou art diſpoſed make may come take large rowme doth wee behold potentate beeing asked thought rome ſaid tooke contentment onely hee learned even alſo men mortall emperour therefore ſeene many thing ſtrucke dreadfull aſtoniſhment complained fame ſhe either ſmall force elſe maliciouſly diſpoſed uſing alwayes make every thing yet blaſing abroad theſe monument rome fayleth ſtrength long deliberation ſhould doe determined end adde ſomewhat ornament citie namely erect cirque ſhewplace ſtood next obeliske originall forme whereof ſhew place convenient meane euſebia empreſſe queene beeing ſelfe barraine life time practiſed even againſt helena ſiſter conſtantius wife iulianus caeſar brought rome colour love affection wyle drew drinke medicine little better poyſon ſhe gotten end ſo often ſhe conceived child ſhe might miſcarrie caſt untimely fruit time alſo gaule ſhe brought foorth man child ſhe loſt deceitfull caſt midwife bribed piece money cutting away navellſtring newborne babe meet killed ſo great care ſuch diligence uſed iſſue ſo valiant man might come light grow good proofe well emperour willing deſirous make ſome long abode ſeat others moſt full majeſtie end might thereby enjoy pure repoſe pleaſure terrified continuall newes thoſe reported certaine gave underſtand suevians made roades rhaetiae quadi alſo invaded part pannonia valeria yea tartarians sarmatians people moſt expert theeving robberie waſted illyricum whence place marcellus ſent severus experienced warriour long continuance grounded commaunded vrſicinus repaire unto hee received theſe letter gladly came sirmiſch ortel sirmium accompanied fellowes long pondering conſulting peace muſonianus related might eſtabliſhed perſians ſent backe againe eaſt authoritie magiſterij generall cavallerie elder ſort companie provectis forte profectis advaunced conduct rule ſouldiors younger men commaundement attend upon perſon readie performe whatſoever ſhould commaund behalfe commonwealth chap vii iulian paſſed winter senones invadeth alemanes raging wonted manner paſſeth rhene foord many foiles overthrowes weakened forceth retyre iſlands rhene part bvt caeſar paſſed troubleſome winter 〈…〉 senones yeare emperour ninth time conſull himſelfe ſecond occaſion germanie menace thundered every ſide remooved fortunate houre good pręſaging token made haſt rhemes cheerefull joyous becauſe government armie committed severus man neither given diſcord yet arrogant approoved frugalitie long time knowne warfare ſouldiors readie follow directly going leader alſo himſelfe guided commiſſion another part barbatio death silvanus preferred bee colonell infanterie commaundement emperour power five twentie thouſand armed men came rauraci deviſed carefully ordered beforehand alemanes raged wonted manner raunged abroad redoubled power force marſhalled manner paire tongs beeing driven ſtrait ſhould beaten downe hewed piece howbeit while theſe project ſo well thought digeſted good order haſtening forward execution barbarian right joyous cunning take time ſteale rob paſſed ſecret wiſe betweene army lay encamped aſſaulted lyon • lugdunum unawares ſacking thereof greedie endevour burnt quite blocking avenue driven backe ſo made havocke whatſoever could found without towne damage loſſe ſooner knowne caeſar ſent three cornet light armed thoſe right valiant horſemen obſerved three way knowing without doubt theſe robber would breake away eſcape neither failed effecting projected went thoſe way cut whole pillage recovered untouched onely eſcaped cleare without harme paſſed ſecuritie fence fort barbatio lay ſuffered ſlip away becauſe bainobaudes tribune valentinian emperour afterwards troupe horſemen regiment ordained execution charge cella tribu • e ſcutariorum tribune scutarij joyning barbatio came piece ſervice forbidden obſerve paſſage intelligence germanes would returne colonell barbatio footman content herewith beeing himſelfe coward obſtinate backbiting depraver iulianus glorious deedes knowing himſelfe given commaundement againſt good romanes ſo much confeſſed cella charged point deceived constantius making relation thereof fained theſe ſame tribune came pretence ſome publique negotiation ſtate ſollicite ſouldiors conducted cauſe deprived place commaund returned home houſes privat perſons ſame time barbarian ſeated themſelves ſide rhene affrighted comming theſe army ſome skilfully hewing mightie ſtrong big tree ſtopped way quite otherwiſe hard travaile owne nature full ſteepe cliffes well neere unpaſſable others gotten iſlands lying thicke ſcattered along river rhene making piteous yelling howling rayled good romanes alſo caeſar beeing highly diſpleaſed wroth catch attach ſome craved barbatio ſeven thoſe ſhippes hee minding paſſe river provided put joyne together bridge becauſe nothing might obtained hand ſet light fire laſt advertiſed information ſpies diſcoverers newly taken priſoners hote ſeaſon summer river might waded exhortation given ſent auxiliarie light armed ſouldiors together bainobaudes tribuno corm • torum tribune captaine cornuti favour fortune minding atchieve memorable exploit one wading ſhallow fourds ſometimes bearing themſelves upon ſhields manner troughes ſmall punt ſwam iſland neere landed killed found one another without regard ſex male female age old young beene ſo many ſheepe gotten ſome emptie boat rowing meanes tottering though brake many ſuch place fill ſlaughter laden rich ſpoyle part whereof loſt violence river returned ſafetie upon knowledge hereof reſidue germanes abandoning iſlands untruſtie place defence got away wife child deareſt friend together corne barbarous richeſſe unto place remote chap viii fort named trestabernae reedifieth chonodomarius veſtralpus aleman king put flight barbatio colonell romane footman chaſed part armie puiſſant army ſat downe neere unto argentoratum embaſſadours inſult iulianus caeſar turning hence reedifying trestabernae fort ſo called long ſince obſtinate aſſault enemy deſtroyed rebuilt ſure german might kept entring inland part gaule wont finiſhed worke ſooner looked laid one whole yeare thoſe bee placed defend place food ſufficient beene gathered together ſouldiors hand without feare danger even barbarian harveſts verily content herewith onely hee purveyed alſo himſelfe victual ſerve twentie dayes theſe warrior willingly made uſe gotten owne right hand taking great ſnuffe indignation becauſe could nothing proviſion corne newly brought unto barbatio paſſed hard prowdly caught hand reſidue remained behind layed upon heape burnt every jot whether like vaine braineficke foole boldly enterpriſed many wicked attempt commaundement emperour knowne howbeit bruited abroad place rife every man mouth iulian choſen caeſar give eaſement diſtreſſed ſtate gaule hee might moſt cruell warres come end thought freſhwater ſouldior one could endure ſo much clattering noyſe armour well while worke ſayd fort goeth apace forward while part ſouldiors maketh forefences abroad field others againe gather corne warily feare ambuſhments barbarous multitude preventing exceeding celeritie rumour comming violently ſuddaine ſet upon barbatio armie hee conduct hath beene ſaid divided ſevered gauliſh fortification following chaſe farre rauraci yea long could carried away greateſt part carriage labouring beaſts campe ſlaves returned home againe hee performed notable fortunate expedition beſtowed ſouldiors wintering harbour returned emperours court minding frame action accuſation againſt caeſar manner readie time bitterly aſſayle vexe foule foyle terrour diſperſed ſpread abroad aleman king chonodomarius veſtralpus vrius alſo vrſicinus together secapio suomarius hortarius aſſembling force power together one place ſat downe neere unto argentoratum ſuppoſing caeſar retyred feare utter extremitie whereas continued ſtill buſily employed finiſhing fort aboveſaid made bolder beare head confidently certaine falſe fugitive one band scutarij scutarius fearing puniſhment crime committed fled unto departure captaine put flight declared remained fifteene thouſand armed men iulianus number indeed followed while fierce cruell barbarian every ſide ſet upon rage furious fight vpon whoſe conſtant avouching ſtill ſame tale pricked boldneſſe dare greater matter ſo ſending embaſſadours away imperiouſly ynough commaunded caeſar depart thoſe landes conquered valour ſwords point chap ix while enemy thus proudly brave iulianus politiquely looking himſelfe exhorteth armie fight ſouldiors captaines force cheerefully approove counſell generall commaunder caeſar could skill cowardly feare neither driven fit anger ſtricken downe griefe ſorrow laughing vaine preſumption barbarian kept theſe embaſſadors untill worke fortification fully ended perſiſted ſtill ſame degree reſolution ſtirred foot moreover king chonodomarius bearing himſelfe big every place chiefe ſetter dangerous enterpriſes kept great ſtirre made trouble confuſion beyond meaſure lifting browes aloft prowd looke one highly conceited regard fortunate ſucceſſe many time affaire onely plaine pitched field encountred decentius caeſar gave overthrow alſo raſed ſacked many wealthie city yea long time invaded overran gaule pleaſure while none gaineſay withſtand confirmed yet confident boldneſſe freſh diſcomfiture flight great barbatio leader number puiſſance od alemans beholding badge armes ſhields knew ſame ſouldiors let ſome brigand robber enjoy land feare whome ſundry time buckled cloſe flight loſſe many went away diſperſed diſarray whereat caeſar penſive tooke matter grievouſly upon urgent neceſſitie driving thereto eſcaped ſuch daungers enforced though valorous men affront encounter ſo populous nation bright sunne beames began appeare trumpet ſound footman led foorth marching faire ſoftly troupe light horſemen flanked ſides wing betweene beſtowed cataphracti complete harneis armed piece corſelettiers archer dreadfull kind armed ſouldiors much place whence romanes advaunced ſtanderds unto barbarian fort foureteene league ſay one twentie myles caeſar good regard well vantage ſecuritie called backe forerunner pricked forth ſilence proclaimed uſuall oyes unto ſouldiors ſtanding band company made according naturall diſpoſition mild ſpeech regard maintaining common ſafetie urgeth caeſar ſpeake moſt ſparily man baſe abiect mind exhort beſeech fellow ſouldiers preſuming doe upon well growne ſtout valour chuſe rather warie way either endure put backe peril feared overhaſtie doubtfull dangerous adventure meet ſhould forwardneſſe manhood boldneſſe ſo occaſion require ſame ought regible adviſed conſiderat mine opinion therefore iudgement ſhall accord thereto iuſt indignation endure briefe declare day groweth well noonetide tyred wearied tedious iourney ſhall welcommed ſtonie blind way night wane old moone like helpe ſhining ſtarres land u burnt heat comfort ſuccour water man ſhould make good effect may well eaſe paſſe whole troupe enemy reſt refection meat drinke come ruſhing violently upon u vigour ſeeing body enfeebled hunger thirst travaile make reſiſtance much therefore difficult buſineſſes diſpoſe order thought upon time hath oftentimes affoorded remedie right counſell given hath beene taken good part divine meanes even heaven ſometimes recovered ſet upright tottering eſtate men affaire beſeech let u empaled within rampire trench take reſt dividing watch turnes time enioyed benefit ſleepe food convenient advaunce forward leave god ſpoken breake day triumphant ſtandards victorious enſignes ſouldiers could well endure untill end ſpeech gnaſhing grinding teeth ſhewing hot deſire fight knocking ſheilds ſpeares together beſought earneſtly might led foorth give enemie battaile within ſight truſting upon favour god heaven confident alſo themſelves preſuming upon approoved vertues fortunate leader director end ſhewed certaine comfortable angell genius place readie ſo long preſent excited fight helpe forward alacritie cheerefulneſſe full aſſent alſo great captaines high officer eſpecially florentius praefecti praetorio praefect praetorium one accord agreed great reaſon ſide fight though much danger while barbarous enemy preaſſed plumpes heapes ſhould turne aſide way hee ſaid ſtirres ſouldiors given much upon bred heat ſeditious commotion would bee intollerable could hardly endure without attempt ſome extreame courſe victorie thought wreſted hand furthermore twofold conſideration encouraged emboldened men calling remembrance yeare laſt paſt romanes raunged pleaſure country beyond rhene ſeene man defend dwelling houſe make reſiſtance lane wayes every ſide ſtopped lopping cutting downe tree lying thicke together nipping cold mid winter barbarian thus remooved farre much adoe live alſo vpon emperours entrie land daring eyther reſiſt ſhew head upon humble requeſt entreatie obtained peace man conſidered caſe time altered combred kept downe threefold miſchiefe namely emperour lay ſore upon rhaetia caeſar hard permitted eſcape next borderer civile diſcords cauſed enemy readie manner tread upon neck behind thus hemmed every ſide afterwards upon graunt peace emperour departed thoſe neighbor nation matter cauſe brawles allayed reconciled growne agreement withall moſt diſhonourable departure barbatio romane leader much encreaſed pride ſtoutneſſe naturally bred likewiſe went worſe romanes part another meanes upon ſuch occaſion occurrent two brother bloud royall faſt tied vertue peace obtained constantius durſt neither raiſe uprore ſo much ſtirre within one named gundomadus greater perſon twaine firme word traine murthered people conſpired banded enemy preſently withall common ſort alſo vandomarius ſubjects affirmed joyned themſelves force regiment barbarian made warre well armie higheſt loweſt gave allowance even convenient meet time joyne battaile ſlacked nothing reſolute mind fully bent fight ſuddaine standardbearer cried theſe tearmes foorth moſt happie fortunate caeſar whither kind favour fortune leadeth thee thee length ſence valour militarie policie advaunce forward lead way luckie valiant warrior marching vaward hard standard good proofe thou ſhalt ſouldiors ſight warlike leader individui inſeparable witneſſe ſervice performed able upon theſe motif encouragement caſe may pleaſe god heaven aſsiſt chap x order alemans armie principall commaunders thereof iulianus ſecond time wiſely encourageth well ownemen ſtrangers give battaile heard without reſpite delay whole armie marched approched hill pretie height eaſie aſcent ſpred ſtanding corne ripe readie harveſt farre diſtant edge bankes rhene top whereof three horſemen enemy lying eſpiall roſe readie give notice ſuddainely romane hoaſt neere hand made haſt companie one footman able follow taken quicke purſute men told u germanes three dayes three night together paſſed river leader eſpied hard arraunging themſelves thicke cloſe together ſquadrons made ſtand ſtirred foot while thoſe maine battaile antepilani pikemen haſtati formoſt every ranke vaward ſtood firme faſt like ſtrong inſoluble wall ſemblable warineſſe enemy kept ground made haſt forward according foreſaid fugitive told ſaw cavallerie right ſide oppoſite unto flower horſemen beſtowed thicke thronged together left wing among entermingled skirmiſhers footman lightly appointed well wiſt horſeman though skilfull ſouldior otherwiſe fighting man armes complete harneis while holdeth ſhield reines bridle ſhaking caſting ſpeare one hand doe hurt unto warriour hidden wholly yron armour proofe footman point height danger man wont take heed aught commeth way encountereth creepeth cloſe ground digging horſe ſide able throw rider horſe head ere aware may ſmall adoe killed marſhalled matter thus right ſide battaile flanked made ſure ſecret blind ambuſhments chiefe leader theſe warlike fierce nation chonodomarius serapio higher place power authoritie king chonodomarius verily miſchievous firebrand whole warre flamecolour wreath taſſell fitted creſt advaunced led left wing man bold truſting upon wonderfull ſtrength bone brawne heat battaile looked mounted high upon luſtie frothing courſer bearing great breadth bigneſſe bulke launce reſt terrible bigneſſe bravely ſeene glittering armor hardie ſouldior aforetime alſo good leader others right ſide conducted serapio even luſtie gallant tender downe growing cheekes action forward yeares ſonne chonodomarius brother medericus moſt perfidious wretch life time ſo called father kept hoſtage pledge long time gaule learned certaine hidden greeke myſteries changed name ſonne originally firſt cleped agenarichus serapio theſe followed king potentate next power unto number five prince bloud royall tenne alſo great traine ranke noble five thirtie thouſand fighting men armed levied ſundry nation partly wage partly upon covenant agreement like ſervice tendered unto againe time terribly ſounded trumpers alarme severus romane leader commaund left wing drew neere unto trench ſaid full armed men whence order beene given afore lying cloſe hidden ſhould ſtart ſuddaine breake array ſtood ſtill without feare ſomwhat ſuſpitious blind ambuſhments hee attempted neither recule backe ſtep forward caeſar ſaw courageous enter upon ſervices greateſt danger guarded troupe two hundred horſe according heat ſervice required riding ſwiftly among footman ſtood embattailed gave comfortable word encouragement conſidering ſpeake unto neither large ground tooke ſtretched foorth length number ſo great multitude aſſembled would permit otherwiſe avoided heavie load envie diſpleaſure feare might thought affect emperour ſuppoſed due himſelfe alone taking good heed unto himſelfe riding apace without ſhot enemy theſe ſuch like ſpeeches animated ſouldiors knowne unknowne one another play men doe devoire valiantly quoth come full time fighting good friend companion long ſince wiſhed heretofore yee required calling armes unquiet mutinous manner likewiſe hee come others behind poſt ſignan • enſignes placed rereward behold ſaith fellow ſouldiors long hoped day compelleth u waſh away former ſtaines blot received ſo recover unto maieſtie romane empire owne due honour theſe barbarian exceſsive furie rage utter overthrow deſtruction whole eſtate hath forced come way puiſſance foiled troden foot semblably others well experienced long practiſe warre arraunged better order encouraged theſe ſuch like exhortation let u rouſe beſtirre ſelves right hardie knight let u put away fortitude fit ſhamefull reproches fastened upon aſſociates beheld much doubting delaymaking though yeelded take upon name caeſar whomſoever hee perceived inconſiderately call ſignall battaile unruly ſtirres like breake commaundement beſeech ſaith doe marre glory future victorie following overgreedily enemy yee put flight give ground yeeld extreame neceſsitie ſuch ſhall bee flye doubtleſſe forſake wound enemy backes preſent without difference even one caſe may done moderate warie adviſement chap xi bloudie battaile fought betweene alemans romanes wherein wiſdome valour invincible courage iulian eſpecially appeareth often iterated theſe ſuch like word ſame manner oppoſed greater part armie full againſt forefront barbarian ſuddainely heard noyſe aleman footman mixt indignation cry one accord voice prince bloud royall leaving horſes ought converſe keepe companie feare ought ſhould happen well would leave miſerable common ſouldiors make ſhift eaſily bee gone field beeing knowne chonodomarius quickly alighted beaſt foot reſt following example without delay ſame one made doubt ſide ſhould win day ſignall therefore battaile ſound trumpet ſolemnely given encountred one another great violence dart arrowes diſcharged ſeene flying aire german running haſt good ſpeed drawing weapon right hand hideous gnaſhing teeth flew upon troups horſemen fared raged wonted manner long ſhag haire made terrible ſight eye certaine furie ſparkled foorth againſt whome romane reſolute ſouldiors covering head putting ſhields betweene holding ſwords brandiſhing dart threatening death greatly terrified while point medley ſides horſemen ſtrongly entrouped themſelves footman ſtoutly fortified owne ſides making front joyning buckler moſt cloſe faſt together raiſed cloud thicke duſt much running traverſing ground betweene diver way while men one made head another gave ground ſome barbarian moſt skilfull warriours ſtriving oppoſe ſet knee forward laboured hard repell enemie ſuch exceeding reſolution ſides preſently came handie ſtrokes buckler pykes thruſt one another ſo skie rang againe lowd voyces well ſhouted thoſe feld readie die left wing advauncing forward ſtill full pace maine force driven ſo many band company germanes preaſing hard upon great noiſe angrie mood charged upon barbarian horſemen kept right wing great diſarray beyond expectation left battaile while formoſt fled hindered hindmoſt ſo ſoone within protection legion boſome ſtayed renewed fight againe fortuned upon occaſion while broken rankes file ſetting againe order men armes complete harneis ſeeing captaine lightly wounded one conſorts killed weightie armour horſe fallen upon necke ſlipped way made ſhift every man hee could treading footman put rout cloſe thronged together bearing one upon another ſtood ground ſure mooved caeſar therefore perceived farre horſemen looked nothing might make meanes eſcape flight gallopped horſe toward like barre way reſtrained taken knowledge purple enſigne dragon fitted top high launce beene pendant ſlough ſerpent certaine tribune one troupe ſtood ſtill ſtrucken feare looking pale upon matter rode backe againe renew battaile men love doe doubtfull caſes caeſar mild manner rebuking whither goe wee backe quoth valiant ſouldiors know yee flight never found ſafetie bewrayeth folly vaine attempt returne companie partaker leastwiſe hereafter glorie ever forſake inconſiderately while fighting commonwealth theſe word ſpake good reſpect brought backe againe undergoe office warfare followed herein example old sylla brought forth force field againſt archelaus captaine mithridates hote battaile wearied forſaken ſouldiors ran formoſt ranke vauntguard caught banner flung ſide againſt enemy goe way ſaid choſen fellowes danger many ſhall aske generall left anſwere thus faile left alone boeotia fighting u ſpending owne bloud chap xii ſharpe conflict footman fighting cloſe hand ſtrokes variable fortune length alemans put flight defeated ſuffer afearefull overthrow alemans therefore diſcomfited disbanded horſemen charged upon foreward front footman minding caſting away mind purpoſe reſiſting make head firſt cauſe recule come cope handſtrokes fight maintained long time equall tearmes cornuti braccati redoubted ſouldiors long experience warres manfully received point ſet mightie great ſhout called barritus outcrie heat medley beginning ſmall humming growing bigger little little riſeth higher manner wave beating againſt rockes arrowes dart flew thicke fro ſinging noiſe flew duſt aroſe equall ſtirring ſides tooke away eyeſight cauſed run armour body one upon another barbarian without order violence anger burnt like flaming fire cloſe jointed ſhieldfence defended men manner roufe hacked hewed many ſtroke ſword knowne batavi together king puiſſant terrible troupe ran ſpeed helpe fellowes readie reſcue deliver aſſiſtance fortune extremitie compaſſed round alemans began fiercely fight puffed blowed hard ſome furious fit would utterly deſtroyed ſtood againſt way yet gave javelines caſtingdarts yea yron headed arrowes let flye although cloſe fight alſo one weapon ſtrucke upon another habergeon cloven ſwords ſuch wounded bloud ſhed roſe againe doe ſome ſervice died ſort even matched alemans ſtrong taller ſouldiors long experience practiſe cunning thoſe fierce fell turbulent theſe quiet warie romanes bold heart courageous preſuming upon mightie big body howbeit otherwhiles romane weight armour driven back roſe barbarian knee wearied ſtepping preſſing forward bowing left ham backe would eaſe himſelfe lye cloſe behind readie yet give aſſault upon enemie token obſtinacie ſtiffe reſolution higheſt degree ſo leapt foorth ſuddainely gallant troupe noble among king alſo fought common ſort following brake within battaillons vantguard men ſo making themſelves way came farre legion 1 primani main battaile placed middeſt guard ſtrength uſe call castra praetoria ſouldiors thicker arranged many rankes file therefore manner tower ſtanding ground firme faſt greater courage fell fight againe ſo carrying heedfull eye ward venies covering themſelves cloſe manner ſwordfencer drawne ſwords ran enemy ſides reaſon hote furious anger lay moſt open barbarian againe fully bent ſpend life gaine victorie aſſayed leuſe battaile ſo jointly knit together ſeeing number lying dead rewes way romanes upon taking better heart unto layed along followed many meane remained alive place ſlaine heard many grone thoſe lay dying place exceeding feare ſtricken aſtonied outwearied laſt ſo much painefull toile ſtrength ſerved thenceforth onely flye ſo diver ſundry lane made ſhift ſpeed could get away much like unto mariner make haſt middeſt ſurging wave boiſterous tempeſt ſea caſt upon land way ſoever wind carrieth romanes upon victorie thing rather wiſhed hoped man confeſſe preſent worſhip gracious power god ſo propice mercifull unto howbeit ſouldiors without mercie ſlaſhing hewing upon backes fled otherwhiles reaſon ſwords bent rebated wherewith ſtrike longer thruſt barbarian heart owne weapon neither one wounding ſatisfied anger bloudſhed thought right hand ynough yet ſlaughter humble entreatie ſupplication would take pitie give execution thus therefore lay mightie number thruſt bodie death craving none remedie quickly bee diſpatched life halfe dead breath began faile ſought yet dying heavie eye meanes live longer others head cut manner quite huge weapon ſo hung downe hold throat number mierie ſlipperie ground chauncing ſlide fall downe bloud fellowes although weapon touched body overwhelmed ſouldiors ruſhing running heapes ſo killed winner got ſo good hand enemy yet preaſſed ſtill forcibly ſo point edge weapon waxed blunt dull ſtriking ſo thicke bright helmet ſhields together lay tumbled foot barbarian laſt ſeeing themſelves driven utmoſt extremitie heapes dead carcaſſes roſe ſo high ſtopped paſſage ſought onely helpe remained even river ran hard backes becauſe ſouldiors running great pace even armour wearie preaſſed ſtill upon fled ſome ſuppoſing skilfull ſwimming ſhould bee able rid themſelves danger committed life unto wave river regard caeſar together tribune captaines quicke forecaſt foreſeeing danger might enſue cryed rebuking manner gave ſtreight charge one men hote purſute enemie ſhould venture upon ſtreame ſo full whirlepits whereupon order tooke ſtanding upon bankes river ſundry ſorts dart caſtingweapons ſticked germanes one happened ſwift nimbleneſſe get away deadly dint ſhot weight bodie thus plunged ſunke downe bottome river like certaine theatricall ſpectacle hanging make ſhew ſtrange wonder man might without feare ſeene many ſights ſome could skill ſwimming ſticke cloſe take hold good ſtout ſwimmers others float aloft like log wood ſpent ſtrength became faint ſort wound within wave devoured violence ſtreame ſtriving againſt ſome againe carried upon ſhields declining crooked turning aſide high ſurges mightie billowes readie come full upon many perill paſſed gaine banke ſide conclude foming channell river ſtained died barbarian bloud euen amaſed ſee ſuch ſtrange vncouth ſights chap xiii chonodomarius fetched backe flight brought unto iulian clemencie received ſent rome ended day ſycophants court eclipſe light iulians victorie glorie whereof like exploit valiantly happily atchieved againſt enemy empire farre diſsite place conſtantius italie arrogantly fondly durſt attribute himſelfe meane king chonodomarius found meanes get away ſlipped heapes dead body ſome guard haſtened quicke ſpeed could make unto campe neere unto tzum dieyen duchen tribunciand rocherſherg concordia two fort romanes pitched feare end embarking himſelfe thoſe veſſels readineſſe within ſecret cove noukes againſt doubtfull accident mought befall might eſcape could poſſible goe owne territory without hee paſſed rhene hee covered face feare knowne ſo faire ſoftly retyred hee drew neere unto bankes river going certaine ditch ſtanding full mooriſh water ſee might paſſe ventured upon horſe flounced floundered heeles ſoft clammie mud got length ſtreightway fat corpulent heavie man though recovered ſuccour pretie hill hard known could bee concealed hee greatneſſe former eſtate ſo bewrayed ſtreightwaies cohort horſemen tribune riding faſt wind would ſerve compaſſed armed men hill overſpred wood beſet round right warily durſt breake feare leaſt ſome deceitfull ſtratageme hidden ambuſh among darke ſhadie boughes might welcommed coſt king ſaw driven utmoſt extremitie feare foorth went alone owne accord yeelded himſelfe thoſe traine companie number two hundred three moſt inward friend ſuppoſing foule ſhame live king die quarrell caſe ſo required delivered themſelves bee bound priſoners manner naturally theſe barbarian humble adverſitie contrarie humour proſperitie drawne vaſſale ſervant another pale looke abaſhed tonguetied alſo ſilent reaſon conſcience guiltie foule offence wonder much changed different man cruell wofull outrage inſulting aſhes reliques gaule threatened many horrible miſchiefes theſe exploit thus favour god heaven atchieved end day upon ſound retreat moſt invincible ſouldiors called back marched neere unto ſide rhene fortifying themſelves rampier many courſes ſhields ſet together tooke repaſt repoſe died battaile romanes 243 commaunders foure wit bainobaudes tribune cornuti likewiſe laipſo alſo innocentius leading horſemen armed piece certaine tribune vacant ordinarie whoſe name doe remember alemans found lying along field ſix thouſand body whole heapes dead corpes could bee reckoned carried downe among wave river iulian man greater marke place fortune yet powerfull deſerts command uniforme acclamation whole armie ſaluted emperour rebuked rated ſouldiors overbold malapart binding oath neither hoped name willing enlarge joy happie event hee commaunded chonodomarius preſented unto counſell warre aſſembled firſt bowing bodie downe afterwards humbly proſtrating himſelfe upon ground craving pardon g •• tilipace peaceably countrey manner willed bee good cheere within ſome dayes beeing brought emperours court thence ſent rome caſtris peregrinis manſion ſtrangers ſtandeth upon mount caelius died lethargie theſe ſuch like exploit fortunatly performed within palace conſtantius ſome finding fault iulian give delight contentment emperour himſelfe tearmed victoria victorinus becauſe modeſt wiſe making relation often gave charge commaund declared many time vanquiſhed germanes heaping vaine commendation oſtentation thing ſeene openly ynough puffed uſuall manner emperour owne nature high minded aſcribing whatſoever world fortunatly exploited unto auſpicate direction happie government wherefore lifted high glorious word theſe flatterer thenceforth edict publiſhed full arrogantly made many lowd lye writing ſometimes alone forſooth god wot action fought field woon victorie yea raiſed king whole nation foot againe humbly made ſupplication upon knee example ſake ſome great captaine even while himſelfe abode italie performed valiant piece ſervice againſt perſians would ſend letter dight lawrell unto army lying province without mention made ſaid captaine long tenor thereof ſignifying moſt odious vaunting himſelfe perſonally fought vaward finally yet extant edict publique record emperours truly engroſſed telling memorable report exalting himſelfe skie time field fought argentoratum whence fortie day journey hee taking upon deſcribe manner fight untruly relateth himſelfe arraunged armie order battaile ſtood among ſtandardbearers diſcomfited barbarian cauſed run headlong away yea encountred chonodomarius hand hand ô ſhamefull indignitie without one word ſpeaking glorious act iulian quite buried ever fame could skill concealing ſuch brave deed howſoever many would ſeeme darken ſame xvii booke chap 1 iulian infeſteth alemanes hee put ſundry loſſes forceth crave truce ten moneths obtaine varietie occurrent order ſet thus atchieved martiall knight iulian rhene battaile argentoratum carried quiet ſtreame void feare yet carefull withall leaſt curſed foules aire ſhould devoure body lay ſlaine field commaunded ſhould indifferently one another interred hee releaſed diſmiſſed thoſe embaſſadours ſaid foughten field related ere brought certaine prowd meſſages returned fort trestabernae whence gave commaundement together captive pillage alſo ſhould brought unto met • mediomatrici kept untill returne himſelfe intending perſon goe mentz maguntiacum paſſed river bridge framed ſet together might ſeeke barbarian owne territory ſince left none behind clamorous gaineſaying armie prohibited howbeit ſweet word eloquent ſpeeches wrought ſo brought owne pleaſure ſuch love growne triall experience affectionate inci • ed willingly follow painfull diligent fellowſouldior brave leader commaunder yea wonted evidently fell enjoyne himſelfe toylefull labour ſouldior ſoone come place aforeſaid paſſed river upon floored bridge ſhips poſſeſſed themſelves enemy land enemy feared little could poſſibly diſquieted living ſuch reſt repoſe ſtricken ſo great accident thinking carefully miſchiefe befallen unto others might hang owne head ſemblance craving peace decline violent brunt firſt tempeſt ſent embaſſadours word mouth ſo framed placed pretended ſhewed firme aſſurance league concord upon policie purpoſe know changed mind embaſſadours diſpatched poſt haſt menaced men moſt cruell warre unleſſe departed country hereof certaine intelligence given caeſar beginning night embarked ſmall ſwift pinnace eight hundred ſouldiors giving charge ſuſpect place might 20 effect ſhould reſt 800 doe twentie ſayled made way river ſhould ſet land ſword fire deſtroy whatſoever could meet withall thus order given sunne riſing enemy diſcovered upon hill top hee led ſouldiors cheerefull forward higher ground finding none enemy imagining much departed behold forthwith ſaw afarre mightie deale ſmoke waulming aire declaring plainly ſouldiors broken enemy territory began waſt ſpoyle ſame object daunted courage germanes much ſo forſaking ambuſhments along narrow ſtraits luiking place addreſſed againſt men paſſed haſt river named mein maenus ſuccour deere friend uſually falleth ſuch doubtfull time trouble danger beeing affrighted one ſide ſuddaine rode horſemen violent invaſion ſouldiors came embarked thither skilfull coaſts countrey found ſpeedie meanes get away eſcape upon whoſe departure ſouldiors marching libertie rifled rich village full corne cattell making ſpare none fetched inhabitant priſoners houſes built ſomewhat curiouſly manner romanes ſet fire thereupon burnt downe ground thus overrun countrey ſpace eſtimate tenne myles ſo come neere unto wood carried hideous fearefull ſhew darkneſſe ſtood lingering long time advertiſed fugitive within certaine hidden cave ground trench running many way great number ſecretly beſtowed readie iſſue forth eſpied opportunitie howbeit adventured moſt boldly approch place found foot way overlayed holmes aſhes cut downe yea mightie barricado made againſt therefore marching backe warily perceived ſuch indignation anger heart could hardly hold could goe forward beyond fetching long circuit hard turning much reaſon rigorous piercing aire ſtrugled vaine moſt difficult extremity aequinox autumne paſt thoſe tract mountaines champion plaines covered deepe ſnow tooke hand memorable piece worke while man withſtand enterpriſe certaine ſtrong fortreſſe built upon alemans ground traian would beare owne name late forcibly aſſaulted haſtie manner ſuddainely repaired time placed ſouldiors defend piece thither victual conveied gotten bowel heart barbarian countrey preparation enemy perceived ſo ſpeedily brought deſtruction fearing leaſt thing indeed would come paſſe take effect aſſembled themſelves together haſt way prayer moſt humble manner ſent orator craved peace caeſar directed policie take ſureſt way alledging many motif carried good probabilitie graunted tenne moneths namely making account prince provident forecaſt thoſe hold fortreſſes ſeized hand even beyond hope could wiſh without impeachment aught fortified offenſive engine planted upon wals ſtrong ordinance munition preſuming confidently hereupon came among thoſe ſent aid vanquiſhed argentoratum three moſt fell cruell king fearing length owne eſtates tooke oath ſet forme word manner countrey would ſtirre trouble peace truly keepe covenant caeſar rejoyced magnified himſelfe fortunate happie prince well might man beleeved backbiter deviſed gave therefore hee demeaned himſelfe ſo valiantly every place becauſe hee wiſhed rather die glorious death ranke condemned perſons like unto brother gallus hoped put death ſemblable purpoſe reſolution death alſo conſtantius become renowmed admirable exploit well theſe affaire thus firmely rhemes lighted upon right ſtrong company frankners conſiſting afterwards appeared ſix hundred light armed skirmiſhers waſted ſpoyled quarter without garriſons tooke opportunitie actuate boldneſſe miſchiefe becauſe while caeſar buſily employed way ſecret part alemans none hand give checke thought verily make mouth fill hand rich booty feare armie returned poſſeſſed themſelves two fort time paſt abandoned left void defended themſelves well could iulianus much troubled new occurrent gueſſing whereto might turne caſe paſſed undealt withall kept force ſtill determined beleaguer towne keſſel cuyck caſtellum hard river maeſe meuſe moſa runneth ſo ſpace foure fiftie dayes wit moneths december ianuarie ſtayed ſiege while barbarian ſtout heart incredible reſolution held withſtood caeſar moſt prudent prince fearing much leaſt barbarian taking advantage night ſhould paſſe river hard frozen upon yce tooke order certaine ſouldiors ſhould every day time ſunne began ſet breake day light barge whirries fro ſcud downe upon river end breaking evermore yce began gather coat none might eaſily mean breake away ſtratageme wearied hunger long watching utter deſpaire yeelded themſelves owne accord doth euſebia ſignifie greeke pietatis miſhap long dolour paine yeelded vitall breath head bruiſed ſquized together ſhoulders leg ſevered body lying thus doubtfull plight betweene life death piteouſly cry god ſake unto others ſame caſe helpe quite forlorne left unto themſelves verily greater part ſacred church private houſes yea people alſo might beene ſaved outrageous flame diſperſed fiftie day
