everlaſting wit alſo naturall philoſophers long ſtudie upon point yet exhauſt worne could never reach unto whereupon provided ceremoniall bookes alſo rite pontificiall prieſts colledges naming one god another ſince unknowne thus ſhaketh earth bee hainous ſcandale damnable ſinne committed according philoſophers opinion among ariſtotle much perplexed troubled theſe earthquake fall either within ſmall cave earth greeke call syringa while thicke often beating water wave fro caſt ſurges el verily anaxagoras affirmeth reaſon violent wind getting cloſe within ground happen hit beat upon ſides thereof hard baked felted together finding way iſſue ſhake thoſe part earth entred moiſt whence men obſerve moſt part earthquake ground perceive wind blow becauſe buſie moſt remote nookes earth beneath anaximander opinion earth waxing drie upon long extraordinarie drought much moiſt weather ſtore raine openeth great chinkes wide chawnes aire violence exceeding much quantitie entreth ſo ſhaken ſtrong ſpirit ſtirred moved proper place cauſe ſuch like terrible accident chaunce either exceſſive hote ſeaſons immoderate fall raine heaven hence auncient poet theologers alſo tearmed neptune hath dominion moiſt element ſhaker earth ennoſigaeon sciles thereupon ſeemeth named delos siſichthona theſe earthquake obſerved foure manner wayes either braſmatiae heaving raiſing earth within force upward moſt huge mount ſort aſia maretamo delos appeared water namphio hiera likewiſe rhodes anaphe rhodus called foregoing age ophiuſa pelagia drenched time paſt golden ſhower alſo eleuſin boeotia iſland vulcano vulcane among tyrrheni many beſide ſecondly b climatiae ruſhing askew ſidelong crooked lay city houſes mountaines flat elſe c chaſmatiae greater kind motion ſuddainely opening wide gulfes ſwallow part earth atlanticke ſea iſland europe gulfe golfo de patras criſeus helice bura alſo ciminia part italie towne succinienſe ſwallowed deepe gaping chinke lye hidden ever perpetuall darkeneſſe among theſe three ſorts earthquake thoſe heard menacing noyſe tearmed mycematiae namely element looſening joynts encounter run one upon another owne accord fall backe ground doth ſettle neceſſitie craſhing noyſe rumbling earth within muſt bellow rore like bull proceed wee hence hiſtorie begun chap viii iulianus while maketh abode paris warreth upon alemans franci salij chamani defeated ſubdued fell famine armie cauſed tumult hot mutinie quenched ſouldiors paſſe rhene lay waſt alemans territory bvt caeſar while wintered paris haſtened diligence poſſible prevent alemans yet aſſembled together battaile argentoratum become audacious cruell beyond meaſure waiting ſtill moneth iuly whence gaule uſe begin warreſervice come field much troubled long time mind go forth could corne brought acquitaine upon breaking cold weather froſts reaſon mild summer ſeaſon diligent conſiderate regard conquereſſe manner difficulty caſting many ſundry thing head way found namely without expecting full ſeaſon yeare encounter barbarian looked ſetled reſolution tooke corne twentie day ſtore provided ſpent ſtanding place abode baked throughly laſt bisket bread ſuch commonly call buccellatum layed upon willing ſouldiors ſhoulders ſo confident helpe good houre hee tooke journey thinking within five ſixe moneths two urgent neceſſarie expedition might performed thing put readineſſe firſt others marcheth againſt frankes thoſe meane commonly tearmed salij old time durſt romane ground place called weſer toxiandria boldly place plant themſelves hee come tongeren tungri embaſſage foreſaid people meeteth ſuppoſing emperour found ſtill wintering harbour pretending peace upon condition man might eyther provoke moleſt while remained quiet owne territory theſe embaſſadours hee fully digeſted diſpoſed affaire oppoſed certaine ambiguous doubtfull condition meant ſtay thoſe tract untill returne ſent away rewarded ſooner way homeward followed hard upon ſending generall severus ſuddainely ſet upon along rivage ſmote beene whitling thunderbolt flaſh lightening fell entreatie rather make reſiſtance turning effect victorie commodious courſe clemencie upon yeelding themſelves rich child tooke mercie chamavi likewiſe given ſemblable attempt ſet upon ſame celeritie partly put ſword partly ſtoutly reſiſted taken alive hung yrons upon others tooke heeles fearefully haſt fled permitted get away without hurt unto whoſe embaſſadours ſent afterward make ſupplication provide eſtates lying humbly proſtrate upon ground face eye graunted peace capitulation returne ſafetie owne home thus thing ſucceeded according heart deſire haſtening moſt vigilant care found mean poſſible good province thought time would permit repaire three skonces fort ſituate directly rew upon banke river moſa lately beene overthrowne obſtinate ſelfewilled barbarian forthwith omitting warres ſmall time reedified end policie wiſely begun might quicke diſpatch make ſafe ſeventeene day proviſion corne ſouldiors marched forward expedition carried neckes defalked portion layed ſame hold hoping ſo much taken might bee ſupplied chamavians corne field fell farre otherwiſe reaſon ſtanding corne yet ripe ſouldiors ſpent carried finding food place fell threatening tearmes higheſt degree provoked iulian foule name opprobrious language calling vaine grecian aſia deceitfull yea one ſhew wiſedome learning lob foole uſually ſome found even among armed ſouldiors readie rolling tongue owne fellowes ſtucke mumble many theſe ſuch like ſpeeches whither drawne without hope better time paſt verily endured hard travaile moſt irkeſome abidden even ſnowes pinching cold bitter froſts ô ſhamefull indignitie upon point finally vanquiſh defeat enemy readie pine away conſume famine moſt inglorious baſe kind death man may thinke u mutineus given raiſe commotion proteſt life onely ſpeake craving neither gold ſilver long agoe might ſo much ſee ſo denied u convicted undertaken ſo many toilefull paine peril even againſt state commonweale ſay truth good reaſon thus complaine among ſo many courſes probable allowable matter doubtfull point neceſſitie ſouldiors outtoyled ſpent painefull ſervices gaule gotten neither e donative wage ſince time iulian thither ſent neither himſelfe could come aught give conſtantius wonted manner permitted ſuch allowance beſtowed hence appeared plainely done upon fraudulent malice rather nigardize becauſe ſaid caeſar given ſmall matter value certaine common ſouldior asking ſomewhat according need goe unto barber trimmed contumelious tearmes traduced backbitten gaudentius notarie abode long gaule ſpie proceeding afterwards himſelfe commaunded put death ſhall ſhewed place convenient length mutinie appeaſed without ſundrie ſorts faire word pleaſing ſpeeches meanes bridge made ſhips joyned together paſſed rhene ſet foot alemans country severus generall horſemen aforetime beene warlike induſtrious captaine ſuddaine became lither heartleſſe oftentimes encouraged ſome fight courageouſly ſeemed contemptible timorous diſſuader battaile haply feare death ſo neere hand like read bookes tages tuſcane within ſmitten lightening veiovis f ſo dulled ſences heare neither thunder great noiſe whatſoever contrarie wonted manner hee marched journey lazily inſomuch hee terrified threatening death guide led way apace luſtily unleſſe one accord would agree avouch altogether ignorant way fearing authoritie prohibition went one foot forward chap ix aleman king suomarius hortarius able endure heavie weight warre humble manner ſue peace obtaine howbeit theſe lingering delayes suomarius king alemans owne accord together friend follower unthought met caeſar upon way prince time prowd cruelly bent endammage hurt romanes thought would unexpected gaine well gotten caſe might ſuffered hold owne countenance gate ſhewed humble ſuppliant entertained willed good cheare quiet mind abandoning wholly owne pleaſure meekely upon knee beſought peace verily hee obtained ſame pardon graunted paſt condition ſhould redeliver men captive find ſouldiors food ſo oft needfull manner baſe vaſſales received mercie protection taking onely ſecuritie life whatſoever brought hee ſhewed time occaſion required might well know wearied againe therewith thus well ordered diſpoſed fulfilled accordingly without faile march alſo territorie king named hortarius becauſe nothing ſeemed wanting guide caeſar gave commaundement unto nestica tribune scutarij chariton man admirable ſtrength valour diligence ſeeke find take preſent unto one captive expedition aleman youth caught brought unto promiſed upon capitulation covenanted life ſaved diſcover ſhew wayes thus went afore armie following impeached going ſtill barricado high tree cut downe lying way wheeling fetching long winding circuit came length place aforeſaid armed ſouldiors every one angrie mood fell fiering field harrying away cattell folke yea without mercie hewing piece many made reſiſtance king ſore troubled diſquieted theſe adverſe accident ſaw many territory ſpoyled beheld withall remaines townes village conſumed fire conſidering finall ruine whole eſtate hand himſelfe alſo beſought pardon execrable oath taken doe whatſoever ſhould impoſed upon promiſed alſo make reſtitution generally captive capitulation condition much ſtood upon earneſtly urged delivered detained moſt part knowne iulian provoked juſt indignation inſomuch ſaid king came manner gift beſtowed upon foure follower accompanied whoſe aſſiſtance fidelitie moſt affiance would diſmiſſe captive returned howbeit caeſar ſent conference parle adored trembling eye even overcome againe ſight conqueror driven hard exigent condition namely much meet requiſit ſo many proſperous atchievements thoſe city alſo barbarian forcibly raſed deſtroied ſhould reedified charge himſelfe people muſt find cariage timber c building promiſed doe withall wiſhed dealt way diſloyally make ſatisfaction loſſe heart bloud permitted returne home tranſporting thither corne victual might bee compelled thereto suomarius becauſe countrey ſo utterly waſted could meet nothing therein give thus theſe king time paſt ſwelled ſo outragiouſly pride accuſtomed enrich themſelves ſpoyle men became tame yeelded neckes yoke romanes power beene borne bred among tributary willingly obeyed commandement theſe affaire wiſe atchieved ſouldiors beſtowed ſundry ſtations caeſar retyred himſelfe wonted wintering place chap x flatterer court goe deprave foredoe noble deed vertues iulianus flouts skoffes conſtantius new ſtrange practiſe marcellinus ſheweth allegation notable example knowledge theſe occurrent time time taken conſtantius court caeſar like unto apparitour double diligent ſervitor neceſſitie give notice unto emperour proceeding many bare greater ſway others court learned profeſſors eighth liberall ſcience flatterie turned whatſoever either wiſely adviſed happily performed unto meere mockerie giving beyond meaſure theſe ſuch like word full fooliſhly iulian goat man carping thus full haire together victory ſtinketh againe become odious tearming alſo talkative moldwarpe ape purple coat bookiſh ſmattering grecian thus reſounding many lewd ſpeeches skurrilities kind prince eares tooke pleaſure heare theſe ſuch like note went impudent word ſmother vertues rayling ſlowbacke coward delicate carpetknight one knew trim word ſet deedes amiſſe thing newly happened never greateſt glorie alwaies ſubject envie wee read malicious ſpightfull perſons uſed deviſe even upon renowmed warriours captaines old time taking offence moſt redoubted act vice crime although could none ſuch found example cimon ſonne miltiades charged inceſt incontinencie even neere unto eurymedon river pamphylia vanquiſhed infinite number perſians forced whole nation prowdly puffed reaſon inſolencie king humble manner ſue peace semblably aemilianus scipio evill concurrents taxed drowſie ſluggard whoſe invincible vigilance two moſt puiſſant city obſtinately bent worke rome miſchiefe utterly raſed ground likewiſe certaine ſlanderous backbiter ſeeking many way hole pompeius coat could find nothing blameworthie obſerved forſooth theſe two thing toyes ſpeake validitie namely peculiar naturall uſe tooke ſcratched head one finger prettie hide certaine foule ill favoured ulcer bound leg little white band one theſe hee ſaid looſe diſſolute perſon one looked change affected bee king comming forſooth bald frivolous reaſon mattered part body hee wore diademe marke regall majeſtie man one bare himſelfe valiant politicke behalfe countrey notable proofes gave doe teſtifie theſe thing thus went abroad artemius abode alſo rome vicepraefect deputie governor baſſus beene newly promoted praefect citie naturall death taken away whoſe government met turbulent ſeditions commotion neither memorable matter worth relation chap xi warre conſtantius made sarmatians quadi while emperour meane time tooke winter eaſe repoſe sirmium came unto heavie newes thoſe thicke one necke another ſhewing sarmati quadi nation ſutable neere neighbourhood like condition conſonant armour joyntly together ſundry ſquadrons diſperſed made rodes pannonia ſecond maeſia better fitted brigandize open fight field weaponed long pike armed habergeon made ſhaved ſmoothed horne featherwiſe wrought cloſe linnen jackes moſt horſes ſerve turnes bee guelded leaſt either upon ſight mare ſhould diſquieted fling order beſtowed behind place ſupply growing frampold bewray thicke neighing thoſe ride upon theſe warrior able gallop ride great ground while either follow others chaſe elſe turne backe themſelves ſitting doe upon ſwift courſers pliable leading alſo hand one lere horſe otherwhiles twaine chaunge might cheriſh ſtrength beaſts alternative turnes reſt renew vigour afreſh therefore day night length aequinox spring time paſt emperour aſſembled puiſſant armie put himſelfe journey guidance gracious mild fortune come moſt convenient place paſſed river called alſo danubius donaw iſter flowing bankes reaſon heapes ſnow yce thawed reſolved water upon planked floore ſhips joyned together manner bridge invaded land barbarian meant waſt ſpoyle prevented ſpeedie journey ſeeing whole troupe warlike armie affronting readie cut throat armie ſay ſuppoſed could poſſibly gathered together conſidering ſeaſon yeare durſt neither breath themſelves ſtand ground avoid unlooked deſtruction betooke themſelves flight moſt ſuch feare could hold ſpeedie pace beaten downe ſlaine thoſe quicke footmanſhip eſcaped death lying cloſe among ſecret vale hidden bottomes mountaines beheld native countrey deſtroyed face edge ſword verily might ſaved made head reſiſted ſame vigour ſerved eſcape away theſe thing done part sarmatia faceth within kingdom hungarie pannonia ſecunda like fortitude alſo overagainſt another part pannonia krabaten rhenano valeria ſouldiors manner tempeſtuous whirlewind carrying harrying rich barbarian waſted ſoever ſtood way beeing throughly mooved ſight ſo great loſſe extreame miſerie laying aſide purpoſe hide themſelves longer armed three battailons thought ſemblance ſuing peace ſet upon men while carried themſelves ſecurely ſo might able either make readie weapon avoid violent wounding laſt meanes extremitie turne themſelves flight preſently sarmatiae partake perill quadi oftentimes beene yokefellowes hurt forward boldneſſe readie could helpe running headlong upon evident open danger number killed many could ſurvive made ſhift eſcape wayes wherein perfect armie upon fortunate event gave edge ſtrength courage joyning ſquadrons cloſer together haſtened dominion quadi fearing much accident paſt might hang head minding ſuppliants crave peace confidently preſented themſelves emperour chap xii zabais acabacius vſafer petie king prince quadi humble prayer ſubmiſsive geſtures ſeeke unto conſtantius peace receive ſame therefore qualifie mitigate theſe ſuch like trouble day appointed ſetting condition zizais alſo prince bloud roiall young gallant tall mightie perſonage even marſhalled sarmatians order battaile fall likewiſe entreatie ſue peace ſooner ſight emperour preſently flung away weapon fell grovelong flat upon breaſt manner breathleſſe able take wind feare loſt uſe tongue even ſhould made petition thereby moved greater pitie aſſayed ſundry time ſpeake permitted ſobbing ſomewhat hindered ſpeech utter well could requeſted length refreſhed bidden ariſe upon knee recovered voice humbly beſought forgiveneſſe pardon treſpaſſes thither alſo multitude admitted make ſupplications feare could open mouth yet better perſon among ſtood doubtfull tearmes danger commaunded raiſe himſelfe ground given unto ſigne long waited make petition caſt targuets weapon wholly gave themſelves humble prayer deviſing many meanes geſtures exceed ſaid prince lowly ſupplication zizais beeing greater potentate reſt armed men brought alſo pettie prince namely rumon zinafer fragiledus many lord beſide nobilitie tender like petition upon hope ſpeed albeit rejoyced highly life graunted promiſed undergoe heavie load hard condition recompence make amends hoſtile hurt outrage committed yea willingly preſent themſelves good child wife together whole circuit territory poſſeſſions power romanes yet courteſie bountie joyned equitie prevailed tooke place ſo willed without feare hold ſtill owne habitation rendred captive men brought alſo hoſtages according enjoyned promiſed moſt readily thenceforth obey whatſoever commaunded example clemencie gave encouragement likewiſe others inſomuch came ſpeedily together people arabarius vſafer prince bloud royall among lord potentate eminent place leader gentile regiment one ruled part quadi inhabiting beyond mountaines certaine sarmatians regard country ſo neere confining ſutable ſavageneſſe ſorting moſt joyntly together multitude people emperour ſuffered aproch leaſt pretence making ſome league might ſuddainely take armes thus companie parted divided thoſe came entreat behalfe sarmatians willed ſmall time withdraw themſelves way while buſineſſe arabarius quadi might skanned conſidered preſented themſelves place faſhion countrey ſtanding body ſtouping able excuſe purge themſelves outrage committed fearing calamity extreame miſerie gave hoſtages commaunded never compelled time exhibite pledge league alliance theſe matter thus according equitie reaſon concluded vſafer admitted deliver requeſt while arabarius ſtiffely ſtood upon theſe tearmes affirmed peace himſelfe obtained ought ſtand alſo ſtead beeing partner although inferiour degree wonted obey commaundements queſtion debated order given sarmatians beene alwaies vaſſals unto roman ſhould freed forraine power ſo gladly accepted put hoſtages better aſſurance keeping peace offered themſelves owne accord mightie number nation king conflowing together troups company underſtood arabarius went way without puniſhment hurt beſought ſword might hang throat like ſort alſo obtained peace deſired brought ſooner man would thought ſons way hoſtages ſent inmoſt part kingdome semblably alſo delivered men priſoners according capitulated parted fro leſſe griefe ſorrow owne child chap xiii sarmatians ſlaves put flight baniſhed lord maſters contemned clemencie conſtantius truſting upon ſtrength place furniſh themſelves guile weapon prayer together defence theſe affaire thus ſet order care sarmatians deſerved rather pitifull eye compaſſion privie hatred diſpleaſure unto fortunate happie occaſion fell man would beleeve ſo might well deemed true one ſayth prince power either maſtereth maketh fortune inhabited kingdome old time certaine ignoble potentate ſecret conſpiracie ſervants taking armes enterpriſed notorious act barbarian uſe evermore reckon might right vanquiſhed maſters ſtoutneſſe match number ſuperior reaſon feare troubled wit ſeeke counſell take fled unto victovali victophali eutrop victobali inhabiting farre thinking better yeeld obeyſance defendors thing men diſtreſſe wiſh doe ſerve owne ſlaves hard fortune grievouſly complaining gotten pardon taken emperours protection craved meanes helpe recover libertie ſo farre forth mooved wrongfull indignitie ſight whole armie called together gave good gracious word willing commanding obey none himſelfe romane captaines end reſtitution freedome might addition encreaſe withall dignitie ſet ſame sarmatians king zizais noble perſon high reputation meet verily even regall enſignes deed ſhewed faithfull beſides neither man licenced theſe glorious atchievements depart captive agreed returned theſe act thus performed barbarian ground camp removed forward brigitio calliſto bregetio end alſo reliques quades warre kept ſtirre thoſe tract might quenched either teares bloud among whome vitrodorus prince bloud ſonne king viduarius agilimundus pettieking potentate iudges governance ſundry nation ſaw armie boſome realme native ſoile layd themſelves along foot ſouldiors ſhould march pardon graunted commaunded yea delivered child hoſtages pawne would yeeld performance condition impoſed upon thē drawing forth alſo ſwords worſhip god ſware continue loyall faithfull theſe affaire thus brought hath bin related ſo happie end regard common good required force ſhould ſpeed turned upon limigantes thoſe sarmatian ſlaves uſurpers aforeſaid abhominable ſhame without puniſhment perpetrated ſo many wicked prankes likewiſe forgotten former outrage free sarmatians brake caſt allegeance gotten ſo fit time oportunitie entred forcibly roman march performe miſchiefe villanie joyning one mind maſters enemy howbeit upon good deliberation determined offence alſo ſhould puniſhed mildly hainouſneſſe crime required proceeding thus farre forth revenge ſhould tranſlated place farre remote thereby looſe meanes moleſting territory yet conſcience carried lewd wicked part long time played made feare danger wherein ſtood therefore imagining leſſe whole warre ſhould bent upon furniſhed thēſelves falſehood heart weapon hand prayer lip firſt ſight armie ſtrucken aſtonied flaſh ſtroke lightning thinking nothing extremitie craved life promiſed yerely tribute muſtering able luſtie youth yea ſervice readie made ſhew geſture countenance yeeld give conſent ſo commaunded flit ſome countrey yet preſuming confidently ſtrength thoſe place wherein driven maſters thence ſeated themſelves ſecuritie river pathiſſus plinio teiſſa hungarie parthiſcus running downe violently theſe land crooked courſe ſtreame mingleth water donow iſter while paſſeth alone libertie gliding ſoft little little long ſpatious country neere unto iſſue reducing ſame narrow ſtreit owne channell defendeth inhabitant upon invaſion romanes channell danubius owne fence performeth ſafe outrodes barbarian place moſt part countrey reaſon naturall moiſture ground riſing river overflowne full ſtanding water overgrowne willowes therefore unpaſſable unleſſe bee ſuch skilfull thoſe quarter beſide winding circuit iſland meeting manner comming parthiſcus greater river environing ſevereth fellowſhip firme land chap xiiii sarmatian ſlaves daring ioyne battaile romane armie aſhort fight diſcomfited bloudie execution within ſpace halfe houre utterly destroyed overthrow reſt remained home cruelly dealt came therefore prince motion inbred pride arrogance hithermore banke river minding end ſhewed doe commaunded becauſe would ſeeme dread preſence ſight ſouldiors ſtood ſtout ſtubborne ſelfewill making plaine ſhew therfore drew ſo neere becauſe would reject whatſoever commaundement ſhould layed upon emperour ſeeing evidently might happen ſecretly divided armie many battailons quicke ſpeed expedition encloſed went within ſaid battailons owne ſouldiors ſtanding himſelfe ſome upon higher banke defended ſtrength guard hee mildly willed unruly wavering doubtfull mind diſtracted contrarie way while wily craft furious heat together aſſayed give battaile withall entermingled prayer ſo providing iſſue forth place neere unto charge upon men caſt nonce ſhields great way ſtepping forward little little recover might without ſhew fraud gaine ground ſtealth time day well ſpent grew toward evening ſeeing declining daylight put mind make haſt ſouldiors marched banner upright fierie heat advaunced againſt keeping cloſe together drawing themſelves thicker rankes bent force againſt prince himſelfe ſtanding hath beene ſaid high menacing eye terrible word furious madneſſe armie anger could endure preaſſed hard hote upon emperour hath beene ſaid battailon narrow ſharpepointed forme ſimple plaine ſouldiors uſe tearme caput porci hog head gave ſuch hote violent charge diſranked battaile thus right hand footman cut piece company footman left men armes entred nimble troupe horſemen praetorian band carefully guarded emperours perſon affronted breaſt ſlew downe right ſoone alſo fled came upon backes killed theſe barbarian overthrowne felled ground ſuch invincible contumacie wilfulneſſe ſhewed horrible gnaſhing noiſe made grieved ſo much owne death men joy gladneſſe beſide thoſe ſtarke dead number ham ſtrings cut thereby deſtitute meanes flye ſome right hand cut others againe unwounded verily cruſhed ſqueezed weight thoſe went endured dolorous torment without one word grone given neither one among thoſe ſundry ſorts execution either craved mercie flung weapon deſired quicke diſpatch preſent death holding weapon continually thus piteouſly afflicted though eſteemed leſſe fault overcome gorce others convicted doome owne knowledge conſcience yea heard otherwhiles grumbling mumbling theſe word long fortune thdir deſert befell unto them▪ thus ſpace one halfe houre trhall battaile diſpatched ſo many barbarian lay dead upon ground victorie alone nothing elſe ſhewed bedne field fought scarcely yet theſe hoſtile nation defeated neere kinsfolke deere friend ſlaine ſexes age one another brought forth rout company plucked poore low cottage abandoning pride former life fell moſt humble ſervile obſequiouſneſſe might thus againe within compaſſe ſmall time man might ſee whole heapes body ſlaine flockes poore captive while heat therefore fighting gaine withall conquering pricked men ſtill forward roſe intending deſtruction thoſe either forſooke field lay cloſe hidden within cottage ſouldiors therefore thirſting ſtill bloud barbarian come place kept downe went light thatch hewed men piece neither one cabbin never ſo ſurely framed ſtrong timberpeeces ſaved danger death finally light fire none could lurke lye hid longer meanes ſaving life cut every one either periſhed obſtinately conſumed fire avoiding fire went forth dores while ſought decline one kind death fell upon enemy ſword ſo ſlaine yet ſome eſcaping weapon fire generall committed themſelves ſtreame river running hard hope skill ſwimming gaine banke farther ſide moſt part ſunke wave periſhed ſome ſhot arrowes ſo loſt life inſomuch abundance bloud ſhed ſtreame river fomed ſwelled againe thus element armed anger valour winner made cleane worke riddance decreed order taken aforeſaid generally throughout ſhould looſe hope comfort life ſo houſes burnt whole family caried away commaundement given veſſels ſhould gotten together ſearch thoſe farther banke river ſevered armie foorthwith leaſt courage warriours ſhould abate wax coole certaine nimble lightly appointed skirmiſhers put boat guided along ſecret coaſts countrey met lurking hole sarmatians ſuddaine ſight deceived namely ſeeing owne countrey wherry rower knew glittering weapon afarre perceived comming toward feared betooke themſelves refuge ſafetie mooriſh fennie ground ſouldiors followed maliciouſly killed moſt found victorie man would verily thought neither could keepe ſure footing would adventure upon ſervice chap xv picenſes limigantes terrified theſe freſh example confederats thus ſubdued laied along yeeld neckes unto romane yoke beene compelled ſeeke place habitation length reducea conſtantius auncient ſeat sarmatians ſo called region adjoyning amicenſes manner deſtroyed large countrey overſpread men marched without delay againſt likewiſe picenſes erſech caſtal picenſes thus called region bordering upon ſafer reaſon fellow miſeries wherof certain intelligence continuall rumor ran ſurpriſing ſubduing hard piece worke purſue ſcattered diver place namely vnskilfulneſſe way giveth check men tooke unto helpe thaiphali taifali likewiſe free sarmatians conſidering regiment theſe aidſouldiors diſtance place farre ſevered men choſe thoſe tract invade joyne moeſia taifali tooke hand thoſe part lay next free sarmatians ſeized upon land lay oppoſite unto limigantes afflighted freſh example ſubdued overthrowne wavered long time doubtful mind whether ſhould die fall entreatie ſeeing notable example experiment given way end counſell elder prevailed ſo much conſideration withall ſo many ſundry victory tooke courſe yeeld themſelves alſo came joined humble ſupplication force armes uſurped libertie reſidue likewiſe deſpiſing ſuch maſters bin overcome unmeet warre ſeeing mightier place humble praiers ſubmitted neck yoke part therefore received ſafeconduct forſaken ſtrong defence bulwarke mountaines ſped apace romanes campe ſpacious wide champian field together parent wife child alſo pelfe quicke departure permitted ſteale away thought would rather looſe life compelled void countrey while tooke licentious madneſſe libertie willingly agreed authoritie enter upon quiet truſtie place habitation ſo might troubled warres changed ſeditions theſe men received protection according owne deſire verily thought remained quiet ſmall time afterwards inbred wildneſſe grew againe commit moſt miſchievous outrage ſhall ſhewed convenient proceſſe hiſtorie proſperous courſe ſucceſſe affaire competent defence illyricum upon twofold reaſon eſtabliſhed duple greatneſſe buſineſſe emperor taken hand effected baniſhed perſons ſuſpected thogh mutabilitie yet like behave thēſelves ſomewhat civilely reduced home length placed auncient habitation doe ſame people greater pleaſure ſet ignoble baſe minded king one royall bloud deſcended endued excellent part bodie mind even time themſelves made governour chap xvi conſtantius taking ioy ſirname ſtyle secundus sarmaticus ſolemne oration reioyceth behalfe himſelfe armie victorie gained enemy vpon ſo happie traine brave exploit constantius bearing himſelfe higher one feared thing generall conſent ſouldiors ſtyled secundus sarmaticus name thoſe ſubdued hand depart called cohort century maniples together deſpiſing u abſence while employed defence italy gaule overran illyricum pleaſure ſundry rodes made fro waſted frontier limit one hollowed troughes oake otherwhiles foot paſsing river way conflict open field uſing meanes armour fine force like uſe hath alwaies bin manner ſecret brigand robber craftie guile varietie deceitfull mockery ever firſt beginning nation dread even unto old ancestor diſpleaſures done tollerable ſuffered perſon farre removed ſuppoſing lighter loſſes effectuall ſervice captaines might forfended licentiouſneſſe proceeded grew worke many miſchiefes utter undoing whole province fortified made ſure avenue rhaetia moſt vigilant guard firmely founded ſecuritie gaule leaving cauſe terror feare behind u backes came pannonia pleaſure eternall god purpoſing worke ſmall ado finiſhed ſeene overrun enemy land sarmatians ſtubbornely wilfull mind went withſtand u unto death overthrew ſubdued without loſſe owne men quadi alſo ſemblable malapartnes while came uſe ſeaſonable mildneſſe clemencie limigantes forced flit place farre removed feare might beſtirre themſelves doe men miſchiefe ſpared thoſe free ſet ruler zizais devoted faithfull afterward unto u reputing greater matter create preſent unto barbarian king honor added much unto ſolemnitie creation appointed unto ſame people ruler time elected accepted fourefold reward therefore one expedition hath performed acquired commonwealth together firſt working due revenge upon hurtfull miſchievous robber taking enemy ſo many priſoners may ſatisfie abundantly thoſe thing ought vertue proweſſe ſtand contented hath woon painefull ſweat ſtrong hand ſelves owne travailes fortitude ſure ſave u much wealth ample rich great treaſures even patrimony men whole ſound beſeemeth mind good prince ſuiteth well proſperous ſucceſſes finally ſelfe alſo carrie ſpoile enemy name even addition ſtyle secundus sarmaticus yee one accord without arrogancie ſpoken worthily deſert conferred upon ſpeech ended whole aſſembly wonted alacritie hope greater matter gaine bettered way joyfull applauſe feſtivall acclamation roſe reſound praiſes emperor laſt open declaration made according maner conſtantius invincible himſelfe deciding quarrel controverſies eſpecially greatneſſe either cauſes perſons ſ required conſtant irremoveable diſcerner right wrong albeit many commendable example ſuch like controverſies yet ſhall ſuffice put downe one patterne likeneſſe whereof deed ſayings bee conſidered numerius ruler narbonenſis gallia accuſed theft heard unuſuall cenſorious rigour openly barre tribunall admitted audience triall whoſoever willing bee pleaded unguiltie put matter objected againſt bare deniall could one point convinced delphidius moſt ſharpe oratour layd ſore againſt want proofes evidence great chafe cried ever found guiltie ô noble renowmed caeſar caſe ſhall ſufficient denie whereat iulian mooved wiſely replied thus ex tempore quoth unguiltie ſuffice accuſed theſe verily ſpeeches many ſuch civile matter minded goe forth unto urgent warreſervice conſidered certaine territory alemans harboured heart hoſtilitie would dare doe many outrage unleſſe alſo example others overthrowne ſtucke perplexed doubtfull force expedition ſo ſoone reaſon might fit oportunitie preventing rumor comming ſhould able ſuddaine invade land caſt thought upon many ſundry way hee reſolved length aſſay prooved iſſue effect thereof expedient hee diſpatched ſhew embaſſie hariobaudes vacantem tribunum tribune ordinarie man approoved fidelitie fortitude without one privie thereto unto hortarius king peace thence going eaſily forward confines againſt immediatly make warre might enquire skilfull barbarian language went beeing boldly gone buſineſſe himſelfe taking fit ſeaſon yeare aſſembled ſouldiors part went foorth expedition among moſt ſpeciall ſervices done thought good ſpeed performe one namely heat conflict battailes enter thoſe city long beene raſed thus recovered fortifie alſo build new barnes garner lieu thoſe burnt wherein might layed ſtore proviſion corne wont tranſported britannie theſe workes finiſhed ſooner man would thought onely garner quickly reared alſo city taken ſeized number ſeven wit erkelens caſtra herculis quaetraedt betweene guilich colein quadriburgum take vltrajectum vtrecht ortel triceſimae nuiſſ upon rhene ortel niveſio bon bonna andernach antennacum bing bingio land peaceable confederats ſhould ſpoyled leaſt while moſt warlike nation readie make reſiſtance bridge ſhould danger many men life ſet place indeed moſt meet framing bridge enemy moſt wiſely advauncement higher place warreſervice deviſed plotted like againſt iulianus caeſar oftentimes thing good men deteſted whiſpered open eares emperour many ſhrewd grievous matter ignorant hee wiſe ſycophants court adviſed call backe home vrſicinus moſt renowmed warrior praefect east while theſe matter much diligence ſtraitly ſought sirmium fortune eaſt ſounded terrible trumpet gave intelligence much danger abroad king perſia bearing himſelfe bold helpe thoſe ſavage nation quieted burning unmeaſurably ambitious deſire rule dominion made preparation armour force victual conſulting fiend infernall ſpirits hell ſeeking conjurer juglers know future event thus beeing ſufficiently furniſhed every way intended firſt temperat ſeaſon ſpring overrun newes hereof brought firſt running rumor afterwards certaine meſſengers men ſtood perplexed wiſt doe ſo great feare calamity comming toward forge court beating ſtill day night one would ſay upon ſame anvile pleaſure guelded eunuch preſented unto emperor ſuſpitious fearefull prince vrſicinus bugbeare grimviſaged meduſa • head gorgon oftentimes iterating theſe ſuch like ſuggeſtions death silvanus ſent eftſoones defence eaſt part default better men aſpired higher matter baſe manner foule flatterie many endevoured purchaſe favour euſebius chiefe chamberlaine muſt ſpeake truth conſtantius euſebius caried ſtrong hand ruled could doe much eagerly bent overthrow ſtate foreſaid generall horſe two cauſes men alone need helpe others beſides antioch gave houſe unto moſt importunately required euſebius like ſerpent full ranke poyſon ſtirring number young one yet hardly creepe doe miſchiefe ſent groomes chamber well growne good bigneſſe direction neere attendance gave privie inward miniſteries might ſmall voice alwaies continuing childiſh ſoft wound grievous envie credite reputation valiant man prince eares open unto ſuch ſuggeſtions quickly put practiſe inſtructions irkeſomeneſſe theſe ſuch like take delight fall praiſe old domitian albeit farre unlike unto father brother hee ſtained memoriall name inexpiable deteſtation yet famous making law ſo generally received approoved threatening wiſe hee gave ſtreit charge man within bound romane juriſdiction ſhould gueld boy happened could endured whole ſwarmes multitude whoſe fewneſſe hardly tollerable yet good warie courſe taken leaſt ſame vrſicinus beeing ſent againe hee made ſemblance ſhould feare ſet hurlyburly good opportunitie offered haled preſently away ſuffer death chap v antoninus politicke well experienced perſon leaving conſtantius ſideth sapor while waited event theſe plot troubled doubtfull thought time wee made ſome ſhort abode samoſata moſt noble citie old time kingdome syr •• comagena ſuddainely rumour comming thicke threefold heard new trouble proceſſe hiſtorie ſhall declare one antoninus rich marchant became miniſter auditor office one protector guard lord warden meſopotamia man well experienced wiſe thoſe part paſſing well knowne greedie avarice ſome lapt bond brought within danger exceeding great loſſe ſaw conteſting bigger mightier himſelfe gained nothing unjuſt dealing weakened reaſon hearing handling cauſe leaned mightier readie currie favour becauſe hee would kicke againſt pricke framed himſelfe give fairer word gentler language yea confeſſed debt covin cautelous packing turned due prince treaſurie projecting great high deſignes cloſely pried part commonwealth well ſeene tongue greeke latine hee buſied himſelfe reckoning accompts ſetting downe ſouldiors force abiding place whole defence ſerved time warre ſemblably enquiring way diligent ſearch whether abundant ſtore armour victual neceſſarie proviſion warres thus learned inward ſecrets eaſt diſtributed greateſt part well men money throughout illyricum emperour held employed ſerious affaire appointed day drew neere paying money force feare compelled confeſſe bill owne handwriting owed foreſeeing every ſide hee like bee overwhelmed manner perillous trouble while lord treaſurer pleaſure another inſtant ſore urged endevoured could addreſſe flight unto perſians wife child deereſt kinsfolke end might avoid ſtationarie ſouldiors warder march purchaſeth ſmall ſumme money peece land hiaſpis place watered river tigris device man durſt demaund cauſe comming number utmoſt part romane limit landed man holder poſſeſſions meanes truſtie friend thoſe cunning ſwimmers hee many time conferred parled ſecretly sapor beeing place warden march defended thoſe frontier quarter lying againſt one alſo time beene knowne unto helpe certaine nimble light appointed men ſent perſian campe fort adjoyning ſet aboord fiſherboats ſo dead time night ſweet wife child whole houſehold croſſeth water like world although contrarie caſe unto babylonian traytor zopyrus chap vi sabinianus cowardly old man unfit warre ſubſtituted vrſicinus ſucceſſor elect barbatio antoninus honourably received perſians ſtood afterward good ſtead thing brought paſſe meſopotamia cohort palatine court ſounding retreat turning againe doe u miſchiefe found occaſion length hurt moſt valiant man motion inſtigation ſort guelded eunuch cruell time greedie wanting otherwiſe child deere pledge love embrace rich alone moſt ſweet daughter determined sabinianus feeble old man verily well monied altogether unmeet warre cowardly yea reaſon baſe obſcuritie farre unlike yet obtaine dignitie commaunding armie ſhould bee ſent praefect governe eaſt part vrſicinus returne unto emperours court take charge infanterie ſucceed barbatio end hote ſtirrer ſedition rebellion gave might preſent place ſet upon aſſailed great enemy ſuch hee dread while theſe part acting campe conſtantius courſe every five yeeres upon ſtage b dirribitores paymaſters ſpread abroad divulge great men houſes price high office thus ſuddainely bought ſold antoninus brought king hee wintered gladly received graced promotion weare tuffe turbant honour enjoy allowed ſit king boord good deſert among perſians may open mouthes ſolemne aſſemblies perſuade deliver mind ſet courſe againſt state commonwealth ſay ſpret oare ſhooving haling way doubtfull darke circumlocution even ſpred full ſayle inciting ſaid king intimes paſt maharball rebuked anniball lingering ſlowneſſe ceaſed tell hee way win wiſt uſe victorie brought place ſpeake man well skilled experienced matter gotten diligent attentive hearer ſuch delighted pleaſing ſpeeches readie praiſe openly like homer c phaeaces admire deepe ſilence uſed rehearſe act paſſed fortie yeares gone namely continuall chaunces warres eſpecially hileia singara moſt cruell conflict battaile fought night force mightily overthrowne defeated ſome herault came betweene take quarrell perſians yet brave victory gained gone farre edeſſa aedeſſa bridge rhoa rhoas euphrates become confidence puiſſance armes noble atchievements ſo farre foorth extended enlarged bound empire time eſpecially reaſon long trouble civile warres romane bloud ſpilt power abated ſides theſe ſuch like motif time time table among cup manner auncient greekes uſe conſult preparation warres ſerious affaire revolted traitor full ſoberly incenſed king firehote himſelfe preſuming alſo upon great fortune immediatly winter ended hee ſhould ſound alarme promiſing alſo aſſuredly owne part ſtead well many neceſſarie important occaſions chap vii comming sabinianus departure vrſicinus bringeth ſorrow unto province east ſubiect romane empire perplexitie care troubleth captaines force ſame time sabinianus puffed ſuddaine advauncement ſo high place commaund entred march cilicia delivered unto predeceſſour letter emperour exhorting ſpeed repaire unto court honoured ſome higher dignitie upon ſuch urgent point neceſſarie affaire vrſicinus made abode even farre iſland tilemarke tract norway ortel thule good reaſon regard ſo weightie buſineſſe ſhould ſent beſt acquainted old diſcipline long experience warfare moſt skilfull perſians policie rumour province much diſquieted state city armed decree people acclamation comming thicke one upon another layed hold detained ſtill publicke patrone defendor bearing well mind left among defence companie idle ſouldiors loved ſtirre dores yet tenne yeares ſpace loſt nothing withall diſtruſting owne ſafetie removall doubtfull dangerous time intelligence moſt cowardly perſon come place deepely perſuaded wee doubt thereof fame flyeth ſwiftly wayes aire whoſe relation giving intelligence theſe occurrent put queſtion propoſed among perſians counſell courſe take much debating fro concluded according advice given antoninus much vrſicinus poſted away farre new come ruler captaine nought regarded ſetting aſide therefore beſieging city commonly dangerous ſhould breake euphrates march directly forward end ſpeedie expedition preventing rumor comming might ſeize hand whole province even thoſe former warres unleſſe gallienus time untouched reaſon long peace wealthie enterpriſe exploit promiſed leave grace god moſt meet ſufficient leader counſell commended one accord confirmed generally bent ſet mind ſuch thing ſpeed gathered together put readineſſe ſo winter long preparation made victual ſouldiors armour munition meanes requiſit warlike expedition ſhortly taken hand meane ſtaied ſide mountaine taurus comming commandement toward part italie made haſt untill drew neere river maritza meritza hebrus runneth downe odryſian hils received prince letter commaunding u without excuſe making returne meſopotamia without officer attendance wee take charge dangerous expedition power commaund transferred unto another thing plotted contrived theſe buſie polititians pragmaticall statiſts emperour purpoſe caſe perſians fruſtrate expectation retyred owne countrey ſhould reputed doubtie piece ſervice exploited new captaine fortune otherwiſe ſhould come adverſe croſſe imputation treaſon state might layed upon vrſicinus thus without reaſon toſſed fro ſtood doubtfull good returned found sabinianus full diſdaine man meane ſtature baſe minded ſmall courage hardly able without ſhamefull feare abide light noiſe companie met feaſt much leſſe ruſtling clattering armie battaile howbeit becauſe diſcoverers ſent eſpiall affirmed moſt conſtantly fugitive avouched leſſe enemy made hote preparation every way while ſilly fellow idle ſlouthfull ſlept buſineſſe approched niſibis readie provide good neceſſarie meanes feare leaſt perſians making ſemblance ſiege ſhould ſurpriſe citie unawares chap viii perſians great power make excurſion upon romanes varietie fortune commonly ſeene while within wall every thing ſpeed putting readineſſe might diſcover ſmoke light fire way along tigris otherwiſe called maurocaſtrum armenia caſtra maurorum place neere niſibis siſara reſt march even citie ſhining thicke uſually done continually evident proofe enemy paſſed river broken forth fell waſt ſpoile countrey whereupon leaſt paſſages ſhould intercepted running march made ſpeed forward come within two myles eſpied wellfavoured boy chaine necke gueſſed eight yeres age pitifully cry middeſt high way ſonne ſaid himſelfe freeborne gentleman mother terrible affright enemy ſo neere hand ſhe fled encumbered carriage haſt left alone behind child while captaines commandement tooke pitie much moved ſight carrie upon horſe bring backe unto citie brigand caſt trench tampier round circuit wals ranged randon abroad terrified trouble calamity commonly follow ſiege ſet boy within poſterne gate halfe ſhut ſpeed could make returned windleſſe haſt toward regiment men marched eſcaped hardly taken wing enemy horſemen followed one abdigidus tribune fled campſlave overtaken ſaid ſervant maſter flight ſlipt away asked paſſed great haſt appointed iudge governour heard vrſicinus little entred citie going toward mountain izalla therewith ſlaine partie anſwered thing never demaunded number purſued u hote chaſe never reſted outſtript ſuch fleet pace horſe mee found men laid ſecurely along eaſe hard amudum weake hold while horſes ſcattered forage ſtretched forth mine arme length ſwinging skirt caſſocke high round head uſuall ſigne ſhewed enemy hand ſo joyning rode amaine horſe readie time tyre thing terrified u full moone ſhining night long flat levell plaine field able affoord u diſtreſſed put ſhifts borough ſhelter u tree ſhrub ſeen aught beſides ſhort graſſe low weed ſtratageme therefore deviſed namely ſet upon horſe backe burning lampe tie ſame faſt falling ſo let caried ſame go looſe himſelfe without rider take left hand way while meane time marched toward mountaine top ſituate right end perſians weening tallow linke giving light captaine ſoftly marching might take courſe way eſpecially wee foreſeene wee ſhould beene taken priſoners brought ſubjection enemy eſcaped danger come certain woodie place ſet vine appletrees named meiacarire ſo called cold fountaines inhabitant ſlipt away gone wee found nouke remote farre way one ſouldior lying hid alone himſelfe preſented unto captain faltred ſpeech feare ſo word hung together therefore ſuſpected affrighted menace revealeth whole truth ſheweth borne paris gaule while ſerved troupe horſemen afraid puniſhed foule fact time paſt committed fled countrey turned perſian ſince time honeſt behavior cariage well approved wedded wife begat child ſent ſpie part related many time true tidings addreſſed frō sapor nohodareus two great potentate led certain company brigand returne minding report unto learned delivered withall hee knew contrarie ſide ſlaine therefore ſeeing care encreaſed upon u thence wee came great ſpeed according time would give u ſend ammianus marcellinus wiſely taken view enemy armie returneth unto companie ſpeedily could hoped looked diſcoverers returned hither found parchment written cypher ſtrange character within ſcabbard commaundement brought unto u procopius together come lieutenant lucilianus ſaid beene ſent embaſſage perſians ſame ſet downe darke tearmes purpoſe leaſt bearer beene caught ſence writing underſtood ſome matter much miſchiefe ſhould riſen thereupon carried tenour embaſſadour greekes ſent away farre perhaps killed longlivd king contented statto di gallipoli bra da george saint george arme helleſpontus making bridge river granius rhyndacus come puiſsant armie many nation minding overrun aſia prince owne nature eaſily provoked anger moſt fierce withall hath incite incenſe ſucceſſour hadrian ſometime emperour rome loſt paſt helpe ever unleſse greece take better heed writing implied thus much king perſia paſſed river anzada tigris advice inſtigation antoninus aſpired dominion eaſt throughout theſe content hardly much adoe read reaſon written ſo exceeding intricately politicke courſe taken ſame time great potentate named iovinianus ruler corduena province perſian dominion growne romane ground ſecretly ſtood well affected unto u detained hoſtage syria beeing allured ſweetneſſe liberall art hote deſire affection returne unto part againe vnto ſent certaine centurion right truſtie approoved fidelitie know certainely matter hand came deſart mountaines ſteepe ſtraits ſeene knowne courteouſly received confeſſed unto alone cauſe preſence ſent accompanied one ſecrecie skilfull way unto paſſing high rockes great way whence might ſeene fiftie myles forward leaſt thing man eyeſight failed abode two whole day ſunneriſing third day diſcovered circle earth u uſe call horizon full infinite troupe armed men king himſelfe leading way glittering gorgeous glorious array cloſe unto left hand went grumbates king chionites man muſt need ſay middle age riveled lims carrying brave mind ennobled enſignes many goodly victory right ſide king albanes high mightie prince equall place honour diver captaines leader men eminent qualitie commaund marched followed multitude ſorts degree picked choſen manhood nation adjoyning trained enured long time many adventure endure difficultie accident whatſoever tell greece art ſo fabulous long wilt thou talke unto u doriſcus towne thracia force muſtered numbred band within encloſures whereas warie circumſpect ſpeake truly timorous amplifie nothing teſtimonies credite neyther doubtfull vncertaine delivered well ſaid king paſſed moſſe moſal nineve botun caſtaldo adiabene mightie citie middeſt anzaba bridge killed beaſts ſacrifices ſeene inwards thereof praeſaging good ſucceſſe went moſt joyfully gueſſing multitude behind could hardly goe three dayes made haſt returne thence unto potentate ruler aforeſaid reſted refreſhed courteous office hoſpitalitie whence returned place likewiſe deſart ſolitarie ſooner could hoped expected while mightie meanes neceſſitie guide wee ſtrengthened heart thoſe ſtood doubtfull quandarie intelligence given unto king without fetching compaſſe paſſed one bridge made ſhips chap x meſopotamia romanes waſted field fiered place fortified endure firſt brunt warre sabinianus ridiculouſly taketh pleaſure maketh much himſelfe incontinently therefore ſwift horſemen ſent caſsianus ducem marqueſſe meſopotamia euphronius ruler time province commiſſion compell countrey peaſants family cattell remoove place ſafetie towne heren nig canhae compaſſed weake wals ſhould quickly abandoned preſently hereupon field ſet fire might ſtore forage thus ſaid commiſſion without delay performed accordingly ſooner fire made kindled mightie violence raging element conſumed corne ſwolne full ſtraw thereof turned yellow yea ripe graſſe ſuch ſort brim tigris banke farre euphrates greene thing left ſame time many wild beaſts burnt lyon eſpecially ſo fell furious thoſe part wont wonderfully periſh bee blinded little little ſort betweene reedplots river meſopotamia buſhie ſhrubbie ground raunge abroad infinite number lyon ſo long mild winter laſt thoſe alwaies moſt gentle take hurt ſeaſon yeare reaſon sunnebeames become exceeding hote thoſe country ſo ſcorched frying parching heat ſultrie breath ſayd planet great gnat ſwarme exceedingly every corner thoſe land ſore troubled ſet madding ſaid flyes make eye moiſt ſhining member while ſettle upon eyelid fall biting ſame lyon abidden painefull torment long time either drowned ſwallowed river whereto flye remedie elſe loſſe eye clawes often ſcratch teare plucke owne head become much wood eaſt part throughout ſhould exceeding full ſuch beaſts while field burning hath beene ſaid tribune ſent protectores fortified hither bankes euphrates skonces ſtakes ſharpe pointed kind defenſive munition planting convenient place artillerie ſhot river full gulfes ſwallowing deepe pit while theſe matter ſpeedily put execution sabinianus moſt 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 excellent captaine manager mortall warre occaſions advantage caught well ſet avoid danger among ſepulchres edeſſa made grounded peace dead caſting peril fearing nought carrying himſelfe looſely one lived careleſſe life militarie dancing armour ſound muſicall inſtruments lieu hiſtrionicall actours player tooke delight pleaſure greateſt repoſe ſilence might thing aſſure enterpriſe place ominous whereas may learne courſe world proceſſe time every perſon excellencie ought avoid theſe ſuch like word deed carrying fearefull heavie praeſage pronounce portend future trouble chap xi time perſae uſing counſell helpe antoninus provide well owne armie every ſide encircle two troupe romane horſemen ſent ſuccour meſopotamia went antoninus fugitive boldly dallieth vrſicinus meane king paſſed niſibis ſtation account fire ſtill encreaſed varietie drie fuell feeding ſhunning could want forage marched foot mountain along greene vallies bottomes full graſſe come bebaſes village whence even unto towne otherwiſe called amida conſtantia ſtandeth hundred myle thing withered dried continuall drought ſave ſome pit found little water ſtayed long time doubtfull ſuſpence doe reſolved upon confidence hardneſſe people paſſe take knowledge intelligence given faithfull diſcoverer euphrates riſen reaſon ſnow newly thawed reſolved ſwelling ſtreame ſurrounded bankes overſpred great way beſides whereby affoorded foord wade diſappointed therefore put beſide expectation hope conceived betake themſelves whatſoever caſuall occaſion would miniſter embraced put queſtion conſultation according ſuddaine urgent condition preſent state caſe done antonine commaunded ſpeake mind began effect perſuading turne journey toward right hand fetching longer circuit country fruitfull thing neceſſarie uſe regard enemie went ſtreight forward yet unſpoiled untouched might guidance goe barzala laudias two garriſon caſtles river ſmall narrow ſo neere head yet growne big river running might eaſily paſſed many ſhallow foords theſe reaſons beeing heard counſellor commended willed therewith lead way knew company whole armie altering intended journey followed wild deſart byway ſure eſpials knowne appointed make haſt unto samoſata thence paſſed river cut bridge citie dacia called ſome clauſenburg mulenbach zeugma caperſana might helpe fortune beat backe enemy force chaunced horrible ſhamefull fact ſuch deſerved buried ſilence ever horſemen two troupe number ſeven hundred newly ſent illyricum ſuccour meſopotamia beeing feeble fearefull keeping garriſon thoſe part fearing ſome ambuſhment night departed evening beſeemed paſſages ſhould beene better warded farre common portwayes perſians well obſerved number well neere twentie thouſand leading sapor nohodares paſſed beyond overloaden drinking wine faſt aſleepe while man looked foorth eſpiall lay hidden armed behind certaine high mount neere unto amida within hath beene ſaid upon journey samoſata went forward yet twylight certaine high barbican toothill ſuddainely affrighted bright ſhining glittering armour cry alowd enemy hard hand accuſtomed ſignall battaile given made ſtand caſtour ſelves round ring thinking ſafeſt way neither flye enemy within ſight follow chaſe joyne battaile mightier wee horſemen number otherwiſe feare certaine death end beeing driven upon extremitie fight even while deviſing behoofefull u doe ſome men running raſhly skirmiſh ſlaine part preaſſed one upon another antoninus advaunced gloriouſly armie vrſicinus tooke knowledge chiding accent rated tearmed wicked traytour putting tuffe turbant wore aloft crowne head ornament honour alighted horſe bowed bodie ſo low touched wellneere ground ſaluted calling patron lord faſtening hand together behind backe among aſſyrians geſture ſuppliant forgive quoth right honourable come lieutenant upon neceſſitie mine owne fallen theſe courſes know lewd ungracious certaine officer importunate calling upon well know whoſe covetouſneſſe high place excellencie protecting poore estate able reſist plunged mee headlong theſe deſignes withall ſpeaking theſe word hee departed ſight turning backe ſlipt away modeſtly ſtepped backward ſhewed ſtill breaſt afront chap xii troupe romane horſemen diſcomfited put flight loſse moſt part number ſlaine hardly recover amida while theſe occurrent happen compaſſe one halfe houre ſouldiors rereward kept upper part hill crie another multitude men armes complete harneis ſeene behind ſpeed could make came forward approched commonly falleth dangerous extremity ſeeke againſt miſchiefe either ought able make head preaſſe ſo huge multitude came ſtill upon u put u rankes broken throughout ſides made ſhift every man himſelfe next way could flie while one endevoreth owne part get great danger diſperſed ray become entermingled among enemy traverſing ground meet u every turne ſo fighting manfully without deſire live driven wee unto bankes tigris ſtood high cut rocke whence ſome thruſt headlong ſtucke faſt armour weapon encumbring river ſhallow yeeldeth foords others ſwallowed drowned hole whirlepits ſome joining skirmiſh enemy fought variable event others againe affrighted thicke band ſquadrons made haſt next wold mountaine taurus among leader himſelfe known environed round number fighting men together aiadaltha tribune one lacquey ſwift horſemanſhip eſcaped ſelfe while wander way reſt companie tooke looke beſt doe meet verennianus one guard protectores ordinarie ſhot thigh arrow while aſſayed ammianus himſelfe band protectores fellowes earneſt requeſt plucke forth ſeeing ſelfe hemmed every ſide perſians going mee came apace climbing faſt wind would permit toward citie ſituate high ſide aſſayled whereto paſſage one narrow aſſent ſame exceeding ſtreight reaſon among cloven hils certaine huge mount erected purpoſe way make footpath narrow entermingled pellmell perſians running forth ſame brunt u higher ground ſtood wee ſtirred untill sunne riſing next day ſo thicke thruſt together dead body ſlaine borne multitude could find rowme fall downe inſomuch certaine ſouldior juſt face head divided cloven maine ſtroke ſword ſo lay even half ſhoulders ſtucke pent ſtreight every ſide manner ſtake albeit many ſorts caſtingweapons dart bulwark diſcharged ſhot kind engine artillerie yet reaſon ſo neere wall avoided danger ſo length entred citie poſterne gate found full occaſion ſort ſexes men woman conflowed thither part bordering upon happened alſo ſame time number people uſed every yeare place city ſide traffique forraine commodity met together ſo encreaſed multitude rurall folke meane heard every ſundrie confuſed noyſes while ſome bewayled thoſe dead loſt others carried mortall wound many called upon diver deereſt friend theſe ſtreights could ſee chap xiii deſcription amida right ſtrong towne munition garriſon therein sapor taken hand certaine fortified pile great clemencie entreateth captive ſexes namely virgin conſecrated devoted chriſtian religion commaunding kept ſafe citie time paſt ſmall constantius caeſar end inhabitant thereby borderer might moſt ſafe place refuge time built antoninupolis another town encircled large wall faire tower ſetting armourie hold engine batterie artillerie planted upon wals made dreadfull enemy would need called owne name verily south ſide watered beneath curving ſtreame tigris ariſeth neere unto way ſtandeth againſt eaſt wind hath proſpect underneath plaines meſopotamia expoſed north hath river nymphius nympheus neighbouring thereto ſhaddowed top mountaine taurus divide nation beyond tygris armenia aſunder oppoſite weſt wind joyneth upon gumathen fruitfull countrey cattell tillage plentifull wherein ſtandeth village named abarne well knowne naturall hote bathe medicinable holeſome water middle heart amida citadell iſſueth rich plenteous fountaine ſame potable verily otherwhiles reaſon hote vapour reaking ſtrong ſtinking ſavour garriſon defence towne ſerved alwayes appointment fifth legion together ſmall troupe naturall inhabitant ſixe legion partly ſpeedie journeyes running outgone perſians multitude invaded thoſe part approched place ſtood defence moſt ſtrong wals namely magnentiaci thoſe ſerved magnentius decentrus uſurpers decentiaci civile warfare ended deceitfull turbulent ſpirit emperour forced come eaſt feare forraine warres alſo triceſimani decimi e fortenſes likewiſe f superventores g praeventores together aelianus lieutenant new untrained ſouldiors motion perſuaſion ſaid aelianus one protectores ſallied singara recorded alreadie ſlew great number perſians lay along faſt aſleepe alſo piece ſervice greater part h comites sagittarij wit certaine troupe horſemen ſo tearmed wherein ſerve barbarous ſouldiors free borne good armour proofe cleane ſtrength bodie ſurpaſſing others well while firſt impreſſion brunt unexpected attempt enterpriſes theſe deſignes put execution king perſon people thoſe nation conduct turning journey toward right hand place called bebaſes according antoninus given counſell way horte meiacarire charcha would paſſe amida hee come neere unto certaine fortreſſes romanes whereof one name reman buſan aſſayleth ſayd hold whereupon defendant ſuddaine amazedneſſe mind beeing affrighted ſight ſuch varietie armour weapon betrayed thoſe fled thither ſuccour defence thoſe commaundement depart preſently countrey farre could ſeene ſhone againe glittering armour weapon men armes bard horſes complete harneis covered hill dale himſelfe mounted upon courſer higher reſt advaunced whole armie wearing lieu manner retyred came refreſhed themſelves meat ſleepe night fully paſt ſound trumpet leading way beſet citie round gave ſo terrible aſſault unto within would fallen scarcely grumbates like herault hote climate aethyopia ſo ſet foot attica others opinion ayre like water uſe infected corrupted ſtinke dead carkaſſes ſuch like greateſt cauſe moſt diſeaſes leaſtwiſe ſuddaine alteration change aire breedeth lighter ſickneſſes alſo affirme aire thickened ſome groſſe exhalation earth thereby reſiſting letting forth ſubtile matter uſeth breath pore bodie killeth ſome cauſe living creature beſides chap iiii citie encircled round hurdlefabrickes meanes certaine towneſ man perſians become master high tower whence cunningly ſcatter firedarts among beſieged meanes moleſt upon winning pile called ziatum cruelly fall upon many thouſands priſoners bvt time reſtleſſe perſian king compaſſed citie round hurdleworkes began raiſe platformes againſt alſo framed high tower front bound yron upon top every baliſts planted might drive defendant bulwarkes howbeit ſlingers archer ceaſed ſo much one minute houre make light skirmiſhes u two legion magnentiae newly brought gaule ſaid ſame conſiſting valiant men active nimble meet fight even plaine ground manner ſervice warre whereto wee tied onely unfit contrariwiſe alſo exceeding unruly troubleſome would lend helping hand man engineworke making bulwarkes fortification uſed foolehardily fallie forth fight moſt courageouſly came home fewer went good one handfull water men ſay common 〈◊〉 fire laſt gate lockt faſt entreatie tribune made might height certaine craggie broken rock lay gaping open ſo man could looke downe without horrible dizzines turning braine whence vault hollowed ground along foot mountain certaine ſtaires workmanly finely poliſhed led unto plaine plot citie whereby end water might privily ſtealth drawne river chanell deuiſe haue ſeene fort ſtrong hold throughout thoſe country lie hard river darke angle regarded reaſon way turne u make head againſt theſe ſtood aboue moleſted u againſt multitude skaling already hand take hold upon bulwark thus ſervice devided among u five lighter kind baliſts removed owne place company perſians fuming fretting every ſide came hotely ſet fight gaules ſide ſtrong body undaunted boldneſſe ſo long could hold ſlaſhed hewed ſwords ſtood way ſome owne ſide either beaten downe ſhot bodie number arrowes flying eares every hand perceived therefore danger bent amaine one place whole ſquadrons enemy running toward made haſt get away yet one turned backe ſo driven without rampier retyring little little ſound meaſures could longer endure band ſo thicke aſſayling noyſe trumpet campe ſore troubled ſo departed alſo many trumpet cornet reſounded citie gate ſet open receive men happily could poſſibly returne ſo farre yea engine artillerie kept great ratling without ſhot dart end captaines ſtations ward fellowes ſlaine might driven goe behind knowing ſtood againſt naked wals diſorderly directed mild ſound trumpet without running raſhly forth array covered roofes pent houſes head wicker hurdle made rod fence drew ſo neere within dartſhot perſian footman held ſhields unneth
