evening came apace ſo ſides reſted greater part night ſpent deviſing meanes might meet ſo horrible miſchiefe end caſt projected many wayes reſolved upon device putting quickly execution proved ſafer namely againſt thoſe baliſts aforeſaid foure ſcorpions ſhould planted full affront removed placed overagainſt warily matter great difficultie skill day commeth u moſt wofull ſhewing dreadfull band perſians whole heards troupe elephant joyning cloſe unto made ſuch braying noiſe body withall carried ſo huge boulke man mind cannot conceive terrible fearefull ſight al ſides put violent weapon huge fabricks hideous beaſts meanes scorpion socket yron ſlings round ſtones driven otherwhiles bulwarkes brake joynts turret overthrew baliſts bender ſo headlong ſome without woundhurts others cruſhed huge heavie weight periſhed elephant great violence ſet beaſts beeing ſides encumbred flame fire throwne among taken hold body going thereupon backward maſters could hold afterwards munition fabrickes burnt skirmiſhed yet ſtill gave king himſelfe perſians never forced bee perſonally battaile ſore moved theſe tempeſtuous infortunities new manner never exampled knowne like unto ſouldior uſed fight field leapt forth thickeſt becauſe goodly brave ſeene looked farre multitude ſuch guarded protected many caſtingdart throwne number guard ſquires bodie layed along hee went cleere away changing alternatively turnes battaillons eaſie ruled end day affrighted fearefull ſight either thoſe dying wound given taken length permitted ſome ſmal time graunted reſt night came ended conflict ſo ſmall time taken ſhort ſleepe ſooner grew daylight boyling anger dolour minding ſet regard right eye excited people againſt u win hoped fabrickes platformes burnt ſhewed attempted fight along high terrace next unto wall mount raiſed within forth men ſo farre able doe ſtraine equall force reſiſted high ground long time continued bloudie battaile neither feare death ſtirred one man ſide gave endevour make good place conflict drawne continued thus farre fortune ſides ruled inevitable event mount terrace coſt ſo long labour ſhaken ſome earthquake fell downe forward ſpace lay hollow gaped wall heape earth caſt withoutforth layed even plaine cauſey bridge ſet made open paſſage entrance enemy ſame barres way impeached ſo moſt part ſouldiors thus caſt ceaſed fight either overwhelmed earth weakened travaile howbeit running ſides put backe ſo ſuddaine danger while haſt making entangled one another enemy grew bolder venturous good ſucceſſe chap vii length force part ſent aſſembled together amida power thereof woon garriſon ſouldiors eſcape among ammianus marcellinus ſwift flight ſave themſelves sapor crucified aelianus lieutenant certaine romane tribune ſought carefully transtigritores put ſword reaſon therefore king commaunded brigand robber ſent naked ſwords bent againſt one anothers breaſt occaſion infinite ſlaughter nothing bloudſhed ſides ditch filled body thereby broader way layed open citie thus peſtered concourſe force ſtill ſharpe ſet hote upon execution hope cut eyther longer defence eſcape flight hewen piece pellmell one another armed ſouldiors unarmed weakling regard ſex made wherefore began darke evening yet number men though adverſe fortune ſtood ſtrived againſt joyning fight held occupied hand full two others lying hidden benefit darke night certaine ſecret place towne got forth poſterne gate watch kept ſome helpe skill deſart place ſwift ſpeed companion made came length farre ſtation baiting place ten myles end wherein beene moderately refreſhed goe forward ſtill ourway ſelfe overcome much travaile gentleman uſed ſuch toyle found terrible object ſee yet ſo wearied tyred yeelded paſſing great comfort one theſe campelacqueyes ſouldiors page riding upon ſwift horſe without ſaddle bitt bridle end might drop backe tied ſtreight ſhort unto left hand halter cord wherewith manner uſed led guided within chauncing bee caſt able breake ſunder knot bond held faſt lims piteouſly rent mangled dragged deſart wild forreſts ſo weight carkaſſe reſtrained backe beaſt time alſo ſpent tyred running ſervice jade thus caught making uſe time came much adoe together ſaid companion mine certaine fountaines water naturally hote ſtanding upon veine brimſtone reaſon hote weather overtaken drought thirſt went ſoftly ſeeking great water ſo ſpied length verie deepe pit able either go downe depth carried cord rope u wee taught extreame neceſſitie doe caſe cut linnen ſhirts lapped ſmall piece whereof drawne rope mightie length tooke quilt one companie wore morrion put ſame nether end ſaid rope let downe pit drinking water like ſpunge diſhclout quickly quenched thirſt wherewith wee manner conſumed thence went apace unto river euphrates minding croſſe water unto banke veſſell long time wont give attendance therein tract ferrie horſe man behold wee might diſcover farre regiment romanes horſemens guidons diſranked broken multitude perſians purſued wiſt whence ſo ſuddaine violence charged thus backes marching way example thus preſented eye beleeve verily thoſe earthbegotten gyants aroſe bowel boſomes earth borne indeed ſo exceeding ſwift ſeene ſuddainly diver place sparti commonly tearmed men ſuppoſed ſtarted ground ſo fabulouſly doth antiquitie extoll thing others beſide unhappie occurrent made u beſtirre ſtumpes helpe wee ſave ſelves lay ſwift footmanſhip wee made ſpeed greves grove toward high mountaines ſo thence wee came melitina towne leſſe armenia met captaine wee accompanied readie take journey viſited antiochia againe meane sapor perſians becauſe might march inland part countrey conſidering grew toward end autumne ſtarre named kid riſen driving captive booty intended returne home owne countrey among theſe execution nevertheleſſe rifling citie thus raſed aelianus come lieutenant thoſe tribune whoſe valiant ſervice wall ſtood ſo long defended ſo many perſians ſlaine villanouſly hanged upon gibbet iacobus ceſius numerataij regiſters notary belonging office generall horſemen protectores led away priſoners hand pinnioned behind backes inhabitant beyond tigris ſtreightly layed maſſacred every mother child without reſpect degree higheſt loweſt chap viii wife craugaſius nobleman taken captive ſendeth husband abode niſibis romanus praefect garriſon ſouldiors craftily maketh eſcape commeth perſians hoast thus recovered wife advaunced new dignity honour sapor report ſiege amida lost thirtie thouſand fighting men bvt wife craugaſius keeping ſtill chaſtitie unſtained honoured noble dame mourned though ſhee ſee another world without husband albeit ſhe hoped freſh preſent example better happie fortune caſting therefore providing owne good farre forecaſting accident come troubled ſhee twofold thought one deteſting widowhood wedlocke whereupon ſhe ſecretly diſpatched truſtie familiar friend one knew well coaſts quarter meſopotamia direction enter niſibis mountaine zagrus betweene two garriſon fortreſſes miride lorne requeſting husband ſpeciall meſſage ſome ſecret token matter privily paſſed twain enformed occurrent happened would come live bleſſed life theſe inſtructions paſſenger beeing content furniſhed withall lightly appointed blind wayes forreſts ſhrubbie place hieth apace entreth niſibis pretended errand namely much miſtreſſe ſeene peradventure murthered hee eſpied meanes make eſcape departed enemy campe ſo regarded one baſe fellow enformed craugaſius beene done ſoone taken faithfull promiſe might ſafetie would follow wife meſſenger gat away thence glad man bringing unto woman newes ſhe ſo long wiſhed knowing thus much mediation marqueſſe sapor made ſupplication king departed romane march hee would might conveniently bee done gracious favour graunt commaund husband might come power protection ſaid ſtranger ſo ſuddainly come ſoone gone man looked indeed preſently returned ſecret manner without privitie ſlipped away marqueſſe caſsianus ſtrucke deepe ſuſpition thing great captain place government commaund came roughly upon craugaſius threatened put death cry open mouth man neither came went without fearing charged traytor troubled exceeding much mind feare leaſt revolt ſome fugitive thither intelligence might given wife remained living moſt kindly entreated way ſemblance affected marriage another brave noble virgine ſo pretending hee would provide thing neceſſarie nuptiall feaſt went forth village ſtanding eight myles towne ſo ſpeed haſt could make fled companie perſian forrayers abroad waſt countrey intelligence approched gladly received known word ſpake five dayes delivered sapor king recovered good beene taken deareſt friend together wife ſome moneths loſt hee ſecond place next unto antoninus howbeit excellent poet ſayth longo proximus intervallo next indeed yet great way notable wit grounded beſides long experience world ſufficient man able ſome policie compaſſe whatſoever tooke hand whereas craugaſius nature ſimple yet name well renowmed much ſpoken theſe thing verily happened long king albeit countenance made ſhew ſecuritie ſeemed outward apparance rejoyce deſtruction citie yet greatly diſquieted grieved deepely heart caſt accompts found hee many time ſuſtained lamentable loſſes theſe dangerous miſchievous ſieges yea himſelfe loſt farre owne people taken men alive ſlaine leaſtwiſe ſo many skirmiſhes like fell diver time niſibis singara ſemblably ſeventie three dayes beleaguered amida multitude armed ſouldiors hee loſt thirtie thouſand fighting men good warrior within diſcenes tribune notarie reckoned eaſier difference obſerved carkaſſes men ſlaine ſoone become fantome doe burſt run turne putrifaction inſomuch foure dayes paſt dead man known face body perſians ſlaine waxe drie ſtarke ſtakes ſo neither lims become ſoft moiſtened matter corrupt bloud wherein embrued cauſe hereof frugall manner living land wherein borne bred ſo parched heat chap ix rome diſtreſſed dearth ſcarcitie victual tertullus praefect citie wiſe oration reclaimeth people uprore bringeth good order vpon change wind ſhips fraight corne drive away ſaid want conſtantius prepareth expedition rebellious sarmatians while theſe affaire carried end ſundrie whirlepuffes utmoſt march eaſt immortall citie rome feared dearth comming default ſcarcitie corne tertullus praefect ſame time violence common full menace fearing famine worſt calamitie others otherwhiles ſore troubled without reaſon aſſure long victuall brought convenient time ſhipping beeing arrived faire next bayes partly roughneſſe ſea angrie ordinarie partly tempeſts contrarie wind affrighted doubt great peril putting auguſtus cauſe ſayd praefect often diſquieted ſeditious commotion reaſon common people tooke raged fully vexed imminent miſchiefe feared hope ſave life thought unto people thus keeping ſore ſtirre tumultuous wiſe yet uſing aforetime wiſely conſider ſuch accident preſented little ſonnes ſhedding teares behold quoth hee fellow citizen countreymen ſhall endure god heaven forfend oſse ſame hard distreſſe together unleſſe ſome better fortune ſhine upon u therefore loſſe deſtruction theſe yee thinke heavie calamitie light upon readie commaund pitifull object common ſort enclined owne nature clemencie became appeaſed held peace patiently waiting lot ſhould befall unto anone ſuch pleaſure divine power hath advaunced rome firſt infancie thereof given anſwere ſhould continue ever while tertullus offering ſacrifice oſtia temple caſtor pollux calme came allayed ſea wind turning changing bee mild south ſhips full ſayle entred filled garner corne while constantius among theſe occurrent thus doubtfull doe ſtill winter repoſe sirmium ſat carking muſing upon matter throughly moved troubled fearefull heavie newes ſhewing much afraid namely limigantes sarmatia ſhewed expelled owne lord maſters ancient ſeats poſſeſſions little little neglected thoſe place yeare paſt good profitable policie ſet appointed leaſt fickle unconſtant nation ſhould riſe plot ſome miſchiefe state ſeized hand country confining upon limit inbred manner raunged abroad licentiouſly readie ſet hurrie combuſtion removed put backe outrage emperour ſuppoſing would ſhortly grow prowder tearmes buſineſſe deferred gathered together part number moſt expert active ſouldiors tooke field beginning spring yet come height forward expedition two reſpects armie full rich booty ſince end late summer confidently upon like hope emboldened atchievement proſperous exploit againe becauſe anotolius time fitting ſc pratorio pręfect illyricum abundance neceſſarie proviſion gotten together alreadie even ordinarie time without loſſe hinderance man never diſpoſe order ſet downe praefectſhip unto preſent men confeſſe avouch flouriſhed northren province bleſſings friendly correction wiſe reformation ſome amiſſe erred caſed great loſſes waggonage carriage undid infinit number made ſhut dores delivered profeſſing acknowledgement everie man worth subſidie booke goodly ſhew truſt thenceforth inhabitant thoſe part might lived exempt hurt beene ſaved harmeleſſe conſidering matter quarrel complaint huſht afterward odious deteſtable title matter exquiſitely ſought deviſed ſame amplified aggravated criminous wiſe thoſe exhibite admit ſuch bill while theſe one ſide ſtraine ſtrive power authoritie ſettled continued ſtill thoſe hoped men ſhrigged good left bare ſhould live ſafetie grew length open proſcriptions hanging ſilly innocent perſons well emperor ſayd redreſſe urgent outrage enormitie ſtately glorious manner furniture proviſion put himſelfe journey came valeria province ſometime part pannonia honour valeria daughter diocleſian firſt inſtituted ſo named encamping armie lying ſpread tent along bankes river iſter obſerved barbarian comming colour pretence friendſhip minded ſtealth invade waſt pannonia hardeſt time winter conſidering snow yet melted warmth spring whereby ſaid river remained paſſable every ſouldiors hardly could endure ſtay longabroad lye without dore froſtie weather chap x goeth appeaſe limigantes sarmatia pretending craved peace ſuddaine raging wiſe weapon hand ſet upon force ſhift himſelfe running away within men deſtined deſtruction put ſword forthwith therefore ſent unto limigantes two tribune one interpreter apeece modeſt tearmes way asking queſtion required know reaſon leaving houſes aſſigned unto requeſt peace covenant league concluded wandered abroad ſo diſorderly ſundrie place violence upon limit prohibition behalfe notwithſtanding alledging excuſe certaine frivolous vaine reaſons while feare forced lye beſought prince pardon entreated grudge diſpleaſures forgotten would permit paſſe river come would relate harmes damage ſuſtained preſt readie might ſtand pleaſure take land farre remote ſo lay within compaſſe romane world men nuzzeled long reſt peace worſhipping quietnes goddeſſe health would undergoe burthen beare name tributary emperour taking knowledge hereof returne tribune aforeſaid leaping joy affaire deemed moſt difficult explicable would fully bee diſpatched without paine taking admitted preſence one inflamed hote deſire ſtill getting humor crew flatterer followed fed without meaſure filled eares theſe ſuch like ſpeeches ſtilled forraine trouble made peace everie place ſhould gaine number r proletarie ſubjects multiplie beget iſſue bee able levie muſter moſt puiſſant frie young ſouldiors provinciall people moſt willing give gold ſaving bodily labour take ſpoken perſon author hope hath diver time hindered endangered ſtate rome therefore placed rampier neere kamet simlero acunincum erected high terrace banke like unto tribunall diver ſhips manned certaine legionarie ſouldiors lightly appointed commaundement ſet keepe channell river next unto bankes together innocentius ſometime land meaſurer gave counſell end perceived barbarous people ſtirre while bent another way ſaid ſouldiors might charge upon backes limigantes man aware albeit perceived ſome haſt hurrie made yet deviſing nothing head raſhly ſtood bowing forward thinking deepely heart matter farre different pretended geſture ſpeech ſaw emperour addreſſing himſelfe high pulpit make moſt mild oration readie ſpeake unto people would ſoone tractable obedient one terrible fit furie flung violence ſhoo tribunall cried marha marha among watch word ſignall begin fray skirmiſh rude multitude ſeconding preſently put barbarian banner lowd outcrie wild ſavage manner advaunced forward againſt prince himſelfe looking downe aloft ſaw multitude running fro every place caſting dart reaſon drawne ſwords rapier like come preſently ſome miſchiefe entermingling himſelfe owne people ſtrangers known whither captaine ſouldior becauſe time either linger ſit ſtill beeing mounted upon ſwift ſtead gallopped away bridle necke eſcaped yet ſome yeoman guard while laboured keepe villain back flaſhing upon like flame fire loſt life beeing cruſhed weight onely thoſe fell upon king throne together cuſhion cloth gold ſtollen carried away while man gaineſay within little newes came emperour beene plunged well neere extreame jeopardie ſtood yet upon ſure ground armie ſuppoſing chiefeſt firſt thing reſcue thought quite rid yet danger preſuming confidently good hand ſave life armed though half becauſe ran fight ſo ſuddainely gnaſhing teeth alſo ſo rung againe fell ſouldiors uſe doe engaged themſelves among band company barbarous rebel fully bent leave life becauſe fierie courage men reſolved fully manhood wipe away ſhamefull diſhonour whetting anger againſt ſuch diſloyall perfidious enemy without ſpare downe went ſtood way hewing piece trampling underfoot well thoſe alive lay halfe dead killed outright indeed could make hand full killing theſe barbarian lay whole heapes dead thruſt ſteaked faſt together theſe rebel driven extremity while ſome killed downright place others deadly feare ſcattered aſunder great ſort conceiving ſome hope life prayer came nothing many blow wound received one necke another maſſacred end defeated made away trumpet ſounded retreat men alſo though ſeene lying breathleſſe dead namely ſuch ſome violent rout borne fatall courſe deſtinie made end while withſtood enemy rage laid naked unarmed ſides open death cella tribune scutarij notable among others beginning conflict thruſt himſelfe firſt others middeſt sarmatians troupe ſo cruell carnage maſſacre committed conſtantius taken order ſecuritie according urgent occaſions limit required returneth sirmium full revenge taken falſe enemy likewiſe diſpatched thoſe affaire inſtant neceſſities time called departed thence went conſtantinople ſo neere unto eaſt might ſalve ſores hurt received amida renewing armie freſh ſupplies like puiſſance force reſtraine king perſia violent attempt well knowne unleſſe heavenly power ſome greater care many beſides repell intended leave meſopotamia behind advaunce enſignes diſplayed along ſpatious wide country maine chap xi new tragoedie growing ſlender matter chiefe part wherein acted committed unto one paulus notarie skilfull cruell feat howbeit among theſe care thought trumpet ſounded full blaſt according certaine received cuſtome old lieu civile warres certaine matter imputation coloured deepely crime majeſtie high treaſon purſuit managing whereof paulus chauncellor notarie muſt ſo often name ſent skilfull practitioner theſe capitall bloudie art like fencer ſwordplayer ſ funeral playes ſo himſelfe alſo racke hangman office uſed reape ſome gaine commoditie obſtinate ſetled purpoſe doe hurt ſo forbare alſo theeve ſteale deviſing againſt innocent perſons ſundrie cauſes imputation tending miſchiefe overthrow ſo long hand ſuch damnable ſalaries ſmall baſe occaſion miniſtred matter examination infinitely extended towne named abydus elſium ortelio acutich caeſtaldo abydum ſeated furtheſt part province thebais oracle god called place beſes old time revealed thing come wont honor worſhip done unto according auncient ceremony country lying round much ſome perſonally preſent ſome others ſending ſcript ſhewed deſirous know expreſſe forme ſupplications conceived asked counſell divine power thoſe piece paper parchment contained requeſts petition remained otherwhiles even anſweres given chappell theſe ſome upon malicious intent ſent unto emperour man baſe mind carrying deafe eare matter even great weight importance became particular cauſe information preſented unto paſſing tractable ſuſpitious beſides prepared hand naturally bitter gall ſoone heat caught fire immediately therefore warned paulus ſpeed go eaſt armed warrant commiſſion captaine renowmed experience world hee ſhould cauſe theſe matter heard pleaſure likewiſe emploied buſineſſe modeſtus lieutenant overall eaſt man fitted theſe ſuch like affaire hermogenes ponticus ſame time praefectus praetorio rejected one mild temper well paulus according hee commaunded ſet forward journey full deadly furie carrying pernicious breath graunted libertie therefore preferre ſlanders falſe endictments number brought queſtion part manner earth well noble birth obſcure parentage whereof ſome put paine hard ſtreight bond others died pent cloſe priſons dungeon choſen behold theſe deadly wofull puniſhments bethſan scythopolis citie palęſtina upon twofold conſideration thought meeteſt others ſtood ſecret apart beſides juſt middeſt betweene antiochia alexandria whence many moſt commonly drawne accuſations chap xii execution right honourable noble perſonages while paulus notarie ſat iudge exquiſit cenſure ammianus marcellinus touching affaire horrible monſter borne ſeene antioch iſauri theeving robberie infeſt neighbour nation threat rather rigour lauritius reformed brought therefore judicially firſt simplicius ſonne philip beene praefect conſull endited upon point reported enquired obtaining empire commaunded put torture vertue prince writ theſe caſes time neither ſinned treſpaſſed matter pietie mercie ſome ſpeciall providence god protecting without foile abuſe done bodie condemned baniſhment pernaſius late praefect aegypt plaine conditioned man brought point danger ſentence pronounced worthie death likewiſe driven exile beene heard oftentimes long ſay hee left patra patrae towne achaia borne dwelling place obtaine get certaine office ſeene lay aſleepe many image habite tragicall actor accompanying bringing way andronicus afterwards well knowne liberall ſtudies excellencie poetrie brought judgement place carrying cleere ſecure conſcience could touched ſuſpitions preſumptions laied againſt ſtanding ſtill purgation ſtoutly acquite semblably demetrius philoſopher ſirnamed cythras man verily farre ſtept yeares ſtill good ſtrong bodie ſtout mind hardly layed unto charged diver time offered ſacrifice could denie fact fault impleading prime youth uſed ſo pleaſe pacifie god never ſounded ſearched high matter ſo much know man affected deſired continuing therefore long time ſet faſt racke ſurely grounded upon firme confidence perſiſted feareleſſe without varying anſweres alleadged pleaded ſtill ſame ſuffered without harme received depart unto alexandria borne theſe verily ſome others righteous hand god helpeth aſſiſteth truth delivered extreame preſent danger while theſe criminations endictments ſpred ſtill intricate intangling ſnares without end ſome body piteouſly mangled died therof others deſpoyled good condemned ſuffer puniſhment paulus while prompter ſuccentor theſe cruell enterludes ſpence budget craftie device brought forth open ſhew hurt whereof acted many upon whoſe pleaſure may manner boldly ſay depended life many went ground man wore necke remedy againſt quartane ague ſome paine could charged information evillwillers paſſed monument evening one witch ſorcerer collected horror ſepulchres vaine illuſions ſpirits ghoſts walking wandering thereabout pronounced hee deſerve death died verily matter thus world carried handled many man ſollicited u clarus x dodonaean tree oracle delphi ſo famous time paſt procure death deſtruction emperour whereupon palatine cohort courtier curiouſly finely faining naughtie deviſes flatterie affirmed flatly ſhould henceforth exempt evil commonly befell men giving alowd open mouth fortune appeared time powerfull ſurely effectuall confounding deſtroying adverſaries verily ſuch ſtreight inquiſition theſe matter man wiſedome diſcretion findeth fault doe denie life ſafetie lawfull prince protector defendor good men ſeeke mean others ſafetie ought joint diligence endevour men fenced maintained whoſe redeeming might maine upon violence abuſe offered majeſtie ſtandeth upon guard defence law z cornelię exempted perſon eſtate degree ſoever examination way torture though ſame loſſe bloud ſide becommeth prince unmeaſurably rejoyce take pleaſure wofull caſes ſubjects leaſt ſhould ſeeme governed licentiouſneſſe authoritie example tully ought point followed power harme ſpare himſelfe affirmeth ſought cauſes forgiveneſſe occaſions puniſhment proper dutie diſcreet conſiderate iudge ſame time daphne pleaſant ſumptuous place neere unto citie antioch borne monſter horrible ſeene reported infant two mouth two teeth beard foure eye two exceeding little eares birth ſo miſhapen deformed foretold commonwealth turning foule ill favoured ſtate ſuch ſtrange uncouth monſters theſe many time brought forth world ſignifying praeſaging event ſundrie thing becauſe openly old time expiated paſſe away unheard unknowne even theſe dayes iſauri beene long time quiet done ſome act according content former ſtorie attempted ſiege citie seleucia reviving little little ſerpents wont spring ſeaſon leape hole came downe craggie ſtraits deſart wields putting themſelves cloſe thicke company ſquadrons robber brigand ſore troubled diſquieted borderer withall mountainers paſſed beſide forefences ſtations ſouldiors unſeene meanes dayly practiſe ran eaſily fro rockes ground full buſhes appeaſing either maine force reaſonable perſuaſions lauritius ſent ruler dignitie alſo come added ſtyle man politicke civile carriage reformed moſt enormity threatening rather rigorous dealing inſomuch great time governed province happened nothing reputed worthie puniſhment xx booke chap 1 lupicinus ſent iulianus britannie repreſſe trouble commotion vrſicinus ſlanderous calumniation thoſe court depreſſed throwne underfoot laid away girdle knighthood commaunded betake himſelfe private life order proceſſe affaire throughout illyricum eaſt tenth yeare constantius conſulſhip third iulianus outrodes scot picts ſavage nation peace broken brittannie place neere unto limit appointed march waſted ſo province wearied multitude calamity paſt heaped upon affrighted caeſar keeping winter paris diſtracted ſundry carefull thought afraid goe ſuccour thoſe beyond ſeas conſtantius done time according declared leaſt ſhould leave gaule without ruler eſpecially ſuch time alemans ſtirred make cruell warres thought good therefore ſend theſe part ſet thing order lupicinus ſame time colonell infanterie warlike man aſſure skilfull feat armes prowd withall carrying ſtately looke ſetting browes aloft like horn ſpeaking thereto big yea keeping ſtirre one would ſay acted tragedie upon ſtage men doubted long time whether covetous cruell great captaine therefore abovenamed ſetting forward journey auxiliarie light appointed ſouldiors wit heruli batavi many company moeſici middeſt winter came bullen bologne bononia gotten ſhipping embarked ſouldiors good gale wind hee waited arrived richburrow ripcheſter neere sandwich rutupię juſt overagainſt ſo marcheth toward london lundinium thence advice taken according qualitie buſineſſe might make ſpeed come field give battaile while theſe affaire thus proceed aſſault forcing amida vrſicinus returned prince cour campe captaineſhip footman wee ſaid hee ſucceeded barbatio place welcome given backbiter firſt diſperſed abroad whiſpering manner biting ſlaunders followed framing openly counterfeit criminations whereunto emperour giving eare readily meaſuring moſt thing opinion onely lying open waitlayers accuſers appointeth arbetio florentius maſter office bee commiſſioners iudges make inquiſition reaſon foreſaid • la towne raſed rejected evident probable cauſes thereof feared leaſt euſebius high chamberlaine ſhould bee offended caſe admitted proofes argument plainely ſhewed misfortune befell happened obſtinate negligence cowardiſe sabinianus beeing turned quite liſtening unto truth enquired vaine frivolous matter farre purpoſe unjuſt proceeding viſicinus throughly mooved heard manner quoth emperour deſpiſeth yet preſent buſineſſe weightie importance neither knowne puniſhed otherwiſe perſonall iudgement prince yet know thus much way praeſage propheſie while mourneth theſe accident hath learned honeſt true relation chaunced amida while led pleaſures guelded eunuch himſelfe preſent perſon whole puiſſance armie able next spring helpe meſopotamia ſhall need defence theſe word many put related malicious gloſſe expoſition ſet thereto constantius exceeding wroth without farther ſifting matter ſuffering thoſe particular layed open whereof ignorant commaunded thus traduced falſe imputation give place commaund armie betake himſelfe privat life promoting agilo rowme unreaſonable leape conſidering better captaine tribune gentile scutarij chap ii memorable eclipſe sunne east part diſcourſe according naturaliſts touching motion sunne moone eclipſes ſame time eaſt part aire men ſight caſt darke miſt dawning day untill noone tide ſtarres ſeene continually ſhine increaſe fearefull accident fell ſo heavenly daylight operiretur hidden reaſon totall darkneſſe face earth like unto night men afraid ſuppoſed verily sunne extraordinarily like moone conjunction sunne call chaunge hath univerſall defect eclipſed ſeeing firſt diminiſhed ſhape moone horned new increaſed forme halfe moone afterward reſtored full whole againe thing happeneth time ſo evidently unleſſe moone unequall oblique courſes certaine ſpaces betweene change returneth ſame point beginning houſe ſame ſigne whole body moone found moſt direct line quite oppoſite sunne ſtayeth theſe minute art geometrie tearmed part albeit converſions motion planet ſearchers aſtronomers intelligible cauſes obſerved courſe moone fulfilled perpetuall diſtinction meet one ſame end yet sunne thoſe day alwayes hidden covered moone juſt plumbeline oppoſite middeſt interpoſed betweene fierie globe sunne ſight briefe sunne hidden ſhining light ſuppreſſed himſelfe roundle moone loweſt ſtarres accompanying together keeping owne proper sphęres placed joyntly ſaving regard height ptolomaee skilfully elegantly ſheweth come thoſe dimenſions uſually tearme greeke tongue 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſay eclipticke defective conjunction aſcending deſcending touch place joyning cloſe unto ſaid caput cauda draconis joynts eclipſe ſmaller abide point joynts bind ſtreight together ſaid aſcents deſcents skie overcaſt groſſer darkeneſſe aire thickened ſo able ſee ſo much thing ſtand juſt eye moreover wee thinke wee behold two sunnes wiſe caſe cloud mounted higher ordinarie ſhining againe reaſon neereneſſe thoſe eternall sunne light repreſent brightneſſe another circle reflection pure glaſſe come moone thus onely otherwiſe ſuffereth moone plaine evident eclipſe beeing full light round oppoſit unto sunne ſhe orbe diſtant one hundred eightie part ſay ſeventh ſigne albeit diſtance oppoſition happeneth alway every full moone yet ſhee alwayes eclipſed becauſe ſhe placed mobilitie earth utmoſt univerſall beautie moſt remote heaven putteth ſelfe sunne otherwhiles ſtriketh upon interpoſition limit night endeth pointed cone ſhe lieth hidden enwrapped covered within blacke globe ſhadow caſe sunne compaſſed bent inward sphęre reaſon maſſe earth lying way able enlighten beames ſhe hath proper light owne according diver opinion collected againe equall part ſhe meeteth sunne one ſame ſigne darkened ſhe hath beene ſaid totally white bright hue wholly obſcured time ſhe called greeke 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 conjunction change ſhe thought ariſe new againe ſmall declining plumbeline ſhe carrieth sunne erected juſt ariſing yet ſmall firſt ſeene men leaving companie sunne ſhe proceedeth ſecond ſigne ſhe gone therefore ſtill good lightſome ſhaped one would ſay horne ſhe commeth tearmed 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 carrying forme moone time ſhee beginneth removed great way diſtance sunne ſo ſhe proceeded farre fifth ſigne beames turned upon ſhee conceiveth greater light named greeke tongue 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 forme repreſenteth halfe circle ſemicircle paſſing ſtill caught moſt remote ſigne ſhe ſheweth figure 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 bearing bunching ſides ſhe ſited juſt againſt directly line oppoſite ſhe ſhine full keeping houſe ſeventh ſigne yea while ſhee converſeth abideth yet ſame beeing little gone diminiſheth habite ſtate tearme 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 full whole moone ſame formes ſhe taketh againe wane ſhe waxeth old learning many writer agree one mind taught moone never ſeene univerſally eclipſed darkened altogether time change moreover whereas ſaid sunne hath courſe one skie another world yee know body planet ſtarres regard univerſall frame world neyther ſet norriſe ſeeme ſo ſight beneath upon earth elevated held aloft motion ſome inward ſpirit compariſon great fabricke world ſet bigger ſmall pricke one wee behold u ſtarres fixed skie whoſe order perpetuall ſometimes againe becauſe man ſight doth faile ſuppoſe departed gone place let u returne purpoſed hyſtorie chap iii vertues iulianus gaule conſtantius heart minded take auxiliarie force ſouldiors favouring iulian ſtand partly open mouth partly caſting abroad libell while constantius made haſt ſuccour eaſt like ſhortly infeſted perſians outrodes according fugitive intelligencers one accord declared vexed envie vertues iulianus generall bruit blazed abroad talked dayly among ſundrie nation loftie praiſes whoſe great travailes exploit fame carried divulged world namely certaine kingdomes alemain conquered hee recovered townes gaule ſacked aforetime raſed barbarous enemy hee made tributary ſubject pay impoſts moved regard theſe ſuch like matter fearing leaſt ſame would grow greater conſidering report went florentius praetorium praefect pricked hee ſent decentius tribune chauncellor notarie fetch away forthwith heruli batavi celt alſo together petulantes three hundred beſides choſen foorth band colour commaunded make ſpeed might bee readineſſe warre beginning spring upon parthian touching aidſouldiors verily three hundred bee levied gathered lupicinus certaine knowne paſſed yet britannie dealt withall apart himſelfe scutarij gentile sintula tribune ſame time caeſars table commaundement draw foorth thoſe greateſt activitie bring along himſelfe iulian held tongue condiſcended hereunto ſubmitting pleaſure mightier perſon howbeit one thing could neither diſſimule paſſe ſilence urge inſtantly thoſe might ſuffer trouble leaving habitation beyond rhene come capitulation condition ſhould time led unto part beyond alpes avouching bee feared leaſt voluntarie ſouldiors barbarian oftentimes upon ſuch tearmes condition wont come ſide u taking knowledge hereof might hereafter kept backe performing like ſervice ſpeech came nothing ſayd sintulae tribune making account caeſars complaint obeyed emperours commaundement hee made choiſe companie lightly appointed ſuch lively vigour deliverneſſe bodie ſurpaſſed others hee went foorth hoping confidently greater matter becauſe caeſar penſive ſhould bee done reſt commaunded ſent caſting mind diver ſundrie thought deemed buſineſſe ought managed good heed circumſpection ſeeing alſo cruell barbarian one ſide powerfull commaund enforce eſpecially abſence generall horſemen made moſt doubt hee willed praefect returne unto beforetime departed vienna colour provide victual might exempt himſelfe militarie trouble praefect well conſidered according relation thought time paſt ſent thoſe warlike band dreadfull alreadie barbarian bee withdrawne defence gaule received caeſars letter adviſing requeſting come ſpeed aſſiſt commonwealth counſell moſt obſtinately drew backe refuſed mind feare troubled regard letter plainely imported thus much praefect ought parted chiefe imperatore generall commander heat broile fearefull ſtirres thus much moreover written caſe hee held performe ſervice accordingly himſelfe owne accord would caſt enſignes princely authoritie taking honourable glorious die commaundement deſtruction province ſhould imputed unto ſtiffe conſtant reſolution praefect prevailed might ſtriving againe refuſing yeeld obedience thoſe thing reaſon required howbeit time theſe delayes lupicinus abſent ſouldiors mutiny iulian deſtitute helpefull counſell prowd praefect waving doubtfull tearmes doe ſuppoſing beſt courſe determined haſten forward journey ordinarie way beeing departed ſtations wherein wintered knowne one among company petulantes cloſely let fall upon ground libell many content carried tenor alſo thus verily driven confined guiltie condemned perſons unto furtheſt part earth thoſe leife deere unto u ſhall bee ſlaves enthralled againe unto alemans thoſe ſay mortall foughten field freed firſt captivitie ſcript brought unto counſell court read iulian conſidering reaſonable complaint commaunded whole family goe eaſt graunting warrant take poſthorſes waggon doubt made long time way ſhould journey thought good motion decentius secretarie chancellor aforeſaid notarie folke ſhould paſſe along paris caeſar yet abode removed yet whether ſo indeed chap iiii iulian endevoureth ſatisfie deſire conſtantius captaines ſouldiors breaking mutinie take armes lowd voice ſalute iulianus ſtyle auguſtus yea force aſſent thereto accept diademe ſet upon head ſame approched comming iulian prince met place village neere city ſide manner commending thoſe knew putting every one mind doe valiantly mild word animated goe cheerefully unto emperour whoſe power ample large alſo ſhould get moſt condigne reward travailes paine honourably entreat thus depart ſo great way hee invited chiefe principall feaſt willed confidently preferre lawfull petition could readily thinke wherein might pleaſure thus liberally entertained tooke leave malecontent ſorrowfull regard twofold griefe certaine unkind fortune thus ſevered ſo temperate governour alſo native ſoyle thus poſſeſſed anxietie retyred unto uſuall campe ſooner began bee night brake open brawle ſet blouds according every man found himſelfe aggreeved unexpected occurrent take weapon hand ſo mightie noyſe palace went compaſſed round ſo man could eſcape get away hideous terrible clamour cried unto iulianus name augustus urging ſpeed come forth unto beeing compelled ſtay untill daylight forced length goe forth ſaw iterating ſame great noyſe ſhout moſt firme ſettled conſent ſtyled auguſtus part upon reſolute grounded mind withſtood ſome one ſhewing himſelfe wroth highly diſpleaſed otherwhiles ſtretching forth hand requeſting beſeeching ſo many moſt happie fortunate victory undecent unſeemely part ſhould committed unſeaſonable raſhneſſe breaking rayſe matter cauſe diſcord end mild ſpeeches appeaſed tumult thus much moreover added ſayd let angrie mood pray ceaſe without diſſention ſeditious ſeeking alteration yee demaund ſhall eaſily obtained much yee poſſeſsed thus ſweetneſſe native countrey feare go ſtrange land yee acquainted returne yee even hand unto owne home ſee ſhall nothing beyond alpes becauſe diſpleaſant unto hereof aſſoyle competent ſatisfaction emperour prince capable reaſon moſt prudent withall theſe word ſet lowd crie ſides god ſave auguſtus natheleſſe one uniforme zeale heat affection preaſſed ſtill exceeding earneſt noyſe mixed reprochfull reviling tearmes caeſar enforced condiſcend unto ſo ſet upon footman ſhield borne aloft ſight great ſilence people declared auguſtus hee willed bring forth white band diademe ſaid never called one wife ſhe uſed necke head becauſe affirmed meet ſhould fitted firſt entrance empire woman ornament attire ſought horſe trapping end handſomely adorned therewith might make ſome ſhew yet obſcure though higher authoritie ſtill avouched alſo baſe unſeemely one named maurus afterwards come captaine diſcoverers eſpiall received foile fight ſtraits succi time ſerving qualitie pikeman tooke collar owne necke wore b enſigne bearer boldly upon iulians head thus driven extremitie perceiving hee could avoid preſent danger perſevered ſtill make reſiſtance promiſed unto throughout five c aurei apeece every one pound ſilver beſides theſe matter thus paſſed leſſe troubled care foreſeeing quicke conceit might afterwards come hereof neither wore • ademe durſt go abroad ne yet negotiate ſerious buſineſſes never ſo urgent while iulianus affrighted ſundrie accident betooke thus privat retyredneſſe certaine decurie meaneth iulians court palace degree place dignitie ſtepping great pace petulantes celtae quartered crieth turbulent manner oh ſhamefull indignitie day iudgement declared auguſtus emperor ſhould ſecretly murthered ſooner knowledge taken hereof ſouldiors moved alike well knew knew ſome brandiſhing ſhaking caſtingweapons others ready fight naked ſwords hand running forth diver way manner ſuddaine uprore haſt gat unto prince traine exceſſive noyſe warder tribune aſtonied name excubitor captaine guard ordinarie fearing alſo ſome trecherie mutable unconſtant ſouldiors diſperſed themſelves feare ſuddaine death ſlipt ſight howbeit ſouldiors ſaw well huſht ſtood armed quiet demanded cauſe unadviſed ſuddain hurlyburly long ſilence making ſome doubt new emperours life departed ſent conſiſtorie ſeene full gloriouſly dight imperiall robe notwithſtanding theſe newes heard abroad alſo ſaid gone unfore leading sintula ſecure paſt feare returned togegether unto paris upon edict proclamation made morning next following ſhould meet open plaine field iulian prince beeing come forth greater port pompe uſually mounted tribunall environed enſignes well maine eagle ſtandards banner guidons alſo guarded whole ſquadrons armed cohort hee pauſed time while aloft hee beheld countenance preſent perceived chearefull joyous plaine ſimple word end might bee underſtood ſo many trumpet incenſed wiſe chap v oration iulianus touching appointment militarie reward alſo word night day wherein declared emperour publicke genius state ſaluted difficultie preſent buſineſse doth require inſtantly crave right valiant trustie protector perſon commonwealth together many time put life danger state province much yee ſetled iudgement advaunced caeſar higheſt pitch honour dignity word ſummarily deliver may deviſed iuſt wiſe remedy cure ſalve chaunge world u youth ſcarce come growth ye well know clad purple made caeſar onely ſhew yet providence heavenly power commended protection tuition never put ſettled purpoſe leading upright honeſt life painefull labour ſeene together time put rout confidence bold nation city deſtroyed infinite thouſands men ſlaine thoſe remaine left behind halfe broken unſound infinite calamity ſtill overran needleſſe thinke rehearſe often hard winter bitter cold weather time land ſeas exexempt warfare repelled alemans nation untamed time ſmall detriment loſſe force verily one thing meet ſhould either overpaſſe conceale namely neere unto argentoratum bleſſed day ſhone ſome ſort brought perpetuall libertie unto gaules while rode fro pike among arrowes dart flew thickeſt ye throughly grounded vigorous courage long experience vanquiſhed enemy ſuddainely brake overflowed manner ſwelling ſwift land flouds either layd bare ground dint ſword elſe drowned deepe channell river men left dead behind u whoſe funeral honourably kept rather ſolemne prayſes mournefull ſorrow exploit ſo great ſo renowmed poſteritie ſuppoſe keepe ſilence touching good deſerts commonwealth nation yee fully adorned ſo high title maieſtie ye vouchſafe defend vertue gravitie caſe adverſe fortune ſhould aſſaile end might ſound courſe holden affaire reward valorous men may attend upon without corruption ſecret ambition indirect ſeeking promotion catch beforehand reverend preſence counſell aſsembly determine ſet downe neither civile iudge martiall commaunder ſhall preferred higher degree helpe aught elſe owne worth good deſert neither ſhall otherwiſe preſume ſuiter goe wayes without diſgrace ſhame inferior ſouldiors beneath encouraged confidence greater hope beene long time kept faſting dignity reward ſmiting buckler javelines roſe mightie noiſe one voice manner accord gave favorable aſſent ſpeeches good beginning immediately feare might never ſo little time given trouble ſo conſiderat well adviſed diſpoſe behalfe pro atthuarijs nation frankes • tel read pro actuarijs • clerkes scribe others per atthuarios actuarios meanes mediation atthuarij petulantes celtae beſought might ſent governe province pleaſed could obtaine departed neither offended ill appaied howbeit night went next day wherein hee declared augustus himſelfe emperour reported thoſe next inward ſleepe appeared one unto ſhape forme publicke genius angell uſeth bee portrayed ſaid way chiding theſe word unto iulian long ſince ſecret manner duly obſerved kept entrie thy houſe deſirous encreaſe thy dignitie diver time gone wayes reiected bee time received admitted namely iudgements ſo many agree one goe forlorne ſorrowfull howbeit take thee ſet deepely thy heart longer dwell thee chap vi king perſians while conſtantius abode farre invadeth meſopotamia forceth citie singara hewed piece two romane legion carried reſt well citizen ſouldiors away unto furtheſt part perſis while theſe thing earneſtly gaule cruell king perſians burning hote deſire kindled firſt antonine redoubled comming craugaſius bee lord meſopotamia while constantius abode farre armie augmented armed force paſſed uſuall manner tygris ſetteth hand aſſault singra athanaſio singara citie well fortified ſouldiors thing elſe neceſſarie requiſit deemed government thoſe country defender place eſpied enemie great way quickly ſhut gate ſtout courageous heart ran fro along turret battlement gathering together great ſtones warlike engine diſcharge upon thus made readie beforehand ſtood armour preſt repell multitude enemy attempted climbe wals king therefore come mediation noble captaines admitted approch neere hee might gentle mild parle perſuade defendant yeeld unto pleaſure gave whole dayes reſpite next morning betimes breake day ſetting ſignall firered banner aſſayled citie every ſide while ſome brought skaling ladder others planted engine moſt part defended fence timber hurdle alſo penthouſes head ſought wayes undermine foundation wall againſt theſe deviſes towneſmen ſtanding upon high bulwarkes munition ſtones ſorts caſtingdarts afarre repelled thoſe venturouſly proudly preſumed put themſelves forward within reach ſhot thus continued fighting certaine day together doubtfull event many man ſides loſt life many wounded laſt skirmiſh hot evening came one exceeding ſtrong ram among engine brought forward puſhes thick threefold butted upon round tower former ſiege ſaid citie breach layed open vnto tower multitude came reſcue fought moſt cloſely might man ſeene firebrand burning torch fierie dart flying every way burn miſchievous engine approched neere neither gave thicke ſhot arrowes bullet either ſide ſharpe pointed head ſaid ram went beyond device againſt entering piercing joynts ſtones new layed yet reaſon moiſture weake feeble fight continued ſtill fire ſword tower aforeſaid fell downe wherby way made citie place disfurniſhed defendant whome great danger ſo imminent ſcattered wherupon whole troupe band perſians ſetting yelling outcrie filled part towne while none reſtraine ſome ſlaine thoſe pell mell one another reſt commaundement king sapor taken alive carried away furtheſt country perſia two legion garriſon defence citie wit e prima flavia f prima parthica beſides many homelings naturall inhabitant together auxillarie horſemen whoſe hap reaſon ſuddaine danger ſhut within ſaid led hand bound while none men helped greater part armie lay field encamped defence niſibis citie farre diſtant otherwiſe never could man ſo much old time ſuccour singara diſtreſſe reaſon place round want water dried albeit antiquitie built fort fit convenient place diſcoverie adverſe ſuddaine trouble yet turned alwayes detriment romanes ſundry time ſurprized taken loſſe defendant thereof chap vii sapor king perſia ſetteth upon bezabde otherwiſe called phoenicha great violence aſſaulteth racing therefore towne king wiſedome policie avoiding niſibis one ywis well remembring hurt many time ſuſtained tooke right hand way marching crooked winding journeyes minding either force winning unto garriſon defendant ſweet promiſes recover bezabde auncient founder tearmed alſo phoenicha ſtrong fort ſituate upon pretie high hill bending toward bankes tygris place either ſuſpected low fenced double wall defence piece three legion deputed secunda g flavia secunda h armeniaca likewiſe parthica secunda together many zabdicene archer whoſe ground ſame time ſubjection ſtood towne firſt brunt therefore king perſon accompanied troupe horſemen glittering complete harneis himſelfe mounted higher reſt riding circuit bulwarkes fortification approched venturouſly brim edge trench albeit aſſayled ſhot baliſts miſſed marke arrowes flying thicke yet reaſon hee good armour proofe ſame wrought manner roufe tortoiſeſhell went away without taking harme howbeit ſequeſtring ſetting apart anger time ſent manner heraulds whome hee gently exhorted beſieged would looke unto life hope yeelding time raiſe ſiege ſetting open gate goe forth humble manner preſent themſelves unto conqueror nation theſe heraulds adventured approch neere regard defendant wals forbare becauſe brought cloſe ſides certaine gentleman freeborne acquaintance taken priſoners singara pitifull reſpect man flung dart made anſwer touching peace ceſſation armes graunted one whole day night daylight next morrow perſians ſetting fiercely upon rampier gave cruell threat terrible noyſe comming boldly wall preaſſed hard upon towneſmen great force reſiſted whereby moſt parthian ſore hurt ſome carrying ladder others holding hurdle oyſiers went blindly forward within ſhot neither eſcaped men without hurt arrowes flying thicke like hayle went ſtood cloſe together sunne ſet departed part equall loſle toward next morning fought much eagrely while trumpet ſounded one ſide neither leſſe flaughter ſeene either hand fighting moſt obſtinately ſides chap viii sapor reiecting admonition christian biſhop force winneth beſieged citie fareth cruelly againſt towneſmen given attempt upon virta moſt ſtrong fenced citie relinquiſhed vaine enterpriſe length departeth bvt day following truce common aſſent manyfold travaile paine taken graunted time great terror preſented round wall perſians feared leſſe chriſtian biſhop ſhewed certaine ſignes geſture beckening willing goe foorth upon faithfull promiſe returne ſafe conduct came farre king pavilion leave given ſpeake mind mild manner ſpeech perſuaded perſians depart home part received common lamentable loſſes ſaying withall greater ſorrowes yet bee feared happily would come unto hee ſtood diſcourſing theſe ſuch like point vaine ſuch fell outrageous furie king withſtood motion ſtoutly ſwore would depart towne fortification deſtroyed yet biſhop ſomewhat ſuſpected untruly thinke though commonly many men vouched ſecret conference talke hee informed sapor part wall ſhould aſſault weake withinforth eaſie battered ſeemed carrie ſome likelyhood afterwards enemy engine evidently ſeene great ſhout joyous leaping aſſaylants play luſtily upon undefenſible place ſuch age rottenneſſe began leane readie fall ſome knew inward ſecrets citie given direction albeit narrow wayes yeelded difficult acceſſe unto wall ram fitted batterie hardly ſet forward feare ſtones throwne hand arrowſhot kept yet ceaſed eyther brake ſcorpions wherof theſe diſcharged ſtones thicke ſent dart faſt together basket pannier burning beſmeared pitch k bitumen continuall fall whereof comming ſtill downe hill ſayd engine artillerie ſtucke faſt fixed rooted deepe within ground beeing thus ſet fierie dart burning linkes together throwne luſtily good arme ſtar hand ſet light fire although caſe ſtood thus many ſides ſlaine yet aſſaylants hotely ſet raſe deſtroy towne naturall ſituation ſtrong alſo great workemanſhip man hand fortified ere middeſt winter perſuaded king rage would allayed therefore neither effuſion much bloud number ſhot bodie deadly wounded could reclayme reſt like boldneſſe long time maintained fight much hurt miſchiefe gotten thereby length expoſed themſelves extreame preſent danger drave rammes weightie ſtones comming thicke wals ſundrie fireworkes debarred going forward howbeit one ram higher fellowes covered wet bull hide therefore leſſe danger miſhap flame dart going much ſtraining endevour crept wall ſo mightie ſharpe pointed head entring betweene joint ſtones loſened ſame overthrew tower beeing fallen wonderfull craſhing noyſe alſo ſtood upon ſo ſuddain ruine thereof throwne downe ſo eyther breaking bone overwhelmed rubbiſh died ſundry death thoſe unlooked thus armed multitude found ſafe aſcent ruſhed hideous noyſe perſians made yelling cry every ſide thundered reſounded fearefull eares towneſmen thus overmatched fight grew hote cloſe within wals while enemy ſquadrons fought hand conſidering ſtanding body one againſt another thicke ſwords drawne ſides one ſpared ſtood way concluſion beſieged reſiſting long time much adoe miſchiefe ſides length preſſing hard huge multitude diſranked ſcattered heapes angry enemy put ſword whomſoever could find ſmall babe plucked mother boſomes mother alſo themſelves killed man regarded yet meane time bloudie nation greedie pillage carnage loaden kind rich ſpoyles leading away exceeding great number priſoners went backe much rejoycing tent king puffed extraordinarie joy one long time burned deſire win phaenicha ſtrong fenced piece great importance departed thence hee right ſtrongly repayred part wall ſhattered layed ſtore plentie victual beſtowed garriſon armed men ſuch birth good note skill martiall feat renowmed feared fell indeed leaſt romanes taking heart loſſe ſuch mightie ſtrong hold would addreſſe themſelves maine force beſiege ſame vaunting therefore bearing himſelfe big fed hope win whatſoever could go hand ſurprized taken meaner pile determined ſet upon iu • ta virta ſort great antiquitie inſomuch thought beene built alexander king macedonia ſeated verily utmoſt part meſopotamia encircled wals winding pointed horne reaſon ſundry device meanes made unacceſſable aſſayed skill art one alluring defendant goodly promiſes otherwhiles threatening hang crucifie ſundry time going hand raiſe bankes mount bringing engine againſt pertaining ſiege wound loſſes received given gave vaine enterpriſe end departed theſe act atchieved yeare betweene tygris euphrates constantius learned relation many meſſengers fearing parthian expedition while wintered conſtantinople greater care furniſhed frontier warlicke proviſion ſetting alſo armour together new trained ſouldiors ſtrengthening likewiſe legion ſupplies ſtrong young men ſet battailes legionarie ſouldiors oftentimes ſped well warres ſervices eaſt part beſides ſought scythian aid either money love mid spring ſetting forth journey thracia might forthwith ſeize hand place ſuſpected chap ix iulianus good regard himſelfe long epistle endevoureth pacifie mind conſtantius meane iulian placed wintering harbour paris much fearing would end theſe begun enterpriſes ſore perplexed caſting toſſing many matter mind conſidered constantius would wiſe like doings whoſe conceit eye reputed vile baſe contemptible perſon adviſing well therefore fearefull beginning innovation change ſtate empire reſolved ſend unto embaſſadours ſhould declare occurrent happened withall diſpatched letter agreeable unto wherin plainely advertiſed ſhewed done ought afterwards done although ſuppoſed hee heard good report decentius long ſince returned alſo gentleman chamber newly come againe backe gaule carried unto caeſar certaine ſolemne preſents albeit unwilling hereunto yet wrote nothing arrogant tearmes leaſt might thought ſuddainely revolted tenour letter went wiſe faithfull allegeance according purpoſe leſſe accustomed behaviour covenant agreement verily part carrying alwayes one ſame mind time hitherto kept performed many effectuall proofes hath evidently appeared ever ſince created caeſar expoſed terrible noiſe battailes contenting ſelfe place commaund wherein ſet like truſtie ſervitour officer filled eares evermore newes proſperous atchievements performed wiſh heart deſire attributing nothing mine owne peril adventure whereas dayly example continuall proofes well knowne germanes ſpred abroad intermingled every painefull travailes others ſeene firſt repoſe refection laſt may good leave ſay ſo much caſe chaunge alteration thinke hence commeth ſouldiors ſpending yeares many warres thoſe right dangerous without reaping fruit ſervice effected tumultuous manner length long ſince determined impatient ſerve commaunder ſecond place ſeeing caeſar could recompence made long labour many victory whoſe anger neither found augmentation dignity touched yearely wage alſo fallen unlooked aggravate matter beeing men acquainted cold frozen country commaunded come utmoſt part east world drawne away needie bare apart wife child whereupon enraged wonted manner night aſsembled themſelves together beſet palace loud voice thoſe often reiterated ſtyling iulian name auguſtus ſet trembling confeſſe withdrew ſelfe thus ſo long could keepe way ſought ſave ſelfe holding peace hiding head would give time reſpite conſider upon matter fenced may ſo ſay wall free pure heart went forth ſtood ſight ſuppoſing tumultuous riſing might eyther authoritie countenance gentle word allayed howbeit grew wonderfull heat went ſo farre becauſe aſsayed overcome ſtubborne obſtinacie entreatie inſtantly menaced death ſeemed violent aſſaults following one necke another end overcome reaſoning thus mine owne ſelfe ſtabbed ſome perhaps willingly ynough would declared prince gave aſſent yet hoping ſtill aſſuage franticke armed violence order manner proceeding beſeech entertaine peaceable gentle conſtruction neither thinke thing hath beene done otherwiſe admit malicious perſons evill willers readie whiſper eares pernicious matter ſuch meane wont owne gaine advantage make debate variance betweene prince putting aſide flatterie nourice vice ſet mind upon iuſtice moſt excellent vertue others receive unfainedly bona fide theſe equall condition propoſe vnto reaſoning reckoning thus mind theſe thing behoofefull romane state u neereneſſe bloud height ſupreme fortune conioined pardon pray deſire ſo much ſuch thing ſhould done reaſon required profitable honest courſes ſhould approved whoſe commaundements even henceforth ſtill purpoſe right willingly embrace ſuch meane need requireth performed ſhort allow unto regard ſoveraigne preheminence spaniſh horſes chariot choſen piked young men entermingled among gentile scutarij ſome race barbarous nation diſcended ſide rhene leaſtwiſe thoſe yeeld themſelves revolt ſide promiſe doe onely thankfull mind alſo willing heart ſo long live • l l chiefe iuſtices praefects praetorium ſhall clemencie give unto u thoſe equitie deſerts knowne worthie place reſidue well ordinarie civile iudges meſſengers warre affaire likewiſe pentioners guard perſon promoted meet left unto pleaſure folly may prevented hand admit thoſe guard emperours perſon whoſe behaviour whoſe mind affection knowne one thing verily may bold without doubt avouch gaules beene long trouble grievous misfortune vexed neither owne accord compulſion ſend young ſouldiors ſtrange remote country leaſt youth utterly ſpent afflicted anew calling remembrance paſt deſperate feare danger hanging head readie periſh neither convenient hence aid ſouldiors ſhould ſent oppoſe parthian nation conſidering yet violent rodes invaſions barbarous enemy ſtopped abide truth ſpoken theſe province afflicted continuall trouble calamity need themſelves forraine helpes thoſe right ſtrong valorous theſe thing way exhortation good deeme state written requiring requeſting ſame put execution well wote may ſpeake nothing prowdly according imperiall place well wote ſay adverſe wofull caſes commonwealth manner remedileſſe given loſt ever concord prince yeelding turnes one unto another hath reduced better tearmes conſidering evident example auncestors ruler thinke theſe ſuch like courſes find ſome ſort way lead fortunat bleſſed life ſo commend moſt pleaſant remembrance themſelves unto posteritie future time ever chap x conſtantius taking heart name auguſtus conferred upon iulianus plotteth many thing take effect iulian walking warily ſubdued frankes called atthuarij returneth vienna winter theſe miſſives jointly ſent others ſecret credence preſented cloſely unto conſtantius thoſe penned objurgatorie biting ſtyle tenour whereof neyther might ſearch might became mee publiſh abroad performance office embaſſage choſen grave perſons wit pentadius maſter office eutherius high chamberlain delivered letter report without concealing aught ſaw confidently deale order future affaire among thing envie theſe new begun enterpriſes iulian aggravated made much departure florentius praefect praeſaging trouble would ariſe aboveſaid ſending ſouldiors commonly ſpoken purpoſe departed vienna pretending excuſe regard ſuch want victual caeſar parted truth dreaded hee oftentimes hardly entreated afterwards underſtood hee mounted imperiall throne little hope none life became fearefull farre removed delivered himſelfe danger doubted leaving neereſt friend kinsfolke behind went aſide ſoft journeyes came unto conſtantius ſhew himſelfe lyable fault many imputation charged upon iulian traytor state whoſe departure iulian conſidering well wiſely matter willing alſo ſhould knowne ſpared preſent gave commaundement wife child thoſe held deareſt together good touched diminiſhed ſhould returne ſafetie eaſt part allowing take benefit publicke poſthorſes waggon ſaid embaſſadours leſſe diligence following carrying thoſe letter inſtructions ſaid ſtill minding wayfare came iudges ruler higher place indirectly ſtayed detained endured long chargeable abode italie illyricum length croſſed frith ſtre • ghts conſtantinople boſphorus travailing forward eaſie journies found conſtantius making abode tiſaria caeſarea cappadocia place time named mazaca citie good importance well frequented ſituate foot mountaine argeus beeing admitted preſence permiſſion graunted unto delivered miſſives ſooner read emperour grew choler indignation beyond uſuall manner looking ſo awrie upon feared death commaunded goe forth could abide afterwards eyther move queſtion unto heare ſpeake howbeit great heat hee ſtrucken yet hee ſtood doubtfull mammering whether ſhould command thoſe force wherein hee truſted march againſt perſians againſt iulian ſticking thus long time weighed ſundrie counſels hee gave eare advice ſome perſuaded good ſo proclaimed journey eaſtward yet angrie mood ſoone diſmiſſed embaſſadours aforeſaid alſo appointed leonas treaſurer quaeſtor ride ſpeed gaule letter alſo written unto iulian affirming nothing liked new change alteration charging hee regarded ſafetie owne perſon neereſt friend lay downe ſwelling pride vanitie containe himſelfe within power government caeſar feare menaced might ſooner induce thereto preſumed bare himſelfe highly great force promoted nebridius treaſurer quaeſtor ſaid caeſar rowme florentius praefectus praetorio foelix chancellour secretarie notarie made maſter office preferred ſome officer advanced gumoharius ſucceſſor lupicinus l maſter armour ſuch matter knowne leonas therefore entred paris received honourable prudent perſonage morrow iulian prince gone field multitude well armed ſouldiors common citizen purpoſe called together commaunded preſent letter unto ſtanding aloft tribunall might ſeene ſcrow edict ſent unfolded begun bee read beginning reader came place containing thus much conſtantius diſallowing beene done iudged power authoritie caeſar ſufficient iulian ſides ſet ſound terrible voice cry note god ſave iulian auguſtus according provincial ſouldiors authoritie commonwealth hath decreed indeed refreſhed yet feareth new excurſions invaſions ſtill barbarous enemy word heard leonas letter iulian importing ſame returned ſafe nebridius alone admitted praefectſhip ſo much caeſar alſo openly ſayd letter ſhould ſtand good pleaſure maſter office little ordained anatolius man time place give anſwere unto requeſts like made officer according thought meet owne behoofe ſafetie much among theſe proceeding hee feared lupicinus though abſent making abode britannie prowd minded man ſwelling nature hee ſuſpition jealouſie knew thus much beyond ſeas would ſtirre ſome matter alteration rebellion chauncellor notarie ſent bologne bononia obſerve watch carefully man might ſuffered paſſe narrow ſeas meanes prohibition lupicinus returned tooke knowledge theſe newes ſo able raiſe trouble howbeit iulian right joyous man regard higher fortune confidence ſouldiors becauſe would wax luke warme reproved one remiſſe idle nothing hee diſpatched embaſſadours unto constantius went foorth march low dutchland netherlands germania ſecunda ſtrengthened himſelfe furniture proviſion buſineſſe hand required drew neere towne obtricenſis neere moſa afterward croſſed rhene ſuddainely overran countrey frank call atthuarij men unquiet ſpirit ſame time licentious manner raunging coaſts gaule whome hee ſuddainely ſurpriſed fearing hoſtilitie exceeding ſecure could remember prince entered townes territory reaſon difficultie ſtonie wayes kept overcame little ado taken priſoners ſlaine moſt reſt remained upon earneſt ſuit graunted peace condition would himſelfe ſuppoſing bee expedient neighbour borderer poſſeſſors holder land whence returned like celeritie ſaid river diligently ſurveying garriſons along march reforming amiſſe hee came farre people baſil rauraci recovered thoſe place barbarous enemy time paſt taken holden owne fortified ſame carefully departed way beſanſon beſantio vienna winter chap xi conſtantius concluded firme peace king armenia aſsembled armie beſiegeth bezabde wals whereof laboureth vaine undermine overthrow ſort went affaire gaule ſo proſperous ſafe ſucceſſe conſtantius ſent arſaces king armenia entertained moſt liberally forewarned exhorted perſevere faithfull friend u hee underſtood king perſians oftentimes deceitfully threat craftie device beene hand caſt ſocietie roman combine taking many oath could forgoe life would change mind highly rewarded ſo traine brought accompanie returned realme never durſt afterward breake promiſe obliged unto conſtantius bond many favour pleaſures done unto among chiefe joyned unto marriage olympia daughter ablabius ſometime praefectus praetorio eſpouſed wife brother constans diſmiſſed himſelfe way boſoch caſtaldo melitina towne armenia leſſe lacotena samoſata paſſed euphrates came edeſſa ſtayed long time expecting company ſouldiors aſſembled together part waiting plentifull proviſion victual autumnall aequinox went forth came amida wall whereof hee approched beheld round full aſhes dead ember ſhed teares groned againe conſider calamity wofull miſerable citie endured vrſulus treaſurer state chanced place griefe heart cried ſaid behold courage valiant heart city defended ſouldiors payment whoſe wage wealth empire beginneth fayle ſo bitter ſpeech militarie multitude remembred afterwards chalcidona soph calcitin turcis chalcedon roſe mutinie deſtruction thence marching thickeſet ſquadrons approched bezabde pitched downe tent see 22 booke came death fenced high rampier deepe ditch riding great way circuit fortification towne informed report many place ſtrongly rebuilt time injurie time decayed becauſe would omit nothing neceſſitie provided heat fight ſent certaine ſage wiſe men unto vvit mercinarie garriſon ſouldiors defendant towne urge propoſing twofold condition either returne home owne country graunt men good without bloudſhed elſe become wholly ſubject unto romane empire ſhould bee advaunced dignity rich reward upon naturall obſtinacie inbred reſolution rejected offer men nobly deſcended high parentage addreſſed themſelves undergoing extreame peril paine againſt preparation belong unto ſiege therefore began give aſſault unto part towne men marſhalled thicke rankes ſound trumpet incite courage ſervice valiant romane ſouldior legion gathered ſundrie defenſive roufes ſhields going ſoftly ſafely forward began undermine wals becauſe manner caſtingweapons diſcharged upon came ſaid wals thereby ſaid joynt frame ſhields looſened departed upon ſound retreat heart one whole day refreſhed third morning curiouſly covered defended lowd outcry every ſides aſſaied skale get wals albeit defendant lay cloſe within behind haire clothes becauſe would ſeene enemie yet ſo often need required would ſtoutly thruſt forth armes ſtones dart aſſaile beneath hurdle fence oyſiers went confidently forward hand touch wall fell great pipe barrel milſtones piece broken pillar exceeding weight whereof fighting men overwhelmed thus device cover violently driven aſunder laid gaping open made ſhift get away utmoſt danger life chap xii new engins batterie conſtantius ſhaketh wall amida many aſſaults redoubled ſundry ſorts wearieth well owne people perſians beſieged tenth day therefore aſſault began men hope grew worſe ſo ſet heavineſſe thought good bring huge frame ram perſians time paſt batterie thereof raſed antiochia brought thence left carras ſodain ſeene moſt artificially ſet together fitted accordingly daunted heart beſieged ſo fallen manner laſt remedie yeelding tooke heart againe prepared oppoſe ſome meanes againſt terrible menacing engin neither gave men one jot adventure raſhly adviſe politikely while old ram beeing unjoynted taken peeces eaſier carriage ſetting order readineſſe cunning ſtrength man notwithſtanding exceeding force firme reſolution defendant peeces ordnance ſtill defended nevertheleſſe number ſtones bullet ſent ſlings ſides many killed ſtill mount bulwarkes waxed greater quickly roſe mightie height ſo ſiege grew fierce hoter every day many men loſt life place fighting ſight emperour hope reward taking helmet head becauſe might ſooner knowne cunning ſhot enemy archer overthrowne therefore tending watch ward night day ſtood wary part devoir time perſians ſeeing bank terrace brought mightie height withall huge ram aforeſaid followed alſo ſmaller engins kind ſtricken wonderful horror poſſibly could might maine burne albeit ceaſed fling heap bals wildfire ſhoot fiery dart yet laboured vaine moſt timber peeces covered skin hayre clothes throughly wet others againe well ſmeared alum fire might glide without harme roman bringing forward great force valor though much difficutlie yet defended ſaved earneſt deſire win towne ſet nought imminent preſent danger ſide defendant wals greateſt ram ſaid came toward ready ſhake downe tower ſtood againſt ſubtle deuiſe enſnared yron front beareth truth reſembleth rammes head long rope either ſide ſo held faſt returning backe againe ſhould gather new ſtrength able thicke jurres puſhes forcibly ſtrike wall purpoſe withall powred downe ſcalding hot pitch engins alſo advanced forward ſtood along time carrying upon huge ſtones batter wall caſting weapon mount without rayſed ſtill higher defendant fearing deſtruction hand unleſſe tooke better heed ran headlong moſt bold adventurous action ſodaine ſally iſſuing number gate ſetting upon formoſt men threw might upon ram firebrand yron bucket loden fire skirmiſh valiantly performed doubtfull fortune moſt prevailing nought driven backe within wals anon mount roman erected ſame perſians ſtood upon bulwarkes aſſayled arrowes ſlingsſhot fiery dart flying among roofes curtaines tower moſt part went glaunced vaine hurt ſome purpoſe readie quench ſides fighting men grew fewer perſians driven utmoſt diſpaire found better meanes eftſoons gave attempt greater care diligence ſally fortification ſo multitude breaking ſuddenly forth among armed ſouldiers ſome appointed purpoſe carried greater ſtore fire thoſe threw yron skuttles full flaming fire upon timber frame ſtickes alſo twigges dry fewell apt take fire exceeding blacke cloud ſmoake tooke away ſight trumpet ſounded battaile legion good array marched quicke pace heat skirmiſh grew ſtill little little time came buckle handſtrokes foreſaid engine light fire manner burnt ſave greater one reſt halfe burnt rope plucked away caſt upon wals held faſt much adoe forcible ſtraining ſtrong men drawne forth fire darkeneſſe night made end skirmiſh ſouldiers reſted long beeing refreſhed ſmall food ſhort ſleepe roſe call captaines removed munition far wall providing fight cloſe ſhort along high baſtiles countermures finiſhed overtopped wall defendant might eaſily driven wals upon top ſaid baſtiles planted two baliſts feare verily thought one enemy could ſo much put head looke theſe meanes ſufficiently provided little twylight morning appeared three battailons men good array advancing creſts helmet bending forward threatning wiſe together number carried ladder attempted giue aſſault upon wals armor clattered trumpet reſounded fighting ſides joyntly ſemblable heat eagreneſſe made venturous conflict ſpread ſtill roman perceiuing perſians hid head feare engine artillery placed upon mount beat upon wall ram mattock pickax yron crowes ladder approched meane ſides flew caſting dartes thicke troubled annoyed perſians much reſt ſundrie ſhot diſcharged baliſts running loope hole grate baſtiles newly rayſed whereupon ſuppoſing come laſt caſt ran reſolutely upon daunger death thus parted betweene ſeverall charge fight upon point extremitie ſhould happen leaving thoſe behind ſhould keepe wall ſtrong companie ſecretly ſetting open poſterne gate iſſued forth others following behind cloſely carried fire while roman one preſſe hard upon reculed another receive thoſe themſelves charge carried fire pan creeping ſoftly ſtooping low ground conveied light burning cole within ioynts one fabricks raiſed upon boughes diver tree reed bundels cane ſo ſoone drie fewell caught fire burnt ſouldiers together peeces ordnance untouched departed firſt danger enough chap xiii while conſtantius determineth abide fall continual ſhewers raine foretold rainbow concerning annexed ſpeculative diſcourſe followeth winter fearing therefore tumult angred ſouldiers without effecting purpoſe get backe syria bvt ſo ſoone evening ended fight ſo departed ſides take ſome ſhort repoſe emperor diſtracting turning himſelf unto ſundrie counſels conſidering important reaſons urged longer ſtil attēpt deſtruction phaenicha fort like inſoluble bar lay oppoſed againſt enemy outrodes late ſeaſon yeare checked determined ſtay yet continue ſleight skirmiſhes thinking perſians like haply diſtreſſed want victual would quit place gone fel otherwiſe ſuppoſed ſmall fighting ayre moiſt waterie cloud fearefull darkeneſſe aroſe ground continuall rain became ſo drenched clammie ſoft clay country ſtanding upon moſt fat turffe ſoile made great trouble everie beſide crack thunder flaſhes lightning comming thicke one another mightily affrighted timerous mind men moreover increaſe feare apparition ſeen continually rainbow commeth uſually ſhaped ſo laying open natural cauſes thereof declare hot exhalation earth moiſt vapour gathered round together cloud thence ſcattered ſmall ſprinkling dewes ſpreading ſunnebeames made bright glittering lye rolling full againſt verie round bodie ſunne ſo ſhape forme rainebow ſame winding ſpacious large bent becauſe openeth ſtretcheth world reaſons naturall phyloſophie place halfe part whole sphae • e hemiſphaere firſt colour ſhew whereof farre man eye doth behold diſcerne ſeemeth lutca pale yellowiſh ſecond yellowiſh tawnie third red fourth purple laſt compounded blew greene temperature mingled beautie carryeth underſtandings upon earth conceive therfore becauſe firſt part thereof ſeene thin wateriſh ſutable colour aire round next following tawnie deeper brighter hue ſomewhat former yellow third red ſubject brightneſſe ſun receit ſpirit aire diſcoloureth diminiſheth moſt pure reſplendence glittering againſt fourth therefore purple colour becauſe thicke ſprinkling dew riſeth glitter betweene caſteth forth ſhining rayes ſheweth ſight colour cōming neere unto flame colour ſpreadeth abroad turneth blew greene others opinion forme rainebow appeareth thing beneath world beames ſunne infuſed deepely thicke cloud carried high caſt cleere light finding iſſue winding round ſelfe much fretting ſtriking therupon ſhineth thoſe colour verily come neereſt unto white taketh sunne aloft ſuch greeniſh reſemblance cloud next uſually falleth ſea wave white beat upon ſhore ſea bank thoſe farther within ſea without mixture blew azure becauſe ſigne change weather wee ſaid namely cleere aire gathering heapes cloud contrariwiſe thicke aire making change faire pleaſant weather therefore read often poet iris rainbow ſent heaven alteration toward preſent ſtate many others thoſe ſundrie opinion ſuperfluous thing reckon conſidering narration haſteneth returne whence hath digreſſed theſe ſuch like object emperor toſſed betweene hope feare while winter came pace grew hard while ſuſpected alſo forelaid thoſe deſerts wild tract withall feared likewiſe ſome mutinie ſouldiers diſcontented angrie beſides vexed perplexed mind doore ſet open rich man houſe returne without effecting purpoſe emptie hand cauſes giving vaine enterpriſe returneth syria minding winter antioch endured labourious moſt dangerous summer ſame long time lamented thus fell ſome fatall conſtellation ſo ruled diver event evermore conſtantius himſelfe perſon warred perſians ſome adverſe croſſe fortune attended upon whereupon wiſht might otherwiſe win conduct captaines thing remember ſometimes hapned deed xxi booke chap iulian purpoſeth firſt begin conſtantius ſet upon conjecting death ſundrie preſaging token dreames amd ſuch like device touching ammianus marcellinus ſetteth downe owne judgement while conſtantius held occupied hard fortune war beyond river euphrates iulian making abode vienna beſtowed dayes night laying plot againſt future nomentana neere unto citie wife alſo gallus conſtantina ſiſter ſometimes buried tooke head incenſed deſires ſeeing gaule quieted ſet firſt upon conſtantius gueſſing many preſages propheſies wherein anſwer thus grammarian hath ſometime ſpoken barbarouſly muſitian ſung abſurdly phyſitian beene ignorant remedie yet therefore followeth either grammer muſicke phyſicke whereupon tully among excellent harme feared waſted tract confining rhetia whole company brigand raunging downe abroad libertie ſuffered nothing paſſe hand unattempted outrage leaſt winked neglected might ſtirre occaſions anew warre germanes beginning conflict himſelfe firſt man loſt life vpon whoſe death barbarian became bold confident romanes enkindled revenge captaine tough battaile reſolutely fought men ſome ſlaine wounded huge multitude enemy preaſſing hard upon broken put rout vadomarius brother gundomadus likewiſe king constantius hath alreadie beene related eſtabliſhed peace gundomadus dead thinking vadomarius would faithfull unto ſilent executor ſecret deſignes gave charge herauld wee may beleeve report fame onely wrote unto covenant concord broken betweene ſhould otherwhile trouble march neere unto end iulianus ſtanding dread thereof might never depart defence protection gaule inſtructions vadomarius following may well thinke committed thoſe ſuch like outrage aforeſaid beeing man prime youth wonderous skilfull beguiling deceiving world afterward alſo ſhewed while hee marqueſſe warden march phaenice taken manoir convict forbare abſtained secretarie notarie ſent unto constantius caught ſtationarie
