philagrius alſo bidden entred place ſooner eſpied king remembred iulianus emperours word pretending way excuſe ſome earneſt urgent buſineſſe went backe unto inne hee read writing thereby taken knowledge bee done immediately returned ſat downe among reſt gueſts feaſt ended hee layd ſtrong hand upon vadomarius thus attached committed ſaid captaine ſouldiors ſtraitly kept e ſtandards enſignes dart haſtily flew upon ſome ſlew others craving mercie offering booty tooke priſoners upon ſubmiſſion reſt remained upon entreatie promiſing withall continue ſtedfaſt aſſured quietneſſe graunted peace chap iiii hortatorie oration iulianus unto ſouldiors meant give battaile unto conſtantius open field ſolemne oath taken except nebridius iulian delivereth furie ſouldiors ſaveth life exploit performed ſtout reſolute courage gueſſing world civile domeſticall trouble hee raiſed foreſeeing quickneſſe wit underſtanding nothing ſo well befitting ſuddaine enterpriſes expedition thought himſelfe ſhould bee ſafer eſtate hee profeſſed openly revolt breach allegeance ſtanding doubtfull ſouldiors loyaltie firſt pacified ſecret kind religious ceremonie goddeſſe warre bellona f ſummoned armie together unto aſſembly ſtanding upon banke raiſed ſtone ſeemed confident diſcourſed thus lowder voice wont doe long ſince ſecret deliberation ſelfe ſuppoſe noble worthie fellow ſouldiors ſtirred ſo brave valiant exploit expect counſell hand namely thoſe event feared might throughly thought upon well taken heed hand becommeth ſouldiors growne glorious act uſe eares tongue deeme commaunder approoved equitie may prayſed liked worthily diſpatch therefore purpoſed letting circumstance goe marke pray favourably ſhall word deliver god heaven entermingled companie beginning youth continuall inrodes invaſions well alemans frankes repreſſed iointly vigorous courage made rhene paſſable romane force often would ſtanding unmoveable againſt noyſe rumor violent excurſions puiſsant nation truſting aſſure grounding ſelfe upon vertue valour theſe painefull labour taken ſuſtained gaule eyewitneſse thereof loſſe many man life long grievous calamity hath beene relieved ſhall commend unto posteritie age age ever ſeeing compulſion grave honourable iudgement alſo urgent neceſsitie grace god favour lifted imperiall dignitie fortune enterpriſes aſpire higher reach greater matter protesting declaring thus much openly unto armie equitie noble proweſse whereof hath beene ſo renowmed beene ſeene home temperate mild many warres alſo banded combined force barbarous nation conſiderate warie may therefore iointly one accord mind prevent adverſe event follow way policie right good take ſeeing welfare state correſpondent intention deſire while country illyricum without greater garriſons let u march apace without stay take time ſeize hand utmost bound dacia thence meanes good ſucceſſe furniſhed instruction ought done manner hardie redoubted leader captaines promiſe beſeech bond oath continuance concord fidelitie unto commaunder endevour diligently accustomed manner part nothing done inconſiderately faintly yea produce testimonie man ſhall require ſyncere uncorrupt conſcience enterpriſe attempt nothing willingly expedient profitable u common verily earneſtly deſire requeſt take heed fit heat boiling anger none breake forth hurt hinderance private perſon let conſider thus much infinite overthrowes loſſes enemy ſo indemnitie ſafetie province teſtified notably example given vertues made u ſo famous oration emperours leſſe approoved beene oracle whole aſſemblie ſeene ſtirre moove exceeding much deſirous noveltie change one conſent made terrible noyſe lowd voice wonderfull clattering ſhields calling great high commaunder ſeene experience fortunate conquerour barbarous nation king beeing commaunded throughout ſweare alleageance unto ſetting ſwords cloſe owne neckes tooke ſolemne oath ſet forme word paine horrible curſes would quarrell even ſpending life need ſo required undergoe chaunces peril whatſoever done great officer ruler following yea thoſe next place unto prince obliged fealtie like oath nebridius praefect onely man companie although inward purpoſe ſure ynough ſtedfaſt yet boldly refuſed ſweare ſaying might bound oath conſtantius unto many benefites ſundrie time alreadie beene obliged ſouldiors ſtood neere unto heard great chafe furious heat anger made killed outright emperour rich coat armes protected fell downe knee returned royall palace eſpied gone lying proſtrate ſuppliant wiſe beſeeching eaſe feare would vouchſafe reach foorth right hand unto ſayth ſhall keepe eſpecially friend caſe thou touch hand goe thy wayes hence whither thou wilt ſafetie ſecuritie heard retyred himſelfe apart without harme done unto owne houſe tuskane thuſcia iulian provided thus aforehand weightie importance buſineſſe required knowing alſo experience powerfull effectuall troublous affaire prevention getting ground ſignall watchword given warning meet unfold time paſt recount ſummarily act constantius wintering antiochia atchieved home warres abroad while theſe affaire aforeſaid paſſed gaule among many right honourable perſonages came ſtrange country doe reverence unto emperour alſo captaines tribune better ſort men marke appointed thereunto therefore conſtantius returned meſopotamia received kind dutie one amphtlochius paphlagonian beene tribune long while ſerved constans deepely ſuſpected upon preſumptions carried likelyhood truth ſowed matter quarell diſcord among elder conſtantinus conſtantius brother preſuming verie ſawſily ſtand place end himſelfe alſo might admitted like obſequious ſervice known debarred many muttered hereat yea cried worthy live longer obſtinat ſtiffenecked traytor conſtantius theſe matter mild otherwiſe hee uſed surceaſe quoth trouble man thinke guiltie yet openly convicted remember yee committed ſuch matter mine eye ſhall receive puniſhment doome owne conſcience cannot hidden ſo departed day armour weapon engine diſcharge ſhot alſo gold ſilver yea plentie victuall ſundrie ſorts diver kind beaſts carriage becauſe king perſia hard winter much ado driven backe therefore puiſſant force feared arſares meribanes king turcomania anaduole accorto girau • p • gian caſtaldus armenia georgiana hiberia bought wrought ſide coſtly gorgious ſuits robe many gift alſo ſundrie ſorts like endamage roman affaire dangerous doubtfull time revolted unto perſians amid ſo many trouble urgent negotiation died hermogenes promoted praefectſhip helpidius borne paphlagonia man carried preſence infirmitie ſpeech reckoning verie ſimple plaine nature gentle nothing bloudily minded inſomuch conſtantius commaunded put certaine innocent perſon torture preſence verie well content bee deprived place beſought theſe matter might committed others better himſelfe accompliſhed according prince mind chap vi ſort conſtantius provided inſtant affaire politike ſpeed iulian made ſetting deſignes forward conſtantius therefore difficultie urgent buſineſſes ſtanding doubtfull ſeeke courſe take one along time much troubled mind whether ſhould goe againſt iulian country farre repel parthian upon point threatned paſſe euphrates ſticking thus equall ballance end conſulted oftentimes captain enclined wholly way namely finiſhed leaſt wiſe appeaſed neerer warre left behind back enemy might feare sc • avonia illyria italy thought daunted quelled take iulian hunter prey verie beginning enterpriſes allay feare owne ſouldiers theſe verie word otherwhiles gave forth becauſe hee would bee thought waxe coole omitted ſide warre foot minding diſperſe ſpread terror comming place fearing withall leaſt africke countrey fit commodious emperour occaſions might befall ſhould abſence invaded hee beene departed march eaſt ſent thither ſea gaudentius chancellor •• secretarie notarie meane briefely touched lay ſpie good obſerve proceeding iulian gaule hoped hee obſequious quicke ſervice would able effect two regard firſt becauſe feared adverſe iulian part offended becauſe hee made haſt meanes ſo good opportunitie commend doings unto conſtantius made doubt would get victorie man contrarie opinion fully ſame mind gaude • tiu thither come carrying mind charge prince given letter inſtructed cretio captaine • lieutenant bee done alſo reſt commaunders made choyce ſtouteſt ſouldiers place yea brought barbari • mauritaniae nimble light appointed skirmiſhers kept moſt ſtraitly ſea coaſts lay oppoſite unto guitune martiano gaſcoigne remigio florentino acquitanie gaule neither failed conſtantius purpoſe policie ſo long lived none adverſe part ſet foot thoſe land although number armed men obſerved coaſt sicilie reaching capo bo • capo coco lilybaeum cabo paſſato pachynus readie ſoone ſayle paſſage beene cleere open conſtantius diſpoſed theſe ſmall lighter matter thought conſidering thing ſtood expedient advertiſed meſſengers letter captaines force perſians aſſembled together conduct proud sapor king leading way tendere encamping themſelves marching neere unto edge tigris doubtfull whither went breake make invaſion newes much moved end making abode neerer might prevent attempt departed ſpeed wintering harbour ſending part horſemen ſtrength infanterie wherein truſted paſſed euphrates capeſſana upon bridge ſhips went rhoa nigro edeſſa citie ſtored victual ſtrongly fenced waiting untill either owne diſcoverers elſe ſome fugitive brought word enemy encamped forward meane iulian departing rauraci hee diſpatched buſineſſe ere ſhewed ſent backe gaule salluſtius promoted praefect commaunded germanianus hold roome nebridius semblably one charge horſemen appeareth little beneath maſterſhip armour committed unto nevita fearing gumoarius old traitor heard ſay while leading scutarij ſecretly betrayed veteranio prince soveraign alſo iovius gave treaſurerſhip houſhold queſtorſhip made mention act magnentius unto mamertinus charge state empire treaſure revenewes dagalaiphus ordained steward seneſchal houſhold captaine h domeſticall traine others according owne pleaſure whoſe good deſerts faithfull ſervice hee well knew ſouldiers therefore make journey martian wood wayes joyning upon bank river iſter among ſudden occurrent exceeding uncertaine doe hee feared eſpecially one thing leaſt ſo traine accompanie ſhould grow deſpiſed offend offenderes multitude readie repugne repine againſt prevent inconvenience good forecaſt tooke wiſe courſe dividing armie diver regiment ſent ſome leading iovinus iovius march ſpeed along knowne wayes italie others committed conduct nevita tearmed magiſtrum armorum generall horſe end thus ſpread ſundrie wayes might thought infinit number ſo fill place feare terrour even thus alexander great many skilfull leader caſe ſo required howbeit hee gave charge unto thus gone forth march ſtand well upon guard enemie forthwith readie encounter keepe watch ward night ſtations ſentinels leaſt might ſome outrode unawares ſet upon buſineſſes beeing thus thought well digeſted following manner whereby oftentimes broken barbarian tract preſuming confidently upon continued traine ſucceſſes hee went ſtill farther farther come place whence underſtood river navigable embarked fiſher boat whereof hap found good ſtore along chanell river paſſed cloſely poſſibly could keeping himſelfe therfore ſecret finding miſſe fine viand contenting himſelfe ſlender courſe dyet hee paſſed beſide good townes without forth ſecurely laying rule follow notable ſaying old cyrus turning way hoſtelrie asked hoſt good cheere ſhould provide anſwered bread onely hope quoth ſup neere unto ſome river chap vii fame iulians comming chaſeth away certaine captaines adverſe part lucillianus thinking make head againſt ſodainly taken priſoner word rebuked chaſtiſed ſtraits paſſes illyricum thracia great celeritie intercepted iulianus fortified bvt fame thouſand tongue folke ſay multiplies report thing exceedingly much talke ſpread sclavonians illyrian iulian overthrown number king gaule vanquiſhed armie manie nation bearing himſelfe proud ſundrie ſucceſſes comming neere hand rumor taurus praefect praetorium ſtricken feare departed quickly auoyding leſſe foreine enemie ryding away ſpeedily change poſthorſes allowed state paſſed iulian alpes ſame trice florentius praefect likewiſe away howbeit lucillianus come time thoſe country charge commaund force moved ſome ſleight intelligence touching ſtirre trouble iulian made abode sirmium gathering ſouldiers together many ſpeedie execution buſineſſe hand would permit bee ſent proper ſtations intended make head againſt hee ſhould come like firebrand caſting dart ſet fire haſtening ſwiftly hee flew finall end appointed journey ſooner come bonmonſter simlero bononia ſtandeth 19 mile sirmium old moone therefore ſhining greater part night leapt ſodaine ſhip tooke land preſently ſent dagalaiphus companie light appointed men call lucillianus unto take away perforce made reſiſtance even reſt rayſed troubleſome noyſe ſaw himſelfe environed round companie men knew conceived preſently matter hearing emperours name amazed feare obeyed commaundement though full againſt thus little commaunder horſemen bare himſelfe proud ſtout enough yeelded pleaſure another ſet upon horſe ſuch came next hand preſented unto prince baſe captive unneth able call wit againe together ſo much oppreſſed terrour hereof verie firſt ſight perceived leave favour granted adore purple robe hee taking heart againe laſt ſecure himſelfe lord emperour quoth done unwiſely raſhly thus venture perſon ſo upon theſe foreine part againe iulian grim bitter kind ſmile reſerve quoth hee theſe wiſe word thine conſtantius enſigne imperiall maieſtie reached thee counſellor becauſe thou ſhouldeſt ceaſe feare lucillianus voided away iulianus ſuppoſing make delayes ſlacke buſineſſe hand beene alwaies prince doubtfull dangerous affaire bold confident marching toward citie preſumed leſſe ſurrendred went quicke pace hee drew neere unto ſuburbs verie large reaching great way length whole companie ſouldiers multitude people ſorts comming forth many burning light gay flower luckie vowes calling auguſtus lord brought royall palace taking much contentment good ſpeed grounding hope future event lucky preſage according example mother citie ſo populous ſo well frequented ſhould city alſo received gracious healthfull ſtarre proclaimed morrow ſolemne game running chariot prize great joy people third morning waxed light impatient delayes hee rode ſpeed along common highwayes meeting man durſt make reſiſtance tooke turk •• eſt succi kept garriſons defence thereof hee ordained ruler nevita man approved truſt fidelitie ſite place meet ſhew top ſtanding thicke together high mountaines 〈…〉 monte argenta • itali • haemus valiza rithay • ero rhodope whereof one ariſeth verie bank river iſter hither part river bardare tzet • ae axius ending length ſtreits riſings ſmall hill cut mids illyrian thracian one ſide bordering hard upon midland • benburgen germanis dacae serdica looking downe thracię • hilippopoli vel • errano philibe turcis philippopolis great noble city nature foreknew nation ſeated round ſhould reduced roman dominion ſo framed faſhioned purpoſe time paſt gaping obſcurely betweene hill thruſt cloſe neere together afterwards roman state roſe greatneſſe glorie laid wide open paſſage alſo cart ſundrie time avennes thereof ſhut ſtopped checked attempt great captaines puiſſant nation part faceth illyricum meaner height taken unwares paſſed part againſt oppoſit unto thraciae broken bearing forward downe right one ſide encombred rough craggie wayes hardly climbed although man impeach vnder theſe high bankes cliffes lyeth ſides ſpacious ground plaine field upper plot reacheth unto alpes iuliae nethermore ſo flat open inhabited without let way farre take f • th boſporus thracius helle • pontus narrow ſea mardi marmota propontis chap viii embaſſage iulianus ſent unto senat rome invective againſt conſtantius two whoſe legion conduct nigrinus taken aquileia drive iulianus new thought counſels theſe thing thus ſet order ſuch ſo urgent buſineſſe might emperour iolianus soveraigne commaunder leaving generall horſemen returneth naeſſum wealthy towne end might thence diſpoſe readily ſpeed particular ſhold make commoditie profit commanded victor hyſtoriographer ſaw sirmium come thence unto ordained lord deputie governe pannonia ſecunda honoured braſen ſtatue man ſober carryage right commendable long made pręfect romecitie time bearing himſelfe aloft thinking verily conſtantius could never poſſibly wrought unto agreement ſent unto senat ſharp invective oration laying open certaine reprochfull villanies vice againſt read senat houſe tertullius yet governed citie rome praefect right notable curteſie thankfull goodneſſe nobilitie unto joyned honourable teſtimonie affiance one accord ſentence judgement cryed alowd autorituo reverentiam rogamus wiſh award reverence honour thy author alſo harrowed memoriall great constantine one beene deviſer innovation troublous confuſion auntientlawes cuſtomes received old laying openly charge firſt others advanced barbarian unto honour dignitie conſuls unſavorly aſſure ſmall diſcretion ought avoid right bitterly blamed another ſhortly preferred conſulſhip mamertinus man neither honeſt life brave part ſightly preſence glorious reputation world comparable theſe upon conſtantine conferred moſt honorable magiſtracie contrariwiſe one full imperfection rude uncivile withal intollerable high place authoritie cruell thinking theſe ſuch like matter carefull moſt weightie ſerious buſineſſes fearefull unexpected newes brought unto ſhewing wicked attempt ſome like hinder forward courſes deſignes unleſſe watchfull providence hee repreſſed alſo grew farther two legion conſtantiacae additiō one cohort archer found sirmium ſent whoſe allegiance yet diſtruſted gaule colour ſome urgent neceſſarie occaſions theſe making ſlow haſt forward fearing well long tedious journey german cruell continuall enemics plotted make ſome rebellion counſell inciting nigrinus borne meſopotamia captaine tribune troupe horſemen contrived matter ſecret conference ſtrengthened deeper ſilence come aquileia towne ſtrongly ſeated compaſſed mightie munition bulwarkes wall hoſtile manner ſudden tooke naturall inborne towneſmen common people favoured friended ſtill name conſtantius put helping hand ſet forward horrible fearefull tumult ſhut wayes entrance manned tower bulwark thereof armed ſouldiers made preparation againſt time come fight living meane time eaſe libertie ſo audacious act ſtirred italian inhabitant ſide constantius beene yet living iulian advertiſed hereof abiding naeſſum without feare trouble behind backe knew beſides reading hereſay citie ever bin diver time beſieged yet never either raſed rendered earneſt made haſt gaine owne ſide cunning practiſes ſundrie ſorts flattery ſome greater miſchiefe might ariſe therefore commanded iovinus captaine horſemen comming alpes entred beyern bavaria noricum returne ſpeed quenching fire one way flame nothing might wanting gave commaundement ſouldiers followed either comitatum aut signa court captaine ſtaid paſſed ſame towne bee readie power give aid chap ix ſiege aſſault aquileia while iulian wintered conſtantinople upon hearing conſtantius death deſcribed theſe thing thus ſet order himſelfe long taking knowledge conſtantius death paſſed ſpeed thracia entred conſtantinople oftentimes advertiſed ſaid ſiege would rather hold long bee dreadfull dangerous appointed ſervice immo companie captaines removed iovinus thence employed affaire importance neceſſitie therefore aquileia compaſſed double pavoiſado ſhields thought convenient conſent captaines draw defendant threatening word faire ſpeeches yeeld much debating fro ſeeing obſtinacie grew ſtill depart parle without effecting purpoſe becauſe nothing looked fight ſides refreſhed body food ſleepe earely morning ſound trumpet incenſed doe miſchiefe one unto another ſo haſt good adviſement ſet cry amaine prepared encounter aſſaylants therefore carrying roofefences hurdle thicke wrought marched ſoftly good heed ſo number yron tooles aſſayed dig wall many brought skaling ladder framed juſt meaſure height ſaid wall almoſt wall ſome ſtones came tumbling downe upon bruiſed ſore ſquized together others ſhot dart flew ſinging eares gave back drew away reſt feare like welcome wholly averted purpoſe fighting beſieged emboldened firſt encounter aſſumed confident hope better better ſtill made ſmall account thing behind ſettled reſolute heart along river yeelded convenient place unceſſant labour performed watch ward meanes better ſecuritie ſide aſſaylants without although ſore troubled feare danger yet ſhame leaſt might thought dull ſpirit ſlouthfull ſeeing aſſaulting open force ſped better betooke themſelves artificiall fabrickes engine meet ſiege becauſe place found meet eyther ſet ram plant engine againſt undermine reaſon river natiſone lea • natiſo runneth along citie ſide neere unto device found comparable thoſe old time built quicke ſpeed certaine tower timber higher enemy bulwarkes placed ſame upon trige • tinis three ſhips ſtrongly faſtened one another ſtood armed men putting whole ſtrength together joyntly laboured equall courage neere hand drive away defendant ſtandings light appointed skirmiſhers came foorth certaine hole ſaid tower put foorth layed little k bridge purpoſe framed joyned made haſt trice paſſe upon end while placed aloft ſides aſſayle one another caſtingweapons ſtones theſe went ſaid bridge without one diſturbe pulled part ſtoneworke wall might make breach entrance towne within ſecond enterpriſe wiſely begun ſped amiſſe end theſe tower drew neere aſſayled ſhot fierie dart beſmeared pitch reed alſo ſtickes twig ſundrie ſorts fuell readie catch light fire tower quickly ſet burning bending forward reeling weight thoſe ſtood waving upon fell downe river ſome armed men ſticked engineſhot farre killed top conflict footman beneath ſhipmates ſerved water aloft fallen huge ſtones cruſht ſome ſwift footmanſhip comberſome place refuge eſcaped length conflict continued untill toward evening ſound retreat manner departed ſides aſunder paſſed little remnant day diverſly affected aſſailants upon ſorrow lamentation death fellowes ſo defendant hope winning upper hand mightily incenſed yet theſe alſo themſelves tooke loſſe ſome owne ſide right heavily nevertheleſſe time loſt allowance ſo much one whole night ſufficient recover ſtrength reſt food betimes next morning fight began afreſh ſound trumpet ſome bearing ſhields head fight nimbly others carrying ladder upon ſhoulders running forward fervent violence expoſed breaſts ſtroke many dart alſo ſetting hand breake yron portcluſes ſoone fired away killed mightie ſtones wals ſome went boldly paſſe ditch ſuddaine aſſaults iſſued forth ſecretly poſterne gate ruſhed unadviſedly ſore hurt ſet backe ſafe recourſe wall vaumure ſtrengthened turfe defended theſe waitlayers danger albeit defendant skill martiall feat ſurpaſſed helpe left wall yet ſouldiors picked forth beſt company able endure long delayes went round place neere unto citie ſeeking forcible meanes engine might make way breake could effect ſo much ſo great difficulty way began ſlackly lay ſiege unto citie ſtationarie garriſon ſouldiors leaving guard centinels waſting field neere adjoyning got plentie thing meet neceſſarie imparted great deale booty gotten unto fellow ſouldiors whereby ſwilling deale drinke cramming themſelves full fare high diet became heavie ſpirited unluſtie chap x newes brought conſtantlus death men aquileia beſieged ſet open gate unto agilo ſent iulianus nigrinus burnt quicke two executed ſword iulianus taketh charge affaire illyricum italie ivlian intelligence hereof common report relation conſorts while hee wintered yet conſtantinople politiquely tooke order ſet frame theſe trouble soone therefore ſendeth agilo colonell footman time man good note well knowne end upon ſight right honourable perſonage knowledge taken conſtantius death ſiege ſhould breake meane ſiege aquileia might bee given thought good ſince paine labour undertaken otherwiſe came nothing theſe ſo fiercely ſtood ſhould forced thirſt yeeld whereas notwithſtanding conduit pipe cut betweene ſprings head valiantly made reſiſtance nevertheleſſe nay courage confidence much labour courſe river turned away device likewiſe tooke effect meanes drinking liberally greedineſſe cut thoſe owne wilfull raſhneſſe encloſed within lived ſparily contented themſelves water pit wels theſe thing thus paſſe fell hath beene ſaid agilo according commaundement came upon covered head thicke fence ſhields approched confidently delivered many ſpeeches thoſe truly whereby acquainted conſtantius death empire ſettled upon iulian reputed lyar eſcaped without reviling tearmes neither gave man eare unto relation done upon graunt ſafeconduct admitted alone unto certaine baſtile fortification upon religious proteſtation true report recounted ſame againe delivered heard long ſorrow gate ſet open came forth heapes joy received peaceable captaine excuſing cleering themſelves preſented nigrinus author outrage ſome others requiring execution crime majeſtie calamity citie might expiated conclude within dayes buſineſſe neerely ſifted examined mamertinus praefectus praetorio ſitting place juſtice nigrinus hoteſt perſuader warre burnt quicke romulus sabostius principall 〈…〉 bourgeffes towne convicted ſowen diſcord ſtirred ſedition without regard perill might enſue deſerts puniſhment loſſe head reſt neceſſitie owne forced theſe furious broyles went away without harme ſo mild mercifull emperour weighing well caſe equitie reaſon tooke order theſe verily proceeding paſſed afterward iulian reſiant ſtill naeſſum encumbred deeper care fearing many thing ſides ſtood dread leaſt ſouldiors ſhut within aquileia ſome ſuddaine impreſſion ſhould ſtop ſtreits iulian alpes might looſe province ſuccours dayly expected thence semblably feared much affaire eaſt hearing ſouldiors diſperſed thracia againſt ſuddaine violence quickly aſſembled drew toward confines succi leading captaine come martianus yet himſelfe alſo regard theſe inſtant buſineſſes working effectually ſuch carefull proviſion meet gathered together illyrian force bred inured martiall exploit readie conflict joyne warlike commaunder deſpiſing ſo troublous buſie time good profit private perſons giving audience cauſes matter controverſie eſpecially poteſtates state free townes favouring overmuch enclined unjuſtly inveſted many great office state finding symmachus maximus two senatours good marke noble birth ſent embaſſadours unto conſtantius returned hee viſited honourable manner rejecting worthie perſonage rowme tertullus made maximus praefect rome gratifie rufinus vulcatius whoſe ſiſters ſonne knew whoſe government market plentifully ſerved victual complaint common oftentimes wont ariſe ceaſed alſo ſettle fearefull state ſecuritie embolden thoſe obedient declared mamertinus praefect praetorio illyricum confull together nevita ſay late beyond meaſure taxed conſtantine firſt man began countenance honour baſe barbarian chap xi dangerous warre toward perſians conſtantius much ſorrow perplexitie fearefull haſt frameth ſouldiors allegeance meane perſians repelled direction deſtinies returne home while theſe ſuch like meanes plotted new deſignes upon tickliſh tearmes betweene hope feare conſtantius edeſſa perplexed mind occaſion ſundrie report delivered intelligencers drawne ſurvey diver courſes doubtfull take one preparing ſouldiors skirmiſhes battailes another readie goe hand opportunitie might ſerve lay ſiege gemina ſecond time bezabde wiſely conſidering ſhortly take journey north part leave tract meſopotamia without defence thus unreſolved counſels withheld hee many delayes perſia king ſtayed yet beyond tygris untill ſacrifices religious ceremony warrant enter upon expedition paſſed river found none make head againſt without difficultie might gone euphrates alſo otherwiſe keeping ſouldiors civile warre feared expoſe unto danger citie wall experience particularly ſtrength wals fort reſolute alſo valourous defendors nevertheleſſe becauſe would ſit ſtill deſpiſed ſtouth enforced arbetio agilo captaines officer cavallerie make haſt puiſſant regiment conduct meaning ſhould provoke perſians fight keepe hither bankes tigris good guard forefences lye eſpiall whither king violence would breake forth direction moreover gave admonition writing oft ſo ſoone multitude enemy began paſſe ſhould draw backe ſpeed while theſe captaines keepe limit accordingly charge obſerve ſecret deſigne moſt deceitfull nation himſelfe remaining 1 ſtronger old legionarie ſouldiors infanterie part armie carefull eye urgent occaſions meant defend townes protection ſallies outrodes ſpies fugitive adverſe part otherwhiles came delivered intelligence repugnant one uncertaine future iſſues reaſon among perſians none privie counſels noble great lord ſilent truſtie among likewiſe god alſo worſhipped name silence foreſaid captaines ſent dayly emperour himſelfe come unto proteſted able withſtand violence moſt fierce king without force put together meane theſe matter thus carefully handled arrived ſure meſſengers one another whoſe faithfull relation knowne truth iulian great celeritie paſſed beyond italie illyricum ſeized went ſtraits paſſe succi waited aid come ſpeed part beeing thus environed multitude armed men might overrun thraciae knowne constantius driven great agonie one comfort yet ſuſtained himſelfe civile warres hometroubles alwaies upper hand conſidering difficult matter take counſell doe caſe made choice courſe eſpecially namely beſtow ſouldiors lay poſt affaire state publicke waggon ſent little little expedition meet reſiſt imminent danger opinion generall conſent armie approved went commaundement lightly appointed taking order next morning word brought king power led forth returned home occaſion praeſaging ſignes bird brake enterpriſe feare thus allayed force called backe ſave thoſe ordinarily appointed defence meſopotamia returned haleppo belion hierapolis chap xii conſtantius delivered care ſtinging biting oration incenſeth ſouldiors iulianus tearmeth rebell ſendeth arbetio gomoarius certaine cornet light appointed horſemen bvt doubting whereto theſe enterpriſes would fine tend army come together hee ſummoned aſſembly century maniples cohort ſound trumpet filling whole field multitude readily hee might bind eſtabliſh give charge ſtanding upon high tribunall ſame thicker guard uſuall compoſing countenance chearefull aſpect thus diſcourſed unto better encouragement time carefull commit ought either word deed never ſo little ſuited well perfite honestie like warie pilot skilfull sayler ſetting bending downe helme according billowes ſtirre constrained confeſse unto loving friend mine errours nay rather may ſpeake truth humanitie courteſie thought verily would profited common affaire end therefore may eaſily bee knowne cauſe aſſembling companie listen pray patience favour mine uncle ſonne gallus time magnentius valour proweſse overthrew obstinately perſiſted working tumult reſted ſo ſtood contented herewith theremembrance alone griefe paſt ſame commonly devoid care diſquieted troubled u another accident happened ſorrowfull dare well ſay went native inbred fortitude helpe god heaven ſhall repreſſe iulian ordained defence gaule while yee employed aſſayling forraine nation made foule ſtirre round illyricum preſuming upon victorie ſome light skirmiſhes germanes halfe naked men hath borne head aloft like mad man aſſuming prowd ſocietie ſome aid ſouldiors readie fell ſtomacke deſperate boldneſſe enter miſchievous action conſpired hurt commonweale abandoned troden underfoot iustice mother nourſe romane world goddeſſe revenged ſuch ioy wicked deed end bring ſuch prowd ſwelling fierie ſpirits dead ſparkes ember ſelfe found experience eaſily induced beleeve knowledge auncient history remaineth withſtand theſe tempeſtuous whirlewinds raiſed ſpeedie remedy repreſſe quell rage warre new ſprung bee growne greater ſtrength doubt made favour moſt high god aſsiſting u whoſe eternall ſentence unthankefull perſons alreadie condemned edge ſword ſo impiouſly prepared turned upon utter deſtruction provoked iniuries made greater many benefites thus riſen endanger innocent mind preſageth iuſtice readie good counſels doth promiſe dare undertake come buckle cloſe fight ſtarke feare grow ſo benummed ſhall able endure ardent light brandiſhing ſparkling eies firſt noiſe outcrie ioyning battaile theſe ſpeeches uttered hee drew mind anſwered ſame kind word loving acclamation ſhooke ſpeares angrie wiſe called bee led foorth hand field againſt rebell whereupon emperour turning feare joy ſoone diſſolved aſſembly commaunded arbetio knew alreadie former proofes bee others fortunate man appeaſing civile warres goe journey lancearij n mattiarij hee lived exile ſame dayes manlius although might deſired raigned king aclitus alſo epheſian affirmeth ſame advertiſeth u brave worthy men diver time beene overcome ſuch variable event fortune worketh witl • ſſe pride ſtained credit diſhoneſt ſhamefull gaines among enormity grew alſo foule ſinks deepe gulfes waſtfull banquet ſtead triumphes victory feaſting triumphes came wearing ſilkes velvet ſouldiour sparta ſharply chaſtiſed time warre abroad durſt ſeene within houſe moreover ſouldiours thoſe dayes allyes countreymen ſo ſtout withall ſo given extortion contrariwiſe enemy ſo falſe harted cowardous ambitious ſuits idleneſſe gotten wealth could moſt skilfully diſtinguiſh varietie gold pretious ſtones farre otherwiſe find record later date well knowne time maximian caeſar fort campe king perſia rifled certaine common ſouldiour met parthicke ſacbell wherein perles upon ſimplicitie want skill knowledge threw gemmes went away ſufficiently contented beautie onely lether bagge fortuned ſame time certaine barber commaunded come pole emperours head entred arrayed rich coſtly apparell iulian ſaw much aſtonied quoth commaunded auditor f receiver barber ſent howbeit ſaid party demanded might diſpend art anſwered got everie day much came g allowance twentie men victuall much horſeprovender commonly terme h caput alſo good ſtipend ſalarie yeare money beſide many commodious ſuits requeſts graunted unto whereat moved diſpleaſed diſcharged away ſuch together cooke others like ſort wont recive manner ſame fee thoſe little need gave licence paſſe whither would albeit verie firſt inſtructions childhood given much worſhip idol heathen god grew little little elder became zealouſly affected ſame ſtanding infeare many thing yet ſome point thereto appertaining practiſed ſecretly poſſibly could thoſe matter paſt gone feared perceived time libertie come wherein might liſt diſcovered ſecrets heart verie plaine abſolute decree ordained temple ſhould ſet open beaſts ſacrifice ſhould bee preſented altar worſhip idol heathen god god ſhould put ure againe effectuat ſtrengthen theſe deſignes ſo digeſted chriſtian biſhops diſſention together people divided ſchiſmes admitted pallace gave admonition appeaſed ended civile diſcords among themſelves everie man confidently ſhould profeſſe follow owne religion without impeachment whatſoever ſtiffe conſtant purpoſe end libertie encreaſed diſcentions might afterwards feare multitude according one mind found experience ſavage beaſts ſo noiſom hurtful men chriſtians themſelves moſt part mortall deadly oftentimes would come theſe word heare alemans frankners heard thinking imitat ſpeech auncient prince marcus little marked caſe much altered ſayd marcus travailed paleſtina way aegypt beeing oftentimes diſquieted odious ſtinking ſturres tumultuous unruly iewes griefe heart ſaid taken exclamation ô marcomans ô quadi ô sarmatians length found others unquiet chap iiii aegyptians unſeaſonably importuning troubling hee wiſely expelleth kind civile ſubmiſsion laboureth currie favour men ethnicke philoſopher maximus familiarly entertaineth fame vertues puiſſance driveth prince certaine ſecret dutifulneſse embaſsages part repaire unto verie ſame time upon ſundrie rumor ſtirred came abroad number aegyptians litigious kind people taking much pleaſure joy time ordinarie cuſtome ſue one another maintaine ambiguous controverſies moſt greedie require againe way multiplication increaſe given ought proctor advocate compulſori ſame take suffragator little atturney creditor eaſed thereby debt leaſt wiſe allowed commodiouſly way forbearing giving day bring thoſe ſummes debt demaunded feare ſome odious crimination call queſtion moleſt rich men caſe extortion theſe thronged thick together flocked prince himſelf praefects prętorium chattering like ſort iayes diſturbed troubled order moſt rudely readie extort wreſt avouched given unto verie many whether rightfull otherwiſe skilled even threeſcore ten yeares would ſuffer buſineſſe elſe bee diſpatched iulian publiſhed proclamation commanding paſſe water unto chalcedon promiſe himſelfe alſo perſon would follow quickly decide determine theſe cauſes gone went precept maſters ſhips uſe ſayle fro man ſhould ſo hardie transfr • tare aegyptu • tranſport ſea aegyptian precept kept ſo ſtraitly ſo forward carefulneſſe obſtinat purpoſe thus quarell forge accuſations came nothing end ſo diſappointed preſumed conceived hope returned home whereupon law paſſed equitie ſelfe indited whereby provided advocat atturney ſhould troubled thoſe fe • moneyes might frontier fort taking diligent care neither armour apparell money victuall ſhould wanting unto lying diſperſed along bank iſter oppoſit rodes invaſions barbarous enemy hee heard ſay performed ſervice great vigilancie valour while hee diſpoſed thus theſe affaire ſuffering nothing done ſlackly favourite next perſon perſuaded ſet upon gothes joyning ſo neere beene ſo often falſe perfidious ſaid trogloditae peucimi ſmaller nation alſo ſtandeth iſtros ſometime moſt mightie citie likewiſe kiovia 〈◊〉 tomi apolloni anchiolo anchialos varna odyſſis beſide many contained within coaſts thracia river donaw danubius hath head neere unto mountaines • • igerwald • • ten walde • c rauraci confine upon border rhetia ſtretched forth wider part world receiving threeſcore river manner navigable scythian ſhore breaketh forth sea ſeven mouthes name carrie interpretation according greeke stoma greeke ſignifieth mouth tongue firſt peuce iſland ſayd ſecond naracuſtoma third calonſtoma fourth pſeudoſtoma fift boreonſtoma ſixt sthenoſtoma farre leſſe reſt ſeventh mightie great one manner meere blacke whole ſea pontus circuit thereof flowing round cloudie freſher ſweeter alſo ſeas yea full ſhallowes ayre thickened oftentimes breathing elevation moiſt vapour congealeth tempered multitude water ruſhing riſeth certaine flat full ſhelves ſandbanks occaſion number ſtreames comming everie way caſt mud heap ſand knowne certaine utmoſt bound ſea fiſhes flocke whole skuls ſholes nooke ocean breed ſhut ſpawne end ſweetneſſe water may holeſomely bring yong frie ſecured devouring whale monſters ſea within hollow place receit verie thicke pontus hath beene time ſeene ſuch onely harmeleſſe dolphin thoſe ſmall coaſt ſoever ſame maine gulfe pontus beaten northeaſt wind froſtie aire ſo throughly frozen congealed neither courſes river ſuppoſed roll underneath yce neither poſſible man beaſt ſet firme footing upon ground ſo unſure ſlipperie fault never taketh hold ſea pure ſelfe mingled river water beene thus carryed ſomewhat farther thought proceed reſt hyſtorie behind chap ix iulianus borne high favour men haſteneth go unto antioch act iourney therefell another occurrent encreaſe heape meaſure theſe preſent joyes verily long time hoped protracted many circumſtances delayes tydings came agilo iovius afterwards treaſure • queſtor defendant aquileia wearied ſo long ſiege advertiſed conſtantius death ſet open gate went forth delivered author thoſe ſturres commotion ſaid party hath beene related afore burnt quicke reſt obtained graunt pardon treſpaſſes iulian verie proud theſe proſperous proceeding carried thought conceit beyond ordinarie compaſſe reach men continual proof trial found unto ruling citie rome peaceably favorable gratious fortune carrying word β cornucopia wealth aboundance preſented unto glo • proſperitie adding moreover unto title victory paſt thus much while held empire alone neither troubled civile commotion home barbarian paſſed beyond owne bound north cold winter bind freeze mightie great ſnowes congealed gathered together theſe afterwards reſolved force exceeding hot sunne turne cloud full liquid flowing humor μ eteſian wind driven south quarter wrung exceſſive heat miniſter plentious increaſe water nilus others opinion occaſion great ſhowers raine abezim alhabas inhabited abyſſ • ne aethiopia report fall aboundantly thoſe tract time parching hot weather ſaid river doth riſe overflow certaine ſet time yeare theſe opinion ſeeme accord truth reported aethiopia either falleth ſhowers elſe verie ſeldome great time betweene another opinion embraced reſt while • forerunning prodro •• wind blow eteſian blaſts together holding continually ſpace fortie five dayes force backe ſtreame reaſon ſwift courſe thus reſtrained ſwelleth wave overflow ſo growing bigger ſtill contrarie ſpirit ſtriveth againe while violent windes beat backe one ſide courſe everrunning ſprings beſides urge forward another riſeth high covereth got ground ſurroundeth open field looketh like ſea king iuba grounding opinion aſſuredly upon found written certaine written c • rthaginians punicke bookes ſheweth ariſeth certaine hill ſtanding kingdomes maro • cho peſſe mauritania overlooketh ocean ſaith upon theſe preſumptions argument opinion ſet foot becauſe like fiſhes hearbs beaſts bred among thoſe mariſhes river nilus running along part aethiopia alſo gone diver name many nation given paſſeth along earth moſt rich exundation commeth length cataract ſay certaine ſteepe broken rock downe hee falleth ſeemeth ruſh rather run whereupon time paſt people inhabiting continuall roaring water much impaired uſe eares became hard hearing forced neceſſitie remove flit higher ground thence paſſing milder courſe ſeven mouthes everie yeeld uſe carrie alſo face ſo many running river ſpreadeth himſelfe aegypt without helpe fortaine water beſide verie many river derived chanell father falling chanels welneere bigge ſeven bee navigable full ſurges unto thoſe writer auncient time given theſe name written wit roſet • heracleoticus sturioni sebenniticus bolbiticus pathniticus damiate nig migni b • n •• ct • l • mendeſius tanes nig cal •• en • bonac • taniticus carabes peluſiacus moreover riſing whence ſaid carried forward mariſhes unto cataract aforeſaid maketh many iſlands whereof ſome ſaid lye ſo farre along water hardly hee leave one behind three dayes ſayling among iſlands bee two great name wit g • guere caſ • • meroë 〈◊〉 delta ſo called better marke diſtinction triangled form greeke letter δ sunne beginneth paſſe ſigne cancer nilus riſeth higher untill courſe libra thus flowing aloft hundred dayes together beginneth afterwards decreaſe ſo hugeneſſe water abated carried ſhips ſheweth field paſſable men horſebacke riſe ſwell overhigh hurtfull unfruitfull otherwiſe flow high ynough exceſſive ſtore water ſtanding ſoking earth long letteth tillage field ſmalneſſe thereof threatneth ſlender barreine corne neither doth holder land wiſh riſe ſixteene cubit high happen flow moderatly ſeed caſt upon land fat ſoyle yeeldeth increaſe diver time threeſcore tenne fold onely river breedeth affoordeth gale wind chap xv furthermore deſcribeth beaſts aegypt well land water among crocodile ichneumon hippopotamus ibis diver serpent alſo temple pyramides aegypt aboundeth alſo many kind beaſts among ſome land others water live land water whereupon named amphibia verily drie ground feed roebuckes bucali biſturitia ridiculous deformed creature monſters booteth recount among water beaſts ſtore crocodile every thoſe tract crocodile miſchievous fourefooted beaſt dangerous vermine uſed water land element without tongue moving upper jaw onely rowes teeth faſhioned like combes ſo whatſoever catched betweene ſame biteth pernitiouſly holdeth faſt layeth egges like thoſe geeſe armed clawes ſo pollex thumbes thereto ſuch ſtrength hath able overturne whole ſhippes alſo reaching otherwhiles tenne cubites length night long keepeth water quietly day time hee feedeth land preſuming boldly skin carrieth ſo ſtrong naturall fence hath upon backe like armour proofe unneth pierced ſtrong ſhot diſcharged engine artillerie ſame wild beaſts notwithſtanding alwayes raging yet become mild leave outragious felneſſe ſpace thoſe ſeven ceremonious holy dayes wherein prieſts memphis celebrate nativitie apis beſide thoſe crocodile die fortu • morte ſuppoſe meaneth manner death violent • occaſioned outward knowne cauſe cōming ſelfe differeth na • urall inward diſeaſe cannot ſee caſualtie ſome burſt aſunder ſoft belly digged underneath fretted certaine hard cruſts growing upon backes beaſts like unto dolphin foreſaid river maintaineth others againe periſh come end manner little pretie bird ξ trochilos while ſeeketh ſome picking ſmall food flying gently lyeth along tickling gombes ſomewhat hard commeth length place neere unto throat water ſerpent • hydrus kind ichneumon ſeeth entieth paſſage mouth made open ſayd bird went gnawne belly torne ſunder vitall bowel breaketh forth crocodile bold beaſt flye yet perceive one venturous ſet upon moſt timorous vpon land hath quicke ſight foure winter moneths ſaid eat meat bee engendred alſo thoſe part water horſes hippopotamus beaſts wanting reaſon moſt wittie ſhaped like horſes cloven houſes ſhort tayles whoſe readie quicke wit ſuffice ſhall ſhew two proofes beaſt made couch among high overgrowne reedes ſtanding thicke together moſt watchfull care looketh ſee coaſts cleere reſt finding time libertie opportunitie goeth forth feed upon ſtanding corne hee beginneth returne b • llie ſtrut full going backward maketh many diſtinct pathes leaſt hunter following direct line one plaine ſtreight way ſhould light upon without difficultie wound death semblably overgreedie eating bellie ſwollen ſo big waxeth unluſtie ſlow upon reed new cut walloweth rolleth thighes legges ſo wounding foot bloud iſſuing forth might make light ſo crammed fed fat ſore raw place fleſh hee daubeth mud untill wound doe cica • rice whole even againe theſe rare beaſts held wonder monſters time people rome ſaw firſt aedileſhip scaurus father scaurus while tully pleadeth commaundeth sardi alſo would together authoritie whole world good opinion noble houſe many age oftentimes brought hither found inhabitant thoſe country doe conjecture forced flit ſo wearie multitude diligence everie much deſiring propagat memoriall empire ſome great workes hee intended exceſſive coſt reedifie ſumptuous ſtately temple time paſt ieruſalem many mortal skirmiſhes aſſaults ſiege veſpaſian firſt titus afterwards layd unto much adoe hardly forced beaten downe gave charge diſpatching buſineſſe ſpeed alypius antioch ſometime beene deputie governor britannie therefore ſayd alypius earneſtly bent upon affaire ruler iudea province ſet helping hand behold certaine fearefull flaming ball fire iſſuing forth neere unto foundation making many terrible aſſaults conſumed ſundrie time workemen made place unacceſſable reaſon element ſtill gave repulſe enterpriſe given ſame time ſent rome unto emperour embaſſadors noble perſonages high birth approved life converſation knowne good ghoſt ſtanders whether want skill upon mind flatter ſaid pretend ſome ſuch accident unto elder two conſuls namely sallustius appeared foreſhewed thereby death approached unto auncient yeares precedent power authoritie beſides theſe ſmaller foretoken likewiſe otherwhiles preſaged happened verie beginning making preparation parthicke expedition word brought conſtantinople ſhaken earthquake skilfull propheticall bookes sybilla commaundement peruſed conſulted rome touching warre plaine anſwer forbad emperour yeare depart owne limit yet among theſe occurrent embaſſadours many nation promiſed ayd liberall entertainment diſpatch ſent home anſwer prince proceeding brave confidence wayes became state rome bee defended helpe ſtrangers whoſe meanes meet ſhould maintaine friend allyes caſe driven upon neceſsitie call crave ſuccour onely arſaces king armenia warned gather puiſſant force together attend pleaſure ſhould quickly know whereto tended hee ought urge ſet forwrd wherefore upon firſt opportunitie might ſtand adviſed conſiderat conſultations making haſt forerunning rumor ſeiſed enemy land midſpring ſent militarie company token watchword giving notice expedition hee commaunded paſſe euphrates knowne hie away ſpeedily wintering harbour croſſed river hyſtorie enſuing ſhall declare diſperſed ſundrie ſtations expected prince comming chap ii departed antioch troubled haunted ſtrange syria ſaid withal man indeed deſerved place ſuch iuſtice meet covetous ſpightfull antiocheans multitude ſorts accompanied departure wiſhing happie journey glorious returne beſeeching thenceforth mild gentle unto anger conceived ſcornfull reproofes reproach yet aſſuaged hee gave rough language ſaying would thenceforth ſee ſaid determined expedition ended returne neerer way tarſus cilicia winter written memorius preſident ſame town thing ſhould put readineſſe fit truth fell indeed long corp brought backe thither ſmall pompe funeral obſequies enterred himſelfe gave order place neere city ſide weather began warme lightſome 5 day • march third day none march tooke voyage uſuall journeyes came hierapolis entred gate moſt ſpatious large citie gallerie left hand ſodainely fell downe beſides number wounded weightie fall tymber peeces tyles cruſhed death fiftie ſouldiers going whence force aſſembled together advanced enſignes meredi • toſt • meſopotamia ſo ſpeedily rumor ran comming thereof taken verie carefull heed hee ſurpriſed aſſyrians unawares end upon bridge ſhips paſſed euphrates armie aid scythian came batne free towne oſdroēna found ſorrowfull token preſaging ill number campe ſlaves ſtood neere unto exceeding high ſtack ſtraw take thence according cuſtome foder maner thoſe country ſuch kind farage mowed while many plucking thereat whole mow ſtacke ſhaken borne downe huge heap fell overwhelmed ſemblable maner fiftie men death departing thence heavie cheere rode apace came carrae auncient towne remarkeable defeature overthrow craſsus roman armie whence two diſtinct high roadwayes leading perſia left hand bo ••• caſtald adiabena tigris right hand aſſyrians euphrates ſtaied certaine dayes provide neceſſaries offer ſacrifice unto moon thoſe tract rite place devoutly worſhipped reported verie altar without admiſſion one thither witneſſe privie ſecretly delivered unto procopius kinſman purple coat armes charged boldly enter upon imperiall dignitie hee underſtood himſelfe ſlaine parthia iulian tooke reſt lay aſleepe mind diſquieted dreames preſaged ſome unfortunat accident follow wherefore himſelfe expounder alſo viſions conſidering preſent occaſions pronounced day following 18 day march foureteenth day kalends aprill ſhould well obſerved knowne afterwards verie ſame night temple apollo palatinus rome while apronianus ruled praefect fire burned good helpe everie ſide come flame fire ſo great conſumed alſo propheticall verſes sybylla force thus ordered diſpoſe made victual everie kind word brought even light horſemen diſcoverers came blowing haſt troups enemy horſe broken certaine limit neere adjoyning forrayed ſodaine driven away booty grievous occurrent adverſe accident much troubled forthwith purpoſed committed unto ſayd procopius charge thirtie thouſand ſelect ſouldiers joyning like cō miſſion sebastian iieutenant generall come come late dux whereby appeareth come higher dignitie dux contrarie practiſe dayes marqueſſe aegypt hee commanded preſent ſhould make abode within tigris vigilant eye place leaſt ſide ſurely guarded obſerved ſome ſodaine unexpected miſchiefe might ariſe oftentimes many ſuch chance ſayd happened gave charge withall conveniently might would joyne king arſaces together marching running campe way corduena moxoena waſted chiliocomus fruitfull tract medium quarter make ſpeed meet himſelfe while yet abode aſſyria readie aſſayes upon everie ſodaine urgent occaſion aſſiſt ordered theſe affayres wiſe himſelfe making ſemblance would goe tigris way hee commaunded alſo nonce bee layed proviſion ſundrie ſorts furniture turned right hand hee paſſed night reſt quietneſſe morning hee called manner 〈◊〉 beaſt ride upon brought unto horſe named babylonius happening ſore vexed ſuddaine gripe wring belly fell downe while hee able endure paine walloweth along happeneth beſprent capariſon ornament richly garniſhed gold pretious ſtones ſtrange ſight tooke great joy cryed applauſe thoſe next baldach caſtald bagda c • ropala • according diver language hath ſundry name babylon fallen lay along ground diſpoyled ornament ſtayed untill luckie propitiatorie ſacrifices hee ratified fortunate token praeſage hee came devana garriſon fortreſſe whence river belias ſpringing poureth ſelfe euphrates well refreſhed body meat came next day callinicum alſo • tel calliniſum ſtrong towne defence rich cheviſance quicke traffique moſt delectable place upon ſixt day calends rome annuverſarie c feaſts ſolemnized great pompe honour mother god chariot carrieth image report waſhed ſtreame dachia neere unto way appia runneth tyber almon auncient manner performed ſacred ſolemnitie hee tooke reſt quietly ſlept night whereupon hee conceived much joy contentment morrow next enſuing departed thence edge river bankes ſtreame big occaſion brooke conflowing thither every ſide marching warlike ſort force armed weaponed tooke ſtation abode tent potentate prince saracenes humbly upon knee preſenting unto crowne gold honoured lord world nation gladly received men meet warlike brigandize robberie while communication behold arrived flet comparable armado moſt puiſſant king xerxes conduct constantianus tribune lucillianus lieutena •• come tooke moſt ſpacious river euphrates ſo hardly able receive wherein thouſand ſhippes burthen framed diver piece timber bringing aboundance victual ſtore caſtingweapons engine artillerie meet ſiege aſſault fiftie warreſhippes beſides many neceſſarie joyning together making bridge chap iii curious exact deſcription certaine warlike engine meet ſiege aſsault vpon occaſion put mind briefely ſo farre foorth meane wit ſerve ſhew deſcription theſe kind inſtrumens ſake ignorant thereof firſt declare forme faſhion baliſta betweene two plank ſet frame faſt joyned ſtrong big yron reaching length manner good great rule ſquire roundbodie whereof middeſt finely artificially made lyeth foorth farther foureſquare beame ſpire made hollow direct ſtreight paſſage narrow riggall trough faſtened hard many cord wrythen twiſted ſinewes thereto two wooden skrewes moſt fitly joyned neere unto one ſtandeth baliſtier himſelfe expert artificiall workeman cunningly beſtoweth hollow paſſage beame tiller ſhaft wood big head glewed faſt done two luſtie tall young men nimbly turne wind deſcription content ſee figure others veget ••• noti ••• wheeles one ſide ſharpe head ſhaft come upmoſt end ſtrings ſinewes aforeſaid goeth ſhaft forcible ſtrength within forth baliſta quickly flieth ſight otherwhiles ſparkling exceeding heat catcheth ſwift flight oftentimes happeneth dart ſeene body feeleth painfull mortall wound scorpion call onager forme thereof two plankes hewen oke helme thoſe ſomewhat curbed ſo may ſeeme beare ſtand backes theſe manner serratoria machinae sawmachine tied faſt together bored ſides good wide hole hole ſtrong rope tied keeping whole frame together flye ſtart aſunder midſt theſe rope riſeth forth beame wood overthwart faſhion yoke ſpire tiller erected tied cord ſtrings ſuch meaſures gage may ſet let downe lower top thereof joyned yron hooke hangeth ſlingſocket tow yron piece wood lyeth huge great bouttriſſe ſupporter even hayrecloth ſtuffed full ſmall ſtraw chaffe faſtened thereto ſtrong binding planted upon turfes heaped together elſe banke raiſed raw brick ſuch mightie engine beeing ſet upon wall ſtone forceth aſunder breaketh ever findeth weight violent ſhake giveth therefore come point skirmiſh fight round ſtone put ſling foure luſtie young men one ſide unfolding barres whereto rope incorporate draw backe ſtyle ſtandard hooke ſo length maſter engine ſtanding aloft giving mightie ſtroke hammer ſetteth open rayles containe binding whole worke whereupon ſtandard libertie quicke ſtroke hitting againſt ſoft hairecloth aforeſaid hurleth ſtone batter whatſoever way verily called tormentum unfolding whirled hurled scorpion becauſe ſtanding upright hath ſharpe pricke unto alſo moderne time hath impoſed name onager wild aſſe regard wild aſſes courſed hunter fling heeles ſtones afarre behind back ſo pierce breaſts follow chaſe breake skuls head daſh braines hence proceed ram choice made high firre wild aſh one end whereof ſhod hard plate yron long ſhaped front like unto ram forme gave name engine battering piece thus hanged overthwart plankes ſides yron hoopes another piece timber held balance ſame according meaſure length thereof permit number men driving backe thruſt forward againe breake whatſoever ſtandeth againſt mightie ſtrokes maine jurres manner armed man commeth upon one giveth aſſault manifold puſhes whereof violent force thunderbolt comming fro building rent made cleave chawne yea joynts wals ſhaken loſened fall downe kind worke driven backe maine greekes name helepolis meanes long uſe whereof demetrius ſonne antigonus given aſſault unto rhodes city called poliorcetes built manner mightie teſtudo frame made ſtrengthened long piece timber fitted place burneth ſame water caſt ſprinckled upon hoter fire cauſeth neither remedie allay quench rage thereof flinging duſt upon thus much touching peeces ordnance wall ſome beene ſhewed returne orderly courſe hyſtorie chap iiii iulianus ſetting nought letter praefect gaule paſseth perſia plucketh bridge take away hope ſouldiors returne againe wearied adverſe prodigy while soothſayers naturaliſts barbarian ſet ordaine inward limit leaſt perſians might raunge syria within yeres chaunced great detriment damage province happened antioch ſtill ſilent ſolemne ſtageplayes dauncing buffon tregetour yonder perſians whereat whole multitude turning head backe decline avoid dart came flying thicke eares diſperſed every way thus enemy burnt citie hewed number piece time peace ſtragled abroad loſely pleaſures fired alſo waſted village place bordering upon loaden booty pillage returned home without receiving hurt burnt traitor marea • e quicke without good adviſement led forth death owne countreymen fortuned verily dayes gallienus iulian while ſtayeth cercuſium end bridge ſhips aboras armie traine following might paſſe received letter nothing pleaſed sallustius praefect gaule prayed expedition againſt parthian might put earneſtly beſought hee would thus haſtily unſeaſonably plunge himſelfe irrevocable danger deſtruction yet obtained grace favour god howbeit rejecting advertiſement moſt ſage wiſe counſellor hee boldly advaunced forward ſtill never power proweſſe man able merit prevaile ſo much fatall order deſtinies preſcribed muſt need take effect forthwith paſſed adviſed wel otherwiſe wherefore plucke heart beſeech bee reſolute ſay preſume much thoſe ſhall together u ſame ſort equall meaſure undergoe daungerous ſervice ſoever ſhall occurre making account first king riſing encreaſe ſcituation limit thereof forced courſe ſtorie devolved thus far way quick digreſſion ſhew ſite perſia hath bin curiouſly deſcribed geographer verie thoſe hardly delivered truth whereas diſcourſe ſhall fall ſomewhat long availe perfect knowledge thing whoſoever hee bee narration unknowne matter affecteth much brevitie ſeeketh ſo much ſhould verie plainely declare ought indeed overpaſſed kingdome time paſt ſmall ſuch cauſes oft related called time many name time alexander great taken away untimely death babylon became ſubject arſaces parthian man obſcure parentage preferred rule kingdome unleſſe hee bee line race arſaces yea every civile brawle contention dayly happen among one avoideth leſſe ſacriledge lay violent hand upon deſcended arſaces beare armes scythian moſt eagre revenge g ſonnes diſcomfited put hoſt ſword time darius afterwards xerxes altering uſe element invaded greece force manner well land ſea quite defeated themſelves could hardly find meanes eſcape ſafetie ſay nothing alexander magnus alexandrine warres teſtament whole nation transferred government one ſucceſſor affaire thus atchieved long time paſſed conſuls government afterward state reduced power caeſars thoſe nation waged warre u ſometimes went wayes even hand otherwhiles loſſe ſometimes againe victorie ſet downe ſituation place therein ſummarily briefely reaſon permit theſe country lying largely ſpread length breadth environ every ſide perſian gulfe ſo full iſlands ſo famous ſo much frequented mouthes ſea report ſo narrow cabo laſquette ortel harmozonta cape promontorie cherman carmania unto another ſtandeth againſt inhabitant call mace man may kenne without impeachment ſtraits one paſſed open ſea ſpreadeth ſelfe exceeding wide men uſe ſayle directly farre citie balfero ortel teredon many downefals euphrates drowned ſea whole gulfe man meaſure along ſhore whole ſpace wrought round turner brake taketh circuit twentie thouſand ſtadia upon coaſts ſides wherof ſtand town village thicke yea frequent paſſage fro ſhipping therefore yee ſayled foreſaid ſtraits yee come gulfe armenia lying eaſt certaine diſtance betweene occaſioned necke iſthm land openeth bay gulfe south named cantichus farre whence another tearme chalites sunneſetting number iſles paſſed knowne joyne upon indian ocean ſea firſt others entertaineth fervent heat sunne riſing beeing ſelfe alſo exceeding hote according geographer penne hath card made draught manner whole circuit aforeſaid parcel divided north pole caſpian ſtraits confineth upon caduſij many nation scythian arimaſpi men one eye ſavage south ſide meeteth armenian mountaine niphates alſo albanes ſeated aſia red ſea arabian scenitae poſteritie enſuing named saracenes south point overlooketh meſopotamia lyeth afront oppoſite eaſt ſtretcheth river gangan caſta •• cantan merca ••• gualgas theveto ganges cutting middeſt indian land diſcharged south ſea chap vii region thereof praefects ruler wonder nature city ſheweth contained within whole compaſſe perſia theſe country greateſt name thoſe ruled vitaxae captaines horſemen king prince tearmed satrapae thoſe leſſer ſort ſo many number difficult needleſſe piece worke recount namely adriu • n • gr diverſly named ſundry geographer aſſyria cu nigr suſiana cordini haithon • servan caſtald medium farſi mercator pharſic theveto petſis arach mercator parthia cherman n • g turqueſtan gitav carmania greater diargument mercator hyrach erythr •• hyrcania ieſelbas caſtald margiana caraſſ • n caſtald batter ram • ſio bactriani maurenha •• mercator sogdiani sa nigr theſe three country laſt named marius niger compriſe • h tartaria zagathea sacae part cathaia scythia lying beyond mountaine emodus magbali caſtald emodes cambal • gir •• serica sernere mer •• aria turk ga • reporteth gemiſtius pletho paropamiſſadae segiſtan segaſtan mercator n • gr drangiana cheſimur merc arachoſia geſt mercator gedroſia next unto u ſide reſt noble aſſyria well peopled much frequented greatneſſe alſo compaſſe fruitfulneſſe many wayes moſt wealthie lyen time paſt ſpread large country territory full plenteous withall grew one name called aſſyria among abundance berry vulgar fruit groweth h bitumen neere unto lake named soſingites whoſe belly channell tigris ſwallowed running ground hath gone great way ariſeth appeareth engendred naphtha clammie glutinous like unto pitch alſo reſembleth bitumen upon little bird ſettle ſhe looſeth flight ſinketh downe drowned quite ſight kind liquor beginneth one catch fire man wit able deviſe meanes ſave onely duſt quench put theſe territory likewiſe ſeene gaping hole within ground whence exhaleth deadly breath vapour ſtrong ſmell ſent whereof killeth living creature ſoever ſtandeth neere unto noyſome peſtilent vapor ariſing forth certaine deepe pit paſſed wide mouth thereof walmed higher cauſed contagiouſneſſe thereof ground lying round inhabitable like hole unto ſome report ſeene heretofore hierapolis phrygia ſemblable ſort hurtfull ſpirit aire iſſuing continuall ſmell yeelded killed whatſoever came neere unleſſe guelded cauſe might accident referre reaſons may made naturall fountaine running forth poole ſwelling big abundance water drinking himſelfe againe yet never ſurroundeth bankes neere unto circuit part aſſyria called auncient time botan caſtald adiabena long uſe many like unto ſhew name theſe three onely moſt glorious greateſt note wit baldach caſtald babylon wals whereof semiramis layd bitumen tower citadell thereof moſt auncient king belus built dakia gaule infected place contagion bred much mortalitie hard lyeth chaldaean countrey nourice auncient philoſophie themſelves report among truth divination credit propheſies firſt ſhone foorth gave light chap viii river perſia greater note many tract therein magi wonderous medicinable oyle moreover run theſe ſame land nobler river others theſe named alſo marſyas naarmalcha mentioneth afterward ſignifieth much king river together euphrates paſſeth carrying three channel ſtreames navigable runneth round iſlands induſtrie husbandman watereth corne ground maketh ſame pliable plough meet alſo breeding wood grove vpon theſe tract joine suſiani many townes among suſtra caſtald suſa holdeth head beene many time ſeat habitation king likewiſe arſiana sela arecha reſt ſmall obſcure beſide many warres deemed among right happie ſpendeth life battaile ſuch depart otherwiſe caſuall naturall death rayle revile baſe perſons meere coward vpon theſe eaſt south ſide bound happie arabian ſo tearmed although hath ſtore city well 〈◊〉 mediterranean maritime abound plenteous field vale yet theſe hath greateſt ſtate reſt wit geapolis naſcus baraba likewiſe nagara mephra taphron dioſcurias moreover name reſt sagareus saganis hydriacus city alſo although number yet fare apparell paſſing full rich among carmania mother carryeth brave ſhew ſo doth ortoſpana alſo alexandria hermupolis travaile ooke byplace bred ſolitarie life diſperſed great way ſunder uſed live upon homely poore food verily bee ſundrie nation habit theſe tract reckon making haſt doe matter thinke ſuperfluous yet thus much would knowne among theſe nation unacceſſable manner reaſon exceeding rigour roughneſſe countrey ſome men mild kind namely laxartae galactophagi poet homer maketh mention verſe 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſay galactophagi people live eating milke abij among violence beareth ſway regard food life moſt righteous men moreover among many riuers theſe land nature either joyneth greater courſe afterward draweth sea much talke roemnus iaxartes talicus theſe nation knowne three city aſpabota cauriana saga chap xi likewiſe seres ariani paropamiſſadae drangiani arachosij gedrosij teyond theſe place scythia one full upon eaſt climat top high hill linked chaine compaſſe within round circle one would ſay seres plentifull large country much eſteemed weſt ſide joyne upon scythian north eaſt bound upon ſnowie wilderneſſe southward lye farre india ganges ſame mountaines ſaid called aria nazavitium aſmira emodus opurocarra playne therefore environed everie ſide ſteepe downefall theſe land
