syzyges chardi ly open full upon northerne wind froſts rabannae aſmirae eſſedones nobleſt moſt famous face sunneriſing unto weſt part joyne atharae aſparatae betae bending toward high mountaines south much renowmed city though many yet great wealthie whereof aſmira eſſedon aſparata pherae moſt beautifull beſt knowne people themſelves meane seres live quietly without uſe armes time without triall battailes reſt ſtayed peaceable men delectable none neighbour troubleſome temperature weather among pleaſant holeſome conſtitution aire cleere pure blowing gentle wind moſt commodious wood pretie ſtore light within whence people much ſprinckling water ſoftening tree yeeld bring forth like unto certaine fleece kembe moſt fine tender matter mixed kind downe liquid ſubſtance ſpinning thred hereof make ſilke ſerving uſe nobilitie gentrie time baſeſt ſort alſo without difference reſpect themſelves others moſt frugall lover ſtill quiet life ſhunning company mortall men ſtrangers paſſed river buy thread ſome commodity without ſpeech fro price ware ſet forth ſale eſteemed onely eye ſo void covetouſneſſe delivering forth thing grow bred among themſelves buy nothing brought country beyond seres live ariani ſubject cold boreae preciſely northweſt wind northren wind whoſe land runneth river named aria ſufficient beare ſhips maketh huge lake carrying likewiſe ſame name moreover ſelfeſame region scrnere mercator turqueſtan pineto aria hath number townes among theſe much reſorted unto great name bitaxa orbitana sotera niſibis alexandria whence thouſand five hundred ſtadia ſayling caſpian ſea next unto theſe place ſeated paropamiſſadae eaſt ſide look toward indian caucaſus weſt themſelves alſo enclining breach end hils whoſe countrey runneth river ortogordomaris bigger reſt ariſeth bactriani theſe people alſo ſome city among famous gazaca naulibis ortoſpana whence man ſayle along ſhore unto bound medium next lying caſpia portae ſhall find two thouſand two hundred ſtadia vnto nation aforeſaid joyne drangiani linked together hils goe denomination arabian becauſe deſcended among townes vaunt much twaine prophthaſia ariaſpe rich indeed highly renowmed next overagainſt arachoſia ſheweth ſelfe bending toward right ſide lying juſt upon indian river much leſſe though ariſing indu caſtald hijnd nig • indus greateſt others whence thoſe country tooke name watereth plentifully maketh mariſh named arachotoſcrene alſo among baſe city alexandria arbaca choaſpa moſt inland part perſis lyeth gedroſia right hand reaching border indian made fruitfull river artabius beſide ſmaller ſtreame barbitane mountaines end foot bottome whereof ſpring river intermingle water indus looſing owne name regard greater alſo city among theſe city beſide iſlands sedraſyra gyn • con li • en 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 woman eſteemed better reſt leaſt therefore while ſhewing particular bayes along maritime coaſt flow hard upon border perſis ſhould wander overfarre purpoſe ſufficient ſhall bee thus much ſay ſea paſſing along caſpian mountaines north ſide unto ſtraits aforeſaid reckoned containe nine thouſand ſtadia south ſide mouthes river nylus unto frontier entrance carmania meaſure foureteene thouſand ſtadia chap xii body perſians manner lawes art well peace warre decking trimming eſpecially pearle touching breeding nature whereof briefe diſcourſe among theſe ſo many diſſonant nation people alſo place diverſe ſundrie ſorts deſcribe generall body manner manner ſlender lanke ſomewhat blacke ſwart paliſh colour eye looking grim thoſe goat doe browes bending like unto halfe circle doe meet wearing beard unſeemely ſhag haire head long one another indifferently even meat upon feaſtivall holydayes ſeene ſwords ſides ancient manner greek athenian firſt layed away thucydides moſt ſufficient author recordeth moſt wont exceſſively bee given unto fleſhly luſt hardly contenting themſelves number concubine cannot skill unnaturall abuſe boyes every man according wealth contracteth marriage fewer whereupon among love affection diſtracted diſperſed ſo ſundrie luſts child cold dull eſchew leſſe bane plague exquiſite fare laviſh expence table eſpecially greedie deſire drinking neither amongſt ſetting aſide king boord ſet dinnertime every man bellie dyall clocke ſtrikes fall whatſoever come next hand neither doth man hath ſatisfied hunger engorge ſuperfluous meat wonderfull • ee ſtrait laced carefull warie while paſſe among enemy hortyards vineyard neyther deſire touch ought feare poyſon witchcraft ſorcerie ſecret art hardly ſeene perſian either ſtands making water goeth aſide eaſe bellie ſo preciſely declineth theſe buſineſſes like kind feare ſhame ſo diſſolute looſeneſſe joynts wandering pace keepe ſuch flinging themſelves jetting gate man would take meere effeminate whereas indeed moſt fierce warrior rather wylie cunning ſlight hardie manly fight afarre terrible full vaine word ſpeaking braineſicke wild manner big boaſters ſhrewd miſchievous given threat alike adverſitie proſperitie craftie prowd cruell challenging taking upon power life death ſervants meaner ſort alſo common people flay skin men alive either peecemeale whole neither lawfull ſervant among waiteth ſtandeth table open mo • th ſpe •• e ſpit ſo muzzeled bound lip prickly ſharpe pointed skinnes lawes mightily feared among ſeveritie rigour thoſe exceed enacted againſt unthankfull perſons traiterous revolt others deteſtable abhorred vertue whereof offence one man kinred muſt die ſit judgement decide controverſies ſuch appointed worldly experience tried approoved integritie alſo little nothing need counſell others whereupon laugh cuſtome otherwhiles ſetteth eloquent orator moſt learned common lawes backe unlearned iudges prompt another iudge forced ſit upon skin iudge condemned unjuſtice wrong eyther fained tale deviſed thoſe old time auncient received cuſtome hath end put practiſe militarie furniture diſcipline continuall flouriſhes encamping uſing armour weapon oftentimes deſcribed dreadfull even greateſt army boldly confidently preſuming upon proweſſe cavallerie ſervice nobilitie gentrie gallant labour ſweat againe footman covered manner theſe swordfencers tearmed mermillones doe commaundements like baſe campeſlaves ſort theſe follow evermore awarded perpetuall ſlaverie neither relieved time wage rewarded gift nation hath put yoke ſubjection much people otherwiſe beſides thoſe whome fully ſubdued ſo bold ſo throughly trained exerciſed martiall feat continually held occupied troubled warres either civile forraine moſt part ſo clad garment ſame glittering ſundrie lightſome bright colour although leave lap ſides unſowne looſe ſhaken puffes wind yet nothing ſeene uncovered crowne head ſhooes ſubdued india vanquiſhed croeſus uſed weare bracelet ouches jewel gold precious ſtones alſo pearle eſpecially occaſioned matter ſo requiring deliver ſome word ſuccinctly touching generation gem ſtone among indian perſians found theſe pearles within ſtrong bright ſhels ſeafiſhes conceived certaine time yeare commixtion deaw theſe ſhellfiſhes deſirous engender certaine humor often yawning gaping catch influence ſprinckling moone hereupon conceived great young bring forth two three little one pearles called vniones little ſhels land otherwhiles delivered one apeece ſame bigger ſize good proofe argument young frie may ſo tearme pearles hoth bred fed rather ſome influence skie ayre food ſea doth yeeld becauſe drop morning deaw infuſed drſtilling upon ſame maketh bright round ſtones evening deawes cauſe contrariwiſe ſoft fluxible yellow reddiſh yea otherwhiles full ſpots faſhioned falleth diverſly either verie ſmall great according qualitie draught take deaw oftentimes ſo ſhaken theſe ſhell fiſhes feare flaſhie lightening become emptie bring forth • eeble young one leaſtwiſe ſome abortive defect ſlip run fiſhing hard catching dangerous price alſo high reaſon ſhunning ſome thinke ſhores woont much haunted reaſon fiſhermen lay wait lurke cloſe rockes hole seadogges keepe conclude ignorant kind gem engendred gotten noukes creckes brittiſh ſea alſo although like worth thoſe india xxiiii booke chap iulianus vadeth perſia moſt puiſſant armie anatha ſurrendred unto romane armie ſore troubled tempeſtuous whirlewinds ſinking certaine ſhips laden corne ivlianus aſſured army cheerefull readineſſe one uniforme heat uſuall crie affirmed invincible prince could vanquiſhed thinking verily make end betimes whole enterpriſe exploit taken reſt ſleepe night commaundeth trumpet ſound march ſo provided beforehand furniture mean painefull difficulty warre required time faire day light entred march aſſyria brave ſpirit others riding gallantly band ſquadrons incenſed emulation performe part valour fortitude noble leader throughly grounded experience inſtructions fearing leaſt ſtrangeneſſe place ſhould intercepted ſecret traines ambuſhments began march foureſquare battailons verily thouſand five hundred light horſemen appointed outrider goe ſoftly pacing way warily eye ſides likewiſe afront enemie might unwares breake ruſh upon himſelfe conduct middeſt infanterie ſtrength whole power gave commaundement right hand certaine legion leading nevita ſhould paſſe along bankes river euphrates left wing together cavallarie committed unto arintheus ormiſda led thick cloſe together plaine field eaſie wayes dagalaiphus together victor secundinus hindmoſt marque oſdruena conducted rereguard end might ſtrike terror feare greater multitude unto enemy haply ſhould • ally forth place eſpie farre ſo enlarged rankes diſplayed forth length horſes men taile armie almoſt ten myles diſtant front formoſt enſigne bearer ſtratagem marvellous polilicie skill oftentimes report practiſed pyrrhus noble king epirots captain moſt skilfull encamping place yeelded beſt advantage ſpreading alſo purpoſe making leſſe ſhew armie whereſoever came might eſteemed many pack campeſlaves follower attendant ſervitors campe unmeet fight together kind carryages beſtowed betwixt ſides company marched forward leaſt wanted protection ſuch convoy might ſome ſodaine violence carried forcibly away oftentimes chanceth fleet although paſſed along river many winding crooked reach continnally turned ſuffered either lag behind make ſpeed thus therefore gone two dayes journey wee came dora citie forlorne unpeopled ſcituat upon verie ſide river place happened upon many heards ſtagges whereof ſome ſhot bodie caſting weapon others knocked downe brained weightie ore fed u gave u fill moſt uſed ſwimme paſſed ſwift ſtreame ran away could ſtayed eſcaped unto knowne wood wilderneſſe thence wee gone fortie eaſie dayes journey forward evening came lucillianus lieutenant want prince haply ſe • ſervice skill ſent thouſand light appointed ſouldiers embarqued win fort anatha others moſt part watered round river euphrates according commandement direction given diſperſed ſhips place convenient beſet ſaid wherein anatha ſtood iſland conſidering miſtie darke night ſhadowed ſecret enterpriſe aſſault intended day brake indeed became light one gone fetch water diſcovering ſodainly enemy ſet lowd howling crie whereby rayſed defendant peece cauſed tumultuous noyſe arme anone emperour himſelfe verie high totehill barbican viewed ſcituation ſayd pyle fortification right ſpeedily helpe two ſhips paſſeth river many veſſels followed behind carryed engine peeces ordance batterie time approaching wall conſidered could aſſault skirmiſh without many daungers partly gentle word part rough ſpeeches threatning language moved defendant yeeld calling ormiſda parley induced faire promiſe othes tooke much perſuaded roman clemencie length driving oxe decked coronet token embracing peace came humble maner forthwith fortreſſe wholly burnt puſeus captain thereof marqueſſe aegypt advanced honourable place tribune reſt wife child houſhold good ſent poore ſimple array chalcis citie syria among theſe certaine ſouldior beene left ſicke theſe part maximianus time paſt forcibly invaded frontier perſia man verie prime flower youth ſaid himſelfe wedded many wife according guiſe nation farre ſtepped yeares ſtooping age numerous progenie much rejoicing principall counſellor perſuaded betraying ſurrender fort brought province affirming conſtantly witneſſes long ſince hee foreknew foretold came poynt hundred yeres old ſhold enterred roman ground done saracene foreriders preſented unto moſt joyfull prince certain enemy ſide ſent back againe performe like ſervice morrow fell ſhrewd miſchaunce roſe certaine tempeſtuous wind raiſing many whirle puffes ſhuffeled together made ſuch confuſion among place harbour ſhelture many pavilion fell downe number ſouldiors layd along eyther backes groveling wind would ſuffer hold footing ſure verie ſame day happened another accident leſſe perillous occaſion ſodainely river overflowed bank certain ſhips uſed bring corne drowned reaſon ſcluces floudgates made ſtone worke let reſtraine water uſed water field plucked away whether chanced ſome treacherous practiſe violence ſtreame could never knowne chap ii anatha burnt ſtanding corne together country ſheds • ovels conſumed alſo garriſons certain caſtles vaine aſſayled armie ſetteth fire diacira ozogardana ranſacked left emptie skirmiſh betweene perſians roman citie firſt raſed burnt captive ſent away army carried aſſured hope confidence lowd voyces ſhewed favour good bare prince ſuppoſing verily thenceforth heavenly providence would aſſiſtant unto country unknowne ſuſpicious care ſecret hidden practiſes much feared wily ſleights nation ſundrie deviſes delude deceive wherefore emperour one marching vauntguard enſignes another buſie leading rereward company nymble skirmiſhers lightly appointed ſearched ſcoured rough place ful ſhrubs vallyes leaſt ſome ſecret ambuſh ſhould lye hidden within reſtrayning withal either way affabilitie faire language naturally threat thoſe ſouldiors even licentiouſly raſhly would ſtraggle fro afarre yet permitted enemy field rich kind fruit together ſtanding corne cottage ſet fire everie man gathered neceſſarie proviſion himſelfe great aboundance meanes life health enemy wounded ere knew fighting men tooke much pleaſure make uſe gotten owne right hand ſuppoſing found garner vertue valour rejoycing plentifull ſtore mean alſo maintain ſuch accident performed came ſtrong fortreſſe caſtle named thilutha ſcituat mids river place mounting certaine mightie high top naturall ſtrength fenced round worke man hand inhabitant whereof gentle meanes ſolicited ſurrender meet rough craggie height thereof force armes imprenable ſaid plainely unſeaſonable overtimely revolt thus farre forth gaged anſwer roman marching forward ſhould become maſters inland part alſo follower tayle kingdome would joine conqueror ſhips paſſed along cloſe verie wals modeſt kind quietneſſe without ſtir viewed paſſed fort come another ſtrong hold named achaiacala ſame entrenched courſe river difficult paſſage acceſſe alſo unto repelled wee like anſwer ſo departed morrow caſtles pyle abandoned inhabitant reaſon weake wall ſet fire paſſe beyond next two dayes following marched two hundred ſtadia wee came place called baraxmalcha whence wee croſſed river enter diacira ſtanding ſeven mile citie voyd inhabitant full corne fine white ſalt wherein ſaw temple ſeated upon citadell bearing loftie head citie wee burned put ſome woman ſword found alſo paſſed certain fountain iſſueth plentie bitumen ſeized towne ozogardana likewiſe inhabitant forſooke feare armic comming toward towne ſhewed • ight tribunall traian emperour conſumed towne alſo fire allowed ſelves two dayes refreſhing body toward latter end night followed two dayes surena potentat among perſians high place dignitie deſerts next king one named malechus podoſaces chiefe phylarch •• tribune saracenes aſſanitae notorious brigand maner crueltie long time committed ou • rage march could waded firſt appearing daylight enemy within view time beene ſight glittering bright helmet terribly clad ſtiffe ſtubborne jack ſouldiors eagre fight ſharply ſet give battaile charged upon right valiantly albeit bent bowes mightie ſtrength brightneſſe ſwords weapon glittering againe beene ynough encreaſe roman yet anger gave ſuch edge unto valour covered • ence targuets ſhields couched thicke cloſe together empeached ſo could diſcharge ſhoot arrow chap iii armie paſſeth naarmalcha king river beſiegeth alſo aſſaulteth pyriſabora large populous towne ovr ſouldiors encouraged emboldned ſo good beginning came ſmall towne named macepracta wherein ſeene remaines ruinat wall old time ſtretching great length reported fence aſſyria inrodes invaſions hence one arme river divided large ſtreame leading inward tract babylonia ſerve field countrey village city lying round another named naarmalcha way interpretation king river runneth along cteſiphon verie firſt entra • ce whereof riſeth paſſing high tower maner pharus b • aunch river footman paſſed upon bridge wiſely warily placed horſemen armes together beaſts ſwam ſtreame river ſo much milder becauſe runneth crooked courſe others charged ſodainely volley enemy ſhot auxiliary gone forth moſt lightly appointed ſpeedie footmanſhip followed hard upon neck chaſe ran away laid along ground ſeiſed tearing peeces beene foules exploit likewiſe gloriouſly atchieved came pyriſabora large populous citie fenced round trench rampier like iſland vnder wall plot whereof ſeated emperour riding warineſſe circumſpection began ſiege feare onely would drive towneſmen mind making defence beene oft dealt withal way parle could man brought yeeld either promiſes threatnings began give aſſault ſo environing wall three • old circle courſe armed men firſt day night began maintained skirmiſh ſhot diſcharging peeces againſt defendant whoſe courage ſtrength behind ſpreading wide everie ſide bulwark large haireclothes keep violent force another ſerve liniaments proportion everie lim part bodie ſure armour proofe covered whole man howſoever ſundrie time craved earneſtly conference ormiſd • borne bred among prince beſide bloud royall yet ſooner came toward reviled railed opprobrious tearmes diſloyall traytor revolter thus moſt part day ſpent trifling cavillations verie beginning ſtill darke night advanced forward engine many faſhions deepe trench began filled laied even defendant wiſely beholding thing full daylight alſo forcible violent puſh ram thirled hole cornertower leaving duple wall citie put themſelves within repaſt namely surena perſian tribu •• commaunder come unawares ſet upon three troupe part foreriders ſlaine among thoſe tribune laid along dead tooke away one banner forthwith moved great fit anger ſped himſelfe apace companie armes weapon hand haſt made wrought moſt ſafetie diſcomfited ſaid brigand put ſhamefull foyle two tribune left alive caſſed diſcharged militarie oath ſlouthfull lazie coward ten thoſe ſouldiors ran away condemned ſuffer death following herein lawes auncient diſcipline conclude citie hath beene ſayd burnt downe ſtanding upon tribunall raiſed purpoſe hee called together armie hee given thankes hee exhorted exploit like act thenceforth promiſed hundred ſilver e denier apeece perceiving chafed readie mutinie ſo ſmall niggardly promiſe himſelfe growing alſo indignation yet full gravitie behold quoth perſians flowing abundance plentie thing wealth nation able enrich u caſe one heart accord beare ſelves manfully romane commonwealth trust truly infinite rich become exceeding poore even thoſe fill owne purſes perſuaded emperours returne home peace ſavages barbarous bought gold treaſurie state hereby ſore layed upon city drawne drie province wasted ſelfe neither wealth uphold kinred backe deſcended though noble parentage onely heart feareleſse neither ſhall ſhame emperour repoſeth good furniture mind profeſſe honeſt povertie fabricius alſo poore houſehold good rich honour glorie managed moſt dangerous warres theſe thing may abundantly yee devoid feare demeane ſelves mildly following wiſe guidance direction god ſelfe ſo farre foorth humane reaſon doth require yee goe reſiſt authoritie turning againe diſhonourable preſidents ſeditions old time goe hardly doe ſo ſtill part becommeth emperour noble commaunder run race performed ſo many brave courſes alone die ſtanding foot readie contemne life mine ſome little fever bereave leaſtwiſe go wayes leave field lived ſo may one day become private perſon howbeit glorie reioyce u moſt report iulian armie refreſhed commeth euphrates divided many branch neere unto maiozamalcha privily aſſailed ten perſians notwithſtanding great danger life eſcaped ſafetie modeſt ſpeech emperours carrying current betweene courteſie ſeveritie ſouldiors time appeaſed putting greater confidence expectation better matter promiſing tractable obedient extolled heaven authoritie highneſſe ſpirit ſaid truly heart love wont ſmall noyſe ſhewed declared returned againe tent according ſtore preſent would affoord hee refreſhed himſelfe food reſt night manner iulian animate armie ſwearing evermore ſuch thing deere unto great exploit affaire begun example might hee ſubdue perſians might repaire ſhaken eſtate roman empire like reported traian otherwhiles hee woont bind word promiſes ſuch oathes theſe may ſee dacia reduced forme province may paſſe ister euphrates upon bridge many ſuch like word ſay paſſed foureteene myles forward wee came certaine place abundant overflow water enricheth field maketh plentifull way perſians informed would goe plucked floudgates ſuffered water flow ſpread abroad reaſon therefore ground ſtood ſtanding poole ſecond day emperour giving ſouldiors reſt went forth himſelfe many floored bridge made f leather bougets ſhips ſupported pyle alſo hewen log plankes date tree much difficultie tranſported armie theſe country many field planted vine ſundrie ſorts fruitfull tree date tree wont grow take great deale ground reaching manner mightie forreſts farre adiabene botan caſtaldo meſene great mediterranean ſea ortel levant ſea according spaniard sea way ſoever man goeth ſeeth continually branch palmetrees date hanging thereupon fruit tree aboveſaid made plentie honey wine touching date tree themſelves ſaid maried wedded one another alſo ſexes may eaſily diſcerned reported moreover female annointed ſeed male doe conceive beare yea report delight mutuall love appeareth hereby doe bend head leane one againſt another ſo puffing blaſts wind turned another way caſe female according uſuall manner ſo beſmeared ſeed male ſhe looſeth abortive defect untimely fruit well knowne tree female love ſtocke ſtem beſmeared ointment thereof tree naturally conceiveth ſweet odour ſo theſe token bewrayed certainetie generation food armie repleniſhed plentifully paſſed many iſlands afraid want ſcarcitie feared fulneſſe ſurfeit well emperour end aſſayled covertly enemy archer yet without revenge againe drew neere place greater part euphrates divideth ſelfe many river diver ſundrie ſtreames tract citie low wals thereof abandoned iewes ſouldiors anger ſet fire done emperour marched ſtill greater courage confidence thinking hee aſſiſted gracious helpe divine power come otherwiſe called bithra zo • ••• majozamalcha great citie encircled ſtrong wall pitched downe tent carefully provided campe might troubled ſuddain rode perſians horſemen valour puiſſance whereof champian open ground wonderouſly dread nation taken order guarded ſome light went ten perſians armed paſſing cloſely knee bottome cliffes ſuddainely great violence charged upon men two eſpying emperour himſelfe evident ſeen knowne rich apparell drawne ſwords layd lifting broad ſhield warded blowes ſure fence thereof himſelfe brave bold reſolution ran one ſword ſide many ſtroke wound given ſlaine guard aforeſaid reſt whereof ſome hurt ran away ſo diſarmed deveſted thoſe twaine brought backe companion ſafetie returned ſpoyles unto campe great joy received g torquatus tooke enemie laid along coller gold h valerius ſirnamed afterwards corvinus help defence ra •• n foule overcame moſt bold bragging gaule theſe brave exployts commended unto poſteritie envie glorie yet would noble worthy act regiſtred alſo auncient record chap vi ſiege maiozamalcha enterpriſed begun name title higheſt dignitie next unto king surena great commaunder enemy ſet upon beaſts grazed date tree grove cohort appointed drive backe welcomed ſlaughter ſome ſo went wayes without effect inhabitant two city ſtand iſlands environed round river ſome upon confidence owne ſtrength haſtily betooke themſelves c • eſiphon walled towne others running thicket ſome againe conveying themſelves waſhes mariſhes flotes troughes hollowed tree betooke themſelves onely chiefe helpe remained namely get away far ynough meaning goe remote part land ſome made reſiſtance ſouldiors ſlew alſo themſelves skoured coaſts downe flotes boat others toooke priſoners brought deliberat adviſed conſideration order taken while regiment footman beſieging aſſayling wals towne troups horſmen divided certaine cornet company • hold employed buſily rayſing driving away booty field provident forecaſt without loſſe hinderance provinciall people ſouldiors preyed fed upon enemy bowel time emperour encircled threefold courſe ſhields towne aforeſaid double wall hope atchieve enterpriſe maine force gave aſſault attempt neceſſarie ſo effecting therof moſt difficult avenue unto everie ſide danger thereof doubtfull reaſon cliffes aloft turning cloven rent alſo aſcents top full crooked winding denyed meanes acceſſe eſpecially tower ſtanding ſo thicke high made terrible ſhew equall height craggie mount naturally riſing aloft citadell ſtood plaine deſcent falling river ſide fortified ſtrong bulwarkes theſe difficulty another miſchiefe leſſe troubleſome reſt namely beſieged picked number valiant men furniſhed ſtore everie way could allurement induced yeeld making full account either win victorie devow betake themſelves conſumed aſhes countrey withſtood enemy time ſouldiors hardly much ado held backe advancing themſelves fooliſhly prowdly forward calling alſo fight even plaine field ſet battaile yea retrait ſounded ſtill pricked couragious ſtomacke hot endevour preaſſe upon enemie howbeit counſell captaines overcame length exceeding forwardneſſe violence ſo ſervice worke divided everie man moſt ſpeedily taketh ſeverall charge appointed unto one ſide rayſed high mount terrace ſide ſome filled deepe ditch made levell ground while others buſie elſewhere making hollow trench paſſages along within earth cunning mechanikes alſo planted engine peeces ordnance batter wals ſuch wold diſcharged make horrible deadly noyſe verily undermining fabrickes forecovert defence nevita dagalaiphus charge emperour himſelfe gave direction skirmiſh alſo ſaving frame engine wel fire ſallies preparation overthrow raſing city much painful labor finiſhed nothing fight called marqueſſe victor returned ſounded diſcovered wayes farre cteſiphon brought word hee found ſtops let journey joy newes ſouldiors ſo ſet god bare ſo confident reſolute mind fight armed preſently waited ſignall proceed unto aſſault chap vii moſt ſtrong aſſault ſaid citie painefull toyle industrie fortitude well beſiegers beſieged length undermining wall overthrowne while trumpet ſounded alowd battaile ſouldiors part ſhouted amaine firſt roman many run minatorie noyſe charged upon enemy covered everie ſide plate yron manner thin ſlender feather bearing themſelves bold dart caſting weapon hitting upon ſlipperie hard yron armour rebounded backe otherwhiles knitting together roman ſhields roofe arch worke cannot well bee deſcribed moſt fitly protected continuall ſtirring motion opened ſomewhat wide ſunder contrarie • ide perſians ſticking cloſe wall ſo far forth could ſtrive againe aſſayed checke make voyd deadly violence aſſailants carrying hurdle tough • • ier winding upon point skale wall ſlingers archer together others alſo tumbling downe huge ſtones firebrand fireball ſet alſo baliſts bent fitted ſhafts wood wreſted diſcharged great noyſe ſending forth headed arrowes exceeding thicke scorpion likewiſe whither ſoever skilful hand directed diſcharged round ſtones thus redoubled conflict one upon another heat weather ſtill encreaſing untill noone reaſon sunne caſt ſcorching hot vapour called away buſie preparation workes deſirous fight tyred running ſweat ſame purpoſe ſetled reſolution day alſo following part bickering one another ſundrie ſorts fight depart even hand neither winner looſers everie hard pinch daungerous ſervice prince perſon joyning cloſe fighting men called inſtantly upon citie forced deſtroyed becauſe hee would lye long wall overſlip greater deſignes projected falleth caſes urgent extremitie nothing ſo ſlight ſmall otherwhiles even contrarie hope expectation yeeldeth occaſion advantage greater matter ſides fought ſo faintly oftentimes beene point depart aſunder behold ſtroke ram long time diſuſed little brought againſt wall downe came tower higher reſt built moſt ſtrongly bricke fall whereof brought mightie craſh ſide wall joined unto occaſion ſundrie accident occurrent painfull labour beſiegers diligent induſtrie beſieged notably ſhewed brave worthy exploit fighting ſouldiers ſo enkindled anger dolour thought ſervice hard defendant running beſtirring themſelves life nothing dread terrible fight continued hot long time even ballance doubtfull tearmes much bloudſhed many man ſlaine part determined end day ſo length reſpect conſideration wearineſſe while theſe thing open day light word brought unto emperour full watchfull care legionarie ſouldiors charge digging trench undermining wrought ground hollow wayes upheld prop pierced verie foundation beneath readie riſe ground hee ſo direct therefore moſt part night paſt upon ſignall given ſound trumpet go forth running hand arme fight purpoſe aſſault given ſides affront wall while defendant skudding fro wall put repell daungers ſo neither tinging ſound yron tooles digging hard could bee heard man remained within forth make reſiſtance companie myners ſodaine ſhew head ſo ordered agreed defendant buſily occupied lurking cave layed open ſtarteth firſt ſouldior one number overcome magnus tribune iovianus notarie bold hardie multitude following ſtabbed thoſe found houſe came forth light marching ſoftly ſilent pace killed watchman lowd ſhrill voyces extolling manner cuſtome nation juſtice felicitie king thought ſometime mar himſelfe perſon lawes divine majeſtie permit god may entermingled men aſſiſtant k lucinus hee invaded campe lucanes men verily beleeved ſo much becauſe verie middle heat skirmiſh one ſeene huge terrible bigneſſe armed carrying ladder next day review taken armie ſuch one could found though ſpeciall care ſearched whereas bin ſouldior would willingly accord ſhewed himſelfe knowing memorable act done altogether unknowne performed ſo brave deed ſo moſt valiantly ſhew themſelves ſeene reſt rewarded obſidionall coronet praiſed open place whole armie aſſembled according cuſtome auncients chap viii citie thus forcibly wasted fire ſword dumbe boy tumbler player feat falleth pillage iulianus ſhare ſingular continence ſaid emperour hunting roman comming seleucia nabdates captaine governor maiozamalcha executed accordingly length citie laid thus naked reaſon many breach wayes made readie fal forcibly entred without regard either ſex age whatſoever violence found power angrie ſouldiors made havocke put ſword others feare imminent deſtruction ſeeing fire threatning one ſide drawne ſwords preſented another weeping laſt flung themſelves downe wall head forward ſo diſabled limmes disjoynted led time life wofull miſerable death ſelfe while killed little little fetched forth alive nabdates captaine garriſon foureſcore guard gracious mercifull emperour brought others commaunded bee kept unhurt untouched ſaccage therefore divided dealt conſideration everie man deſert paine taken himſelfe hee one ſtood content little tooke ſhare dumbe boy brought unto one theſe tumbler dauncers kind alſo could expreſſe moſt lovely daintie jeſtures skill valued l three peeces gold ſay tooke pleaſant acceptable reward eſteemed victorie obtayned virgines taken priſoners beautifull perſia woman paſſing faire would neither touch ſee one following herin example alexander africanus declined theſe temptation feare might overcome luſt everie ſhewed themſelves labour travaile invincible time theſe conflict architect maſter carpenter ſide whoſe name commeth remembrance chaunced ſtand behind engine scorpion reverberation recoyling backe ſtone enginer beſtowed looſe tottering ſling ſocket ſtrucken downe therewith backe breaſt ſo ſquized preſently loſt life withall knitting joynts ſo diſjoyned torne ſunder token verily whole bodie could knowne emperour went forward journey thence one enformed certaine wals towne thus ſubverted companie lay cloſe ambuſh within certaine deceitfull blind cave ſuch many thoſe tract end thence unwares might ſet upon backe part armie killing hindmoſt ſtreight wayes fetching hole ſent footman approoved valour could neither make entrance ſaid cave drive forth beſtowed within fight gathered deale ſtubble ſtraw vine cutting laid upon heapes mouth hole whereupon ſmoke gotten narrow ſtrait paſſages within mean thicker ſtopped vital breath ſome killed others hot breath fire mingled therewith • withall forced come forth upon owne preſent death ſo diſpatched way fire ſword ſouldiors quickly returned backe colour thus large populous citie raſed proweſſe roman force fell duſt utter ruine ſo glorious exploit paſſed diver bridge joyning one another reaſon concourſe many river came unto two fort built hollow vaulted houſes king ſonne advauncing forward cteſiphon many noble multitude armes went debarre victor come went armie paſſage river hee ſpied company ſouldiers following went way ſo marched untill came certaine grove field freſh greene blade young corne ſowen alſo found houſe king built roman faſhion pleaſed u well ſtood untouched verie quarter large peece ground lying round encloſed mound like fenced circuit ſome hold containing within wild beaſts appoynted king game delight wit lyon ſhaggemaned neckes wild boar briſly ſhoulders beares likewiſe ſuch perſia beyond meaſure ſavage raging beſide beaſts choſen nonce mightie maine body wee broken boults bar • e gate horſemen hunting launce number ſhot caſting weapon ſticked ſlue theſe place ſeated fat ſoyle well husbanded farre ſtandeth coche call bachad n • gr seleucia prince caſt trench rampier campe tumultuarie haſt two dayes ſpace refreſhed whole armie opportunitie found water food marched avantcurriers hee viewed citie forſaken left deſolat time paſt deſtroyed raſed verus c • ſar ſacred memorie wherein alſo euer running fountaine ſendeth forth mightie great poole running downe river tigris beheld hanging upon gibbet many body neere friend kinſfolke ſaid betrayed citie pyriſabora nabdates alſo burnt quicke ſhewed • rewhile foureſcore beſides drawne lurking hole citie lately forced beginning ſiege ſecretly promiſed ſurrender citie fought notwithſtanding moſtſtoutly yet beyond hope hee obtained pardon brake height inſolencie reviled ormiſda gave opprobrious tearmes could chap ix iulianus upon intercepting certaine roman forragers avoyding great danger beſ • egeth amost ſtrong fenced pyle winneth burneth hee thrust certaine h • rſemen ſervice foot cowardly received brun • certaine perſian brigand ioyning bridge together armie paſſeth tigris thus marched prettie way ſtrucken dumpes croſſe adverſe accident while three band outrider skirmiſhed lightly regiment companie perſians citie ſetting open gate ſuddainely put others brake forth contrarie banke river intercept kill horſes beaſts followed u together ſome forragers ſtraggled looſely pleaſure whereat emperour wroth anger gnaſhing teeth tooke journey forward approching territorie cteſiphon met high caſtle paſſing well fortified view whereof adventured goe neere unknowne unſeene himſelfe thought companie rode wall hee found engage himſelfe overfarre even within reach dartſhot could longer unknowne preſently courſed aſſayled voley cloud ſundrie caſtingweapons ſlaine beene engine wall eſquire armourbearer ſtucke cloſe ſide wounded himſelfe covered roufe ſhields couched cloſe together eſcaped great danger departed cauſe mooved much exceeding chaſe determined beſiege ſaid fort notwithſtanding defendant hotely bent reſiſt preſumed upon place manner unacceſſable becauſe king perſon marching apace royall armie verily thought would ſhortly fencefabrickes device elſe requifite • iege readineſſe toward end neere midright ſecond watch night happening light moone ſhine ſhewed thinges evidently thoſe ſtood upon bulwarkes ſuddainely multitude gathered together one plumpe opened gate ſallied foorth charging cohort horſemen unawares ſlew may among whome tribune alſo chaunced looſe life went repell danger while theſe thing thus perſians like manner oppoſite river banke ſetting upon part men killed ſome tooke others alive withall feare becauſe enemy thought come greater number ſouldiors beſtirred themſelves ſlowly taken heart againe growne bold ſo tumult haſtily armed caught weapon hand whereby armie alſo rayſed ſound trumpet made haſt muttering minatorie wiſe foreſaid enemy brake thus foorth upon affrighted returned fought withall emperour himſelfe great paſſion anger thruſt reſt cohort baſely faint courage abidden brunt ſaid brigand downe ſerve footman place paine leſſe reputation heat revenge converted diligence care ſubverſion caſtle ſuch jeopardie himſelfe perſon ſtirring foot way vauntguard fighting ſo among formoſt might give ſouldiors good example behave themſelves valiantly beholder approver act hee beene long time much converſant higheſt extremity danger length ſuch varietie munition weapon ſuch joint reſolution alſo fighting men ſame caſtle woon ſacked burnt conſidering dangerous ſervice occurrence paſt alſo readie enſue armie outtoyled tyred exceſſive paine reſted plentie many thing meet ſuſtentation life dealt among howbeit thenceforth rampier fence campe ſurely fortified palliſado ſtakes ſtanding thicke deepe trench ſeeing feared cteſiphon ſo neere hand ſuddaine outrodes privie practiſes hence came river digged man hand named naarmalcha interpretation much king river channell whereof drie river traiane beforetime afterwards severus paſſing great care cauſed digged earth caſt manner mightie large gutter chanell end watercourſe derived thither euphrates ſhipping might paſſe tigris reſpects thought ſafeſt policie ſame place cleanſed time paſt perſians fearing like accident ſtopped dam many big ſtones layed together botone skoured mightie deale water let upon plucking away ſluce fleet beene driven backe ſpace thirtie ſtadia caſt ſecuritie chanell tygris forthwith armie upon bridge made ſhips couched together ſet tooke journey toward coche end convenient reſt might follow upon ſuch weariſome travaile wee ſat u downe rich territorie moſt pleaſantly garniſhed hortyards vine greene cypreſſe tree middeſt whereof ſtandeth ſhadie delectable retiring place pleaſure ſhewing every rowme houſe countrey faſhion picture repreſenting king many ſorts hunting killing deere wild beaſts nothing elſe among either drawne picture caſt counterfeit ſundrie kind ſlaughter warres chap x ſhips delivered extreame danger army ſides put ordinance battaile whereupon enſued ſharpe conflict deſcribed whereby perſians chaſed farre wall cteſiphon loſt 2500 men emperour therefore ſo good ſpeed affaire atchieved heart deſire holding loftie ſtately pace againſt difficulty whatſoever grounding ſo great hope upon fortune yet never foyled oftentimes ſet hand many adventure ſavoured ſtrong raſhneſſe cauſed talleſt veſſels thoſe caried victual engine diſcharged fraight manned octogenis place doub corrupt read therfore oct • ngent • 15 800 elſe expoſid octogenis diſtribut • veli 80 apeece 80 armed ſouldiors keeping ſtill himſelfe better ſtrength navie divided three part one appointed ſent victor come beginning night end croſſed river haſtily might poſſeſſe himſelfe bank enemy ground captaines ſore afraid joyned altogether prayer entreatie aſſay might hinder yet could alter reſolute purpoſe prince behold ſuddaine five ſhips flag ſet aloft commandement given launched forth ſoone went ſight approched banke ſo aſſailed firebrand kind fewell apt catch fire continually flung among ſouldiors within preſently beene burnt emperour ſtarted cold ſwawme feare quickly came heart cry lowd voice men commaunded erected ſignall given unto upon point land cauſed armada make haſt row apace whereby foreſaid ſhippes recovered ſafe ſound reſt ſouldiors alſo pelted though ſtones caſtingweapons diver ſorts moſt ſharpe skirmiſh gained paſſing high difficult bankes firmely kept ſtanding hiſtories forſooth make wonder sertorius keeping weapon corſelet ſwam river rhoſne rhodanus inſtant certaine ſouldiors much troubled fearing ſtay behind marke ſignal ſet bearing cloſe faſt breaſts groveling upon ſhields broad bending welding alſo ſame though unskilfully made ſhift river ſo full whirlepits make way keepe ſwift pace companie ſhips againſt theſe force perſians oppoſed troupe embattailed horſemen armed peeces thoſe raunged ſo thicke cloſe together body way ſoever turned fitted plate dazzeled brightneſſe thereof looked full againſt whoſe horſes alſo whereof number defended leather armour furniture behind whome company footman placed ſupplie fenced long crooked ſhields carie made platted oyſiers • aw leather advaunced forward thicke rankes theſe elephant making ſhew like ſo many hils marching together mooving monſtrous body threatened death thoſe came neere unto proofe experiment made former time dreadfull hereupon emperour appointed middle ward betweene two vauntg • ard • eward battailes ſtrong band footman according ordinance embattailing homer deſcribeth leaſt placed afront vaward happening recule ſhould ſhamefully turne reſt backe againe caſt behind rereward might libertie run away while none ſtay himſelfe light armed auxiliary traverſed fro betweene formoſt hindmoſt romanes ſaw one ſide army battaileray neere adjoyning glittering creſted helmet ſhaking ſhields advanced gently forward footed meaſures metricall foot 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 anapaeſtus launcing ſharpeheaded dart caſtingweapons wherewith skirmiſhers running forth gave firſt eſſay battaile duſt raiſed every ſide caried ſwift whirling wind ſhout outcrie made every hand uſuall maner trumpet ſounding battaile gave edge courage ſouldiors joyned medley javelin drawne ſwords part fought cloſe neere hand verily ſouldiors haſt made get within better ſecured danger arrowſhot meane iulianus part common ſouldior commaunder made haſt uphold thoſe ſore layed freſh ſupplies yea ſtirre incite ſuch made ſlow haſt vantguard therefore perſians brake array giving backe gentle ſoft pace hote armour went toward citie hard followed ſouldiors wearied likewiſe fighting morning betimes evening ſcorching hot field preaſſing hard upon hindparts neckes drave headlong together tigranes surena narſes principall chiefetaines farre wals cteſiphon laying upon ham leg backes ran intermingled company thus ſlipped away fled broken within entrie citie marqueſſe victor lifting well hand voice forbad himſelfe ſlightly ſhot arme arrow fearing leaſt theſe haſtie ſouldiors found inconſideratly within circuit wall meeting way might encloſed maine multitude let old poet ſound battails hector fought extoll withall fortitude theſſalian captaine achilles let poſteritie long time talke sophanes aminias callimachus n cynegirus thoſe famous thunderbolt ſhooke medes warre greece evident men confeſſion ſome men behaved themſelves valiantly day ever thoſe chap xi iulianus preparing number ſacrifices unto mar terrified ominous ſigne leaving therefore ſiege cteſiphon forrayeth waſteth country round well adviſed ſetteth fire conſumeth ſhips ſave twelve leſſer ſort feare paſt enemy body troden heap lay underfoot ſouldiors embrued bloud juſtly ſhed aſſembled emperours pavilion gave due prayſe rendred hartie thankes unknowne everie place whether leader ſouldior hee atchieved ſo fortunat victory killing two thouſand five hundred perſians leſſe threeſcore ten men loſt life alſo part calling moſt name himſelfe eie witneſſe judge ſaw performed reſolute heart brave ſervice rewarded naval civik campecoronets fully perſuaded like proſperous ſucceſſes would ſhortly hereafter follow hee made preparation many ſacrifices mar revenger whereas ten moſt beautifull bull purpoſe brought place nine preſented altar themſelves fell downe dead moſt heavie fearfull manner tenth brake bond got away hardly brought backe againe ſlaine ſhewed ominous ſignes ill lucke ſight whereof iulianus falling grievous fit indignation cryed ſware iupiter would offer ſacrifice unto mar neither hee ever ſacrifice againe ſurpriſed ſoone ſpeedie death ſo hee debated counſell principall captaines officer armie touching beſieging cteſiphon concluded according adviſe mind ſome knew adventurous unreaſonable peece ſervice take enterpriſe hand citie verie ſcituation thereof inexpugnable defended alſo thought verily king would hand dreadfull power better opinion tooke place utilitie whereof moſt prudent prince approoved hee ſent arintheus power light appointed footman forray ſpoyle country lying round rich cattell corne like induſtrie purſue enemy alſo lately put rout diſperſed lay hidden thicke overgrowne wayes hole wherewith ſo well acquainted iulian againe greedie humor time bee encroaching gaining little weighing word willed contrarie rebuking chiefe leader officer becauſe ſloth deſire eaſe gave counſell forgo kingdomes perſia maner alreadie conquered leaving river left hand direction unluckie guide led way determined ſpeedie pace take midland mediterranean wayes deadly curſed firebrand bellona commaunded fire put ſhips burne ſave twelve leſſe ſort gave order carried cart meet joyning bridge hee thought herein taken profitable courſe feare forſooth navie left behind ſhould ſerve enemy good ſtead leaſt wiſe twentie thouſand welneere fighting men verie beginning expedition done ſhould imployed haling towing governing ſaid ſhips everie man fearing owne behalfe ſecretly mumbled plain truth evidently ſpake haply ſouldiers put back reaſon drouth high hils could returne unto water alſo fugitive openly confeſſed upon rack erred done amiſſe great hurly burly commaundement given flaming fire ſhould bee quenched much fire caught ſo mightie head conſumed moſt part alreadie twelve ſhips onely could ſaved without hurt ſet apart might kept ſtill chap xii perſians burnt growne graſſe ſtanding corne drive roman deſtitute ſhipping diſtreſſed distemperature weather ſoyle many ſtraits yea forceth alter iourney chaunce fleet loſt ſuch time behoved iulianus truſting united armie none armed ſouldiers employed diver place affaire ſtanding upon great number marched ſay inland part wealthy country yeelding plentie victual unto beeing knowne enemy pinch • hunger ſet fire graſſe ground ſtanding corne ful growne reaſon generall fire ſtopped paſſage forward truſted upon ſtanding campe untill flame began ſlake perſians great way inſulting u bravado one nonce diſplayed force abroad otherwhile made head thicke cloſe together might thought thoſe looked farre king aid alreadie come ſhould thinke brake therefore ſuch audacious outrodes unwonted attempt emperours ſouldiors ſorrowed hereat neither meanes frame bridge ſo raſhly loſt ſhips could encounter force ſtrange enemy new come alreadie place appeared glittering brightneſſe armor artificially wrought bend everie limme helpe matter well happened another ſmall infortunitie namely ſuccors waited come arſaces owne captaines ſeemed cauſes aforeſaid letted ſtayd regard theſe occurrent prince comfort diſtreſſed diſquieted ſoldiors commanded priſoners lanke ſlender themſelves perſians maner time alſo growne carrion leane brought forth caſting eye againe upon men lo quoth theſe martiall heart reputemen even deformed foule ſtinking goat many event experience taught u readie fling weapon run away come joyne battaile ſaid captive voyded ſat counſell maine buſineſſe hand much arguing pro contra unskilfull multitude ſaid open mouth must returne ſame way came prince earneſtly gainſaid opinion many together ſhewed plaine demonſtration could conſidering throughout ſpatious open plaines forage corne conſumed remaines townes village late burnt extreame want povertie becauſe alſo ground beſobbed drenched midwinter froſts thawed water ſwolne carried away bound bank become verie rough alſo encreaſe difficultie affaire thoſe country grew hot ſultrie heat sunne place haunted multitude fly gnat flie ſhadow daylight body ſtarres ſhine night wit man could prevaile meet theſe miſchiefs long wavering fro ſtanding doubtfull tearmes reared altar killed beaſts ſacrifice conſulted god know whether ſhould returne way aſſyria marching ſoftly beſide foot mountaines ſodainely overrun waſt chiliocomus ſcituat neere unto corduena neither theſe two wayes inſpection beaſt bowel waranted unto u howbeit reſolved upon end ſeeing hope better cut gone ſhould take way corduena ſo upon ſixteenth 16 day iu •• day kalends iuly enſignes ſet forward daylight begun wel entred appeared ſmoke certaine round ſharp topped cloud duſt occaſioned man might thinke heards wild aſſes whereof thoſe tract infinit number going together purpoſe ſo thicke troupe thruſt together might able check fruſtrat fierce aſſaults lyon opinion captain sacena comming raiſed alreadie rumor ſpred emperour would maine force aſſault cteſiphon others affirmed perſians armes readie ſtirre new trouble therefore conſidering doubtfull caſe ſtood feare leaſt ſome diſaſterous accident ſhould light upon u ſound trumpet battailons march called backe ſo faire greene vale full graſſe neere unto river ſide pitched tent round forme circle manifold rank courſe ſhields protect u reſted ſafetie reaſon ayre continued thicke miſtie evening could diſcerne ſeemed ſo foule ill favoured xxv booke chap 1 romane armie encountreth joineth fight many skirmiſh perſian hoaſt armour perſian men armes bard horſes terrible ſhew elephant battailefought mightie overthrow ſlaughter perſians night verily wherein bright ſtarres ſhone give light commonly falleth doubtfull caſes diſtreſſes paſſed ſo one u durſt either ſit downe ſleepe one winke feare ſo ſoone faire daylight glittering habergeon trimmed white guard bright curet made yron plate diſcovered farre ſhewed king power hand ſight whereof ſouldiors enkindled courage made haſt encounter reaſon little river ſevered aſunder emperour forbad farre rampier cruell fight betweene foreriders thoſe perſians wherein machameus leader one regiment ſlaine whoſe quarrell defence brother maurus marqueſſe afterward phaenice killed wounded brother death terrifying every one came way ſelfe alſo ſore hurt ſhoulder dart yet able maine force reſcue draw forth battaile machameus looking wan pale point death ſides waxed faint intollerable heat weather ſo many conflict ſuſtained end troupe enemy foule repulſe broken ſcattered retyred ſomewhat farre hence saracenes feare footman conſtrained returne backe within intermingled multitude perſians ſuddainely charged full mind carrie away romane carriage ſo ſoone eſpied emperour returned wing lay ſupplie wee gone region came village named hucumbra two dayes ſpace refreſhed beſide hope thing meet uſe gotten corne ynough departed preſently reſt ſave time would give u leave convey away conſumed fire next day armie marched eaſily forward perſians unwares ſet upon thoſe hindmoſt chaunce day charge rereward little adoe killed every one cavallerie neere hand intelligence hereof ſpred open wide valeyes repelled great danger wounding thoſe thus ſurpriſed skirmiſh ſlaine adaces noble peere kingdome beene ſometime ſent embaſſage emperour constantine courteouſly entertained killer offering unto iulianus ſpoyles rewarded well beſeemed ſame day cornet terciaci horſemen much blamed accuſed legion theſe brake enemy battaile raunged full againſt little little ſlipping away like diſcouraged whole armie whereupon emperour growing indignation good reaſon tooke guidons brake launce many juſt proofe knowne fled enjoyned march among carriage packes truſſes captive leader onely fought manfully made captaine another troupe whoſe tribune convicted ſhamefully forſaken field fled moreover caſſed alſo diſcharged militarie oath tribune certaine company horſemen like foule cowardly part mild moderate allay temper correction conſidering difficulty danger toward emperour contented therefore journeyed forward ſeventie b ſtadia occaſion grew ſcarcitie thing graſſe corne burnt every man faine catch flaming fire keepe himſelfe corne forage hee able carrie leaving therefore place alſo behind whole armie come certaine tract named maranga twylight ſomewhat day appeared infinite number perſians together merenes generall horſemen two king ſonnes many potentate lord countrey band regiment harneiſed armor yron every part bodie covered ſo cloſe thick plate ſtiffe joint thereof meet knitting lims vizards men face ſo curiouſly fitted head whereas body plated ſhot lighting upon could onely take hold ſticke little hole full againſt eye admit ſmall ſight tip noſes narrow paſſages ſerved wind breath theſe ſome readie ſerve pike ſtood firme kept ground ſo man would thought bin fixed faſt held chaines rope braſſe hard marſhalled archer feat whole nation cradle hath bin paſſing confident skill mightie practiſe thereof theſe drew bent bowes armes ſo wide aſunder ſtrings came cloſe right breaſt head arrow head lay juſt upon left hand exceeding skill ſtroke finger ſhafts flew whiſtling ſinging ſound carrying miſchievous deadly wound placed elephant terrible ſight beaſts glittering together grim cruell yawning mouthes fearefull minded men could hardly endure upon ſat maſters carrying faſt tied unto right armes knife haft bearing remembrance ſtill defeature loſſe received niſibis unruly beaſt could reſtrained ſtrength maſter feare leaſt turning backe upon owne men fell hee might overthrow common ſouldiors mightie ſtroke made gaſh turning joint parteth head necke aſunder experiment made aſdruball brother anniball readie way diſpatch ſuch beaſts bereave life ſeene without great terrour moſt confident reſolute emperour guarded round armed cohort principall captaines according extraordinarie puiſſance cruell force required arraunged thoſe band affront encounter enemie forme halfe moone creſcent bowing winding ſides leaſt archer running foorth might diſray rankes company men advaunced forward banner ſpeedily thereby brake violent force ſhot uſuall manner given ſignall battaile romane footman ſtanding thicke together preaſſing hard thruſt backe thronged front enemy vaward medley grew hote ſuch ſound ſhields ſuch clattering noyſe alſo well men themſelves weapon making dolefull din among whome hoe ſtay hand field covered bloud ſlaine body lying along perſians fell faſter ground oftentimes faint conflict found great hinderance inconvenience cloſe fight foot foot wonted otherwiſe beare themſelves valiantly afarre perceive time battailons give ground recule retyring toward backe manner ſhowers ſtormes ſhoot arrowes ſtreight ſo fright enemy bold confident purſuit parthian therefore driven backe borne downe maine force ſouldiors outtoyled long time ſweltered flaming heat sun ſound given retreat returne againe tent emboldened good hand thenceforth attempt greater exploit battaile evident ſayd ſlaughter perſians great men ſmall among variable chaunces fell theſe conflict remarkable ſhield haſteneth battaile chaunced horſemans ſtaffe ſpeare run rib while aſsaieth pluckeforth head hee fell horſe battaile part lamentable brought backe campe ſooner departed hence perſians greatly feared ſteedie fight footman beene oftentimes beaten therwith laid amhuſhes cloſely accompanied u avoyding battailons either ſide lying eſpiall view march top high hill ſo men ſuſpecting ſo much livelong day might neither caſt rampier fortifie themſelves pallaiſadoe thus verily while firmely guard ſides armie according ſite poſition ground marcheth ſix ſquare battailons diſplayed large thin rankes word brought unto prince yet unarmed gone forth forward diſcover quarter ſodainly thoſe behind gathering armour weapon together charge given backes accident much troubled catching haſtily tumult ſhield forgetting corſlet making haſt helpe thoſe rereward called backe againe another new alarme whereby advertiſed avantguard alſo whence lately departed felt like diſtreſſe while without regard owne perill hec haſteneth recover ſet upright order againe another part companie parthyans couplet harneis ſetteth upon century maine battaile mids ſpredding themſelves fiercely left wing began alreadie ſhrinke while men could patience abide ſtrong ſtrength braying noyſe elephant fought pike caſting weapon diſcharged thicke prince ſetting ſpurres horſe rode full carrier among moſt dangerous skirmiſhes went light armed company charging behind layd houx backe part well beaſts perſians themſelves cut hacked iulianus forgetting looke himſelfe lifting hand aloft cry alowd made evident demonſtration diſrayed fearefully ſcattered withall ſtirring anger thoſe followed chace engaged himſelfe boldly farre battaile • ida •• gallant follower feare diſperkled cryed unto ſides ſhould decline huge multitude thoſe fled leſſe fall ſome ill framed disjoynted loover high building therewith ſodaine horſemans javelin whence came god knoweth ſlightly rippled skinne left arme pierced within ſhort rib ſtucke faſt neather lappet fillet liver while laboureth plucke forth right hand perceived ſharpe edge thereof ſides ſinewes finger cut thus falling forward horſe head conveied backe campe thoſe preſent ſpeedily came running meanes phyſicke chyrurgerie dreſſed cheriſhed accordingly ſoone paine little aſſuaged gave feare great ſpirit ſtriving againſt death called horſe armour end reviſing battaile againe hee might repaire confident hope owne men ſeeme rechleſſe neglect himſelfe wonderfully poſſeſſed care life preſervation others shewing herein ſame vigorous courage though caſe unlike epaminondas renowmed captaine wounded death mandigna mandi l • un • l mantinea returned battaile ſought carefully ſhield hee ſaw neere unto died wound joyfully without feare forwent life afraid looſe ſhield iulianus ſtrength anſwerable flux bloud ſore followed hee ſtood ſtill ſtirred hereupon grew afterward paſt hope life becauſe inquirie made underſtood place hee fell called phrygia intelligence given aforetime written anſwer oracle even muſt dye prince brought againe pavilion man would beleeve heat ſouldiors enchaufed anger griefe haſtened revenge rapping ſhields ſpeares fully unadviſedly otherwhiles beene defeated returne new warres ſuffered ſhipwracke goe againe ſea betake themſelves undergoe thoſe difficulty oftentimes ſhrunke ſunke ſome find fault prince winning place victorie ſtill put himſelfe upon like exploit chap vii conſultations variance among principall captaines chiefe officer armie touching creation new emperor length iovianus choſen received different affection armie neither leiſure ſolemn mourning weeping corp ordered prepared according preſent ſtore time would give leave might enterred himſelfe time appointed next morning early fell 17 day iune fifth calends iuly even while enemy lay ſpred everyſide captaines armie calling principall officer footman horſemen legion troupe fell conſultation creating new prince divided turbulent faction arintheus victor thoſe remained conſtantius court ſought meet perſon ſide contrariwiſe nevita dagalaiphus noble gaul caſt ſuch one cōpanies while choice ſtood doubtfull tearmes ſo could agree length one accord good enclined unto salluſtius alledged excuſe ſickneſſe honorable old age certaine ſouldior marking ſtiffely ſtood againſt ſtood ſaid would ye done maſters emperour abſence oftentimes hath bin ſeene committed charge war unto would ye quoth ſetting buſineſſes apart deliver ſouldiors theſe inſtant imminent diſtreſſes let deed may ſight meſopotamia army ioyne giving voice declare lawfull emperor ſmall time bring ſo important matter inſtigation ſetting ſome oftentimes hath happened point extremitie opinion throughly weighed conſidered elected emperour iovianus chiefe companie ranke pentioners guard ordinarie domeſtici man regard father deſerts indifferently commended ſonne varronianus come right good note long laid downe charge warfare departed quiet courſe life incontinently clad princely robe ſuddainly brought foorth pavilion preſently rode among regiment company providing take journey much armie ſet array reached length foure mile thoſe vaward hearing ſome cry alowd iovianus auguſtus reſounded ſame note much ſtrucken almoſt amazed affinitie neereneſſe name differed one letter thought iulian come againe himſelfe refreſhed accompanied favorable applauſes wont iovianus ſeene comming toward ſtooping forward taller ſuſpecting fell indeed fell weepe abundantly lament ſome gra •• quid ••• aquitatis prava •••• tor ſuppoſe manifeſt catachreſis ſtrange thing author ſevere cenſor preciſe iuſticer blame act election extremitie state lying thus bleeding one would ſay point death done unwiſely juſtly find fault thoſe ſeamen letting skilfull pilot go bluſtring wind rough ſea committed helme ſhould ſteere direct ſhippe companion partaker skilled danger chap viii perſians hearing iulians death certaine enſignebearer fugitive ſet upon roman certaine skirmiſhes emperour privat perſon intemperat traducer backbiter father fearing danger toward enemie ſtepped degree common ſort revolted perſians audience granted unto ſpeake knew advertiſeth sapor approached upon death feared iovianus better protector unskilfull perſon effeminat tumultuous ſtir drudge campe ſlaves taken beare name ſhadow emperour heard alwayes timorous prayer wiſhed deſired ſet aloft unlooked proſperitie joining number roial cavallery unto thoſe fought u determined ſpeedie marching pace taile armie charged end while beaſts ſacrifice ordained fro behalfe iovianus upon inſpection bowel pronounced ſtaied within campe thought ſhould looſe hee went forth ſhould upper hand therefore wee began go forth perſians elephant leading way gave onſet upon u terrible braying fearefull approach beaſts horſe man firſt much troubled diſordered ioviani p herculani killed ſome ſaid elephant manfully reſiſted horſemen armed peeces legion iovij q victores helping fellowes diſtreſſed ſlew two elephant ſmall number enemy left wing battaile three right valiant warrior loſt life namely iulianus macrobius maximus tribune colonel thoſe legion principall whole armie whoſe funeral ſolemnized preſent neceſſitie would permit neere unto ſhutting evening while marching apace fortreſſe named sumere bodie anatolius lying knowne haſtie tumultuarie wiſe committed earth alſo recovered threeſcore ſouldiors together r palatine related fled fort named vaccatum day following according place wold permit encamped even valley encloſed round within circuit wall ſave one place goe forth ſame lying open ſharpe ſtakes pitched every ſide ſtanding maner ſo many ſword point enemy ſaw wood foreſts let flie u ſundrie ſorts dartes caſting weapon reviling u alſo reproachfull tearmes perfidious traitor murderer moſt valorous excellent prince heard fugitive reported occaſion headleſſe rumor ran abroad iulian ſlain hand weapon roman end alſo certaine cornet horſemen broken ſ gate praetoria ſo bold herewith come neere unto verie prince pavilion many ſide ſlaine repulſed maine force gone thence next night entred upon charcha place regard ſafe reaſon high bank rivage man hand raiſed end saracen might thenceforth overrunne aſſyria one time trobled ſquadrons march theſe verie firſt day kalends iulie marched 4 mile 7 ſtad • halfe make mile thirtie ſtadia drew neere citie named du • reaſon horſes wearie rider hindmoſt taile going foot forth beene environed multitude saracen ſlaine everie man vigorous lighter appointed troupe horſemen reſcued daunger reaſon wee thus infeſted troubled saracen debarred iulian receive time paſt many ſalaries gift making thereof complaint unto could get anſwer warlike vigilant commaunder uſed yro • gold chap ix roman ſouldiors wearied ſo often aſſaults perſians instantly crave leave notwithſtanding iovianus ſtood paſſe tigris wrestled hunger sapor feared place ſo obſtinatly perſiſted perſians moleſting u ſpent loſt foure dayes marched forward time followed u hard heeles many provocation drew u backe made ſtand preſt fight would little little retyre thus vexe u long delayes time uſually meere forged rumor wont give content unto thoſe feare worſt occaſion flying report frontier limit farre armie open mouth called importunatly leave graunted paſſe tigris againſt emp •• great captaines oppoſing themſelves ſhewing river ſwelled riſing dogſtaire praying hazard life dau • gerous ſtreame whirlepooles thereof affirming number unskilfull ſwimming adding moreover enemy fo • ce gained al • eadie ſides skirt river overflowne redoubled theſe reaſons oftentimes gainſaid vaine ſo ſouldiors cry alowd maine heat big word threatened doe worſt emperour made proclamation ſtay march gaules practiſed ſwimmers ſhould firſt others take river end ſwallowed carried away mightie ſtreame wilfull ſtubborneſſe reſt might daunted performed deed ſafely paſſage might hand attempted boldly buſineſſe fit men choſen ſuch childhood beene enured ſwim greateſt river others native country taking advantage ſtil darke night let forth caſement ſooner man would thought raught banke ſides troden foot cut peeces many perſians beſtowed keepe coaſts quiet ſecuritie faſt aſleepe holding hand ſhooting dart gave ſignal adventure taken effect ſped eſpyed farre ſouldiors ho • ſet upon paſſage ſtayed onely maſters work promiſed frame bridge budget bottels made beaſts hide ſlaine theſe project gone hand enterpriſed vaine king sapor abſent far alſo come neerer advertiſed true report diſcoverers ſent fugitive comming valiant act men done ſhameful foyles overthrowes owne taken elephant killed king could ever remember bin time alſo roman armie hardened unceſſant travailes paine death glorious prince ſought gave ſave ſelves revenged minded end theſe inſtant danger painfull trouble either abſolute victorie memorable death theſe regard caſt mind many thoſe fearefull conſequences namely force ſpread provinciall nation might experience thereof aſſembled ſmall watchword knowing alſo owne people loſſe greateſt part common ſouldiors ſore diſmayed affrighted finding withall meſopotamia left armie enemy behind much leſſer theſe thing daunted perplexed carefull mind five hundred men ſwimming together one time paſſed ſafetie river riſen high killed warder coaſts ſtirred reſt conſorts like bold hardie exploit meane eſtate king moſt mercifull prince content remaines armie ſhould returne namely • emperour caeſar together principall counſellors great men performed ſuch poynts hee commaunded countermatch theſe arintheus together salustius praefect ſent while ſitting conſultation ſage adviſement done foure dayes went head tormented plagued u hunger unto u grievous puniſhment whatſoever reſpite time theſe ſent prince made uſe little little departed enemy ground certes reached ſtrong garriſon townes corduena countrey plentifull owne beſides one hundred mile diſtant place wherein theſe affaire treated king claimed hard required owne himſelfe ſaid long ſince maximian taken appeared handling hee required ranſome redemption five country beyond tigris wit arzanena moxoena zabdicena likewiſe rhehimena corduena fifteene caſtles alſo niſibis singara caſtra maurorum ſtrong hold verie good importance whereas beene better fought ten field one theſe ſhould ſurrendred yet crew flatterer came timorous prince buzzing whiſpering eares dread name procopius unleſſe made ſpeedie returne taking knowledge iulians death would eaſily power thoſe unfoyled ſouldiors regiment worke alteration state proclaime himſelfe emperour while none make head againſt theſe pernitious word iterated continually unto grew enkindled without farther hafting holding delivered demaunded great ado obtained thus much niſibis singara without inhabitant therein ſhould paſſe dominion perſians alſo fort hold alienated garriſons verie roman ſhould ſuffered revert hand theſe capitulation added another article alſo moſt miſchievous impious namely compoſition paſſed arſaces friend unto u time truſtie confederat might aid craved againſt perſians deviſed twofold reaſon partly man might puniſhed prince commaundement waſted chiliocomus partly might remaine ſtill ſome occaſion quarell colour whereof might time time invade armenia pleaſure whereby happened afterward ſame arſaces taken priſoner alive parthian among theſe diſſentions troublous garboyles went away greateſt ſide armenia confining upon medes together citie choi • • ov •• artaxata diſhonourable decree confirmed end ceſſation armes ſhould nothing done contrarie covenant given either ſide ſhew hoſtages great perſons qualitie wit part nevita victor mellobaudes tribune notable valiant band bineſes one ranke nobilitie three lord potentats right good note thus peace thirtie yeares concluded ſame ſurely ratified ſolemne complement religious othe returned another way becauſe avoided place adjoining river comberous rough diſtreſſed want drinke meat ſo peace graunted colour courteſie humanitie turned deſtruction many pinched extreame hunger laſt gaſpe therefore ſecretly going either want skill ſwimming ſwallowed river ſtreame el paſſed overcame violence wave came bankes saracenes perſians ſaid german expelled little killed like ſheepe ſent farre ſold ſlaves trumpet ſounding together openly gave ſignall paſſing river wonder ſee heat every man raſhly venturing upon advantage triall putting himſelfe reſt made haſt ſhun many fearefull danger while ſome ſitting upon hurdle made adventure holding horſes ſwum either hand others upon bottle ſome turning winding diver way point neceſſitie crooked courſes cut pierced billowes wave beating full againſt emperour himſelfe ſome others croſſed thoſe ſmall barkes remained burning fleet ſhewed appointed ſame veſſels paſſe fro betweene untill conveyed end came bankes ſide ſave thoſe drowned gracious favor heavenly power hard chaunces eſcaped jeopardie while ſtood yet feare calamity trouble hanging head given underſtand therelation foreriders made perſians making bridge farre ſight end peace covenant eſtabliſhed while tempeſtuous ſtormes warre allayed might ſet upon ſickly craſie folke went ſecure feareleſſe alſo beaſts long wearied tyred heart perceived diſcovered relinquiſhed wicked deſigne chap xi marched ſixe day iourney penurie thing refreſhed new proviſion victual iovianus goeth hand establiſhing state empire niſibenes hearing citie others east ſtrongeſt ſurrendred sapor burſt teares freed ſuſpected danger alſo made haſt long journeyes approched ha • ra old towne ſituate middeſt deſart long ſince diſpeopled traianus severus wa • like prince attempted ſundrie time raſe downe ground army like beene utterly defeated according hiſtorie act orderly ſet downe theſe particular alſo whence knowing along plaine ſtretching threeſcore ten myles theſe drie country could found neither water drinke ſuch ſalt ſtinking thing elſe • feed upon sothernwood wormewood dragonce kind moſt bitter biting hearbes veſſels carried u filled freſh water killing cammels beaſts draught carriage made ſhift food though unholeſome ſix day journey found ſo much graſſe give comfort ••
