upon doubtfull tearmes feared new occurrence ſhould ariſe oppoſe himſelfe beſide theſe mandats gave letter alſo unto ſecrecie willing lucilianus likewiſe bring certaine choiſe men approved induſtrie fidelitie whoſe helpe meant uſe according incident affaire ſhould require good wiſe policie commanded malarichus beene dealer houſhold buſineſſe living italie ſucceed iovinus • maſterſhip • horſe armes gaule ſending unto enſignes ornament office foreſeeing herein two fold commoditie namely captaine high deſert therfore ſuſpected ſhould removed way man inferior hope thus preferred higher place might great ſtudie affection eſtabliſh eſtate found • r yet wavering uncertaine moreover commaundement given thoſe goe accompliſhing theſe buſineſſes ſhould extoll whole courſe late act make beſt yea ſpread abroad way ſoever went light rumour according one tune namely parthian expedition brought happie end travailing ſpeedily night day together ſhould inſinuate unto ruler province leader force new emperours writing ſecret manner ſounded mind returne quickly anſweres thus upon intelligence given done remote part might betimes bee ſome wiſe courſe found eſtabliſhing empire fame prevented theſe meſſengers flew province moſt ſwiftly telling tale heavie accident ſtrucke people niſibenes grievous ſorrow underſtood citie yeelded unto • por whoſe anger ſecret grudge feared calling ever anon mind mortall foiles overthrow continually ſuſtained many time went aſſault full well knowne compaſſe eaſt empire might beene brought ſubjection perſia citie ſo wel ſeated ſo fortified mightie wals made reſiſtance beit theſe poore wretch although much feared future calamitie yet comforted ſmall hope emperour either owne free accord prayer entrea • ie would ſame ſtate keepe citie ſtrongeſt portcluſe key eaſt chap xii theſe victual ſpent armie distreſſed hunger iovianus refuſeth enter niſibis citie bineſes name sapor taketh poſſeſsion notwithſtanding loyall faithfull citizen vaine ſtood againſt whoſe pitifull departure deſcribed while diver rumour diſperſed abroad place order courſe theſe proceeding ſmall ſtore ſpent victual armie brought thither ſaid men neceſſitie feed owne body fleſh labouring beaſts killed laſted ſome ſort wherby came paſſe moſt armour weapon baggage ſo feeble able carry caſt away ſo grievous extreame famine whereby wee pined place one x modius peck meale found happened ſeldome exchanged ten piece gold thence departed came thiſaphalta sebaſlianus procopius together tribune principall captaines ſouldiors committed charge defence meſopotamia ſolemne order required met u courteouſly received bare u companie prince made haſt journey gladly ſeene niſibis pitched ſtanding campe without citie earneſtly requeſted many prayer people hee would enter citie cuſtome prince lodge within palace ſtiffely refuſed abaſhed aſhamed while converſed within wals citie otherwiſe expugnable ſhould delivered angrie enemy hand evening waxed darke iovianus principall secretary notary ſiege citie majozamalcha ſaid eſcaped others mine ground violently taken ſupper brought place way pitched headlong drie pit overwhelmed number ſtones caſt upon cauſe verily iulian ſlaine alſo ſome nominated worthie empire creation iovianus behaved himſelfe modeſt tearmes overheard whiſper ſomewhat touching affayre while invited feaſts martiall men campe next day bineſes one perſians ſaid noble right honorable perſon among others making haſt accompliſh lord king commandement called inſtantly performance promiſe permiſſion roman emperour entred citie ſet banner owne nation upon citadell denouncing unto citizen lamentable remove departure native ſeat preſently commaunded flit gone ſtretched forth hand beſought might impoſed upon neceſſitie departing ſaying alone without publicke allowance victual ſouldiors able defend dwelling houſes truſting aſſuredly oftentimes found experience find juſtice hereafter alſo fighting place wherein borne wiſe verily state common humbly prayed ſpake vaine wind ſay while emperour made ſemblance fearing indeed thing declined hainous ſinne perjurie sabinus man forwealth birth renowmed among fellow citizen burgeſles rolling tongue owne made ſpeech effect conſtantius world fierce cruell warres otherwhiles vanquiſhed perſians brought end flight ſome hibita ſure fenced station lived piece bread old woman countrey much entreatie reached unto yet lost none seignories dying day iovian first entrance empire hath parted wall province barre one would ſay whereof continued time mind without taking harme hee could prevaile while prince conſtantly pretended conſcience keeping oath tooke received length much adoe conſtraint coronet preſented unto good refuſed one silvanus advocate uſed plead defence men cauſes cry boldly alowd crowned quoth ô emperour mayeſt thou city bſides word hee grew ſo angrie hee commaunded within three dayes depart wals deteſting curſing preſent ſtate time ſet certaine purpoſe force drive foorth threatening death alſo many delayed departure whereby citie full ſorrow lamentation throughout ſtreets part thereof nothing heard groning wailing hand while matron readie thruſt baniſhed houſe wherein ſhe borne brought • haire head while mother bereft ſhe buned child widdow husband driven away farre graf mane while lamentable multitude clipping poſts cheekes lintel entrie dores piteouſly wept hereupon ſundrie wayes full thoſe departed every one could make ſhift many conveyed away ſtealth rich thought might handſomely caried ſetting nought reſt houſehold good wherof much great price left behind want labouring beaſts chap xiii iudgement ammianus marcellinus touching condition romane empire thoſe dayes corpes iulian enterred suburbian place neere tarſus armie commeth antioch ſeene many dreadfull ſights namely comet touching reaſon nature whereof put downe naturall diſcourſe place art thou fortune romane world juſtly blamed ſtormes blowing beating fore upon commonwealth diddeſt commit betake reynes helmethereof newly ſtrucken hand skilfull leader pilot state unto raw young man come yet proofe knowne notable thing former life ſuch affaire right neither blamed commended one thing went heart good men while ſtandeth feare concurrent while hee thinketh ſeriouſly upon gaule illyricum caſteth mind ſome many time aſpired high matter making haſt prevent fame comming pretenſe avoyding perjurie committed act unbeſeeming emperour looſing niſibis ever ſince king mithridates dayes ſtood might maine eaſt empire ſhould come poſſeſſion perſians never ſince citie rome firſt founded find ſuppoſe though read annales either conſul emperour gave away right part territory triumphall honour ever conferred upon recoverie aught beene taken away enlarging dominion hence unto publius scipio regaining spaine unto fulvius capua skirmiſhes aſſaults made long time unto opimius diver battailes ended time fregellanes mortall enemy forced yeeld themſelves triumphes denied thus much alſo learned auncient record extreame caſes covenant made generall chief leader party ſides tooke expreſſe formall othe ſtreightwayes making warie afreſh undone voyd example old time ſtreits gullet caudinae roman legion samnium put yoke alſo albinus numidia peace wickedly thought treated laſtly mancinus author agreement made diſhonourably haſt delivered unto numantines well citizen fetched forth citie rendred constantius tribune ſent aſſigne ſet garriſon fort territory unto perſian lord great captaines procopius ſent reliques iulian interre ſame ſuburbs tarſus given charge life time taking journey execute buſineſſe preſently buried bodie departed neither could found although great diligence hee ſought untill long ſeene conſtantinople ſuddaine inveſted purple robe theſe matter wiſe brought journeyes thus diſpatched came antioch many dayes together god beene offended ſeene many fearefull ſtrange ſights event whereof ſuch skilfull prodigial learning foretold prophecied would wofull lamentable ſtatue maximian caeſar ſtood verie porch entrie king houſe loſt ſodainly braſen ball faſhioned forme heavenly globe pole carried alſo horrible noyſe beames poſts within conſiſtories made ſound ſeene likewiſe daytime blazing ſtarres touching nature whereof naturall philoſophers varie much reaſons argument ſome hold therefore called comet hairie ſtarres multitude ſtarres gathered together flaſhing fire certaine haires ſeeme ſcattered others opinion drie exhalation earth ſteeming aloft little little catch fire againe doe thinke rayes beames sunne kept going downeward oppoſition thicke cloud betweene caſting brightneſſe upon groſſe bodie repreſent unto man eye light diſtinguiſhed ſtarres alſo thoſe thus conceited ſuch ſight appeareth cloud drawne higher uſually hath beene ſhineth reaſon vicinitie thoſe eternall heavenly fire leaſtwiſe certaine ſtarres like unto reſt riſing ſetting whereof time bee appointed men wit could never reach unto much beſides concerning bl •• ing ſtarres comet read author learned aſtronomie may ſet downe pen maketh haſt write matter chap xiiii iovianus commeth tarſus departed thence establiſheth imperiall dignitie meanes within come far confines galatia bithynia hee night found dead vertues vice briefly touched emperour ſtayed pretie antioch ſore troubled diver weightie care wonderfull deſire gone therefore ſparing neither beaſt man hee ſets forth thence verie mids cold winter notwithſtanding hath beene ſayd many ominous ſignes croſſed ſame entred tarſus noble citie cilicia originall foundation whereof ſhewed making exceeding great haſt goe alſo appointed ſepulchre iulian trimly garniſhed ſcituat within precinct way leadeth ſtraits mountaine taurus whoſe reliques aſhes hee done right beene well adviſed c • ra ••• l ••••• cydnus ſhould ſeen moſt pleaſant cleere river though perpetuat glorie good deed tiberis runneth mids immortall citie rome toucheth monument auncient emperours ſacred memorie ſhould paſſed tarſus departed tooke long journeyes came tyana town cappadocia procopius foreſaid notarie memorius tribune returne meet open whole courſe proceeding beginning order required namely lucillianus entred millane seniauchus valentinian two tribune brought along knowing malarichus refuſed armes force maſterſhip aboveſaid rode poſt remes beene rumor quiet nation ranne forth uſe ſay without liſts verie unſeaſonably ſoone yet thing well ſetled ordinarie clerke gave himſelfe auditor privie himſelfe owne fraudulent naughtie dealing fled unto armie deviſed iulianus yet alive certaine man meane condition riſen make alteration state himſelfe emperour whoſe falſe deceitfull forgery ſouldiors mightily mooved growne tumultuous broyle ſlew lucillianus seniauchus valentinian ſoon became emperor great feare doubtful whither fly friend hoſt primitivus packed away ſafetie upon theſe heavie occurrent came newes joyfull namely ſouldiors ſent iovinus hand ſuch militarie men uſe call caput scholarum theſe brought tidings army ſerving gaule gladly embraced iovianus emperour knowne truth ſecond forme ranke scutarij committed unto regiment valentinian returned vitalianus ſouldior ſerving band z heruli taken companie ſocietie domeſtici long advanced dignitie come fought unfortunatly illyricum ſtreight arinthe • ſent gaule bearing letter unto iovinus exhorting keepe place ſtill remaine conſtant given alſo charge principall rayſer foreſaid tumult ſhould puniſhed accordingly author ſedition ſhould ſent bound unto emperours court counſell theſe matter diſpoſed ſeemed expedient aſpuna little enfranchiſed towne galatia α ſouldiors ſerving gaule ſhewed themſelves unto emperour admitted conſiſtorie gracious audience given thoſe recounted ſuffered endured qua pertule • • errand brought rewarded commaunded returne unto colour emperour come anguri belloni • ancyra thing put readineſſe according preſent time requiſit ſolemne pompe entred upon conſulſhip taking fellowſhip honourable dignitie owne ſonne varronianus young infant whoſe wrawling while ſtrugled hard made mean ride β curule chaire cuſtome portended ſoone happened hereupon alſo prefixed time iovianus end life made alemans waſted gaule rhaetia sarmatians quadi made ſpoyle pannonia one picts saxon scot attacots infeſted britans continuall trouble auſtorians maurite nation made rodes fiercely wont affricke certain band gothicke brigand rover rifled ranſacked thracia king perſia layd violent hand upon armenian haſtning forcible meanes reduce freſh owne dominion unjuſtly pretending alledging thus much deceaſe iovianus eſtabliſhed league peace ought nothing contrarie hee might recover thoſe thing hee ſhewed time appertained unto aunceſtors therefore winter paſſed quietneſſe peace two emperours agreeing moſt joyntly together one name preheminence outward ſhew equall honour paſſed thracia came naeſſum certaine suburbian countrie towne called mediana ſtandeth three mile citie meant ſhortly part divided comites betweene verily unto valentinian whoſe direction state mannaged f • iovinus promoted good ſince iulian maſter men horſemen armes gaule dagalaiphus iovian preferred colonell footman follow valens eaſt victor appointed alſo choiſe judgement foreſaid prince beene advanced joyned arintheus lupicinus promoted likewiſe iovian maſter horſmen charge eaſt part alſo equitius made colonell armie ſerved illiricum generall maſter yet come serenianus long ſince diſcharged militarie othe entred armes warfare againe pannon • accompanied valens became captaine companie band domeſtici thing thus digeſted ordered partition made alſo militarie band prince entred sirmium divided palatine traine thought good unto elder better twaine ſo valentinian departed millain valens conſtantinople verily eaſt part governed sallustius praefect mamertinus ruled ſame authoritie italy affricke illyricum like germanus province gaule chap vi while valentinian intendeth make warre upon alemans procopius east part aſpireth emperour whereupon valentinian buſied new care while therefore two prince kept reſiance ſaid city put firſt conſular robe eſtate yeare roman empire afflicted grievous loſſes damage alemans brake limit germanie provoked thereto miſchievous mind uſually beene upon occaſion whereas upon embaſſadors ſent unto prince court ſhould beene beſtowed dutie certaine ſet gift appointed cuſtom allowance made ſmaller thoſe leſſe value beene vſed ſhould receive faring furions manner flung away moſt ſhamefull indignitie offered unto beene • ie roughly intreated vrſatius maſter office angrie cruell man •• rned home aggravating fact ſtirred moſt fell nation contumeliouſly deſpiſed rebellion time long procopius eaſt roſe armes plot • ed uſurpe empire newes happening neere firſt day valens alive death equitius upon relation intelligence given antonius tribune command force midland part dacia gave knowledge nothing occurrent ſelf obſcurely upon heareſay alſo himſelfe thing knowne thracia ſhould hoſtile manner make rodes pannonia exceedingly terrified late freſh example calling mind iulian little contemning emperour everie civile warre went away winning hand either feared expected paſſed incredible celeritie one citie another hot ſet hee upon returne • heat became allaied counſell advice thoſe perſuading beſeeching expoſe gaule unto barbarous enemy threatning nothing deadly miſchiefe upon pretenſe allegation forſake province needing helping hand together joyned embaſſadors noble city praying intreating leave ſayd province hard doubtfull eſtate unprotected without defence perſonall preſence might deliver great daungers affrighting german onely majeſtie name length pondering throughly good adviſement utiliti • thing bending framing himſelfe yeeld unto opinion while wee make haſt leap return while one place another ſhould confuſion enwrap order courſe ſtorie verie foule obſcuritie chap vii procopius deviſes policy went uſurpe empire procopius deſcended noble parentage borne brought cilicia regard neere kin unto iulian afterwards emperor verie firſt degree aroſe ſhewed himſelfe one life behaviour verie orderly preciſe although cloſe ſilent carriage given charge whiſpered darke report certaine author ſeene mandate hee ſhould deale according courſe thing occurrent knowne perceived time ayds roman state goe downe wind ſhould take order himſelfe ſpeed might nominated ſtiled emperour carrying himſelfe civile warie wiſe managing enjoyned unto hee underſtood death iulian upon falſe rumor running abroad ſame iulian lying verie point death delivered thus much mind pleaſure government empire ſhould bee put hand procopius fearing leaſt cauſe ſhould killed without proceſſe law condemnation got himſelfe ſight terrified moſt death iovianus chiefe notary upon deceaſe iulian nominated ſome ſouldiors worthy empire ſuſpected afterwards aſpire thereunto underſtood much torment put death learned himſelfe great diligence layd avoid heavie load grievous envie departed way ſaid remote ſecret part perceived iovianus emperour ſpyes abroad ſeeke lu • king hole beſide wearie manner life caſt downe high eſtate low degree ſore pinched alſo hunger ill favoured foule country wanted ſpeech conference men driven end extreame neceſſitie journeying wild bywayes came territorie chalcedon becauſe ſeemed unto ſure place refuge kept himſelfe cloſe moſt truſtie friend one strategius palatine ſouldior become senator going many time ſecretly might betweene houſe conſtantinople appeared evidently ſame strategius diſcloſed oft inquiſition made adherent faction guiſe therefore moſt cunning ſubtile ſpie altogether unknowne viſage hee looked ſo poore leane harkened flying rumor began runne thicke abroad commonly thing firſt beginning bee eve • diſtaſtfull bruited many perſons ſeemed blame valens hote greedily bent make ſpoyle men good enkindling whoſe rigour crueltie miſchievous firebrand readie hand wife father father law petronius promoted ſuddaine jumpe captaine ſouldiors • martenſes f patritian man mind habite bodie deformed wonderfully ſharpeſet ſtrip men without reſpect even skin exquiſit torment bound innocent well offendors fourefold bond raking ſcraping debt due even dayes aurelianus emperour ſorrowing exceedingly abſolved enlarged without receiving ſome hurt damage whoſe intollerable condition miſchiefe alſo made worſe enriched piteous ſorrowes men inexorable cruell carried alſo enraged heart ſo therewith moſt rude untaught fit time either yeeld admit reaſon odious cleander governing praefect emperour commodus high ſtraine outrage madneſſe made havocke read diver men eſtates grievous irkeſome plautianus likewiſe praefect severus ſwelling puffed beyond meaſure would made confuſion thinges died upon revenging edge ſword theſe lamentable proceeding inſtigation ſetting petronius valens ſhut many houſes well poore rich horrible feare miſchiefes toward ſtucke cloſe heart root provinciall people ſouldiors groned theſe burthen alike every man wiſhed day though darke ſecret tearmes joynt grones hand helpe higheſt god might alteration state procopius cloſely taking vantage ſuppoſing bleſſed winter ſpent valens ſpeeding himſelfe apace toward syria entred march bithynia enformed relation report made lordmarchers gothes nation time unfoyled medled ſame moſt cruelly banding together putting force readineſſe invade confines border thracia beeing knowne end himſelfe perſon might without let goe forward whither meant commaunded ſufficient aid horſe foot bee ſent unto thoſe place wherein feared would rodes barbarous enemy prince therefore farre remooved procopius worne away long miſeries ſuppoſing grievous death eaſie tollerable painefull affliction endured threw venture dye hazarded one caſt peril whatſoever deſperate reſolution leading way nothing afraid ſuffer extremity ſetteth hand moſt bold enterpriſe g divitenſes tungritani younger ſort later enrolment appointed among others make haſt unto urgent ſervice thracia purpoſing abide ſolemne manner two dayes conſtantinople haſtened ſollicite mediation ſome ſame company acquainted becauſe perillous difficult matter ſpeake made choice ſome put truſt beeing woon hope great reward promiſed bound religious oath doe whatſoever willed yea gave word favour alſo aſſiſtance fellow ſouldiors among themſelves carried great ſway might much perſuaſion greateſt pay beſt deſert according appointment faire day light ſaid procopius diſtracted ſundrie cogitation went baines h anaſtaſianae ſo called constantine ſiſter knew militarie way honour muſt need ſay yet pent amongſt one beſieged like praetorian cohort time paſt death pertinax received iulianus cheapening one would ſay imperiall dignitie making offer price would give even bywayes phrygia ſo vigorous courage eſcaped embarked would never lye open ſuch doubtfull daungerous chaunces away wife followed ſafetie notwithſtanding cloud arrow flew ſhe point taken priſoner wealthy dame ſhe nobly deſcended whoſe modeſt carriage glorious conſtancie delivered husband afterwards extreame daungers procopius upon foreſaid victorie vaunting himſelfe condition mortalitie knowing man never ſo happie day turning fortune wheele may evening become moſt miſerable commanded houſe arbetio full reaſon thoſe ineſtimable eſcheats houſe time ſpared owne reckoning one owne complices adherent rifled ranſacked cleane taking ſtomacke indignation againſt ſent ſundrie time come unto hee alwayes made delayes alledging excuſe let old age ſickneſſe although cauſe preſumptuous uſurper might well feare ſome grievous inclination turning ballance yet whereas might pleaſure willing aſſent men none make reſiſtance invaded eaſt province deſirous ſee ſome new chaunge irked rigorous rough governement wherewith held yet lingering making longer ſtay allure unto certaine city aſia chuſe skilfull miner getting gold ore thoſe might ſtand good ſtead againſt war expected would lupicinus ſtrong auxiliary ſpeedily advaunced enſignes towardes poſſene theveto peſſinus towne time paſt phrygia galatia quickly fortified garriſon leaſt unexpected accident might unawares ariſe thoſe tract intended take journey foot high hill olympus rough craggie lane minding ſet upon gomoarius while lay ſecure negligent croſſed deſigne many jointly reſolutely agreed together upon conſideration eſpecially enemie hath beene related carrying litter little daughter conſtantius mother faustina way marched alſo battailes approched one another embattailed enkindled courage ſouldiors end imperiall progenie whereto ſayd moreover himſelfe linked might fight boldly like upon time macedonian readie ſtrike battail illyrian placed king yet infant ſwathling band behind armie raunged battaile ray feare leaſt ſhould carried away captive fought valiantly vanquiſhed enemy againſt theſe craftie fetch emperour ſage policie helpe matter thus wavering readie reele tooke good order exhorted arbetio ſometime conſull long time lived privately repaire unto end reverent regard captaine constantius rebel fell ſtomacke might appeaſed ſo fell deed yeares elder dignitie higher reſt ſhewed reverend gray haires florentius barchalba tribune well knowne ſervice moſt bloudie warres even conſtantius dayes neceſſitie owne drawne leawd wicked action therefore greater part night paſt moone evening ſhone untill day light augmented feare procopius ſeeing every ſide himſelfe deſtitute meanes eſcaping knowing doe falleth commonly ſuch hard caſes expoſtulated lamentable heavie fortune ſo whelmed world ſundrie care ſuddainely owne companion faſt bound upon returne day brought campe preſented emperour ſaying never word looking downeward immediately head ſmitten hee buried trouble civile diſcords growing according example perpenna old time murthered sertorius ſat meat enjoyed soveraignetie plucked forth ſhrubs ſhrowded himſelfe brought pompeius commaundement ſlaine like heat bloud florentius barchalba brought ſtreightwayes killed without regard conſideration reaſon betrayed lawfull prince even iuſtice ſelfe would pronounced rightly killed rebell enemie civile peace named ought ample large reward given ſo memorable act procopius departed life fortie yeares old tenne moneths man uncomely bodie meane ſtature ſomewhat ſtouping gate looking alwayes downeward ground cloſe ſad behavior like world craſſus lucillius tully make report laughed life time wondered ſo long lived ſtained bloudſhed chap xiii marcellus captaine nicea serenianus ſlaine chalcedonpoſſeſſed taketh upon ſhaddow deadly wofull emperour within little ſuppreſſed cruell proceeding againſt complices procopius marcellus beyond meaſure valens implacable man whoſe greateſt fault deſerved blame whoſe crueltie deſcribed neere ſame time marcellus protector couſin ſame procopius captaine alſo garriſon nicea intelligence given ſouldiors revolt death procopius came upon serenianus unawares dead time midnight ſhut hee within palace ſlew whoſe death life many ſurvived victorie man rough hewen rude behaviour reſemblance condition vicinitie native ſoyle well accepted valens obſerving cloſe diſpoſition pleaſure prince much enclined crueltie would doubt maſſacred many innocent perſons ſlaine marcellus aforeſaid riding preſently unto chalcedon ſeizing owne hand crie ſhout ſome baſe condition deſperat eſtate thruſt forward miſchiefe taketh upon momentanie ſhadow emperour coſt life induced thereto two motif failed deceived three thouſand gothes upon pacification king ſent aid procopius pretending kin unto constantius thought might brought ſome ſmall reward conſideration ſide alſo proceeding illyricum yet unknowne amid theſe fearefull occurrence equitius given underſtand faithfull eſpials preparation whole warre turned upon aſia departing succi aſſayed great force violence open philippopolis called old time eumolpiada ſhut kept enemy garriſons citie great importance like impeach comming caſe ſhould forced bring aid left behind unto valens yet knew beene done nacolia haſten unto haemimontum little vaine preſumption uſurpation marcellus known ſent adventurous reſolute ſouldiors apprehended caſt ſafe cuſtodie ſlave yeelded receive puniſhment whereupon next day following brought foorth n ſides moſt cruelly cut mangled together conſorts ſuffered like torment died regard onely favoured loved diſpatched serenianus way cruell phalaris truſtie one another even teaching cruell policie learning ſhewed upon ſmall trifling occaſions mortall deadly warre fall chiefe captaine rooted rigorous proceeding againſt many eyther error treſpaſſes required moſt againſt p defendors philippopolis hardly much adoe yeelded citie themſelves ſeene head procopius carried gaule gratifie thoſe made much entreatie ſome chaſtiſed mildly among araxius chiefe man ambitious labouring voice interceſſion daughter husband agilo heat broile attained praefect ſay puniſhment confined iſlands ſhortly eſcaped euphraſius phronemius likewiſe ſent weſt part expoſed determination valentinian verily euphraſius quit ſet free phronemius away cherrhoneſus ſame buſineſſe unmercifully puniſhed becauſe favourite iulianus ſacred memorie whoſe memorable vertues prince brother depraved themſelves neither like comming neere unto beſides exemplarie puniſhments grievous yea farre terrible thoſe execution fall battailes tormentor drag yron hooke bloudie examination without reſpect age dignitie made foule worke eſtates degree pretence peace moſt deteſtable vice put practiſe while men generally curſed unluckie victorie grievous deadly warre whatſoever among weapon yet ſounding trumpet equalitie condition maketh danger lighter power martiall valour either preventeth attempted death happen ſuddainely unawares carrieth ſence ignominie ſhame bringeth end life paine together wicked impious purpoſes right lawes pretence iudges ſit downe falſe colour ſet upon either catonian cui bono fuerit ſuch like caſſian ſentence whatſoever done done according great ruler magiſtrat puffed pride ſatisfie pleaſure matter great importance even life death weighed conſidered accordingly muſt iſſue need fall capitall miſchiefe higheſt degree one thoſe dayes reſpect powerfull toward court burning greedie deſire ſeize upon men good although openly knowne accuſe innocent perſon yet welcommed familiar faithfull friend ſhortly enriched men misfortune emperour readie ynough doe hurt lying open accuſers procuring deadly information proceeded moſt fiercely ſundrie ſorts puniſhments therein tooke delight ignorant hee worthie ſaying tully ſheweth unhappie thinke may lawfully doe thing implacable rigour moſt righteous cauſe verily foulely blemiſhing victorie expoſed many innocent folke tormentor engorged themſelves meat drinke turne edge point ſword one upon anothers bodie ſtrangers state growne great flouriſhing government conſuls marcus didius mightie reſolution conſtancie ſubdued theſe nation untamed alwayes time wandering licentiouſly without civilitie lawes druſus reduced within proper bound owne minutius neere unto river februs runneth high hils odryſae battaile vanquiſhed thoſe remained cruell battaile appius claudius proconſull utterly deſtroyed romane navy poſſeſſed townes ſtanding upon boſphorus propontis theſe came lucullus noble warrior conqueror place firſt others doubtfull battailes fought hazard commonweale ſixe province gained among firſt confineth afront upon illyrian ſpeciall name called thracia adorned two ſpatious city philippopolis called old time wandering travailes long time perpetuall traine proſperous auſpices arrived italie truth knowne continuall rumor time time bruited manner theſe countrey people region aforeſaid inhabite round high mountaines outgoe u health bodie certaine peculiar prerogative long life happeneth folke thinke hereupon abſtaine feeding many meat together reaſon continuall freſhneſſe deaw cold ſprinklings bindeth hardeneth body enjoy ſweetneſſe purer ayre beſides firſt ſee sunne beames owne nature give maintaine life infected corruption earthly thing thus digeſted order theſe matter returne began chap iiii valens reiecting frivolous excuſe gothes maintained procopius ſide paſſed hister meeting none make reſiſtance returneth force warre yeres enſuing renewed length gothes interceſsion athanaricus obtaine peace valens goeth backe conſtantinople procopius vanquiſhed phrygia matter civile diſſentions layed aſleepe victor generall horſemen ſent unto gothes know plaine tearmes cauſe nation friend unto romanes obliged covenant free peace given aid armes unto one warred againſt lawfull naturall prince might ſeeme firſt plea juſtifie deed preſented unto letter ſame procopius alledging tooke upon empire due unto neere kinſman conſtantines race avouching error worthie pardoned vpon knowledge whereof relation victor valens making ſmall reckoning moſt vaine excuſe advaunced warlike manner againſt foreknowledge alreadie trouble comming toward beginning spring aſſembled force together encamped neere unto ſtrong hold named daphne upon bridge floored flankes hatch ſhips paſſed river hiſter without reſiſtance made bearing himſelfe aloft great boldneſſe riding downe could find none might overcome terrifie men ſtrucken feare ſouldiors approching brave ſhew preparation retyred mountaines accurſius rendeth succi serri high inacceſſible ſuch skilfull wayes leaſt ſpent whole summer ſhould returne without exploit done ſending arinibeus colonell footman certaine company waſt ſpoyle ſeized part family ſuch came broken winding wayes might taken ſtraggling wandering plaine field thus atchieved onely fortune preſented hand returned force ſafetie neither given received grievous blow yeare following aſſayed like courage enter enemy land hindered ſtreames • w danubius overflowed farre beyond bank reſted ſtill pitching ſtanding campeneere village named carporum untill end autumne whence becauſe nothing could done reaſon great flouds kept departed martianopolis winter semblably third yeare alſo holding purpoſe ſtill broken ground barbarous enemy novidunum meanes ſhippes joyned together paſſe river continuall journeyes taken ſet upon grutungi warlicke nation inhabited ſome light skirmiſhes conſtrained feate extremitie athanaricus take flight thoſe dayes moſt puiſſant ruler power thought ſufficient dared make reſiſtance himſelfe force returned againe martianopolis keepe winter place thoſe tract meet convenient ſundrie accident fell theſe three yeares ſpace good motif reaſons end warre firſt enemy feare encreaſed prince long abode theſe part becauſe barbarous people debarred traffique commerce diſtreſſed exceeding want neceſſaries ſo much ſent embaſſadors oftentimes manner ſuppliants craved pardon peace vnto emperour unexpert muſt need ſay moſt equall indifferent conſiderer yet thing beguiled pernitious allurement flatterie afflicted commonwealth ſlaughters execution ever lamented taking ſage advice common good decreed behovefull graunt peace ſent forth turnes victor arintheus managing horſemens ſervice given true intelligence letter gothes condeſcended unto condition propoſed meet place appointed concluſion peace much athanaricus avouched bound fearefull curſe othe beſide father commaundement expreſly forbidden tread time upon roman ground regard might bee compelled withall beene unſeemely baſe thing emperor ſhould go thought good wiſe certaine veſſels guided ore mids river embarked emperor foreſaid iudge nation together eſquiers ſhould determined paſſe covenant league peace together buſineſſe diſpatched pledge received valens returned conſtantinople afterwards athanaricus driven native countrey faction neereſt kinſmen follower yeelded unto nature enterred ſolemne ſumptuous funeral guiſe countrey chap v while valentinian lyeth ſicke grievous diſeaſe certaine principall officer ruler lay head together chuſing ruſticus iulianus master rolles severus colonell footman emperour ſaid emperour recovering declareth gratianus ſon colleague auguſtus grave oration recommended unto armie generally accepted adorned coronet imperiall robe exhorteth doe devoire exceeding applauſe while valentinian meane time lay grievouſly ſicke thought like dye feaſt gaules ſecretly met ſerved emperours armie rusticus iulianus k maſter principall remembrance roll furious fit motion madneſſe nominated empire one bloudthirſtie ſavage beaſt well ſhewed while governed affricke place proconſull prefecture citie dyed fearing daungerous tickliſh dayes tyrannie pleaſure whereof climbed high dignitie default ſhould ſeeme worthie perſons enforced ſhew himſelfe mild verie tractable againſt theſe gaules ſome deeper reach drift laboured favour severus colonell footman man fitted obtaining thereof albeit rigorous dread yet tollerable everie way preferred rusticus aforeſaid while theſe matter thought upon effect emperour ſomewhat refreſhed recovered meanes many remedy perceiving himſelfe ſcarce yet delivered daunger death full purpoſe adorne imperiall enſignes owne ſonne gratian pretie young ſtripling well growne provided thing readineſſe accordingly wrought ſouldiors accept thereof good gree willingly gratian come went forth field aſcended tribunall environed gallant companie noble perſons officer state hee tooke youth right hand brought forth ſolemne publicke oration recommended ordained emperour armie wiſe habit princely place dignitie carrie ample ſigne favour enlarged toward deemed worthie perſonage many others thoſe right honourable aſſociats counſels foreman deſires wiſhes due office pietie kindneſſe ſet hand matter god ſaying amen promiſing good ſucceſſe whoſe eternall ayd helpe roman state enured enduring hard world capable yet martiall toyle yee ſee anſwerably according prayſeworthie vertues familie noble deed auncestors like ſhortly come behind verie feare ſay envie woont thinke conceit weighing many time manner motion though ſame yet come maturitie theſe tender youthfull yeares much poliſhed humanitie ſtudies wittie ſciences ſhall peiſe examine uncorrupt iudgement deſerts commoditie joy declared gratian augustus intermingling moſt lowd ſound trumpet gentle noyſe clattering armour valentinian perceived rejoycing greater confidence adorned ſonne crowne robe higheſt eſtate kiſſed thus gorgeous goodly ſeen giving attentive eare ſaid ſpake unto manner behold quoth ſonne gratian thou hast upon thee imperiall garment hoped conferred luckie oſſes acclamation iudgement ſelfe fellow ſouldiors arme thy ſelfe therefore according importance urgent affaire colleague thy father uncle enure thy bodie without feare goe whole regiment footman river hister rhene paſſable foot admoniſh thee accordingly thoſe beſide chiefest maintainer state deſire earnestly beſeech grounded firme affection yee preſerve hopefull emperour riſing growth committed hee faithfull protection theſe expedition againſt alemanes ſame greater puiſſance uſually beene conſidering defence state required leſſe becauſe faithleſſe ſtirres nation whoſe force might ſoone renewed feared ſouldiors nevertheleſſe enkindled againſt ſuſpected condition feeble ſuppliants yet ſhortly threatening deadly mortall hoſtilitie gave reſt ceſſation armes valentinian therefore together gratian aſſembled huge hoaſt well furniſhed well armes victual ſent sebastian lieutenant together band illyricum italie whereof hee regiment joyne freſh prime yeare ſet forward marching foure ſquare battailons cloſe together undivided himſelfe middeſt iovinus severus ſ expert approoved warrior flanking ſides rankes hand feare might ſuddainely aſſayled ſo thence guidance thoſe perfect wayes diſcovered beforehand avenue plaine country lying great length ſouldiors advauncing ſoftly forward yet eagre fight found enemy alreadie threatening manner gnaſhed teeth anger certaine day journey could meet none made reſiſtance put forth regiment certaine cohort devouring flame fire conſumed ſtanding corne houſes could ſet eye upon ſave ſuch food doubtfull ſtate wherein ſtood forced gather keepe done prince going forward milder pace come neere place named solms heroldo bretta lazio solicinium ſtood ſtill barre beene ſet way enformed moſt true relation outrider barbarous enemy diſcovered afarre ſeeing way meanes left ſave life unleſſe ſpeedie encounter defended themſelves preſuming boldly upon skilfulneſſe wayes one mind accord gained verie high mountaine meanes rough craggie hill ſteepe unacceſſable everie ſide ſave onely north whence hath eaſie gentle fall deſcent hand pitched downe ſtanderds manner cryed alarme hand ſouldiors eaſie directed commaundement prince leader ſtood ground waiting untill banner ſet aloft ſignall begin battaile convenient time much little time allowed take deliberation while impatient roman ſouldiors terribly tooke fumed one ſide alemans made horrible noyſes courſe onely ſhortneſſe time quicke diſpatch admitted namely sebaſtian company ſhould poſſeſſe himſelfe north part hill ſaid eaſie deſcent little adoe good luck killing german ſhold flie thought good century maniples without making great commaunders privie ſecret deſignement none guard perſon rode ſome companie whoſe induſtrie fidelitie good proofe view diſcover bottomes hill giving arrogant prizer prayſer himſelfe might bee ſome way found leading thoſe high difficult cliff beſide foreriders diſcovered went therefore way unknowne moiſt mariſhes ſurely loſt life ſodaine rode enemie beſtowed ambuſh among craggie broken cliffes tooke himſelfe laſt helpe time neceſſitie ſetting ſpurres horſe galloped ſlipperie mire got away ſhrowded himſelfe within boſome legion ſo eſcaped ſodaine unlooked daunger whereto ſo neere gentleman chamber carried helmet richly ſet gold pretious ſtones together verie caſe periſhed quite could never found alive dead reſt therefore graunted refreſhing body banner erected woont give ſignall warning battaile menacing ſound trumpet kindling courage salvius lupicinus two valiant young knight choſen purpoſe give onſet daungerous ſervice one one guard targuetier gentile band others readily ſtepped forth led way moſt bold reſolution toward battailons began advance terrible noiſe ſtirring inticing forward thus brandiſhing ſpeares come foreſaid cliffes ſtood againſt endevoured maugre alemans ſhoved thruſt ſore upon gaine higher ground thither came maine force armie end following hard theſe ringleader thicket buſhes rough bramble bryers much ſtraining ſtrength got high toppes mountaine great ſtomacke therefore part conflict began deadly dint point ſword tried one ſide roman skilfull ſouldiors barbarous enemy though fierce yet unwarie inconſiderat coped joyned hand hand verily armie diſplayed verie large ſpreading forth wing encloſe enemy ſides aſſailed ſore terrified hideous outcry neighing horſes ſounding trumpet yet nevertheleſſe tooke heart againe boldly reſiſted thus hoſts equall ballance fortune maintained fight ſmall ado endevour while conflict continued mutual killing ſlaying either ſide length ſuch valiant courage roman enemy rankes broken feare ſo ſhufled together formoſt mingled hindmoſt while ſeeke get away good footmanſhip pierced caſting dart javelin enemy launced end while run fetching wind ſhort wearie laid open followed hammes calf legges backes concluſion many beaten downe sebastian placed freſh companie ſupply back mountaines ſlew part ſlipped eſcaped away reaſon hemmed ſide tooke heed reſt diſperſed betooke themſelves lurking corner wood conflict dyed part alſo men ſmall account among valerianus principall domeſtici guard ordinarie certaine eſquier targuetier borne verie evirate eunuch ſuch expert approved warriour might compared either old sicinius sergius theſe exploit thus performed ſuch varietie accident ſouldiors returned unto winter harbour emperours trier chap x probus pretorio prefectus l chiefe iustice cunning experienced courtier lively depainted theſe dayes vulcatius ruffinus departed life even time prefect pretorium government probus ſent rome citie rule prefectus pretorio man noble parentage power wealth knowne roman world throughout almoſt one end held poſſeſſions livelodes diſperſed whether right wrong lyeth ſimple judgement ſet downe man certain twofold u fortune poet faine carrying flightwings ſhewed unto world one bountifull benefactor advauncer friend great fortune otherwhiles againe vengible waytlayer bloudie grudge diſpleaſures much miſchiefe albeit could doe much life time giving great largeſſes ſuing continually unto thoſe high authoritie yet timorous oppoſition thoſe bold bearing himſelfe bigge ſuch fearefull ſo hee ſeemed preſumed himſelfe creake vaunt loftie tragicall note whenſoever feared debaſe himſelfe lower comicall actor kind fiſhes ſwimming creature driven owne element live long upon drye land even ſo drouped could hold head without prefecture forced take upon trouble lawſuites great family reaſon infinite deſires never innocent end may able effect many deſignes without puniſhment uſe engage lord deepely affaire state governement confeſſed muſt bred magnanimitie hee never commaunded either appendant client ſervant doe unlawfull action found one committed crime hainous offence although even iuſtice ſelfe ſaid nay without due enquirie made matter without reſpect goodneſſe honeſtie would patronize fault cicero way reprehenſion noteth theſe word difference quoth betweene counſellor fact defendor fact mattereth whether would thing done reioyce done howbeit owne nature ſuſpitious baſe faint heart ſmiling alſo bitter ſort yea glavering otherwhiles upon man harme notorious evident bad propertie ſuch condition eſpecially thought may concealed ſo implacable hard hearted hee purpoſed doe man ſhrewd turne could poſſibly intreated enclined forgive ſo much light errours delinquency therefore eares ſeemed many men though indeed cloſe ſtopped higheſt pitch dignity rich full care taking thought regard troubled alwayes light diſeaſes order paſſed affaire weſt part chap xi sapor king perſians invadeth armenia king arſaces taketh priſoner dolorous torment killeth while goeth murder make away wife ſon fall ſome accident ſeeds new warre betweene roman perſians bvt sapor thus long living king perſians prince verie beginning raigne much given addicted ſweetneſſe pillage robbery deceaſe emperour iulian covenant ſo diſhonourable peace concluded ſeeming together people friend u brake faithfull bond article agreement made iovianus reached armenia ſtrength ſaid capitulation beene reverſed cancelled might lay ſame unto owne dominion firſt diver falſe deceitfull fleights put whole nation withſtood intent ſome ſmall light dammages ſoliciting certaine chiefe ruler great lord countrey ſurpriſing ſodaine rodes invaſions caught king himſelfe arſaces meanes fine allurement thoſe interlaced perjuties invited feaſt commaunded drawne away ſecret back doore cauſed eye plucked head bound chaines ſilver among reputed ſome ſolace eaſement yet vaine though puniſhment inflicted upon honourable perſons ſo ſent away caſtle named agabana much torture executioner ſword bereft head done becauſe perfidious treacherie might overpaſſe nothing unpolluted prophaned depoſed driven souromaces roman authoritie ruler hiberia conferred ſaid poteſtat • huiuſmodi candem place governement upon one aſpacures gave unto beſide royall diademe nation thereby ſhew hee contemned trode foot judgement election state effected moſt wicked ungodly mind committed regiment armenia unto cylaces eunuch artabanes time paſt intertained traiterous fugitive prince one theſe time captain prefect nation ſaid beene generall force gave charge ſpeciall care raſe artogeraſſa towne ſtrongly walled ſtoutly manned keeping arſaces treaſure wife ſonne theſe chieftaines therefore appointed began ſiege ſaid fortified place ſcituat upon rough ſtonie mountaine reaſon alſo extreame cold weather nothing froſt ſnow inacceſſable cylaces eunuch meet fellow deceive poore woman taking artabanes approached quickly neere creeping cloſe ſwords readie drawne entred campe feared ſuch matter while man made reſiſtance ſlew number lay unlookedfor revolt unexpected ſlaughter perſians rayſed mightie quarrel cauſes diſcord betweene u sapor alſo aggravated matter emperour valens entertained para ſon arſaces perſuaſion mother departed ſome ſaid fortified towne commaunded abide thocato barbaris niſan bellan neocaeſarea citie great name pontus x polemoniacus kept liberall diet apparell meet perſon courteous uſage cylaces artabane • allured ſent orator craved valens aid yea required ſaid para king aid preſent denied taken priſoner ſonne curſed device reconciled unto sapor romanes helpe armenian whereupon king perſians addreſſeth himſelfe warre upon romanes sapor underſtood theſe proceeding framed tooke raged beyond meaſure ſo riſing armes greater preparation way open reiſes raiſing booty waſted armenia whoſe comming para affrighted alſo cylaces artabanes looking aidforces withdrew themſelves noukes thoſe high mountain confine betweene limit lazica lying cloſe five moneths together among ſecret wood winding woulds deluded manifold attempt king perceiving labour loſt conſidering pinching ſeaſon mid winter burnt tree bearing apple ſuch fruit fortified alſo thoſe pile fort gotten either force treaſon whole puiſſance armie beleaguered artogeraſſa many skirmiſhes aſſaults variable event defendant toyled towne layed open burnt fetched forth wife arſaces treaſure aforeſaid led away cauſes arintheus lieutenant ſent armie ſuccour helpe armenian caſe perſians ſhould attempt aſſayle againe freſh warre meane sapor wonderous wylie craftie could carrie himſelfe lowly aloft better advantage pretending ſhew ſome future alliance ſocietie ſecret meſſengers rebuked para negligent forgetfull owne eſtate thus colour pretence royall majeſtie ſlave unto cylaces artabanes forward truſting theſe traines flattering faire enticement made adoe ſlew ſent head ſlaine unto sapor whoſe devoted vaſſale become vpon loſſe misfortune ſpred farre abroad armenia beene quite loſt perſians comming arintheus terrified made ſtay ere invaded ſecond time contenting themſelves onely ſent embaſſadors unto emperour craving according agreed betweene iovianus ſaid nation might protected rejected sauromaces ſaid beene diſplaced expelled kingdome hiberia ſent backe againe twelve legion conduct terentius neere unto river cyrus aſpacuras requeſted hand ſince couſin germanes ſiſters ſonnes might raigne joyntly together alledging himſelfe could neither ſurrender turne unto romane ſide becauſe ſonne vltus kept ſtill among perſians hoſtage whereof emperour informed end might policie wiſedome appeaſe trouble like riſe affaire alſo condiſcended diviſion hiberia namely cyrus river ran middeſt thereof might divice ſo sauromaces ſhould hold part ſide bordered upon armenian lazi aſpacuras bounded upon chipiche caſtal zuttia ruſcello zitracha incolic albania perſians sapor ſore aggrieved hereat cry indignitie offered unto article agreement contrarie tenor ſaid covenant armenia ſuccoured embaſſage hee ſent redreſſe enormitie came nothing without aſſent privitie concluded kingdome hiberia ſhould divided dores beene faſt locked againſt friendſhip layed aid neighbour nation put armie readineſſe end faire ſeaſon yeare came might overthrow fabricke romanes framed owne behoofe xxviii booke chap miſerable state rome citie maximinus praefect whoſe parentage riſing deſcribed while perfidious diſloyall dealing cauſeth perſia beforeſaid unexpected trouble king behalfe warres revived eaſt part begin againe ſixteene yeares upward death nepotianus bellona provoked upon ſmall occaſions working wofull calamity raged throughout rome ſet combuſtion would god beene ever buried ſilence leaſt happily attempted ſometime ſemblable like doe harme generall example precedent delinquency albeit exquiſite narration bloudie hyſtorie feare might juſtly pull backe many ſundrie cauſes duly conſidered yet preſuming confidently upon modeſtie preſent age ſummarily lay open every particular memorable neither loath thinke much briefely ſhew thoſe accident befallen unto ancient writer might feare firſt warre medes perſians ſpoyled aſia beſetting city herein huge puiſſant force yea threatening defendant thereof terrible torment dolorous death brought people thus ſhut beſieged extremitie ſore afflicted great grievous calamity killed owne deare wife child throwne mooveable good fire caſt themſelves alſo heapes ſtriving vie might moſt commune flame conſumed countrey together argument ſoone particular reproove keeping ſtirre ſaying done firſt ſuch thing overſlipt themſelves ſaw thus farre forth give ſatisfaction unto namely thing worthy put downe writing paſſed among meane baſe perſons neither ſhould beene needfull ſufficient inſtruction verie record conſidering many publique miſeries misfortune ſo rife hot new furie uncurbed unreſtrained made generall pudder confuſion while expectation order whereof wee know carried wiſe governed affricke proconſull allowed corne unto carthaginian much diſtreſſed want food garner appointed people state rome within earth yeelded plentifull ſtore graine made full reſtitution thereof without delay much hee ſold unto wanted ten modij rate one c ſolidus himſelf bought thirtie ſame price whole gaine advantage accrewing thereby amantius famous soothſayer reſt thoſe dayes ſecret information diſcovered made knowne performance complement ſome ſmall matter ſent ſame hymetius ſacrifice hereupon judicially convented albeit hee aboveſaid charged beene conſutarius partner counſellor miniſter forme prayer made well tewed rod compelled confeſſe baniſhed britaine amantius condemned afterwards capitall matter ſuffered death theſe affair order paſſed hymetius brought towne ottegoli criculum cauſe heard ampelius prefect citie maximinus vice prefect like ſeemed preſently put away libertie graunted ſpeake tooke better courſe appealed ſuccour emperour ſo protected ſafeguard name kept ward ſafe prince pleaſure asked ſhould done hee committed managing cauſe unto senat finding equall ballance juſtice caſe ſtood thereupon confining boae place dalmatia could hardly endure emperours wrath chafed mightily hee underſtood man deſtined himſelfe intended death puniſhment milder ſentence theſe many ſuch like example daungers ſeene men begun feare would light upon leaſt ſo many enormity winked creeping ſtill little little might grow whole heapes miſeries vertue decree paſſed senator nobilitie embaſſadors diſpatched unto emperour name pretextatus beene prefect citie venustus ſometime deputieprefect minervius late conſular governor province ſupplication ſhould bee inflicted puniſhment grievous offence required senatour unexampled unlawfull manner might expoſed unto torture admitted conſiſtorie made report theſe particular aforeſaid valentinian denied ever ordained ſuch courſe cryed traduced ſuſtained abuſe eupraxius queſtor modeſt tearmes reproved whoſe libertie ſpeech cruell proceeding thus begun exceeded precedent rigour reformed time lollianus young gentleman verie prime youth ſonne lampadius beene prefect maximinus looked narrowly cauſe convicted copied forth booke magick witch craft charmes c diveliſh art reaſon yong yeres head well ſtayed upon point ſent exile feared motion inſtigation father appealed emperour commaunded led thence unto court comitatum counſell ſay ſmoke flame delivered phalangius governour province audaluzia baetica loſt life hangman hand beſides theſe taratius baſſus afterwards prefect citie brother camenius likewiſe one marcianus euſaphius clariſsimi noble perſons senator degree brought queſtion triall privie one ſame practiſe ſorcerie named favour make much auchenius peradventure could skill sorcerie c chariotier evidence proofes doubtfull went away quit meanes helpe victorinus running rumour went moſt inward friend maximinus neither eſcaped woman free part alſo leſſe like calamity even verie ſex many high birth put death guiltie foule crime either adulterie whoredome among claritas flaviana greateſt name altera wit flaviana one led execution ſtripped ſo neere apparell wherewith ſhe clad ſhee permitted keepe ſo much would ſuffice cover ſecret part therefore executioner convicted committed moſt lewd ſhamefull fact burnt quicke moreover pafius cornelius senator convinced polluted themſelves damnable ſleights poiſoning ſorcerie definitive ſentence ſame maximinus put death like ſort alſo procurator mint loſt life organmaker organiſt sericus profeſſed wreſtler asbolius afore named becauſe exhorting appeach name place thought good hee promiſed faithfully othe would commaund none bee puniſhed either fire ſword cauſed killed mightie pelt e plumbets awarded campenſis soothſayer flaming fire affaire tyed ſuch othe convenient ſuppoſe declare cauſe drave headlong upon owne death deſtruction aginatius man noble aunceſtors deſcended according hath beene conſtantly reported touching matter evident record extant maximinus while yet prefect corne victual puffing brawling ſtill proud ſpirit owne gotten meane inſtigations incouragement boldneſſe proceeded ſo farre contempt probus ranke right honourable perſons greateſt vertue prefecture pretorium governor province aginatius taking mightie indignitie ſetting alſo heart examining cauſes olybrius preferred maximinus conſidering himſelfe deputieprefect rome ſecretly familiar talke ſhewed unto probus vaine man ſpurning againſt perſons high deſert might overthrowne brought confuſion thought ſo good theſe letter ſome affirmed probus ſent making bodie privie therto bearer unto maximinus ſtanding great feare growne cunning expert miſchiefe beſides grace reputation emperour read man fell ſuch heat rage thenceforth hee bent engine levelled bolt aginatius like ſome ſerpent wounded ſquized knowne perſon beſide another greater cauſe practiſing overthrow aginatius brought utter deſtruction accuſed victorinus dead while lived hee ſold friendſhip maximinus gained proceeding whoſe laſt teſtament himſelfe received ſmall legacy like malapert ſaucineſſe threatened wife anepſia go law litigious ſuits moleſt fearing theſe trouble end ſhe might protected alſo aid maximinus feined deviſed husband wil lately made left unto legacie three thouſand pound weight ſilver burning exceſſive deſire covetouſneſſe without vice alſo claimed one moitie inheritance reſting contented herewith ſmall portion nothing ſufficient deviſed another feat hee thought honeſt ſafe becauſe would forgo hold ſo good meanes offered unto gaine wealthie patrimonie ſued daughter law victorinus wife anepſia bare unto former huſband ſonnes wife aſſent woman ſoon obtained concluded chap iiii detestable ſleights practiſes maximinus might continue ſtill butcherly execution created prefectus pretorio diver ſucceſſors prefectſhip citie last exceedeth crueltie maximinus theſe prankes like ſorrow lamented greatly blemiſhed ſtained beautie rome immortall citie man named grone made outragious ſpoyle manifold overthrow men eſtates ſtretching ſtraining power beyond bound law juſtice report ſmall cord alwayes hanging certain remote window pretorium summitas author uſeth indifferently one end wherof ſhold tye binde together certaine gladly scepticus while one taketh nonze another pulley third hatchet fourth woe bloudy ſubſtance c ſuppoſe almiſle mark untill may meet perfect copie cannot determine place doubt corrupt tamuſa grounded verily upon proofes preſumptions like doe miſchiefe unto many guiltleſſe perſons alſo commaunded ſundrie time mutianus barbatus daily officer miniſters fellowes moſt apt fit deceive others ſeverally bee clapt theſe bewayled owne wofull miſhaps whereby made ſemblance wronged oppreſſed aggravating ſtill crueltie ſaid judge iterating ſame ſpeeches verie often pretended affirmed perſons ſtanding accuſed trouble meanes remedie remaining ſave owne life unleſſe would ſeeme charge accuſe ſome nobilitie great crime joyned ſocietie daunger warranted might eaſily quit abſolved reaſon whereof conſidering vile impietie theſe courſes proceeded abjects neere hand came paſſe many man hand ſtreight manacled thoſe noble birth ſeene unregarded poore plight much diſtreſſed neither ought blamed ſimple ſalutations crouched bowed body ſo low welneere touched verie ground conſidering heard robber peſtiferous breath mouth come oftentimes note ſo diſpoſed perſon could poſſibly found innocent word turning quickly deed beene ynough aſſure terrified good men ever numa pompilius cato wiſe altogether matter carried ſome men eies never drie ſhed freſh teares beholding folk miſeries thing commonly life happeneth men upon ſundrie trouble croſſe accident owne howbeit hard hearted judge ever went oftentimes courſe right juſtice yet one ſpeciall point tollerable otherwhiles hee would ſpare pardon ſome requeſted intreated read tullie ſavoureth yet ſome vice place authoritie wrath quoth implacable rigour bitterneſſe higheſt degree exorable great lightneſſe vanitie notwithstanding choice bad thing preferred bitterneſſe leo went forward admitted ſucceſſor maximinus ſent prince court advaunced praetor praetorio became never jot milder harme ſtill even farre like ſerpents called baſiliskes cocatrices againſt time much beeſomes wherewith nobleman curia uſed ſwept ſeene bloome beare bloſſomes portended ſome perſons moſt contemptible baſe condition raiſed unto high degree rule authoritie although high time returne unto order hiſtorie begun yet without hindering proceſſe time tarrie rehearſing ſome particular iniquitie thoſe governed deputie pręfects citie done otherwiſe ought beene carried according pleaſure maximinus ſame miniſters agent apparitors commeth vrſicinus place man enclined milder courſes becauſe would warie civile gave information referred emperour eſaias others kept hold committing adulterie ruffina gone accuſe indict husband marcellus late purſivant intelligencer treaſon therefore deſpiſed lingering delayer nothing meet ſtout execution quicke diſpatch theſe matter put deputicſhip ſucceeded simplicius hemonenſis profeſſor grammar became counſellor unto maximinus adminiſtration deputieſhip man neither ſtout prowd crooked terrible aſpect ſeeming frame word kind modeſtie ſtudied plotted miſchiefe many firſt put death ruffina together thoſe either party culpable matter adulterie privie thereto touching vrſicinus ſaid given information many others without difference guiltie innocent bloudie battail contending maximinus marſhalled maine battaile endevoured outgoe cutting ſinewes one would ſay noble family imitating g buſiris old time alſo antaeus phalaris ſo ſeemed nought wanting bull agrigentum chap v horrible death heſychia matron tragicall historie fauſiana bloudie catastrophe whereof acted aginatius anepſia married folke put death commaundement maximinus iust iudgement almightie power puniſhing maximinus bloudie butcher theſe ſuch like matter manner paſſed certaine matrone named heſychia fearing much ſome hard dealing cruell torture crime wherewith ſhe ſtood charged houſe apparitor ſergeant unto ſhe committed ward caſt face groveling upon featherbed ſo ſtopping breath noſthrils ended life take another miſchiefe cruell reſt eumenius abienus moſt honorable ranke beene ſlandered maximinus fauſiana worſhipfull gentlewoman death inward friend maximinus victorinus whoſe helpe lived ſecuritie skared comming simplicius man leſſe minded doe great matter menace betooke themſelves live cloſe ſecret fauſiana condemned indictment taken themſelves peremptorily called anſweres vertue edict hid themſelves farther way abienus hee ſhrowded himſelfe privily long time anepſiaes houſe uſually falleth folke going downe ſome croſſe accident unlooked ſure attend upon aggravate calamity ſervant anepſia named apaudulus taking grievouſly wife borne ſome ſtripes houſe went forth night gave notice unto simplicius officer ſent upon ſaid diſcoverie made away lurking place abienus verily upon crime adulterie ſtrongly enforced againſt ſaid committed upon bodie anepſia ſuffered death woman end deferring puniſhment ſhe might aſſured hope ſave life avouched curſed enchantmem ſorcerie wicked art aſſayled ſhe ſuffered diſhonour violence aginatius houſe theſe thing happened simplicius rung againe emperours eares maximinus abode upon malitious mind bare againſt aginatius alreadie cauſe ſpecified privie grudge together power authoritie incenſed made exceeding earneſt ſuit might letter ſent backe againe executed verily braineſicke incitor mightie withall ſoone obtained ſo much fearing heavie load envie hatred caſe man noble birth ſhould come death ſentence judgement simplicius owne counſellor friend alſo pronounced kept himſelfe emperours precept ſtay doubting might find eſpecially truſtie ſure executor horrible deſigne laſt commonly like eaſily ſort like lighted upon one doryphorianus gaule bold franticke perſon promiſing ſhortly accompliſh ſervice tooke order deputieſhip ſhould conferred delivered precept together emperours letter inſtructing man cruell though yet unexpert unskilfull expedition might without let impeachment diſpatch aginatius peradventure upon finding meanes delay would eſcape gone doryphorianus ſped himſelfe haſt tooke long journeyes till hee came rome firſt comming complement ſalutation ended caſt great diligence ſought forcible device helpe ſome others might take away life senatour ſo nobly diſcended intelligence beene found farmehouſe gratianus condemned ſuffered death simplicius alſo killed cut piece illyricum yea doryphorianus pronounced guiltie death thruſt deepe dungeon tullianum prince mother counſell fetched foorth thence x ſlouth vanitie baſe behaviour common people thus much senatours degree come idle baſe common among ſhall ſome going even without ſhooes bare foot yet fine goodly known trim elegant name wit place aſſemblies many company gotten together frapling one againſt another pro contrà while ſome hold others manner among theſe lived greater authoritie others long time even ſatietie yeares uſe oftentimes crie along burſes lombard pawnes commonwealth loſt game trial maſteries following one taketh part performeth race formoſt gaineth goale firſt wiſhedfor day chariotrunning beginneth peepe cleare beames sunne appeare make haſt abroad hye apace quicke ſpeed may outgoe chariot ſtrive prize ſucceſſe event whereof number while ſide wiſh favourably diver wayes great perplexitie ſit watch whole night come thence baſe ſports theatre thoſe actor upon ſtage ſure hiſſed caſe ſome money bought favour abject multitude chaunce one miſſe ſhout noyſe common way approbation imitation barbarous people z taurica crie ſtrangers forrainers ought expelled even forrainers ſay whoſe aid time beene ſupported ſtood upright doe foule abſurd tearmes farre different affection mind thoſe auncient common many whoſe wittie pleaſant conceited ſpeeches ſtand upon record dayes device found ſerve ſtead ſtudious reſound prayſes worthie thereof certaine perſons framed appointed ſpeake every ſhew ſpectacle exhibited ſhall unto enterluderhymer baiter chariotier stageplayer every ſort likewiſe unto iudges magiſtrats well higher inferiour yea unto dame come continually bald note let learne thee ſhould learned man able declare among theſe number given wholly gourmandiſe belly cheare like ſmellfeaſts tracing ſteame ſent meat liſtening ſhrill voice woman cockecrow manner peacockes cry hunger emptineſſe tripping tiptoe lightly upon ground hand every great man hall readie even gnaw owne finger end while diſhes meat cooling others againe looking prying pot ynough overturne one ſtomacke raw meat waiting wiſtly untill ſodden man would thinke anatomiſts democritus ſearching intrayles beaſts cut teach meanes poſteritie might cure inward diſeaſes may ſuffice whole diſcourſed touching citie matter let u returne reſt occaſioned many ſundrie occurrence province chap xi warre againſt saxon daunted ſight preſence romane ſouldiors afterwards wile encloſed bewed piece every one while emperours third time conſuls brake multitude saxon paſſed danger ocean kept march bent journey romane limit oftentimes fed ſlaughter men brunt firſt violent excurſion nannenus ſuſtained lieutenant appointed thoſe region man approoved long time toyleſome ſervice warres encountred multitude reſolute die ſaw ſome ſouldiors ſlaine himſelfe ſore wounded able match thoſe skirmiſhes redoubled upon inſtructed emperour done thus much obtained severus colonell footman ſhould come ſuccour diſtreſſed ſtate conduct ſufficient power come place marſhalled men ſundry ſeverall rankes conflict began terrified diſordered barbarian ſo oppoſed hand make reſiſtance eye dazeled brightneſſe enſignes eagle craved pardon peace upon long debating conſultation thought policie behoofefull commonweale truce concluded many tall ſerviceable young men warres allowed according capitulation condition drawne behalfe saxon permitted depart without let hinderance repaire unto place whence came devoid feare upon returne certaine footman ſent ſecretly lay ambuſh within valley whence might little adoe aſſayle many paſſed fell farre otherwiſe hoped noyſe saxon comming ſome men raiſed leapt forth unſeaſonable time ſuddainly diſcovered while make haſt ſtrengthen themſelves put flight barbarian yelling dolefull hideous manner howbeit ſoone caſt themſelves ring ſtood ſince extremitie miniſtred ſtrength unto though ſame ſomewhat impaired forced fight great ſlaughter made died every one left one man alive cornet horſemen armed piece placed like ſort another ſide neere parting way endanger barbarian paſſed moved ſtirred fearefull crie heard nimbly ſuccoured encounter much eagre ſharpe romanes reſolute heart giving recharge encloſed drawne ſwords killed downe right neither could returne ſee native home againe ſo much one permitted remaine alive execution fellow ſouldiors albeit ſome juſt preciſe judge matter may blame perfidious foule fact yet caſe well weighed conſidered take indignly miſchievous companie robber end upon advantage opportunitie ſurpriſed cut chap xii valentinian ſetteth burgundians upon alemans gone forward farre bankes rhene finding helpe roman ſuccours returne native countrey theodoſius ſetting upon alemans diſperſed rhetia partly killeth partly ſendeth italy dwell po theſe affaire ſo fortunately performed valentinian toſſing ſundrie thought mind verie carefully perplexed revolving full many wayes caſting meanes might take downe quell pride alemans king macrianus without meaſure end reſtleſſe ſtirres broyles troubled roman state fierce cruell nation ever ſince firſt beginning riſing thereof ever abated varietie accident chaunces yet grow eftſoones ſo man would thinke many age beene touched emperour approoving one counſell another length reſolved upon burguignians burgundians warlike nation puiſſant huge multitude therefore dreadfull neighbour ſhould rayſed armes rooting many time hee wrot unto king certaine truſtie ſecret meſſengers foreappointed time ſhould ſodainely invade ſurpriſe promiſing himſelfe alſo perſon paſſing rhene roman force would encounter affrighted ſeeking avoid unlookedfor power armed men theſe letter prince thankefully gladly received two reſpects firſt burgundians knew themſelves bee auncient time ofspring deſcended roman againe becauſe conteſted oftentimes alemans ſaltpits bound whereupon ſent moſt choſen picked band ſouldiors aſſembled together gone forward farre bankes rhene while emperour buſily occupied rayſing fort terrified men exceeding much wherefore ſtayed ſmall neither valentinian came day appointed according promiſe could perceive thing done undertaken diſpatched embaſſadours court requiring might ſome ayd ſent unto intending otherwiſe returne home owne countrey leaſt ſhould expoſe back part naked enemy perceived circumſtances denyed emperour trifled time departed thence indignation king prince underſtood beene deluded mocked fell rage killed priſoners returned native country among theſe burgundians king generall name called hendinos according auncient rite cuſtom depoſed regall authoritie removed caſe raigne war ſpeed well earth yeeld plentie corne like aegyptians woont aſcribe ſuch chaunces unto governours higheſt prieſt among burgundians tearmed sinistus continueth tearme life ſubject ſuch daungers king occaſion falling ſo fit opportune time alemans feare foreſaid nation diſperſed blacke while beſtowed hidden blind corner territorie way thoſe implement put readineſſe future examination require trumpet inward domeſticall calamity ſounded becauſe hee ſeemeth leſſe deceitfull wittingly paſſeth knoweth done feyneth thing never done wee deny man maketh doubt thereof life valens oftentimes privie conſpiracies alſo plunged moſt extreame daungers ſwords blade militarie men owne traine ſet cloſe verie throat oppoſition deſtinies put backe ſayd deſtinies preordained lamentable peril thracia onely certaine woodie place betweene antioch seleucia while lay ſweetly aſleepe afternoone ſhade layd sallustius one seutarij oftentimes elſe forelayd others yet eſcaped limit life ſet downe unto verie nativitie bridled thoſe horrible attempt like happened otherwhiles emperours commodus severus whoſe life moſt forcibly oft aſſayled inſomuch many ſundrie inteſtine daungers one within liſts amphitheatre ſhould enter behold ſights game ſpud dagger wounded almoſt death quintianus senatour man unlawfull unhoneſt life verie later day hee lay bedchamber counſell plautianus prefect beene unwares ſurpriſed ſtabbed hand saturninus centurion owne ſonne young gentleman came helpe reſcue therefore valens alſo might well bome withall excuſed caſe warie circumſpection might ſought defend life perfidious traytours haſtenod take away fault inexpiable proud humour abſolute king one verie ſame courſe law difference deſerts way malicious purſuit proceeded haſt againſt offender innocent perſons indifferently while crime remained ſtill doubtfull yet emperour made doubt puniſhment ſo much ſome heard condemned underſtood ſuſpected inflexible purpoſe grew confirmed covetouſneſſe himſelfe thoſe alſo converſed court gaping ſtill never laying chawes together ſet pricke ever forward mention made verie ſeldome humanitie courteſie tearmed timorous dulneſſe alſo bloudie flattery corrupting mind intent man carried death tip tongue turning worſt wayes boyſterous blaſts unſeaſonable whirlewinds violently blew upon haſtening overturne verie foundation moſt wealthy houſes family expoſed lay open acceſſe manie ſought undoing others daungerouſly attached two vice firſt intollerably angrie moſt ſhould baſhed angrie againe looke heard ſecret whiſperings ſuggeſtions advantage opportunitie privat admittance ſwelling pride prince forbearing examine whether ſame true entertained ſame undoubted truthes hence came paſſe pretenſe clemencie many innocent perſons thruſt doores driven headlong exile whoſe good gotten together ſequeſtred common treaſurie himſelfe alſo reduced owne proper gaines ſo much condemned folke faine beg bread live almes ſore cruſhed miſerable ſtraits dreadfull povertie feare whereof theognis auncient poet wiſe giveth u counſell fling ſelves head forward even ſea proceeding ſay ſome man would graunt beene lawfull yet verie exceſſive rigour thereof hatefull whereby found ſentence well truely ſet downe doome cruell while ſeemeth ſpare indeed rough rigorous therefore principall men place together prefect protorium aſſembled together unto hearing determining theſe matter aforeſaid commiſſion graunted rackes b ſtretched bent leaden weight plumbets brought forth ſtringtorments alſo whip put readineſſe rung everie priſon among jengling ſound chaines horrible cruell note while miniſters executioner ſorrowfull office nothing crie hold ſhut ſtraine hide much ſeene many dolorous grievous puniſhment condemned dye ſummarily briefly ſhew able call mind becauſe ſuch confuſe handling matter horror darkneſſe record ſuch thing done
