given ſome good word behalfe could appear matter ſubſtāce againſt examination upon racke prince never gave give captaines horſemen hearing cauſe charge ſhould baniſh claudius pronounce ſentence death upon sallustius promiſing therewith away haled place execution would recall backe againe according appointment ever looked waited deliverie neither sallustius eſcaped death claudius freed heavie plight baniſhment death ſaid valentinian verie often tortured many inquiſitions therefore torment holden one another ſome examinats exceſſive dolorous torture killed found ſo much preſumptions thoſe crime layed againſt buſineſſe souldiors guard protectores ſent exhibit bring perſons place ſaid againſt cuſtome time given baſtinado heart quaketh withall afraid reckon leaſt ſhould thought purpoſe ſearched vice otherwiſe good prince ſtudious weale publique howbeit one thing meet either overpaſſed concealed namely two curſt cruell ſhee beares uſed feed men woman fleſh one named mi • aurea golden mica innocentia carefully tooke order place cage neere unto owne bedchamber ſet truſtie keeper diligently ſee wanted nothing nought might offend innocentia ſeene many burial dead body rent diſmembred ſuffered well deſerved libertie goe way without harme done unto forreſts chap ix valentinian raiſeth warre upon macrianus king alemans without effect returneth trier cauſeth hortarius pettie king burned treaſon verily theſe moſt true proofes bloudie behaviour cruell intent prudent purpoſe commonwealth never digreſſing enemy diſcovered watchtower barbican ſtirre overwhelmed among many ſundrie care firſt principally caſt mind open violence privie traines might catch alive carrie away king macrianus growne among ſo many change ſucceſſions rich mightie reaſon puiſſant force riſing armes againſt men like long iulianus intercepted vadomarius buſineſſe required foreſight alſo time knowne therefore fugitive told foreſaid king looked ſuch thing might taken cloſely poſſibly could feare ſhould hinder framing ſetting together bridge made paſſage rhene ſhips severus conduct infanterie gone juſt againſt martpury ſome thinke mattiacae aqua conſidering full well ſouldiors affrighted ſtood ſtill fearing leaſt able make reſiſtance ſhould borne downe mightie power enemy ſquadrons ruſhing violently upon becauſe ſuſpected brought certaine buffons ſlaves ſold whō chance found would ſpeedie riding give intelligence ſaw thoſe ſpoyled commodity ſlew comming therefore force captaines animated pitched tent ſhort time becauſe man either packehorſe pavilion prince whoſe carpet tapiſtrie ſerved tabernacle ſtayed ſmall reaſon darke night ſooner moone riſen order battaile marched farther guide ſuch skilfull wayes great ſtirre noiſe people hindered charged continually forbeare burning ſpoiling yet could prevaile reaſon crackling fire made diſſonant cry beſide pentioners squire macrianus bodie rayſed ſuſpecting happened indeed mounted king moſt ſpeedie chariot narrow nouke entrie within hils round broken beſtowed thus valentinian defrauded diſappointed glorious exploit default neither himſelfe captaines unruly intemperance ſouldiors oftentimes hath coſt romane ſtate grievous loſſes fired enemy land fiftie myles forward returned treviros trier heavie cheare fretting grinding emptie jawes like unto lyon loſſe stag roebucke while ſcattered rankes enemy affrighted ordained fraomarius ſtead macrianus raigne weisbaden heroldo bucinobantes aleman nation juſt againſt mogunce mogontiacum fraomarius ſay ſhortly becauſe late rode ſame territorie bin quite waſted ſent britannie made tribune colonell regiment alemans number valour thoſe dayes renowmed bitheridus hortarius principall men likewiſe nation commaunded charge ſouldiors two hortarius detected meanes florentius duke mogontiacum written ſomewhat againſt state unto macrianus noble barbarian truth torture expreſſed fetched burnt chap x firmus prince mauritania raiſeth trouble commotion theodoſius generall horſemen endevoureth appeaſe hence among theſe occurrence followed next thought good ſhould delivered one continued narration leaſt buſineſſes place farre diſtant matter inſerted enſue neceſſitie confuſed knowledge many thing nubel petie king nation mauritania right puiſſant departing life left behind ſonnes legitimate alſo baſe begotten concubine one theſe named zamma well accepted favor lieutenant named romanus ſecretly brother firmus murthered gave occaſion much diſcord warre ſaid lieutenant making haſt earneſt deſire revenge death wrought many meanes thoſe dangerous utter overthrow foreſaid privie murtherer ſundrie rumor reported great diligence labour hereabout employed emperours palace verily relation made romanus caſt many grievous imputation upon firmus willingly entertained prince read while wanted many beſides favourably ſecond ſame contrarie ſide looke firmus impleaded oftentimes friend alledged defence himſelfe life ſame ever received remaine long time ſmothered reaſon remigius maſter time office allied marriage friend unto romanus conſtantly alwayes affirmed among many weightie important affaire emperour theſe ſo frivolous ſuperfluous matter ought read unto ſome convenient ſeaſonable time moore perceived practiſe overthrow defence trembling feare extremitie leaſt haply thoſe allegation pretended pleaded caſt aſide might condemned one pernitious contumacious ſo put death renounced allegeance unto empire rebelled ſuch helpes feare leaſt encreaſe power might grow implacable enemie ſuppreſſing helpe ſome ſouldiors attendant court theodoſius generall horſemen ſent whoſe vertues thoſe dayes great efficacie reſt ſhone forth like world thoſe auncient knight domitius corbulo luſius whereof former nero traiane emperours rome renowmed many valiant act departed therefore arelate arles moſt luckie fortunat auſpices paſſed ſea fleet whereof conduct without rumour going hee arrived ſhore mauritania sitifenſis inhabitant call gigell igilgitanum finding chaunce romanus ſpeaking gently ſent ſet order centinels foreguards little rebuke thoſe thing feared gone away mauritania caeſarienſis ſent gildo brother firmus alſo maximus reforme vincentius while lieutenant romanus became partaker uncivile behaviour theft therefore received ſouldiors late though made longer ſtay reaſon maine wide ſea haſtening sitifis gave order romanus domeſticall attendant ſhould committed unto ſafe cuſtodie guard ſouldiors protectores while abode within towne diſtracted doubtfull thought care caſting toſſing mind way device might either hot ſcorched country lead ſouldiors accuſtomed froſts take enemie priſoner uſed make ſuddaine rodes truſted upon ſecret ambuſhes ſet battailes knowne unto firmus firſt running rumour afterwards plaine open intelligence given ſore affrighted comming moſt approoved expert captaine confeſſed error craved pardon paſt orator ſent alſo letter wrote ſhewing declaring brake forth owne accord fact knew wicked reaſon unjuſt dealing grew licentious outrage promiſed demonſtration prove miſſives read pardon promiſed upon receit hoſtages captaine theodoſius aforeſaid went forward take review legion defended africke unto ſtation named panchariana whither rendezvous commaundement repaire honourable wiſe ſpeeches confirmed hope returned sitifis aſſembled ſouldiors inhabiting together thoſe brought impatient farther delayes made haſt exploit ſome warlike ſervice moreover among many notable part beſide one thing mightily encreaſed love countrey unto expreſſely forbad provinciall inhabitant ſhould find armie victual giving brave confident ſpirit harveſts hoords enemy garner valorous men chap xi trecherous deceitfull dealing firmus came paſſe upon battaile fought wherein barbarian diſcomfited firmus end glad crave peace pardon obtained theodoſius repaireth caeſarea theſe thing thus ordered joy tenant farmer lord themſelves poſſeſson • landholder marched forth tubuſuptus towne adjoyning mountaine ferratus rejected ſecond embaſſage firmus brought according appointment hoſtages whence warily viewed ſearched time place would give leave ſped himſelfe apace toward nation tyndenſes maſiniſſenes furniſhed well appointed light armour maſcizel dius brother firmus leading theſe enemy nimble deliver lim within view diſcharge ſhot caſtingweapons ſides ſtrucken moſt ſharpe cruell battaile among grones death wound heard lamentable yelling weeping barbarous people taken priſoners ſlaine fight finiſhed many territory forrayed fired among miſeries borough burgade petrenſis exceeded utterly raſed deſtroyed place lord thereof salmaces brother firmus built manner citie conquerour lifted good ſucceſſe wonderfull celeritie poſſeſſed himſelfe towne lamforctenſe ſituate among nation aboveſaid cauſed great abundance victual layed end went inward countrey ſhould find ſcarcitie food might give order fetched neere hand theſe traine affaire maſcizel repaired force aidſouldiors nation bordering upon joined battaile men wherein many part defeated himſelfe ſwiftneſſe horſe much adoe eſcaped danger death firmus wearied adverſe fortune two battailes chafing heart root becauſe would omit utmoſt meanes ſent certaine chriſtian biſhops hoſtages treat peace becauſe courteouſly entertained upon promiſe victual ſufficient ſouldiors according charge brought backe joyfull anſwere moore himſelfe ſending preſents confidently went forth toward romane generall mounted upon courſer meet doubtfull chaunces might betide drew neere ſtrucken amazed glittering enſignes terrible countenance theodoſius alighted horſe bowing downe head ſtouped almoſt ground ſo teares blamed owne raſhneſſe craving pardon peace received kiſſe thought behoofefull commonwealth full good hope furniſhed u ſufficient food ſo leaving ſome owne kinsfolkes behind lieu hoſtages departed purpoſe redeliver captive promiſed beginning trouble caught carried away within two dayes without longer delay rendred back according commandement towne orano nigr acor caſtald called icoſium 20 founder thereof solin coſium founder whereof related militarie enſignes alſo sacerdotall crowne reſt intercepted hence generall ſpeedie great journeyes entred taves mercat tipaſa unto embaſſadours mazices combined themſelves firmus humble manner beſought pardon anſwered thus high ſpirit forthwith would warre upon perfidious rebel diſmaid caſt downe feare imminent daunger commaunded returne home owne countrey ſo marched toward cabo figalo pinot caeſarea wealthy noble citie time paſt originall whereof likewiſe fully ſhewed deſcription affricke entred ſaw manner burnt conſumed fiers ſpred abroad flint ſtones ſtreets covered grey aſhes determined beſtow time firſt ſecond legion while caſting one ſide heapes dead ember might keepe garriſon leaſt ſecond aſſault barbarian ſhould bee waſted againe newes carried diver wayes abroad true rumor ruler province vincentius tribune came forth lurking hole wherein beſtowed themſelves length without feare repayred ſpeed unto generall chap xii firmus ſtarting promiſed allegeance forceth theodoſius take armes certaine horſemen romanes revolted rebel thrust downe loweſt degree warreſervice afterwards theodoſius executeth others loſſe head occaſion enemy many overthrowes brought upon knee weakened politikely delivereth daunger ſmall companie owne men theodoſius ſeene received joy making abode ſtill caeſarea upon verie diligent ſearch made truth everie thing underſtood certaine firmus colour wellwiller ſuppliant covert policie reached come manner ſodaine tempeſt upon armie fearing hoſtilitie put diſray general therefore turning hence came free borough towne named sugabarritanum ſeated upon riſing mountaine tranſcellenſis found horſemen fourth cohort archer revolted unto rebell ſhew hee content ſome mild puniſhment thruſt downe loweſt degree war ſervice alſo part conſtantian footman commanded come tigaviae tribune one done upon head firmus chaine diademe while theſe thing gildo maximus returned leading belle prince mazices ferinus prefect nation ayded faction troubled common peace produce bound performed according appointment himſelfe went forth breake day finding armie encloſed round thinke yee quoth devoted fellowe ſouldiors ought done theſe wicked traitours cryed one voyce required ſerved among 1 conſtantiani ſhould looſe lifebloud following deſire delivered old manner unto ſouldiors maſſacred principall archer aforeſaid cut hand reſt beheaded example curio moſt fierce valiant captain kind puniſhment made end dardanian ſtoutneſſe manner lernaean ſerpent otherwhiles ſprung new againe malicious backebiters commend auncient fact ſo condemne curſed rigorous ſaying dardanian mortall enemy juſtly deſerved thoſe puniſhments ſuſtained whereas ſouldiors ſerving colour happened fall one errour ſhould beene dealt milder kind correction knowing doe anſwer give underſtand cohort fact example rebellious touching belle fericius aforeſaid gildo brought alſo curandius tribune archer commaunded killed regard neither himſelfe perſon would ever encounter enemy exhort ſouldiors fight wiſe proceeded theodoſius cōſidering ſentence tully wholeſome rigor ſeveritie ſurpaſſeth vaine ſhew clemencie went forth came fort named gaionatis ſtrong wal round moſt ſafe ſure place refuge moore violent puſh ram caſt ſlain inhabitant therin laid wals even ground went forward caſtle tingitanum hill ancorarius ſet upon mazices aſſembled together alſo diſcharged dart backe flew thicke haile ſides skirmiſhed mazices able abide hot charging ſo violently men munition warlike nation though fierce thus beaten ſundry ſlaughters foule fright brake array fled amaine killed ſave thoſe making ſhift eſcape humble ſuit afterward obtained pardon peace time ſo requiring granted suggena leader ſucceeded romanus appointed goe mauritania sitifenſis take order placing garriſons himſelfe lifted ſtill theſe accident paſt marcheth againſt nation muſones owne privitie guiltineſſe robbery murder gathered together joine action firmus hoped would ſhortly attaine unto greater mater entred wel forward way neere unto burroughtowne addenſe certaine intelligence number nation different ſoever faſhions language yet one accord heart agreed rayſe begin cruell warre whereto incited encouraged verie great hope reward ſiſter firmus named cyria abounding wealth wilfull reſolution woman purpoſed power endevour helpe brother theodoſius therefore fearing adventure himſelfe upon unequall match leaſt encountring huge multitude three thouſand five hundred ſtrong might looſe keeping meane betweene ſhamefull flight eagre fight gave ground retyred ſoftly reaſon multitude preſſed ſore upon ſo gat away vpon event barbarous people taking exceeding good heart loſt hee laſt man thoſe nation ſeeing ayds mazices marched certaine roman corporal mightily troubled affrighted ſuppoſing beene many battailons readie violence charge upon tooke heeles ſo opened paſſages wayes men get quite ſtopped chap xiii theodoſius wiſe policie militarie holding aſſailing enemy forceth firmus flight ſhift himſelfe abandoning campe ranſacked followloweth chaſe vanquiſhed iſaflenſes received harboured put certaine principall enemy death bestoweth owne people ſafetie theodoſius afterward leading ſouldiors ſafe come burgh burgade named mazucanum burnt ſome revolters diſmembred maimed others example thoſe archeis loſt hand came moneth februarie tipata making abode long time like unto auncient warie q fabius maximus temporizer conſulted buſineſſe require intending might haply ſpie advantage opportunitie vanquiſh warlike enemy dint dart weapon invincible rather ſtratagems policie daungerous encounter plaine field howbeit ſent continually certaine perſons skilfull perſuading unto nation round namely baiurae cantorians avaſtomates cafaves devares borderer one feare otherwhiles faire promiſes inducing aſſociation yea ſometime promiſing pardon malapert folly purpoſing ſo vanquiſh enemie much abated violent force ſuch faire fetch delayes like pompey time paſt overcame mithridates cauſe firmus declining miſchiefe ſo neere hand although well ſtrengthened great guard leaving common multitude ſouldiors levied aſſembled great wage taking opportunitie ſtill night unſeene reached farre mountaines caprarienſes farre reaſon broken craggie rockes inacceſſable vpon whoſe ſecret departure multitude ſcattered ſlipping dropping away one another without leader miniſtred vnto men good readie meanes enter upon campe ranſacked thoſe ſlaine made reſiſtance elſe upon yeelding taken mercie waſted greateſt part thoſe country like moſt prudent politique captaine ſet thoſe nation paſſed prefect ruler men approved truſt fidelitie enemie terrified unlookedfor purſuit theodoſius accompanied ſome ſervants minding quick departure ſave himſelf end might hindred let encumbrance threw away pack pretious ware commodity brought away wife wearied continual dangerous labor theodoſius ſparing none ſouldiors refreſhed finer food cheered wage caprarienſes abbannae neighbour light battaile defeated made haſt burrough towne enſe true meſſengers advertiſed barbarian alreadie poſſeſſed hill everie ſide winding mounted aloft paſſable none inborne inhabitant knew wayes verie well returne backe gave enemy good mean truce though laſted make themſelves ſtronger paſſing great ayds aethiopians neere adjoyning menacing noyſe ruſhing whole plumpes without regard themſelves fight forced turne backe affrighted terrible ſight ineſtimable troupe ſtraightwayes taking heart againe returned bringing plentifull ſtore victual men caſt round ring ſhaking ſhields terrible kind geſture made head againſt albeit therefore band furious enemy barbarian armour clattering one againſt another making hideous fearefull kind noyſe point give charge yea themſelves alſo knocked buckler againſt knee yet like unto fabius maximus cunctator warie warriour politique ſouldior aforeſaid diſtruſting ſmall force boldly marching ſquare battailon flee turned way without feare citie named contenſis firmus fear men remote high fort beſtowed folke ſo recovered owne ſouldiors ſharply puniſhed woonted maner traytors guard firmus aforeſaid moſt happily atchieving exploit helpe great name advertiſed true diſcoverer firmus fled countrey iſaflenſes demanding together brother mazuca neere kinsfolke deere friend entred thither ſeeing could thē delivered proclaimed open war againſt whole nation upō joining cruel battaile againſt barbarian beyond al meaſure braved behaved themſelves moſt fiercely oppoſed battaile ſhaped round faſhion forcible violence mightie troupe ſquadrons iſaflenſes ſo driven worſt many loſt life firmus himſelfe hardie running oftentimes headlong upon owne miſchiefe horſe carryed quite backe field beene uſed nimbly run rock cragges mazuca brother deadly wounded taken priſoner order appointed ſent caeſarea left cruell durable memorial moſt wicked deed opening wound dyed howbeit head ſevered reſt bodie great joy many came ſee brought citie aforeſaid noble generall vanquiſhed nation iſaflenſes withſtood plagued juſtice required many loſſes calamity cauſed burnt evaſius mightie bourgeſſe ſonne florus ſome openly convicted ſecret conference aſſiſted breaker peace marching ther within land brave mind powerfull courage invaded countrie iubalena heard ſay nubel father firmus borne put backe high mountaines winding crooked ſtraits hee ſtayed journey although ſetting upon enemy killing many made himſelfe way paſſe forward yet fearing lofty hill toppes moſt meet ambuſhments leading ſouldiors ſafetie hee returned fortreſſe audienſe iſaflenſes ſavage people yeelded themſelves promiſing voluntarily furniſh aidſouldiors victual chap xiiii firmus returned iſaflenſes theodoſius goeth meet ſmall power ſetteth upon enemy end doubtfull battaile diſcomfiteth foileth done ſo courſeth iſaflenſes firmus deſpaire himſelfe endeth life halter whereby province recovered quietneſſe theſe like glorious atchievements moſt noble captain taking great joy contentment puiſſant power ſought meet principall troubler himſelfe peace therefore making abode long time neere fort named medianum many politicke debatements mean projected good hope might betrayed unto while perplexed thought deepe care forecaſt compaſſe underſtood truth enemie returned iſaflenſes without farther delay marched againſt ſpeed vnto king named igmazen prince thoſe tract high reputation famous wealth advancing forth boldly affronting whence art thou quoth buſineſſe haſt thou thou art hither come anſwere vpon theodoſius reſolute mind looking wiſtly ſterne countenance lieutenant ſayth unto valentinian lord whole earth ſent ſubdue bloudie cruell robber unleſſe thou render hand according invincible emperour hath determined thou whole nation thou ruleſt ſhall utterly periſh igmazen heard many reviling taunt let flie againſt generall much troubled anger griefe together went way next morning betimes army ſides advanced forth moſt menacing wiſe readie encounter joyne battaile barbarian ſide 20000 neere marſhalled front vantguard behind whoſe backes beſtowed ſecretly ſquadrons auxiliary ſupply riſing little little might ſhew themſelves multitude encloſe men ere aware beſides theſe came many ieſalenes aidſouldiors ſhewed promiſed men helpe proviſion victual ſide roman although yet bearing valiant heart lifted precedent victory ſet flank thicke thruſt together fitted ſhields cloſe one another manner fenceroufe ſtood ground reſiſted sunne riſing unto end day fight continued firmus little evening ſeene mounted upon tall courſer diſplaying forth good way red coat armor lowd cry move exhort ſouldiors deliver theodoſius betimes tearming cruel deteſtable bloudy deviſer torment execution caſe deſirous rid extremity endured theſe word unlooked incited ſome eagerly fight inticed others forſake field therefore ſo ſoone ſtill time night come while ſides enwrapped within wandering darkneſſe roman generall returned fortreſſe duodienſe taking review muſter ſouldiors looke many cowardly feare word beſide firmus turned purpoſe fighting puniſhed ſundry way death ſome cutting right hand others burning alive moſt carefully keeping watch ward ſome barbarian adventured moone downe could ſeene ſet upon campe either diſcomfited elſe ruſhed audaciouſly took thē priſoners departing thence great pace courſed ieſalenes people hardly truſted crooked lane little looked afflicted ſo brought extreame penurie returned townes mauritania caeſarienſis sitifis racked tortured even death caſtor martinianus partaker romanus robbery foule fact burnt warre began afreſh iſaflenſes firſt conflict many barbarian beaten backe ſlaine igmazen king heretofore wont ever winner diſtracted terrified preſent diſtreſſe ſuppoſing ſhould beare himſelfe obſtinately ſtill commerce traffique prohibited remained hope live warily cloſely poſſibly could battaile brake foorth alone eſpying theodoſius humbly beſought commaund maſilla chiefe peere mazices come unto ſent requeſt ſecret conference adviſed generall owne diſpoſition ſtarter conſtant reſolute give mean wherby might bring eaſily purpoſe would preaſſe hotly upō thoſe owne nation continuance fight turne feare verily readie ynough affect favour rebell wearied many loſſes theodoſius gave eare condiſcended word often skirmiſhing foyled iſaflenſes ſo while fell downe like ſo many beaſts firmus privily ſlipped aſide whē bin confined long time within ſtarting hole way while conſulted flie eſcape ſtaied kept ward igmazen much informed bin underhand ſecretly practiſed maſilla ſeeing extremitie deſpaire eſtate remedie left one determined voluntarie death tread foot deſire life nonce full wine till skin ſtrutted againe himſelfe lay awake terror miſerie hanging head while warder load likewiſe headie wine lay ſound aſleepe dead time night leaving bed creeping foure without making noiſe ſevered himſelfe apart farre found cord end life happened readie hand hung upon nayle ſpike ſtucke wall ſo knitting necke within without lingering torment ended life accident igmazen taking grievouſly groning againe diſappointed glory good hap lead rebellious enemie bond romane campe aſſurance made ſafe conduct meanes maſilla himſelfe carrying dead bodie thus murthered upon camell approched tent armie pitched ſort subicarenſe ſhifted upon packehorſe preſented unto theodoſius joyed triumphed thereat calling together well armed ſouldiors common people asked whether knew viſage without delay circumſtance made underſtood certainely face remained little returned sitifis triumphant manner received ſolemnly favour ſorts age degree chap xv valentinian warreth upon quadi whoſe king gabinius wicked plot maximinus murthered while theodoſius generall aforeſaid thus painefully employed within mauritania africke warres markfelders aventin quadi roſe armes upon ſuddaine nation little feared wonderfull warlike puiſſant time ſpeedie exploit doe ſhew people • thern dubra • io marcomanni aquileia ſuddaine beſieged long time od • iſo leandro opitergium raced many bloudie exploit performed quicke diſpatch while mauricus maricus principall ſpoken breaking alpes iuliae hardly able withſtand truth barbarian juſt cauſe quarrell complain valentinian burning deſire glorious muſt need ſay generous exceſſive immoderat beginning empire fortifie limit commanded garriſon caſtles built beyond river hiſter upon verylands quadi ſame bin already roman juriſdiction whereat inhabitant much diſcontented wiſely looking main chance ſo farre forth might partly embaſſage partly ſecret murmuring hindered ſame time maximinus greedily ſet upon miſchiefe able mitigate inbred humor pride puffed praefectſhip blamed rebuked equitius magiſtrum armorum con • ſtabile remigius florentius taketh generall force ſame time throughout illyricum one obſtinate headie ſlothfull ſaid worke yet finiſhed appointed goe forward expedition ſaid moreover one tendering common good parvo ſuo little ſon marcellianus made ducis lord marcher generall force valeria fort would erected without ado allegation contrarie ſoone came paſſe accordingly promoted place commaund ſooner gone forth arrived thoſe part ſwelling pride unreaſonably ut filius ſonne right without winning talke conference whō fained furmiſes deſire deſigne never attempted cauſed avoid owne country ſetteth hand worke little begun meanes ſome entreatie graunted forelet time laſt king gabinius modeſt tearmes required might new alteration marcellianus ſemblance courteſie would condiſcend unto invited others feaſt departure good cheare while feared harme breaking moſt wickedly religious bond hoſpitalitie cauſed murthered rumor whoſe horrible fact incontinently ſpread abroad diver wayes ſet quadi nation ſeated round rage bewailing king death aſſembled themſelves one place ſent company armes raiſe booty ſpoyle paſſed danubius time manner hoſtilitie looked aſſailed countrey people buſied harveſt killed greater part whatſoever remained away carried home number cattell ſundrie ſorts verily ſame time like happened inexpiable miſchiefe reckoned among diſhonourable loſſes romane state went within little daughter constantius taking repaſt certaine mannor call viſ • rici • lazio piſtrenſis time ſhee brought wedded unto gratianus beene taken priſoner faire grace god meſſala governour province preſent mounted ſwift poſtchariot maine pace rode away brought backe sirmium ſix twentie myles thence good fortunate hap royall virgine damoſell delivered danger miſerable ſervitude whoſe captivitie unleſſe ſhe might ranſomed would ſurely brought much miſerie upon commonwealth quadi together sarmatians ranging ſpreading themſelves farther abroad nation moſt meet ſpoile rob drave booty folke men woman cattell alſo rejoycing triumphant wiſe ſee aſhes village burnt wofull miſeries inhabitant lying ſlaine tooke ſuddaine killed without pitie mercie chap xvi probus praefect praetorium baſe minded man able abide violence quadi two legion put ſword theodoſius younger emperour afterwards young gentleman moſt approved valour valiantly repreſſeth sarmatians making tumultuous broile inundation tiberis reſembling ſo many deluge feare therefore like calamity diſperſed part probus praefectus praetorio abiding syrmium man acquainted terror warres aſtonied wofull ſight ſuch ſtrange new occurrent ſcarce able lift eye doubtfull long time ſeeke doe prepared ſwift ſteeds purpoſed next night flie adviſed better counſell ſtayed ſtill ſtirred advertiſed ſtraightwaies upon flight encloſed within wall would follow ſhrowd hide themſelves commodious lurking place happened citie undefended would fallen enemy hand wherefore feare ſomewhat allayed tooke good heart courageouſly ſet hand ſuch matter urgent needfull hee ſcoured ditch choked filled rammell inured humor building quickly brought greateſt part wals long peace lay neglected ſubverted farre battlement high tower meanes worke quickly finiſhed found ſufficient money effect haſtened forward layed erewhile defray charge building theatre approved policie adjoined another right good conſequence ſent cohort horſebacke archer next ſtation ſtanding ground readie aſſiſtant caſe happened ſiege theſe barres barbarous enemy put backe aſſayling citie little acquainted theſe ſtratagemes warre beſides encumbred bag baggage gotten pillage betake themſelves wholly hunt equitius learned intelligence given thoſe tooke priſoners gone aſide farre removed part part pannonia valeria thither hyed apace fretting fuming verie reaſon fully bent cut throat becauſe thought innocent king aforeſaid meanes circumvented made away againſt running end forward bloudie mind advanced verie way two legion ſquadrons pannonica n moeſiaca warlike puiſſant armie could joyntly agreed doubt gone cleere away victorie while haſt ſeverally ſet upon ſaid robber divell caſt bone among ſo fell variance ſore hindred ſervice ſtrove honour dignitie sarmatians paſſing wittie perceived expecting ſolemne ſignall battaile charge upon moeſiack legion firſt ſouldiors ſome ſlacke tumult arme make readie weapon ſlew moſt herewith emboldened brake pannonian legion broken rankes meere might maine redoubled charge put manner ſword ſome made ſo quicke ſhift eſcaped daunger death diſaſterous danger heavie loſſe marqueſſe moeſia theodoſius younger young gentleman whoſe beard began bud forth afterward prooved moſt politique experienced emperour diver time drave ſore annoyed yea many skirmiſhes one taile another cruſhed free sarmatians ſo called difference rebellious bondman another ſide invaded confines ſo defeated whole multitude conflowing together reſiſting right manfully moſt part moſt juſtly ſlaine ſatisfied bloudie foules ravenous wild beaſts whereupon reſt ſwelling pride fallen well abated fearing leaſt ſame captaine warriour expedite proweſſe appeared quicke diſpatch would either beat downe put rout troupe made rodes even firſt entrie border elſe beſtow ambuſhments ſecretly along wood many offer attempt breaking made time time vaine caſting aſide truſt fighting craved tolleration pardon paſt thus overcome time entred action contrarie covenant peace graunted unto moſt curbed kept downe feare come ſtrong power ſerved gaule gallicane ſouldiors defence illyricum while theſe occurrent ſo many ſuch ſort way continuall trouble paſſe time claudius governed rome citie river tiberis running mids thereof together many ſinkes ſewers riverets aboundant intermingleth himſelfe mar toſco leandr mar de mar eille ʋincent lupar tyrrhene ſea ſwelling bigge overflowing outragious fall raine powring ſhewers ſpreading beyond termes river welneere ſurrounded much part citie beſides ſeated upon even levell place ſtanding poole hill onely great houſes built apart themſelves mounted upon higher ground ſaved themſelves preſent fearefull daunger leaſt number people ſhould pine periſh want food conſidering water ſo great ſuffered man go forth whither boat wherry plentifull ſtore meat brought unto tempeſtuous weather appeaſed river breaking thoſe barres held returned woonted courſe feare done away trouble afterwards expected verie prefect carryed himſelfe place verie quietly endured taſted ſedition upon juſt cauſe quarel hot upon getting either force feare flatterie ſaid king revolved mind preſaged ſome grievous miſchiefe hung head ware deceitfull plot finding meanes ſave himſelfe ſpeedie departure perſuaſion ſuch little ynough horſe laden paſſe gat away left ſouldiors behind backe caught miniſters ſent caſt miſt mind wayted looked manner hand reached forth catch hunter prey while looke ſtill would come ſafetie caſe motion miſliked required another thing namely diviſion hiberia annulled garriſons romanes ſide thence remooved aſpacures might bee permitted raigne alone himſelfe made governour nation whereunto valens returned anſwere effect could foredoe ought capitulation article conſent confirmed right willing carefull maintaine ſame croſſe glorious purpoſe reſolution winter end king letter brought alledging vaine arrogant reaſons conſtantly avouched occaſion diſcord might poſſibly bee ſtocked rootes without preſence thoſe privie peace covenanted iovianus ſome underſtood departed life emperour care grew greater tooke deeper impreſſion beeing better able chuſe deviſe good counſels ſuppoſing expedient affaire commaunded victor generall horſe vrbicius marqueſſe warden march meſopotamia goe ſpeed carrying abſolute uniforme anſwere little became iust prince contenting himſelfe owne king uſually gave himſelfe thus wickedly covet armenia conſidering inhabitant thereof owne agreement permitted live owne unleſſe garriſon ſouldiors imparted unto sauromaces returned without faile let beginning yeare following ordered ſhould accompliſh thoſe article owne accord doe omitted verily plaine francke embaſſage ſwerved one point without direction commiſſion behalfe theſe embaſſadours accepted thoſe ſmall country armenia offered embaſſage returned arrived surena chiefe authoritie king offering ſame parcel unto emperour embaſſadours boldly taken liberally honourably entertained ſent backe againe without obtaining came great preparation furniture warres conſidering emperour ſo ſoone rigour winter abated minded three army invade perſis therefore expedition levied waged aid ſouldiors scythian sapor therefore miſſing thoſe matter vaine hope conceived chafed uſed intelligence great commaunder ruler prepared expedition yet biting anger gave surena charge clayme recover force armes thoſe piece lieutenant victor vrbicius received caſe man made reſiſtance ſouldiors alſo appointed garriſon defence sauromaces ſhould plagued extremitie miſeries theſe deſignes quickly put execution ordained remedie meanes crie quittance becauſe romanes beſet another feare gothia licentious manner violently broke thracia dolefull lamentable event enſuing whereupon may bee ſummarily ſet downe ſhall come handle thoſe affaire alſo theſe proceeding paſſed along eaſt tract within traine whereof powerfull vigour eternall juſtice though diver time ſlow yet curious preciſe commiſſioner enquire thing well done otherwiſe tooke revenge thoſe miſeries africke embaſſadours tripoli whoſe mane ghoſts crueltie prince neere neighbour unto gaule others macrianus one thoſe dayes much dread certaine knowne left behind unreconciled would attempt ſiege aſſault walled city theſe allegation motif put therto tending good profit reduced better mind preſently made good commonwealth ſaid king ſent courteouſly come neere unto moguntiacum alſo himſelfe forward ynough appeared entertaine league wonderfull great pride puffed came one ſhould ſuperior iudge peace day appointed parley conference ſtood bearing head aloft banke rhene clattering noyſe countrey ſhields reſounding either hand part emperour embarked certaine riverbarges guarded alſo himſelfe multitude warlike company ſafetie approched bankes goodly ſeene brave ſhew glittering enſignes unſeemely geſtures rude noyſe barbarous people length allayed word paſſed fro ſides peace amitie concluded ſame ratified oath theſe thinges thus finiſhed king made theſe trouble departed well pacified became aſſociate thenceforth afterwards unto dying day gave noble exploit good proofe conſtant mind embracing concord hap die fraunce francia while greedily invaded fire ſword waſted beſet traine warlike king mellobaudes ſo ſlaine howbeit league ſolemne rite complement concluded valentinian departed trier winter theſe affaire gaule north quarter chap v lament able plight east province valens deceived courtier making much theſe frapling among bad art cteſias leontinus gorgias ſaith workemiſtreſſe perſuaſion thus old writer defined ſubtile craft ſome eaſterlings hath brought hated deteſted good men whereby alſo bridled reſtrained reines ſet prefixed time therefore ſhall deliver ſome word touching indignitie thereof found experience converſing thoſe part returne intended courſe thoſe matter begun never elſe flouriſhed tribune little table repreſenting life theſe ravenous harpyes ſorting diviſion certaine formes rankes bvt adayes may ſee throughout thoſe tract diver kind verie violent moſt ravenous men ſuch goe ſwouping flinging court hall juſtice yea cloſely beſet rich men houſes like unto hound miſithra sop • iano sparta candie crete following quicke ſent everie cauſe tract footing come length verie dennes thereof raſhneſſe ſeemeth reſemble libertie headie boldneſſe conſtancie certaine vaine flowing tongue thiers eloquence violent force art tully affirmeth foule ſhame upright conſcience iudge ſhould deceived deepely ſetled commonweale juſt according wonted maner ſharpe ſevere correcting thoſe common ſort remiſſe rebuking ſuch high place ſo much way rough bitter word howbeit probus man courſed purſued garriſon came bregnir • 〈…〉 bregitio fatall deſtinie framed long agoe prince reſt denounced unto laſt end many prodigie betokening ſame dayes blazing ſtarres burned forth commonly forerunner fall prince originall cauſe whereof declared alreadie sirmium lightening ſuddaine clap thunder ſhot cloud ſet fire part c • ri counſellhouſe palace likewiſe sabaria while himſelfe yet remained owle ſitting need goe forth ſame gate entred end might gather ſome good pręſage ſpeedie returne backe againe gaule alſo place lay forelet neglected heapes rammell therein ſcoured made cleane yron dore happened whoſe deſerts valentinian ſonne verie prime youth commendable helpe alſo long traine owne vertues adorned nicea inveſture imperiall majeſtie tooke brother valens unto fellow emperour reſpect brotherhood whole bloud ſorted accorded moſt joyntly valens man carried himſelfe meane betweene reproachfull prayſeworthie act convenient place declare valentinian therefore many dangerous trouble paſt while led privat life ſooner entred upon empire viſited caſtles ſcituat neere unto great river violent ſtreames alſo gaule lay expoſed alemans rodes invaſions began boldly revive ſtirre againe upon knowledge emperour iulians death onely men world ſtood awe good cauſe alſo valentinian much dread becauſe reenforced army ſtrong ſupplies alſo fortified rhene either ſide high caſtles fortreſſes enemie making rodes breaking upon province might undiſcovered let manyparticulars paſſe authoritie ſtaied well grounded governour alſo abuſes reformed either himſelfe induſtrious captaines aſſumed ſonne gratian ſocietie power high place privily ſtabbed becauſe openly could vithigabius king alemans ſonne vadomarius young prince verie flower firſt downe cheekes ſtirring people inſurrections warres alſo battaile againſt alemans neere unto solms herold •• solicinium place forelaid like loſt life might put ſword everie man vantage taken darke night ſome made quicke ſpeed eſcaped yet among theſe politike warie exploit treacherous ſtratageme muſt need ſay advantageous ſlew saxon growne fearefull outrage nation time making ſodaine rodes invaſions arrived maritime tract ſpoyles whereof returned almoſt loden theſe robber ſay brigand force defeated ſtripped bootie pillage like manner britaines able endure ſuch troupe enemy overrunning reſtored libertie quiet peace hope better dayes ſuffering one manner foreſaid brigand returne home countrey ſemblable valour fortunat ſucceſſe whereas one valentinus baniſhed perſon pannonia went theſe province trouble common peace ſuppreſſed plotted deſigne grew ſtrong head delivered affricke great daungers much troubled ſodaine miſchiefe time firmus able abide greedineſſe pride militarie men raiſed nation mauritania upon everie ſmall gale forward ynough entertaine commotion diſcords like fortitude revenged lamentable loſſes calamity illyricum prevented death left ſerious buſineſſe unfiniſhed albeit theſe atchievements wee related performed ſervice excellent captaines yet full well knowne himſelfe alſo quicke nimble conceit yea throughly grounded long experience warfare atchieved many act beſide among might notably appeared caſe could taken alive king marcianus thoſe dayes verie terrible according great induſtrie aſſayed underſtood ſorrow griefe eſcaped burgundians himſelfe annexed unto alemans thus much may ſerve briefe diſcourſe touching act prince chap xi vice large deſcribed vpon aſſured confidence poſteritie enthralled neither feare foule flatterie woont uncorrupt ſingle eye behold thing paſt ſummarily reckon vice afterward ſhew alſo good deſerts pretended ſometime outward ſhew clemencie whereas heat nature much inclined crueltie forgetting aſſure leſſon king emperour ought avoid exceſsive courſes leſſe ſo many ſteepe craggie rockes never doe wee find tooke mild correction puniſhment commanded otherwhiles bloudie examination multiplied one upon another ſome cruell interrogatory tormented even danger life ſo much given miſchiefe never knowne mercifull note ſubſcribing ſaved one perſon death condemned dye whereas otherwhiles even moſt cruell prince done ſo much yet might beheld myrrour many precedent aunceſtors forefather yea imitated well forraine home example humanitie pietie vertues wiſe philoſophers define coſin german whereof ſhall ſufficient ſet downe theſe following artaxerxes moſt puiſſant monarch perſians length one joynt called longhand longarme n macrocheir naturall lenitie owne correcting abridging thoſe ſundrie ſorts puniſhments cruell nation alwayes practiſed ſtead certaine malefactor head chop tuffes turbants onely would crop men eares king uſed ſome treſpaſſes cut away ſtrings cordon onely hung downe hat temperat behaviour cauſed ſo well beloved reverenced withall helpe aſſiſtance ſubjects atchieved many wonderfull act renowmed greeke writer pretor upon time praeneſt certaine warre samnite commaunded make haſt unto garriſon came late wipe away offence preſented brought place papyrius ſirnamed curfor time dictator cauſed officer sergeant lictor make readie axe man caſting aſide hope confidence purge himſelfe ſtood aſtonied papyrius chaunced eſpie ſhrub hard cauſed grubbed ſo kind pleaſant conceit chaſtiſed partie ſet free neither therefore deſpiſed eſteemed ſufficient make part good alexander p great caſe hee come upon italian ground dayes valentinian perhaps ignorant hereof nothing conſidering mercifull mildneſſe prince yeeldes alwayes ſolace afflicted state fire ſword made execution grievous pietie forefather deviſed utmoſt remedie adverſe fortune according excellent oratour iſocrates uſed alwayes teach ſay otherwhiles ruler generall vanquiſhed battaile ought pardoned knowing iust thing whence ſuppoſe tully mooved pronounce notable ſentence time defended oppius able quoth doe much ſaving another hath beene honourable many beene ſmall abilitie bring another miſchiefe hath beene diſhonourable none covetous deſire ſtill without reſpect right wrong alſo hunt diver gaines wrecke overthrow men life exceeded prince grew hoter every day ſome aſſayed excuſe make good pretending example emperour aurelianus pretending thus much behalfe like treaſurie emptied gallienus lamentable calamity commonweale came violently manner ſwelling ſtreame upon rich men even ſo emperor alſo overthrowes loſſes ſuſtained parthicke warre wanting money defray great charge broken band ſouldiors freſh ſupplies might made contented pay joyned crueltie greedie deſire heape exceſſive maſſe money making ſemblance knew thus much namely ſome thing although may yet ought done farre unlike unto themistocles battaile fought perſians force defeated walked downe pleaſure eſpyed paire bracelet coller gold lying ground take theſe thing quoth ſpeaking one companie ſtood neere unto thou art themiſtocles one allowed manner lucre noble minded captaine like example kind continencie plentifull ſtore among roman captaines leave becauſe ſignes perfect vertue take men good away ywis ſuch commendable part ſet downe many one onely ſure conſtant proofe innocencie behalfe even common people old world time marius cinna gave unto common rome thoſe wealthie rich ſtored houſes proſcribed ranſacked thoſe rude minded common ſuch woont regard worldly pelfe forbare rif • le labour men ſo could found ſo needie ſo low condition found heart lay hand upon commoditie bootie graunted unto ariſing wofull fall citizen moreover emperour aforeſaid inwardly tainted ſcorched envie knowing moſt part vice woont carrie reſemblance vertues uſed evermore ſay rich nobly deſcended thoſe valiant depraved detracted alone might ſeeme excell good part diſeaſe read emperour hadrian ſore ſicke ſelfeſame prince found fault many time thoſe timorous calling ſuch infamie chiefe rule campe manage warfare among lupicinus maximus bare greateſt ſtroke one lieutenant thracia moſt miſchievous warden march ſtriving ſhould goe beyond headie raſhneſſe whoſe greedie covetouſneſſe lying ever wind cheat matter cauſe evil miſeries let particular paſſe wherein theſe ſaid ruler themſelves leaſtwiſe others permiſſion naughtie wicked meanes treſpaſſed againſt theſe ſtrangers firſt comming yet harmeleſſe innocent one odious unexampled fact faile tell heard even iudges owne caſe could meanes paſſe cleere bee pardoned barbarous people thus brought ſore diſtreſſed want victual theſe two moſt hatefull governor deviſed foule diſhoneſt kind commerce marchandiſe looke number ſtore dog unſatiable greedineſſe could get together part exchanged ſo many ſlaves chiefe perſons noble brought mean alſo victhericus king greuthingi accompanied alatheus aphraces whoſe direction wholly ruled alſo farnabius approching bankes iſter ſent embaſſadors ſpeed beſought emperor might received like courteſie embaſſadors according thought expedient commonwealth rejected ſtanding doubtfull courſe take athanaricus beginning ſomewhat feare departed remembring well good ſince treatie concord upon covenant concluded deſpiſed valens avouched obliged conſcience never tread upon romane ground cauſe compelled ſaid emperour make peace middeſt river notwithſtanding fearing withall ſtanding yet force declined aſide people caucalandenſis place reaſon high wood woulds inacceſſible sarmatians beene thruſt theruingi permitted long paſſe wandered even neere unto bankes impeached twofold incumbrance wicked diſſimulation ſaid ruler ſuccoured neceſſaries meet living ſet purpoſe tied entercourſe commerce traffique horrible wicked well deepely conſidered diſſimuled turning trecherie helpe urgent miſeries neere hand lupicinus fearing alſo much leaſt ſhortly would revolt rebell advanced cloſe unto force conſtrained quickly take journey gone greuthungi gotten good opportunitie perceived while ſouldiors elſewhere employed ſhips uſed hinderance paſſage skud downe river quiet reſt meanes certaine flotes punt ill favouredly made ſet together made ſhift tranſported encamped themſelves great way fritigernus wittie forecaſt naturally preventing future chaunces might betide end might obey ſoveraigne commandements alſo combine puiſſant king marching ſlowly came eaſie journeyes length late though martianopolis helpe matter practiſed another horrible deſignment kindled ſet light fire torch fury readie burne even miſchiefe deſtruction state lupicinus entreated alavivus fritigernus unto feaſt upon intelligence given ſecret meſſenger regiment ſouldiors repelled farre towne wall barbarous multitude ſubjects dominion continuing peace unitie u way requeſt continually time time deſired enter provide themſelves victual neceſſaries greater broyles quarrel riſen betweene inhabitant within thoſe thus debarred grew length neceſſitie muſt make fray fight barbarian perceiving friend kinsfolke hoſtile manner ſpoyled grew enraged herewith fell upon ſaid ſouldiors ſlew rifled occurrent ſaid lupicinus privie meſſenger advertiſed while ſitting long riotous table amid many ſports paſtimes wherewith roome reſounded much drinking wine grew heavie headed drowſie gueſſing future iſſue would ſlew guard praetorium palacegate well honour ſafetie waited attended upon leader people without beſieged wall taking grievouſly growing little little greater head revenge prince ſuppoſed detained threatened doe wot many ſhrewd diſpleaſures fritigernus prince politique quicke conceit fearing leaſt reſt ſhould kept ſtill hoſtages cryed would another conflict greater miſchiefe ſlaughter unleſſe himſelfe together aſſociats might ſuffered goe forth appeaſe common ſort imagining pretenſe courteſie leader ſlaine grew verie fierce readie make tumult graunted went received applauſe great joy mounted horſebacke galloped away minding ſet foot many ſundrie inſtigations warre chap vi lupicinus araſh braid encountring gothes loſſe tribune many ſouldiors flyeth hystoricall narration marcellinus touching theſe forraine new upstart nation former age grievouſly afflicted ſundrie part world fame ſhrewd nource rumor diſperſed theſe news abroad whole nation thuringi enflamed hot deſire fight ſo among many fearefull overture forerunning preſumptions greater daungers baners manner ſet high dolefull ſound trumpet heard went rodes ſtreightwayes whole troups robber brigand ſpoyling firing village waſting alſo making havocke whatſoever could meet againſt lupicinus tumultuarie haſt aſſembled ſouldiors raſhly adviſedly went forth nine mile citie ſtood readie trye battaile barbarian alſo perceived ſo much brake violently upon company men unwares targuets body preſſing hard upon many ſtood way ſpeares ſwords ran bloudie rage tribune moſt part alſo armed ſouldiors ſlaine loſt enſignes onely unfortunat generall minding nothing elſe while others fighting might ſave himſelfe flying hyed faſt could citie enemy clad roman armor made foule worke ſundrie place man gave checke much manifold diver act come theſe part heartie deſire thoſe ever ſhall read ſtorie none would preciſely require hand every thing particular done juſt number ſuch ſlaine indeed could ſort compriſed ſhall ſufficient without masking truth lye digeſt ſet order verie principall point onely occurrent conſidering unfolding laying abroad record thing requiſit ſhould everie place faithfull ſincere relation thoſe ignorant auncient record deny commonwealth ever time overcaſt ſo great miſts calamity aſtonied beholding late freſh miſeries deceived revolve either former theſe late foregoing age plainely ſhew like wofull trouble state oftentimes happened oſterlings dutchman teuton together iuitlanders cimbri ſodainely hidden part ocean overflowed italie exceeding infinit miſchiefes inflicted upon roman state laſt battaile vanquiſhed moſt noble renowmed captaines quite rooted fright horrible warres many citie ſacked raſed downe ground like left ſmall parcel untouched whole within theſe wofull loſſes calamity state ſet upright againe reaſon onely ſober auncient world thoſe dayes yet infected looſe riot wantonneſſe gaped neither ſumptuous coſtly fare wicked deteſtable gaines uniforme joynt affection higheſt loweſt agreeing together defence commonweale haſtened unto ſome calme quiet harbour dye glorious honourable death fleet two thouſand ſayle scythian nation great number breaking boſphorus coaſts propontus paſſed made great havocke wrought much miſchiefe muſt need ſay ſea land yet loſt greateſt part people returned backe dyed fight barbarian emperours decij father ſonne city pamphylia beſieged many iſlands harried waſted macedonia ſet flaming fire whole multitude beleagured long time salonichi theſſalonica cyzicum likewiſe anchialo sophia kenkis mereat anchialos ſame time nicopoli nigeboli nicopolis emperour traian token victorie againſt daci built many cruell overthrowes given taken riciprocally philippopoli philippopolis deſtroyed unleſſe annales doelye hundred thouſand men put ſword within walles thereof alſo forraine enemy raunged pleaſure throughout albania leandr epirus theſſalie rumelia rom • chi greece claudius noble renowmed leader aſſumed emperour ſelfe ſame prince untimely taken away honourable death diſcomfited expelled aurelianus valiant man moſt ſevere revenger harmes damage done whereby became quiet ſtirred long time unleſſe afterward certaine rout robbing brigand made hot incurſions owne deſtruction territory neere adjoyning go forward traine hyſtorie digreſſed chap vii petie prince nation gothes commaunded paſſe helleſpontus wrongfully miſuſed ioyne others alreadie armed afterwards west ſpoyle thracia whole courſe theſe act carryed abroad divulged meſſengers comming thicke one another sueridus colias prince gothes people long entertained ſet looke unto wintering harbour hadrianopoli • hadrianopolis regarding owne life ſafetie thing world beheld quiet peaceable mind upon emperours letter ſodainly brought unto whereby commaunded paſſe helleſpontus required without ſwelling humour pride warfare money meat two dayes reſpite allowed citie head magiſtrat citie taking well picking quarell thereat diſpleaſed angrie ſome ſpoyle waſt made countrey houſe farre citie made adoe brought forth common together artizans craftſmen mightie multitude armed utter confuſion ſo commaunding trumpet ſound battaile unleſſe went wayes ſooner decreed threatned utmoſt perill death gothes ſore troubled unexpected adverſitie affrighted citizen haſtie ywis conſiderat preſſing upon ſtood ſtill mooved length beene rayled reviled curſed hand yea aſſailed otherwhiles ſome caſting dartes launced brake forth open defiance profeſſed rebellion thus ſlaine great number citizen overmalapert violence deceived put reſt rout wounded ſundrie kind weapon difarmed ſpoyled dead body put themſelves roman armour eſpyed fritigernus neere hand joyned themſelves unto duetiful obeiſant allyes ſo diſtreſſed citie ſhut thoſe trouble miſeries follow ſiege difficultie daungerous ſervice long time employed ran head everie without reſpect bold adventurous fellowes periſhed without revenge yea many ſhot arrowes diſcharging ſtones ſlings loſt life fritigernus conſidering men unskilfull ſieges aſſaults wreſtled vaine ſo many misfortune loſſes leaving ſufficient power adviſed depart leave buſineſſe undone ſaying peace bare wall perſuading would ſet hand without endangering life ſpoyle rich plentifull country wherein yet garriſons empeach commending highly king counſell knew would effectuall partaker theſe project deſignes diſperſing themſelves everie quarter coaſt thracia marched warily thoſe either yeelded taken priſoners ſhew plenteous townes ſuch eſpecially wherein ſaying might bee found great ſtore victual beſide inbred courage boldneſſe owne ſet principall helpe put forward conflowed daily unto multitude ſame nation ſuch late beene ſold marchants number others flocking ſtil unto firſt comming thoſe pined ſtarved hunger exchaunged ſome courſe ſmall wine peeces broken bread came alſo unto encreaſe companie many expert following veines gold mynes able longer endure heavie burden taxation laid upon impoſt cuſtomes willing conſent gladly received ſtood verie good ſtead paſſed unknowne place ſhewing unto hidden garner corne privie lurking place ſecret receits people guidance direction ſame men remained untouched unaſſailed thing unleſſe inacceſſable unpaſſable without difference made age ſex fire ſword went wracke yong babe ſucking breaſt pulled away killed mother raviſhed wife likewiſe made widowes bereft husband ſlaine face ſtriplings well growne boyes haled trailed along dead carkaſſes parent ſumme many old folke cry lived fill loſſe good together beautifull woman hand writhed pinioned behind back bewayled ember aſhes native habitation led away perforce owne countrey chap viii valens distracted manifold care ſendeth armie thracia gothes roman ſtrike battaile victorie without ſweat bloud teares falleth roman theſe newes thracia valens emperour hearing much griefe ſorrow heart diſtracted diver ſundrie care immediatly ſending victor generall cavallerie perſia compound conclude touching ſtate armenia according theſe imminent occaſions trouble require himſelfe readie forthwith depart antioch might meane time goe conſtantinople ſent profuturus traianus great ruler cammaunders verily reached brave noble exploit unskilful feat arm come place multitude enemy ſhould beene cut diminiſhed peecemele way ſtealth robberie rather otherwiſe wholly full time bending themſelves courſe dangerous pernitious oppoſe againſt barbarian while yet hot bloud furious mood legion brought armenia verily martiall ſervices oftentimes beene well tryed approoved able match ſo infinit number people overſpread high hill deepe dale theſe company band ſay yet experience untamed rage joyned deſperatneſſe able doe driven enemie beyond cloven broken cliffes mountaine hemus beſtowed themſelves ſteepe paſſages gullet partly barbarian encloſed within thoſe place without end might long famine conſumed partly themſelves might attend frigeridus warden march aid pannonian tranſalpine ſouldiors comming requeſt valens gratianus appointed go field ſuccour helpe thoſe ſore diſtreſſed driven extremity richomeres captaine b domeſtici commaundement ſaid gratian removing gaule haſtened thracia name onely conduct certaine cohort moſt part forſooke colour went ſome gave perſuaſion merchandes feared leaſt gaule left deſtitute meanes defence ſhould waſted enemy pleaſure broken barre rhene occaſion frigeridus ſtayed gout elſe ſome malicious backbiter falſely deviſed fained himſelfe ſick becauſe would hot ſervice dangerous skirmiſhes rhicomeres generall conſent regiment force joyned profuturus traianus marching along neere unto towne salices whence farre ineſtimable number barbarian orderly placed multitude waines cart round manner circle encloſed apart within circuit wals tooke eaſe ſolaced themſelves rich booty taken roman captaines good guidance better hope caſe fortune affoorded thē oportunitie meaning adventure upon ſome glorious exploit wittily obſerved gothes intended forecaſting eſpecially diſlodged removed campe another place uſed often might confidence ſet upon back hinmoſt gore number thē turne away great part ſpoiles enemy perceiving elſe intelligence given thereof fugitive whoſe meanes nothing ſo ſecretly done knew abode ſame place long time ſtruckē feare armie abroad force feared hand joyne vertue watchword given countrey maner ſent waſtmaking company ſpred diver part neere every great captaine commander among well accepted ſo forthwith made light fire carrago c ſo tearme thē ſelves returning paſſing great celeritie incenſed incited ſtill countreymen attempt greater matter intermiſſion betweene ſides ſhort truce thoſe returned upon neceſſitie called forth whole multitude thruſt togither ſtill within compaſſe incloſure aforeſaid keeping horrible noyſe ſet upon furious mad mood haſtened fell cruell gare trie utmoſt hazard battaile neither prince nation preſent againſt theſe matter thus paſſed sun going downe night ſo faſt drawing ſtayed againſt wils heavie heart go reſt taken meat leiſure would ſerve remained without ſleep ſide romanes intelligence hereof continuing alſo watchfull themſelves feared enemy brain ſicke leader bin ſo many enraged wild beaſts howbeit undaunted heart expected event although doubtful dangerous reaſon number much inferior would yet prove fortunat ſide regard juſt righteous cauſe later end day upon ſignall alarme ſounded trumpet part barbarian manner ſworne one unto another aſſayed gain hillie place end frō thence downe hill might greater violence like wheeles run tumble downe way ſouldiors ſeeing made haſt every man colour company ſo ſtanding ground neither raunged abroad leaving rankes ran array skirmiſh therfore army thus embattailed ſides marched warily came length ſtand ſtill warrior grim lookes traverſe caſt eye beheld wiſtly one another romanes verily ſetting martiall note ſides uſeth begin low ſo riſe higher higher noyſe peculiar tearme call barritus plucked valiant heart ſtrength together barbarian untunable cry ſhouts creaked forth praiſes anceſtors thus among ſundry word paſſing betweene diſſonant noyſe began lighter skirmiſhes whē aloofe aſſailed one another ſides louped dart ſuch like caſtingweapons came togither menacing wiſe cloſe fight hand ſtrokes couching ſhields forme roufe head ſet foot foot maintained medley barbarian alwaies repaired freſh ſupplies nimble withall hurling men huge club parched hardened fire fiercely foining point ſword full upon breaſts thoſe ſtood againſt brake left wing readie recule go right ſtrong hardie regiment lay ſupply riſing valiantly ſide hard horſemen cohort hard neckes ſuccoured ſupported againe fight therefore grew exceeding ſharpe hot much ſlaughter bloudſhed every one readie ruſh upon thickeſt enemy while ſides ſwords ſwaſhed dart flew thicke haile loſt life horſemen followed one ſide ſtrong arme ſlaſhing thoſe fled necke backe likewiſe part footman hewed houx hamſtrings many ſlipped away lagged behind feare whereas every place full ſlaine body ſome lay among halfe dead halfe alive feeding themſelves vaine hope life ſhot bullet throwne ſlings others reed arrowes headed yron head ſome cloven ſword middeſt forehead crowne hung great horror ſhoulders ſides wearied yet tough fighting plagued one another indifferently ſped alike neither one ſlacked one jot owne naturall vigor bodie ſo long courageous heart ſerved ſtirre ſtrength howbeit bloudie mortall conflict ended day many could way make ſhift departed diſorder reſt every one recovered tent heavily appayed conclude ſome honourable perſonages among dead enterred place time would give leave body ſlain remained curſed fowles ayre devoured ſuch wont time feed upon carkaſſes appeareth field white bone day howbeit certaine knowne romanes fewer farre number encountred huge multitude abidden many deadly danger yet without wofull lamentable calamity foiled barbarous people theſe chance battaile thus piteouſly ended men went next retiring place martianopolis gothes thruſt pent owne accord within foreſaid circuit precinct wagon never durſt ſeven day together go forth ſeene therefore ſouldiors taking advantage opportunitie incloſed infinit ſort barbarian within ſtraits haemimontum barred high hils againſt building one would ſay upon hope miſchievous multitude enemy hemmed betweene iſter deſarts finding way would periſh famine conſidering neceſſaries life carried ſtrong city never went beſiege one yet altogether ignorant theſe ſuch like machination richomeres returned gaule minding bring help mean thence regard greater troublous warres feared chap ix gothes taken hunnes alanes ſocietie bootie horrible ſlaughter ſpoile waſt thracia vaine lay ſiege towne dibaltum purſue frigeridus puiſſant warriour leader terrified new overthrow frigeridus taken many confineth mutina rhegium parma till ground theſe thing done yeare gratianus fourth time conſull together merobaudes toward autumne ſeaſon time valens heard dolefull event warres ſpoyles committed charge cavallerie time unto saturninus ſent traianus profuturus bringing aid helpe fortuned thoſe dayes throughout region scythia moeſia thing comeſtible ſpent barbarian upon cruell fierceneſſe owne meere want ſet forward exceeding hot eagre worke mightie matter many time given attempt ſeeing themſelves overweighed vigorous valour men manfully reſiſting notwithſtanding rough ſtonie difficulty driven length upon extreame neceſſity procured upon hope exceeding great booty combine certaine chuni alani saturninus knew time come placed forefences outſtanding guard abroad field gathering little little force together prepared depart good policie leaſt ſuddaine multitude like violent ſtreame water breaking bankes guſhing forth ſhould little adoe diſranke diſcomfit thoſe diligently watched ſuſpected place ſtraits layd open ſouldiors good time enemy departed thoſe aforeſaid within car • ago encloſed every one way could find diſorderly manner bent whole power ſet mind ſeeing man impeach ſet garboyle throughout thracia wide ſpred themſelves ſpoiling waſting without controlment beginning thoſe coaſts iſter runneth ſo going farre rhodope tract ſevereth maine huge ſeas making foule worke havocke moſt ſhamefull manner ſpoyling robbing bloudie murthering firing abuſing body free borne perſons might man beheld groning griefe heart fact horrible ſaid ſeene woman maſſacred amazed feare courſed ſcourges rung againe even great bellied wife babe yet unperfect untimely came world enduring many impiety little infant alſo clinging mother armes might heard piteouſly cry alſo lamentable mones young ſpringals damoſels nobly borne hand ſtrait bound while themſelves haled cruell captivitie virgines ripe yeares chaſt wedded wife blubbered face weeping bewayling extreame miſeries led away wiſhing death though dolorous painefull prevent abuſing defiling body ſhortly among calamity gentleman rich free little dragged haled like beaſt complained thee ô fortune unmercifull blind withall didſt turning hand appoint betake violently wrung ſequeſtred beloved wife deere child ſweet houſe home ſaw face turned aſhes altogether ruinat either mangled diſmembred lim lim whip torment ſerve ſlave cruell bloudie conqueror barbarian yet like unto ſo many ſavage beaſts broken cage overrun great way large countrey went towne named develto soph dibaltum finding barzymeres tribune scutarij thoſe ſouldiors owne cornuti alſo company footman pitching tent ſet upon approved well experienced warrior preſently neceſſitie ſo imminent danger required commaunded trumpet ſhould ſound battaile ſtrengthened flankes brake many readie appointed battaile valiant reſiſtance made part good departed field even hand troupe horſemen running violently upon much breath wearie beſet round thus ſlaughter many barbarian whoſe overthrow ſeene ſo great multitude ſlaine exploit manner performed gothes doubtfull ſhould doe afterward ſought frigeridus intending ever could find overthrow beat downe onely ſtrong barre ſtood way therefore taken liberall finer food alſo ſlept little followed like ſort ſavage beaſts given underſtand direction gratianus returned thracia encamped neere unto beroea lay eſpiall diſcover doubtfull event thing verily gothes part rode downe made haſt put deſignes execution frigeridus knew well ynough governe alſo preſerve ſouldiors either ſuſpecting intent plainely informed thereof relation thoſe diſcoverers ſent returned high mountain thicke growne wood illyricum much emboldened paſſing good hand fortune unlooked preſented unto returne marched ſoftly ſouldiors marſhalled good array ſquadrons prevented farnobius great lord gothes troupe robber ſpoylemakers raunged downe countrey pleaſure leading taifali drawne lately ſocietie worth telling while ſouldiors diſperſed upon fearefull invaſion ſtrange unknowne nation paſſed river full purpoſe ranſacke ſpoyle place void defendant vpon ſuddaine diſcoverie company moſt politicke captaine prepared joyne battaile ſo charging upon ſort thoſe nation diſcomfited theſe bold brigand ſtill ſtucke give many threat put every mother ſonne ſword farnobius terrible troublemaker time many others ſlaine importuned much intreated ſpare many remained alive thoſe ſent away life occupie husband land modem mutina rexxo rhegium parma townes italie nation taifali heard ſay filthily given ſo much abandoned horrible ſinnes beaſtly living uſuall matter boyes men companie together foule abhominable act wantonneſſe named ſpending prime flower youth ſuch uncleane unnaturall abuſe furthermore one growne riper yeares could alone himſelfe either take wildboare kill ſavage cruell beare freed ſtinking puddle ſinke pollution chap x lentienſes people alemaine mightie armie break roman seigniory battaile gratian hath upper hand remained alive ſuch eſcaped flight courſed mountaines make humble ſupplication obtaine peace ſuffered without harme goe native country theſe calamity later end autumne winter drew faſt cruell whirlewindes trouble ſwouped hudled together throughout thracia rage time fury diſpoſed raiſe tumult place going ſtill country alſo farre ſpred ſelfe abroad lintzgoewer lentienſes people alemaine bordering upon coaſts rhetia way craftie treacherous rodes broken league lately made invaded aſſayled march calamitie began firſt upon ſuch miſchievous occaſion one nation ſerving emperor qualitie armiger scutarius squier bodie occaſion ſome weightie buſineſſe rerurned home owne countrey hee laviſh blab tongue many countreymen asked newes court telleth gratianus ſent uncle valens ſhortly make warlike expedition toward eaſt end joynt double force might repell inhabitant upon border conſpired deſtroy root romanes intelligence lentienſes great affection received alſo themſelves bordering neighbour ſeeing theſe matter went ſwift quicke diſpatch gathered themſelve thicke plumpes rob ſpoyle ſo company ſerving roman celtae petulantes together marching neere rhene moneth februarie reaſon hard froſts yce paſſable foot ſore diſtreſſed without ſome loſſe owne maine ſtrength forced turne backe theſe german conſtrained thus retire knowing moſt part armie gone illyricum emperour ſhortly would grew hotely incenſed conceiving greater project aſſembled inhabitant townes village together ſo raiſed armie fortie thouſand armed men threeſcore ten thouſand ſome given love extoll emperours prayſes growne exceeding height pride brake boldly territory gratianus great feare true intelligence called backe cohort ſent pannonia alſo aſſembled others wiſe circumſpect policie kept ſtill gaule committed managing ſervice unto nannienus valiant diſcreet captaine joyned colleague equall commiſſion power mallobaudes lieutenant captaine band domeſtici king frank beſide man expert warfare hardie withall nannienus therefore duely conſidered variable chance fortune therfore thought good hold linger time mallobaudes carried away deſire fight manner impatient delay much troubled thinking long untill might advance ſtanderd againſt enemie therfore adverſe part came forward horrible noyſe give valiant charge ſignall given blowing horne began firſt encounter horburg rhenano colmer lrenicho argentuaria ſhot well arrowes caſting javelin downe went thicke one ſide verie heat battaile men ſeeing infinit number enemie avoid open manifeſt daunger diſperſed themſelves everie man could among narrow lane beſet tree howbeit within ſtood ground confidently carrying like reſplendant ſhew glittering afarre bright armour put barbarian mightie feare emperour come ſodainely turning backes yet betweene while making head againe becauſe would omit meanes even extremitie unattempted ſo beaten downe hewed peeces number aforeſaid eſcaped eſteemed five thouſand thoſe ſhrowded within thick wood among many bold hardie knight priarus alſo king ſlaine even inciter ſetter theſe miſchievous deadly trouble gratianus much encouraged confidence fortunat ſucceſſe marching toward eaſt part turning way left hand cloſely paſſed rhene upon good hope ſet ward determined fortune favoured enterpriſe generally root whole nation ſo treacherous deſirous rebellion purpoſe knowne meſſengers arriving thicke one another lentienſes ſtrucken dump miſeries nation conſumed maner ſodaine comming emperour doubtfull way take conſidering could find breathing time ſhort bethinke themſelves either make reſiſtance elſe doe goe ſpeed force poſſibly could made toward hils beſet everie ſide unpaſſable cliffes taking ſtanding upon craggie rockes ragges round might maine defended good together wife child brought difficultie weighed conſidered choſen everie legion five hundred armed ſouldiors approoved experience politique skill warre oppoſed againſt ſame beene ſo many walled fence emboldened encouraged hereupon emperour perſon ſeen beare himſelfe manfully formoſt vaward aſſailed climbe ſaid hill minding immediatly without fight might get higher ground foot carrie away hunter preyes skirmiſh beginning well toward noone continued untill darke night fought great ſlaughter ſides men fell kill killed themſelves withall armour thoſe emperours traine ſhining againe gold bright colour flinging thicke heavie maſſie ſtones bruſed broken upon conſultation good betweene gratian principall officer armie ſeemed evidently moſt dangerous ſervice effect thus haſt ſtrive without intermiſſion againſt ſuch rough bankes mount bearing againſt much debating ſundrie opinion paſſed fro ſuch buſineſſe conſidering barbarous enemy defence ſuch place diſadvantageous unto u concluded ſhold ſoldiors ſitting ſtill nothing elſe round beleagured wearied famine german ſtrove againe part like obſtinat reſolution knowing country verie wel went unto mountain higher thā thoſe kept emperour armie turning thither like fortitude ſought pathes tract led thoſe high place lentienſes perceiving ſo fully bent life never giving earneſt purſuit yeelded themſelves mercie thing humble requeſt obtained upon tendring luſtie able young men commaunded bee entermingled new trained ſouldiors ſuffered without harme received go native country chap xi commendation gratian frigeridus excellent captaine terrour gothes unſeaſonably called backe valens leadeth ſtrong armie againſt gothes neere unto river hebrus grievouſly diſcomfited defeated sebaſtian colonell infanterie victorie ſuch importance conſequence daunted weſterne nation gracious pleaſure eternall god incredible great vigour effectuall celeritie gratian haſtening another way diſpatched truth young prince ſingular towardneſſe well ſpoken temperat warlike martiall yet mild mercifull vertues proceeded emulation excell beſt emperor even yet lovely downe began grow upon cheekes owne nature enclined toyiſh ridiculous action eſpecially favourite minion let reines libertie turned vaine delight ſports commodus caeſar although prince nothing bloudie cruell like commodus becauſe wont people ſight kill number wild beaſts dart hundred lyon let shewplace amphitheatre ſlew diver kind ſhot never ſtrucke one twice even ſo prince alſo among thoſe empaled encloſures tearme vivarium parkes while ſtroke many arrow hee killed wild boares made ſmall reckoning many thoſe ſerious occurrent ſuch time eſpecially marcus antoninus himſelfe ſitten helme commonweale could hardly beene able remedie lamentable calamitie state without colleague like himſelfe much ſage counſell beſide gratianus therefore diſpoſed affair according time occaſions gaule nation require puniſhed withall traitour squier scutarius aforeſaid told barbarian emperour made haſt illyricum departed thence caſtle bearing name • bon rhenano • bor netit foelix arbor way inaureatum ſped apace ſtretched journeyes helpe part went downe wind ſame time ſucceed frigeridus moſt politikely deviſed many profitable meanes common ſecuritie made haſt fortifie ſtreits succi feare leaſt enemy nimble uſed make rodes breaking alſo violently forth like unto ſome ſwelling ſtreames ſhould raunge overrun pleaſure northerne province ſent lieutenant named maurus man ſhew ſtout courage altogether made money aſſayes mutable uncertaine former part hyſtorie wrot thus much caeſar iulianus made ſome queſtion ſetting crowne upon head while ſerved among squiers attended upon palace tooke coller wore owne necke preſented unto diademe warie diligent captaine remooved ſervice verie time thing lay bleeding whereas though long departed betaken himſelfe unto privat life home ought conſidering great affaire ſtate ſo required beene brought againe field time happened valens length rouſed antiochia long way travailed came conſtantinople ſtayed verie dayes diſquieted light mutinie people committed unto sebastian vigilant leader knowne little ſent italie defenſoribus e magiſtrats citie feared taken priſoner enemie come one ſuborned ſo might worke ſomewhat city undoing like happened another lieutenant ſouldiors magnentius wile caught whoſe meanes forth went way time evening drew upon ſuddaine deſcried neere unto river hebrus company gothes well appointed waſt ſpoyle hiding himſelfe within bankes ſhrubs darke night marched ſoftly heard ſet upon bringing many band old experienced ſelect ſouldiors without expecting aid owne pride pricked forward fooliſh word flatterer certaine miſchievous destinie hasteneth encounter gothes embaſsadours good roman state unleſſe otherwhiles would ſhew unto neere hand hoaſt armes ſo dread imperiall name reclaime pernitious deſire fight thus verily embaſſadours nothing regarded doubtfull tearmes would defence legion treaſure princely enſignes imperiall ornament together profectus praefect counſellors state courtier conſiſtorians incloſed within compaſſe wals length therefore upon eight day enemy
