cruell fearefull howling romane captaines marſhalled ſouldiors order battaile right wing horſemen placed greateſt part footman lay behind beſet wayes left wing horſemen conſidering great number yet diſparkled aſunder much difficultie brought together marched main pace while ſame wing diſplaying ſtretching none yet trouble ſame behold barbarian terrified horrible noyſe armour counterfeited clattering threatening wiſe ſhields made part abiding farre alatheus safrages ſent yet come diſpatched embaſſadours covenant conclude peace while emperour contemned baſeneſſe meane condition theſe embaſſadours requiring better ſort ſufficient perſons ſhould ſent ratifie confirme article agreed upon meane purpoſe held trifled time end theſe fraudulent ceſſations armes horſemen might returne hoped would ſhortly become ſouldiors enchafed heat summer drie chawes might become faint heartleſſe conſidering field wide large ſhone fire ſame enemy ſet burning wood drie fuell put purpoſe beſide fell another miſchiefe alſo namely men beaſts grievouſly diſtreſſed hunger mean time helpe matter well fritigernus one wiſely could gueſſe caſt might fearing doubtfull fortune warre ſent upon owne head one common ſort herault treat peace craving certain nobilitie elect perſons ſhould forthwith ſent unto hoſtages himſelfe reſolved without feare abide violence ſouldiors neceſſarie conſequents therof project motion ſo dread prince commander commended approved equitius tribune charge committed unto palace kinſman valens aſſent every man appointed ſpeed go pledge denied goe becauſe taken priſoner enemy broken made eſcape dibaltum regard whereof feared unreaſonable paſſions richomeres owne accord offered goe willingly promiſed much thinking alſo brave act beſeeming valiant man forward went minding ſhew good token dignitie noble parentage going toward enemy fort archer targuetiers one baturius iberian charge together caſsio violent heat adventured engage themſelves forward farre joyne skirmiſh adverſaries brake ſoone time ſo cowardly reculing diſhonored beginning battaile thus impeachment occaſioned unſeaſonable attempt cheerefull forward ſervice richomeres abated conſidering permitted go gothes horſemen time returned alatheus safrages together power alemans intermingled among ſent like lightening thunderbolt ſhot high mountaines whomſoever could ſwift rodes meet quickly diſcomfited ſlew chap xiiii army gothes romanes embattailed ſharpe conflict length romanes put flight touching death valens twofold opinion ſome thinke killed arrow never ſeene others conſumed fire every ſide fell ſhake armor weapon bellona blew dolefull lamentable blaſt trumpet men began give ground cry many unto made head reſiſted verily fight manner flaſhing flame affrighted even ſtout heart ſouldiors wiſtly beheld ſome thruſt whirling ſhot dart arrowes army buckling daſhing one againſt another like unto ſhips pointed beakhead pike braſſe thruſting one another turnes reciprocall alternative motion wave ſea driven fro becauſe beſt wing romanes horſemen come farre verie wagon readie advance farther ſeconded ſuccoured forſaken cavallerie beſide enemy ſuch number preſſed upon like ſome great rampier fortification fallen borne downe diſrayed footman wanting defence flankes ſtood plump company ſo thruſt thronged together beene clunged one could either draw ſword bring backe hand time ſuch duſt raiſed man able ſee sky reſounding horrible cry ſhouts reaſon caſtingweapons diſcharged everie way miſſed ever fell gave deadly ſtroke miſchiefe becauſe venue could neither foreſeene avoided barbarian ruſhing ſtill huge multitude overthrew horſe man together conſidering rankes men ſtood ſo cloſe together could place roome made retire enemy likewiſe ſo thicke thruſt together meanes make way eſcape ſouldiors alſo ſetting light utmoſt extremitie death tooke againe ſwords full butt running upon hewed peeces withall ſuch maine blowes dealt fro ax headpeeces habergeon ſlat daſhed peeces might man ſeene ſtout ſtomacked barbarian teeth gnaſhed ſet head hammeſtrings cut right hand ſmitten ſword ſide thruſt even readie give laſt gaſpe yet menacing wiſe looke round ſterne terryble eye thus reaſon body ſides fought pell mell laid along ground field covered ſlaine great horrour heard grievous grones men either dying elſe ſhot bodie deepe wound ſo great ſo confuſed tumult footman toyle daungers cleane ſpent afterwards ſtrength failed wit would ſerve deviſe ſome counſell moſt javelin continuall thruſting knocking together broken aſunder contenting themſelves drawne ſwords engaged themſelves thickeſt troupe enemy men unmindfull ſaving themſelves ſeeing mean left eſcape refuge becauſe ground ſtanding lake bloud ſo ſlipperie underfoot overturned went endevoured could ſell life deere dye unrevenged ſo great courage ſtoutneſſe oppoſing themſelves againſt thoſe preaſed hard upon ſome dyed even upon owne weapon length overſpred confuſed ſhew nothing blacke bloud way ſoever one turned eye lay heapes men ſlaine without ſpare trampled dead carkaſſes withall heat sunne mounted great height paſſed leo courſe houſe celeſtiall ſigne virgo overcame roman beſides weakened hunger undone verie thirſt heavie armour alſo weigh downe conclude barbarian charged ſtill ſo maine force battailons diſcomfited great diſorder tooke heeles onely helpe deſperat extremitie fled every man way could while thus diſperſed blind lane make ſhift gone emperour beſet one would ſay round horrible fearfull ſights little little mounting heap dead body betooke himſelfe f lancearij g mattiarij violent number enemy abidden ſtood ground ſtill body ſound unſhaken traianus ſaw crieth hope ever paſt gone unleſſe emperour thus forſaken owne guard squire might length protected aid ſtrangers captaine named victor heard haſtening ſpeed aſſemble h batavi beſtowed farre ſuccour helpe pinch defence guard emperours perſon could meet none retyred backe departed like manner richomeres saturninus made ſhift themſelves eſcaped danger barbarian therefore furious rage ſparkled even verie eye followed hard chace upon men verie heat veines readie melt faint againe fell knew ſmoat others againe overwhelmed preaſe onely ſuch courſed dyed upon owne fellowes hand neither lightly yeelding thoſe ſtrove againe one ſpared thoſe yeelded beſides many lying halfe dead able endure ſmart torment wound ſtopped verie wayes alſo corp ſlain hudled heap together filled field carkaſſes wel theſe loſſes never amends made coſt romanes ſo deere night without moonelight made end began darke emperour among common ſouldiours probably thought man ever directly ſaid ſaw thing mortally wounded arrow fell preſently thereupon yeelded vitall breath departed neither ever found occaſion ſome enemy tooke lodging love would ſpoile dead none either men put flight inhabitant hard durſt goe unto place like wofull caſe befell heard ſay unto decius caeſar manfully fighting barbarian chaunced fall horſe full ſpirit courage could hold ſo flung bog moore could neither ryſe againe ever found others ſay valens yeelded ghoſt preſently ſome gallant guelded eunuch brought back countrey cottage hard made workmanly ſtrong two lo • t ſtories while dreſſed unskilfull hand enemy beſet knowing delivered ſhame diſhonour captivitie followed chaſe went breake open doores ſurely bolted evidently high built houſe aſſailed arrowes leaſt cumberſome delayes ſhould looſe opportunitie harrying making ſpoyle gathered together bundels ſtubble faggot wood kindled fire put ſo burnt houſe whence one foreſaid gallant follower gotten window taken priſoner barbarian bewrayed revealed deed put much griefe ſorrow mind diſappointed great glorie honour tooke soveraigne ruler roman tower ſet fire burnt whereunto fled yet certaine knowne neither scipio valens fortune buried laſt honourable duetie conferred death manifold calamitie loſſe brave men death traianus sebastian remarkable loſt life five twentie tribune vacantes charge regiment together valerianus equitius one great maſter ſtable grand seneſchall palace among theſe potentius alſo tribune promoti ſlaine verie prime flower youth knight everie good man beloved commended well regard approved vertues father vrſicinas ſometime generall horſemen owne good part moſt true hardly third part armie eſcaped neither battailes fabulous ſonets greek ſo highly commended lamentable manner bewayled many conflict chap xv vertues vice valens end life place periſhed foreſignified oracle end valens grew faſt upon fiftie yeares age raigned emperour fourtene yeares ſomewhat whoſe good part vice ſo farre know put downe faſt friend faithfull ſharpe puniſher revenger ambitious courſes ſevere reformer well militarie civile diſcipline paſſing vigilant time carefull man pretence colour kinred ſhould beare himſelfe high right juſt protector defender province everie one preſerved leſſe owne houſe hurt domage mitigating ſingular regard affection heavie tribute admitting augmentation toll impoſts calling debt arrerages reſt nothing haſtie importunat ſore enemie bitter theeves iudges detected robbing common treaſure neither eaſt empire remember ſuch buſineſſes better dealt emperour beſide theſe part carryed liberall mind yet moderation whereof albeit many example yet ſhall ſuffice ſet downe one perſon diver prince court greedie men good begged uſuall manner thing fallen eſcheat ought elſe would great reſpect juſtice reſervation libertie could gaineſay ſuit paſſe graunt unto made petition joyning diver time three foure others abſent ſhare thoſe thing obtained end ſuch buſie reſtleſſe ſuiters ſeeing gaines gaped deviſe proove ſo much leſſe might deale ſparily kind touching edifice ſundrie city townes either repaired built verie firſt foundation brevitie ſake ſay nothing giving leave unto greater perſons themſelves ſhew large well theſe vertues ſuppoſe good men follow let u briefly run vice moſt covetous greedily ſet gather great wealth impatient travell paine taking rather affecting exceeding great hardneſſe given much crueltie nature ſomewhat rude ruſticall furniſhed neither martiall art liberall ſtudies willingly hunting gaines commodity though grievous grones others moſt intollerable drawing ſuch treſpaſſes happened either contempt prince dignitie high treaſon cruelly fought bloud undoing rich perſons neither tollerable whereas would ſeeme commit examination enquirie cauſes unto lawes yea give order ſuch buſineſſes controverſies ſhould tryed decided certaine commiſſioners appointed eſpeciall choſen iudges yet ſuffered nothing paſſe contrarie owne pleaſure otherwiſe alſo doer wrong wrathfull lying verie open entertaine promoter accuſers without reſpect truth falſitie foule fault even theſe pivat daily dealing betwene man man exceeding greatly bee feared one word idle loyterer ſlowbacke colout complexion blacke apple ſight one eye quite cloſed yet ſo farre blemiſh appeared feature bodie limmes well made truſt together ſtature neither tall yet low bow legged carrying good graund paunch thus much may ſerve turne ſpoken valens true report ful teſtimonie time wherin lived together moreover alſo would paſſed ſilence whereas oracle delivered • threefooted table hilarius patricius ſhewed practiſed found thoſe three propheticall verſes laſt goeth thus 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 mimas field head burnt ſhall firſt hee altogether unpoliſhed rude contemned ſame proceſſe thoſe moſt lamentable accident befell unto ſo fearfull upon verie calling remembrance ſaid oracle quaked trembled name aſia towne called erythraeum heard ſay relation learned men homer tully wrot ſtood mountaine named cabo stillari nigr mimas laſt dead enemy departed countrey neere unto verie place wherein thought caught deadly wound found report tombe monument ſtone raiſed ground upon one ſtone faſt laid greeke letter engraven ſhewed one mimas noble man old time enterred well mortall field fought darke night overſpred earth thoſe remained alive ſome tooke right hand others left everie one feare carried way went ſeeking next fellowes friend indeed never one could ſee themſelves alone ſuppoſing enemy ſword hard head behind yet heare might though great way piteous cryes thoſe left behind dolefull gaſpes yexes ſuch lay dying dolourous plaint weeping many lay wounded chap xvi gothes victorie beſiege hadrianopolis take repulſe many aſsault ſlaine ſooner began day light conquerours like ſavage beaſts fell enraged taſt bloud fleſhed whetted ſtomackes moved alluring inducement vaine hope marched troupe ſtrongly embattailed toward hadrianopolis full purpoſe race deſtroy though much hazard danger intelligence given traiterous fugitive greateſt perſonages officer higheſt place regall enſignes alſo belonging imperiall dignitie together treaſure valens beſtowed ſtrong place defence leaſt • long delayes reſpite betweene heat ſhould coole ten clocke fourth houre day encircled wall began moſt cruell fight while aſſaylants inbred ſtoutneſſe haſtened headlong preſent perill defendant ſide behind ſhew vigour might maine great number ſouldiors campedrudges together horſes ſuffered enter ſtanding cloſe unto wall dwelling houſes joyning thicke fought valiantly might low ground rage preaſſed upon gat upper hand unto three clock noone ninth houre day ſuddainely three hundred footman ſtood hard unto parapet wals caſting themſelves thicke ſquadron revolted unto barbarian greedily caught within clutch preſently upon policie know put ſword time forward obſerved one danger deſperat eſtate ſoever ſtood ever ſo much thought doe like againe theſe ſo many calamity comming thus hotly ſo hudled upon beſieged ſuddaine mightie crackes thunder poured blacke cloud ſuch violent ſhowers raine ſcattered cōpanies raging multitude returned campe hold ſet caſt round forme cart waines breathing ſtill cruell mind ſtomackes fell commaund ſummon men minatorie letter embaſſadour ſent unto upon ſecuritie received life ſaved durſt enter ſent certaine chriſtian letter carried read throughly ſaid skanned upon reſt day whole night following ſpent preparing fortification withinforth gate immured dammed mightie huge flint weake undefenſible part wall ſtrengthened diſcharging ſides caſting weapon dart ſtones engine planted meet convenient place yea conveyed neere hand ſufficient ſtore water day ſome fought verie thirſt endaungered much life worth contrariwiſe gothes caſting themſelves difficile daungerous event warre driven dumpes ſee valianter ſort ſlaine hurt peecemeale ſtill force decayed deviſed wily craftie ſtratageme goddeſſe iuſtice ſelfe bewailed divulged abroad certaine gallant ſide day revolted unto enticed colour running away meant returne home owne countrey ſhould endevour received within wals entred cloſely ſet fire ſome one part citie end ſignall hereof ſecretly erected while whole multitude beſieged buſily occupied quenching fire enemy might breake violently citie void defendant upon wals theſe gallant youth aboveſaid went forward appointed come ditch ſtretching forth hand prayed beſought themſelves romanes might let thus received becauſe ſuſpition contrarie upon interrogatory touching deſignes purpoſes enemy varied diſagreed tale whereupon came paſſe beene bloudie torture farther examined upon point confeſſed plainely came head chopt labour warlike engine fabrickes readineſſe toward third midnight watch barbarian forgetting quite feare wound paſt many rankes one ſeconding another conflowed like ſo many billowes wave ſea gate citie made faſt againſt much greater reſolution mightie men ruler among together armed ſouldiors provinciall palatine band roſe beſtirred themſelves quicke overthrow beare downe ſuch dart caſtingweapons diſcharged though venture yet among ſo great multitude could light without ſome harme men perceived barbarous enemy made uſe ſame weapon dart flung ſhot therefore commaundement given arrowes guelding cutting ſtrings ſinewes knit yron head wooden ſteiles together flung ſhould ſhot bowes while flew ayre kept ſtill ſtrength ſound yea ſtucke body loſt horſemen footman yet suidas zonaras affirme properly domeſtici horſmen protectores footman choſen theſe scholae aboveſaid even flower armenian band ammianus marcellinus himſelfe appeareth 15 booke ſent vrſicinus c scutarij scholae palatinae ſo called goodly ſhields guilded may appeare verſes corippus africanus lib 3 laudem iustini minoris armed piece ſome wit clibanarij cataphractarij horſes burial word put death funeral swordfencers woont practiſe feat gaine well thereby whereupon tearmed buſtuarij uſing haunt funerall fire ludius god likewiſe game playes alſo employed ſtate pompe ſame swordplayers reaped ſmall commoditie thence commercia libitinae ludij meant funeral play conſequence commoditie growing unto ſuch fencer ſuch ſolemnities u claro citie ionia renowned oracle apollo whereupon called clarius x dodona citie chaonia within epirus neere wood conſecrated iupiter ſame conſiſting oake wherein report ſ • ood temple iupiter thereupon named dodonaeus oracle moſt auncient delphicus z c cornelius tribune common propoſed law likewiſe l cornel sylla dictator called leges maiestatis ſtrong againſt perſon whatſoever practiſed againſt state ſo conſequence againſt soveraigne 7 nat hiſt lucretius tearmeth them—eteſia flabra aquilonum becauſe come yearely kept ſet time ▪ prodromi alſo wind ſame quarter returning every yere riſe eight day dogdaies begin called prodromi one would ſay forerunner ▪ bucali rather buculi ſmall kind ox bullock likewiſe biſturnicia ill favoured miſhapen camel dromedary quaſi malè tornati formati vegetius lib 2 de veterinaria calleth equos animal lib 6 cap 113 π blemmyes • blemmyae ſee ▪ ibis reſembleth storke fight winged ſerpents two ſorts white aegypt ſave peluſium black part aegypt beſide wottonus anglus de different animal lib 7 cap 1 • 7 ibis fighteth ſerpents blacke long legged like crane hooked byll c generally bring forth young byll σ baſiliske cocatrice ſerpent plinie ſayth length 12 finger breadth solinus ſaith halfe foot long almoſt venomous biting hiſſing breath aſpect wherewith killeth ſee plin nat hiſt lib 8 cap 21 alſo lib 29 ca • ſeemeth called ba • iliske certaine marke head repreſenting diademe plinie calleth macul • candida thinke rather countryman edward wotton ſhould mitrula creepeth along winding ſerpents putting bodie part forward beareth head reſt bodie upright mids thereof plinie writeth ▪ amphisbaena pliny ſaith ſerpent two head one others another taile therefore named ſome 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 headed behind indeed cannot diſcerned part bodie leſſer ſerpents toward taile grow ſmaller bigneſſe alike throughout creepeth backward forward thence name amphisbaena ν scytale much like unto amphibaena bigger backe thereof hath ſpots ſo gliſtering colour therewith raviſheth thoſe behold aſtonieth ſelfe ſlow creeping hereby overtaketh thoſe would aſſayle while ſtand gazing amazed beautie ed wottonus angl de diff animal lib 7 cap 118 φ serpent nicander called acontias reckoned among thoſe harmeleſſe ſeemeth venomous plinie writeth name iaculus according greeke name acontias importeth serpent ſayth boughes tree ſhoot launce themſelves onely take heed serpent glide upon ground alſo looke unto flye dart arrow ſent engine theſe meaneth lucan ſayth —iaculique volucres serpent named alſo cenchrites greene coloured ſpots bodie bellie eſpecially like unto millet whereof ſo called moſt hurtfull forcible floureth ξ dipſas kind viper ſome thinke leaſtwiſe reſembling ſmall viper vpon ſting bite serpent follow theſe symptomes intollerable heat bowel part within whereupon named alſo preſter cauſos unquenchable deadly thirſt whereof hath name dipſas inſomuch drinke allay ample deſcription thereof ſhall find aetius ▪ viper kind adder ſome thinke male greeke called echis female echidna whereas serpent lay egges thoſe come life without body ſhe onely bringeth forth alive perfection wombe deſcription viper manner engendring c ſhall find galen de theriaca ad piſonem nicander ω theſe aspides three ſorts chelidoniae like unto swallowes whereof name cherſaeae breeding keeping deſart rough untilled land whence ſo named whereas former haunt river ſides bank nilus eſpecially ptyades moſt venomous ſpitteth forth poyſon therefore ſo called ſting aspis mortall though worketh ſpeedily yet cauſeth paine worketh grievous symptome ſwelling c killeth deadly ſleepe men beaſts ground overcame others wreſtling untill met hercules wreſtling weary laid upon ground covered eftſoones ſtrength thereby became vigorous hercules perceiving gat ſtrength touching mother earth overthrew armes held betweene heaven earth ſo long ſo faſt cruſhed death natalis come fabulous narration doth mythologize maner namely hereby confirmed great axiome phyſicke contrary cured contrary famous thoſe quinquennall game holden greece every fift yeare citie olympia neere unto hill olympus whither aſſembled people part whence grew olympia ſpace foure yeres complete paſt reckoned time roman luſtra chriſtians nativitie savior wit firſt ſecond third yeare c ſuch olympia carpathos iſland betweene rhodes candie whence came e heroicke verſes ſo called becauſe moſt commonly penned act demie god worthy ſuch tearmed hero po • me homer iliad odyſſea likewiſe ʋirgils aeneid ſtately verſe likewiſe called hexametre conſiſteth ſix foot f pythici ſuch verſes oracle delivered ſo called theſe olympicke game ſee little theſe syrenes meremaids may read homer odyſſ lib 12 ʋlyſſes paſſed sicilian ſea ſtopped eares companion wax cauſed himſelfe faſt tied unto maſt ſhip becauſe ſhould allured ſweet melodie k areopagite counſell court juſtice athens moſt ſevere upright inſtituted cecrops firſt euſebius thinketh solon reaſon name twofold either paſſed court triall judgement bloudſhed murther expreſſed name mar greeke are becauſe mar judicially accuſed neptune killing ſonne halirrhotius ſtucke downe ſpeare hereof fabulous concertation barre god may read carol sigon de rep athenienſ lib 1 cap 3 l seven vowel meaneth greeke 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 pliny writeth paine ſtomacke next unto strangurie occaſioned stone moſt intollerable whether meaneth phyſicians tearme cardialgiam ileos otherwiſe called volvulus iliaca paſſio domine miſerere mei although originally ſeated ſmall higher gut yet vicinitie ſoone affecteth ſtomack appeareth dolorous vomiting rather diſeaſe symptome cholera wherein ſtomake moſt painefully affected diſchargeth ſelfe upward downeward cannot determine kk whereas 29 booke cap 8 valentinian ſaid kept two ſhee beares one named innocentia mica aurea golden mica probable former name alſo alluded mica name ſome woman call mind therefore plutarch moral among praiſeworthie woman th •• e large narration one damoſell daughter philodemus elean named
